Really recommend this hotel however the room we had was a little small that is the only very small issue we had but the staff did apologise that the room was small.‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Karen W
Detailed Review: Can‚Äôt fault the hotel at all, the staff go out of their way to ensure a comfortable stay and any problems are dealt with immediately with efficiency and a smile. Rooms are clean, many different, location excellent as most sights within Mumbai are within walking distance

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: supermn88
Detailed Review: Stayed here one night before a flight home.  Great location, i was able to walk to many restaurants and tourist destinations. The staff was very nice and were very familiar with the area. Thanks Rajas for your help during my stay.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Kayleigh B
Detailed Review: This was the first place we'd stayed in India and the team set the bar high! They were so accommodating, helpful and friendly and made the start of our trip memorable, comfortable and fun.   The hotel itself is nice enough, a little bit dated in places (the professional pictures on here definitely show its best side), but the warm and welcoming team more than make up for this.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Family of Four
Detailed Review: The concierge staff never leave, so there are always many helpers 24/7. I had a need to see a doctor, Rajesh personally took me to the local doctor through the many small streets and set up the time and appointment. The doctor was excellent and very helpful, and I'm now all fixed. Thanks

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: PDS2
Detailed Review: We stayed here for one night on arrival in India and for a further four nights at the end of our stay. The hotel is located in the Fort area within walking distance of many of Mumbai's main sites of interest.  The hotel dates back to the 1930s, but the rooms are modern, clean and reasonably well-appointed.  Breakfast is included in the room rate, and includes a wide range of options, many cooked to order.  The hotel retains many traditional qualities, and all the staff - on reception, in the restaurant, bellboys and cleaners - were very helpful and courteous. Overall, a very good value option. However, the major metro works under way in Mumbai run very close to the hotel and often involve heavy work running into the night.  Our first night was badly disturbed by this (not ideal‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Anil G
Review: The best hotel in the Fort area
Detailed Review: This hotel was by far the best hotel that we stayed at in the Fort Area. Special mention must be made of the the concierge Rajeshbhai, who provided us with excellent advice everyday. The reception staff are available for your every need and the kitchen staff make you feel most welcome.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Hungry traveller
Detailed Review: We had a lovely stay here in one of their club rooms. The local is central, walking distance to all main attractions. Breakfast is very tasty with good Indian and western options. Laundry service is also good, they laundered some ornate dresses for me. All hotel staff are very kind and go out of their way to make you feel welcome. Special shout out to Gopal who helped us with organising our transport to the airport. We would stay again!

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Kirsty T
Detailed Review: We have stayed here twice, both times in a club room which are lovely! Excellent value. Comfortable beds and pillows. Breakfast dosa and coffee is Amazing. Kesar makes fab cappuccino art. Highly recommend

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Mel & Thirza Asia tour
Detailed Review: The stay was superb. The personnel really made us feel like home with their hospitality and helped us with numerous tips to get the most of our (short) stay in Mumbai. Special thanks to Gopal and Rajesh which were always up for a good talk and practical tips for in Mumbai.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Vanessa H
Review: Hotel gave our room away - not safe for women
Detailed Review: I booked this hotel as we were only going to be staying for a few hours after our flight from London to Mumbai. We would then be travelling to our next destination early in the morning. Firstly the hotel driver was not there when we collected our luggage at 4.30 am bearing in mind the time. Then with no advanced notice he took us to a very dodgy hotel and threw our luggage on the ground and said Hotel Le grand is overbooked, we gave your room away so you're staying here. The place they took us was dilapidated, had no proper hotel sign. When I tried to complain they paid no attention and there was no accountability.   Left with no choice as our driver was not coming until 8 am we took the room, which had no key to the room. They were about 5 men standing around making both my‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: miatom
Detailed Review: We stayed as a family at Hotel Le Grande on 11 Jan 20. First things first - this hotel is not three star by any count of hygiene, quality and customer service ! The linen was plain dirty, toilet leaks and the bathroom walls not scrubbed probably for months.   The iron & iron board took four hours to be delivered and when it did come - was a board which should be at least a decade old - stained with poking nails and an iron which has seen many moons !   On request the linen was changed. The only saving grace was the food which was sumptuous both in quantity and quality.   Dirt seemed to be the byword - dirty stairs , dirty lift and dirty rooms ! Stay at your own peril.

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: abhignan
Detailed Review: It was really the best choice I made for stay. The hotel has very good service and the rooms were very good and clean. The food also tasted good. It was also very easy to go to Colaba, Bandra and other places. It made my stay memorable

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Nicky
Detailed Review: Me and my friend stayed at Elphinstone Hotel for 2 nights. It was the best hotel we visited during our 3 week trip! The room was very clean and not expensive at all. The breakfast was included and very good. The staff is really kind and hospitable. They helped us planning Day trips and ordered really nice and valuable indian food that we could eat in the breakfast area of the Hotel. They even let us taken a shower after we checked out because to taken the right train. We would definitely recommend this Place to everyone!

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Danny
Detailed Review: If you book the small room then it is small, there is no window, and there is music coming from the weirdest non-strip club underneath the hotel until 01:20.  If any of this is an issue for you then don't stay, otherwise read on for the great bits...  No window means no noise and no light, leading to a great sleep. The larger rooms looked great. If you don't plan to spend much time in the room then the small ones are fine. Clean, comfortable and with good bathroom and shower. The hallway is lovely and a nice place to sit and relax and meet other guests, an extension of your room if you will, with large windows and comfortable chairs.  There is a kettle in the room but complimentary tea and coffee is also served 5pm-7pm in the hall, where you can enjoy the complimentary massage‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: kiran Deshpande
Detailed Review: I stayed recently for 3 days & services matched with past experience.Managers are very polite & friendly & provide all information to travell with ease in city.Overall you feel very safe & homely.Its value for money.  Kiran Deshpande New Delhi

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Sarah Lewis
Detailed Review: Booked this hotel for last leg of travelling around India (for 5 weeks) and was very disappointed. I wouldn‚Äôt even call it a hotel TBH. It‚Äôs more like two back to back corridors with rooms down each side in an old ? converted building. The staff were pleasant enough, but the ‚Äòreception‚Äô was in the first corridor, and the ‚Äòbreakfast room‚Äô was in the other and consisted of a row of small round tables, each with two chairs !  Breakfast was ok, eggs to order, toast and jam, tea and coffee. There was no common seating/lounge area, no restaurant, no bar. There was no proper entrance, just a dingy doorway and up two flights of stairs. The ‚Äòsuperior‚Äô room was so pokey only one of you could move around at a time, with a gap of approximately 1ft in between the two single beds.  The‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Sean H
Detailed Review: The service from the staff was amazing from start to finish and nothing was too much of a chore. Room was clean and in very good condition and breakfast full of local delights. Location for Mumbai was great for exploring and close to so many things. The only negative was the road works directly out the front of the hotel which are pretty extensive meaning it was difficult to access at times but could not fault the hotel or staff!

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Thor
Detailed Review: We stayed for three nights at Hotel Residency Fort just after Christmas. The accommodation was adequate and the service was outstanding. In particular the concierge Rajesh went out of his way and even walked with us to a nearby place of business that we were looking for.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Geoff G
Review: Very attentive staff, near Mumbai Station
Detailed Review: The room was fine, the staff were always helpful - reception and restaurant, the breakfast was good, staff helpful about where to go, we would definitely come back. The Hotel's in the midst of the city!

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Maxxie6
Detailed Review: we had 3 nights at this hotel. as most previous reviews very good for the price. we paid extra for club room in the new wing and very good size and clean. breakfast was also very good and good coffee / masala tea as well. the staff were very friendly and helpful. would definitely stay again

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Roumila Rajanah
Detailed Review: We stayed in Residency Fort in Mumbai for one night before boarding the Costa Cruise. Its about 45 minutes from the Airport and 10min to the Cruise terminal - the location was perfect. All the staff are very friendly and welcoming. They are very helpful and eager to  cater for all your requests - be it for taxi services, local advice and even accompanying to local shops. The room are comfortable and breakfast was good. We would like to send a special thanks to Rajesh who helped us a lot during our stay. He always went out of his way to make us comfortable. He helped us to change our currency, get good taxi price and even brought us to good shops. In short, we were very happy and satisfied with our stay. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Priyanka
Detailed Review: We stayed there for a night. It was a clean Place with Kind Staff. It is quite close to Gateway of India and Marine Drive. They upgraded our room to a suite with no extra charge. Its moderately economical.  The food was good.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: masudah18
Detailed Review: The hotel is situated in a great location. Walking distance to many popular restaurants and shopping outlets. Excellent service! The staff were extremely helpful, Rajesh and Peter in particular. Breakfast staff were extremely warm and welcoming.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: jamesclarke88
Review: Lovely hotel and friendly staff in a good area
Detailed Review: We stayed late December for a few nights and loved it. The staff were friendly. We followed advice and upgraded to a club room and glad we did as it‚Äôs a newly upgraded building next door to the hotel.  Shower was good, bed very comfy and breakfast especially the freshly cooked dosas and omelettes were great. Would recommend this hotel.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: 519gc
Detailed Review: Great location, extremely helpful staff.   Our very clean and comfortable deluxe room (103) was spacious enough for 2 suitcases and included a chair (always nice to have). The metro works did not bother us as we were at the other end of the building and we slept well.  The breakfast was enjoyable but avoid the 9 AM breakfast rush hour.  There is complementary tea/coffee in the guest lounge.  The hotel airport transfer AC car was comfortable and the very good driver was helpful with our suitcases.  The hotel has a handheld weighing scale to save you finding out you have excess baggage charges at the airport!

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: JEN W
Detailed Review: We loved our stay here! I stayed with my mother and partner. It‚Äôs in a great location and you have great value for money. The service is impeccable (thank you to the guys at the door who looked after us and were brilliant!). The breakfast is the best we have had at any hotel in Mumbai. Rooms were fine and again great value for money. Thanks for our stay!

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Warwick D
Detailed Review: A great location from a friendly, good value hotel. All staff were helpful, in particular Peter, who gave us lots of good advice and attention. He seemed to always be there - do you ever go home Peter? üôè Nameste.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Tony Kyle
Detailed Review: Everything was lovely. Room was amazing, room service was quick and on point. Staff were super helpful. Helped us find our ubers, directed us to nice restaurants and greeted us everytime. Concierge Rajesh was always friendly and down for a chat. Thank you Hotel Residency Fort!

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Greg Lada
Detailed Review: Hotel Residency Fort: The Good, rooms are clean, facility is well maintained, centrally located to most tourist interests, restaurants, and shopping, reasonable breakfast, staff are courteous and professional. The Bad, rooms are small, almost no space to store your stuff and luggage. Just outside the hotel 24/7 open pit subway construction will keep you awake most of the night.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Travel274820
Detailed Review: Thank you Rajesh, Gopal, Kesar and all of the staff at the Residency Fort Hotel for making our stay so very, very excellent. Superb service, happy staff, nice clean rooms,  great breakfast and best cappuccinos ever! Looking forward to seeing you all again soon.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: George
Review: A good stay with a helpful staff member called Gopal
Detailed Review: Strategically well located in Mumbai's touristic heart we spent 2 nights in this hotel. We got a room in a building next to the main building, which wasn¬¥t directly on the main street and provided us a peacyful sleep.  The staff members are nice, especially one of them called Gopal was very helpful regarding various things e.g. getting us a sim card without hassle.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Fandl2011
Detailed Review: Stayed two nights and this hotel was great for us. We got a room in the adjacent building so had peaceful nights sleep away from the noise of the metro works. The room was clean and tidy and the breakfast delicious and filling. Great location and Rajesh was especially good, escorting us to the ATM and ordering an Uber for us for the airport journey. Wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to return here.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Shazeem Fahlen
Detailed Review: This was my first visit at the hotel .  Awesome stay , delicious breakfast with lot of spread ..  Great hospitality and service too ..  Had a good check in and check out experience lStaff is really helpful.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Sharan M
Detailed Review: I stayed here for just a day and I was elated to see how friendly and welcoming the hotel staff were. The hotel being in a good location provides access to the best parts of the city. Proper hygiene was maintained and rooms were very tidy.  Breakfast was excellent, one dish even better than the other.  They offered me a late check out and I was offered a comfortable massage while I waited for my taxi. Overall, a very friendly set of staff. A special mention to Concierge Rajesh. A very lively fellow and always puts a smile on your face with his cordiality. Would highly recommend staying here.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Renata P
Review: Was amazing stay will come back
Detailed Review: Our first time in India, service in hotel was amazing, guys special Rajesh was very friendly helps us with everything, definitely recommend this hotel! Breakfast was good, we had a problem with a room staff helped us

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Andrewh872305
Detailed Review: For the record I want to start by saying I don't like giving bad reviews, as can be seen from my previous reviews. However I feel I need to be honest about this hotel. The hotel itself is in a great location and is therefore good value for money, and the reception staff were very friendly. The good things stop there.  Our room was tiny, the bed sheets and towels were stained with God knows what and the room itself was in need of a good clean.  Now let's talk about the building going on both inside and out. If you want sleep don't stay here. The relentless drilling and construction going on outside makes sleep impossible. Also the hotel was also under some sort of construction inside too.  I feel the hotel has a duty to avoid putting people in rooms facing the outside where‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Kalsait Ravindra
Detailed Review: Amazing place to stay with family and spend time a pleasant stay thank you the special boy sanju and his colleague Glenn both are wonderful staff and very humble and professional it was amazing hospitality shown by then thanks a lot and great hotel

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Maxime
Review: Nice place, good quality for price but really noisy
Detailed Review: We had an amazing stay at this hotel. Really well located, in the heart of Mumbai. Amazing place to walk and have a great Mumbai immersion. The price to pay for that location, it‚Äôs in the heart of new subway construction, noisy from 6am to midnight, really short nights.  Great service from the staff, sometimes too much, for example ... we tried to arrange our laundry services by ourselves and the hotel over took the duty with the laundry. It‚Äôs better than not taking care but when customer wanna do things on their own ... The room was really confortable, nice bed, but getting old. Few caring and cleanliness should be made. Over all, great quality for the price, we recommend this hotel whiteout a doubt.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Thomas F
Detailed Review: The reception where very helpful when it turned out that I had booked a wrong date when we arrived late in the evening. The room was quite small, but ok, bed, shower ok. I had to cut the electricity to the refrigerator because it was making a of of noise, but i t was empty anyway.  It had been a wedding celebration in the hotel and some of the guests had a late night party in a room on the same floor witch was disturbing my sleep, but what to do.  Next morning we had a quick breakfast before heading to the airport. Its a short distance to the airport, 300 rupies, 10-15 minutes with taxi (we payed 900 rupies from the airport, to the hotel, got riped off, so go with the official taxies). We only stayed the night but I saw that it was a lot of road constructions in close proximity‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Jeanine L
Detailed Review: We visited this hotel and from the start we were treated so well! The staff went above and beyond to help us and make us feel welcome! It was clean and easy to find! Definitely recommend this hotel! Such a great place!

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Rajashri
Detailed Review: My Mumma Papa stayed here for 10 days. And it's the best place to live. My parents speak Spanish and little bit English yet staff gave them best service inspite of language barrier. Caring and friendly people. Exactly what one would expect for elderly parents.Clean room. Quick service. Alert and active service at reception. Everything one wish from hospitality industry is here. Highly recommended.  Thank you Bawa Regency Staff ! You guys are doing great job !

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: aadityabajaj
Detailed Review: I visited this hotel in 2019 for a short stay and stayed on the second floor.  The premises are kept well maintained, clean with prompt housekeeping and room services. The front desk staff and all other staff are very courteous and polite. The hotel does not allow food and beverages from outside (not even app delivery), but makes up for it with a good in-house kitchen and reasonably priced(no dining, only room service). Smooth check in and check out. The hotel is very accessible from the Airport.  Overall impression is good and would definitely stay again for solo and official visits.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Dattaraj
Detailed Review: This is one of the best hotel for middle class people. Hotels members are too much co operative.customer relation ship manager is also co operative.facilities are also good.we too much enjoy environment in this hotel.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Molay Ray
Detailed Review: Very clean hotel, I stayed for few days as it was my official stay. Office staffs & Front Admins are all very polite and cooperative. Service is also excellent.  Only negative is they don't have their in house restaurant for lunch & dinner.  Breakfast is complimentary.  All the best hope this service remains same.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: bodhiekanta
Detailed Review: A lovely budget hotel with rooms as big as a shoebox and incredible clean with very comfortable matrazess and wonderful linen. Be aware when you book the size of the room : Superior rooms in the Agoda side are mentioned as 20 m2 and are actually at the most 10 m2 with no window , the Deluxe rooms are around 20 m2. It would be helpful to have a squeeze or shower curtain in the bathroom else the floor gets wet and slippery - else the showering is a delight . Also many people reviewed the breakfast as bad we found it perfect üëå.If you are very noise sensitive bring earplugs as the restaurant below plays music in the night - they lowered it after we asked the stuff to request them so. The stuff is very , very nice ... We meet Sunil and Mr.Singh.They allowed us to keep our luggage‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: dennismurphy3
Detailed Review: I had the most delightful stay at this charming colonial style hotel. This hotel is deceptively modern inside. It has the most comfortable beds and incredibly clean bathrooms. I would definitely recommend this hotel to any travellers to Mumbai.  On a personal note one thing that would help to improve the beautiful rooms further would be some softer lighting and a few table lamps. Like all hotels in India they seem to have installed very harsh LED lighting in all of the rooms which is a shame because the rooms are so beautiful and the strong lighting completely kills the atmosphere in the evening.  This LED light comment is about most of the hotels I stay in India and not only about the one I‚Äôm writing the review for.  Anyway, I definitely recommend hotel Elphinstone to anybody‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Michael P
Review: Great hotel at very reasonable price
Detailed Review: My friend and I stayed here recently.  The staff are great especially the manager Hemond,  the rooms are spotless and the location is walking distance from the main railway station Victoria Terminus. Very good value for Mumbai.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: 20Nomad17
Detailed Review: Very small windowless rooms.  Equipped ok though and close to Gateway to India.  Ok for a night-stop but too claustrophobic for any longer.  WiFi ok in rooms and reception area.  A few shops nearby for meals.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: 20Nomad17
Detailed Review: Very small windowless rooms.  Equipped ok though and close to Gateway to India.  Ok for a night-stop but too claustrophobic for any longer.  WiFi ok in rooms and reception area.  A few shops nearby for meals.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: 20Nomad17
Detailed Review: Very small windowless rooms.  Equipped ok though and close to Gateway to India.  Ok for a night-stop but too claustrophobic for any longer.  WiFi ok in rooms and reception area.  A few shops nearby for meals.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: 20Nomad17
Detailed Review: Very small windowless rooms.  Equipped ok though and close to Gateway to India.  Ok for a night-stop but too claustrophobic for any longer.  WiFi ok in rooms and reception area.  A few shops nearby for meals.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: 20Nomad17
Detailed Review: Very small windowless rooms.  Equipped ok though and close to Gateway to India.  Ok for a night-stop but too claustrophobic for any longer.  WiFi ok in rooms and reception area.  A few shops nearby for meals.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: LGD
Detailed Review: I stayed here in two occasions in 2019 as a solo female traveller and would be happy to return in future. The rooms I stayed in were small but very clean and comfortable, with a good range of facilities. I don‚Äôt usually care about breakfast when I travel but the wide choice included in the breakfast buffet was excellent. The selling point for me was the staff. They were all extremely polite and incredibly helpful to me during my stay, making sure that I knew where I was going and printing train tickets for me. Unfortunately I‚Äôve forgotten the staff member‚Äôs name, but one of the front of house team was kind enough to arrange an Uber for me on more than one occasion, and made sure that I was safe at all times. As a woman travelling alone I appreciated this. I would not hesitate to‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Amy O
Review: Quiet clean oasis in South Mumbai
Detailed Review: This is a lovely hotel but what makes it a five star experience is the excellent staff. They are friendly and accommodating in every way. Really make you feel at home. Also it‚Äôs an excellent value for the money in Mumbai.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: dasgupta105
Review: It was a site seeing tour in Mumbai for two days.
Detailed Review: It was a nice experience staying in the hotel. Its location is very good. Hotel arranged pickup from airport and also arranged tourist taxi for site seeing. Quality of breakfast served is good.Hotel staff are very cordial and helping in nature.Particularly concierge Rajesh helped us a lot. The hotel offers good value for money

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Ankit Kapoor
Detailed Review: Its a nice hotel at good location. Rooms are small, perhaps that's a feature of all Mumbai hotels due to space constraint. Club rooms are located in a separate building. Room cleanliness was up to the mark. Breakfast was also good. It was a nice stay.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: nellnbundy
Detailed Review: We arrived from Australia and my wife had food poisoning from the plane food.  The staff couldn't do enough to make us comfortable and cooked her boiled potatoes when she was unable to eat normally. We had 4 nights in a room with a balcony overlooking the street life below.  The breakfast waiters, Akmal and Kesar were so helpful and patient with everyone.   Girish, the breakfast cook was always filling empty stomachs with his culinary  skills.  Peter organised the busy breakfast sessions with gentle efficiency.  Goal and Rajesh who attended the entrance always greeted everyone with a smile.   The hotel is close to everything in the old part of Mumbai.   We would stay there again in a heartbeat and recommend the Residency if you want an authentic Indian stay with comfort.  The‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Louise Clark
Detailed Review: We had an amazing stay at this hotel because it was so very comfortable and very nice. BUT more importantly all the staff were incredible. They were so welcoming and so friendly and could not do enough for us. Such a credit to this hotelüôèüòÅThere was Keshir, Gopal, Ajmam, Roshn, Rajesh, Peter, the brilliant chef and othersüíöit was excellent exceptional service. My husband and I can not recommend this hotel highly enough üôèalso we really appreciated all the cups of tea, biscuits and brilliant mealsüòäa brilliant stay! Thank you.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Stephen W
Detailed Review: An excellent budget hotel in Mumbai. Location was excellent, staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay. We stayed in a seperate annex in room P4. Room had recently been refurbished and was in great condition, very modern with our own balcony. Breakfast was lovely. The hotel really did their best to ensure everything went well during our stay.  The only negative at the moment is the nearby construction work. It is exceptionally noisy and if you have a room facing remotely near to the ongoing work you will hear it and will struggle to sleep without earplugs. Thankfully we had earplugs and it was fine.  This work is obviously beyond the hotels control. Remember to take earplugs though!!!!!

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: njan45
Review: Ideally located to explore Old Mumbai!!
Detailed Review: We were staying in this hotel for a second time. First time we stayed here in 2012. The hotel has made more improvement in all aspects. They have the best employees who are ready to go the extra mile to make your stay comfortable.  The activities of metro construction has made the access little confusing.  The breakfast was superb with a lot of items to choose from. Free News papers and bottled water, welcome drink and a pack of potato chips, well, we enjoyed our stay. Last but not the least, it was budget friendly too!! Highly recommended.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Zlatko
Detailed Review: Located in Fort, the Hotel provides easy access to Mumbai picturesque neighborhoods of Colaba and Kala Ghoda that can be practically explored on foot from the hotel.   The hospitality provided by the front office staff outshines pricier and international chain hotel options! Unbelievable service!  Stayed here for three nights, great overall experience.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Shelley Ma
Detailed Review: Stayed at the Residency Hotel Fort for just one night, but it was excellent. The service, the cleanliness and the room were spot on. The staff go out of their way to ensure you are well cared for and safe. Staying here as a solo traveller it is important to know someone is looking out for you. The breakfast is buffet style with a good mix of western and Indian food. They even have an espresso machine. Dosa, waffles and eggs are made to order. My room was fantastic, not a lot of natural light‚Äîwhich means quieter though. Very comfortable  bed. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking in this price range and I will certainly return should I ever find myself in Mumbai again.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Youngday
Review: A convenience place to stay for tourists looking to view Mumbai
Detailed Review: Great location and very friendly and helpful staff. As others have mentioned the staff went out of their way to assist in any way they could and the offers of tea and coffee of a drink and crisps after a long journey were very welcome. The construction work going on night and day was the main downside.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Smeer S
Detailed Review: This hotel  i stayed for 1 night .the stay over here is just value for money .on my business trip i stayed here.the rooms are neatly maintained .ambience is good its good to travel from here to the cityall is well perfect

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Sanjay
Detailed Review: Good location but current metro station project can be a bit disruptive. Hotel is generally clean but could do with a overall uplift. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is a simple affair but adequate.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Aron
Detailed Review: This review could go either way.  The hotel is in a great location.  The rooms are small but adequate.   Breakfast and room service are good.  But there is huge construction work going on right outside until early in the morning so say goodbye to sleep.  There's also construction going on inside the hotel so it's far from peaceful.  As well as this, there were some things that left a bitter taste in my mouth, ear wax on a pillow a spot of blood on a 'clean' towel.  The saving grace of this place was the staff. Attentitive, friendly, helpful. Particularly Rajesh, a kind soul who continually went out of his way to make our stay as good as possible.  It's far from luxury but it does the job.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Stephen C
Detailed Review: This is one of the few hotels that really know what hospitality means. I have stayed here for one or two nights for several years. I am usually greeted by the concierge Rajesh, who has even been known to run down the street  to take my bag if he sees me coming. This time I arrived at around 8 o'√ßlock in the morning but they gave me a room immediately (well not actually immediately - I first had to shake hands with all the staff in the reception area who remembered me from last time) and then was allowed to have breakfast despite not being entitled to it util the next morning (I also had to shake hands with the restaurant manager and all the waiters, all of whom remembered me). The staff could not be more friendly or helpful, nothing seems to be too much trouble. It will not be a‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: mzangl15
Review: Perfect City Hotel with Most Amazing Staff
Detailed Review: This three star hotel should have four. The facilities are very clean and on a four star international standard. We had a queen size bed which was very comfortable. Also if you need anything else for your room, pillows, toilet paper, fresh towels, etc. the friendly staff will provide anything free of charge.   The staff is what makes this hotel special. If you need anything - we really tested that - they will provide it for you. Just to give an two examples. First, we are on a very long trip and needed some stuff from amazon. We ordered it to the hotel. We were out during the day and the delivery was not completed because of a policy that it had to be delivered to me personally. When we came back to the hotel they contacted me and told me what happened. Ten minutes later they‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: ChristopherMunich
Detailed Review: My fourth stay already in this hotel.  Reasons to return are the excellent location, extremely good service, cleanliness, comfortable beds. Everyone at the front desk speaks impeccable English and helps with tasks like negotiating a taxi fare.  Breakfast is also really nice and is available until 11am. I couldn't really imagine a better location, most of South Mumbai's interesting spots are in walking distance, there are lots of restaurants, ATMs and shops just around the corner and the area as such feels very safe.  Only downside is the noisy construction site around the corner, but you cannot blame the hotel for it.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Chinmaypanchal
Detailed Review: Front desk staff are so courteous very helpful Restaurant staff and food are amazing Facilities like gym pool and spa available in this property would recommend it to anyone who are Mumbai Kudos to the team

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Claire J
Review: Friendly and Comfortable Hotel in a Great Location
Detailed Review: Our 3 nights stay at the Residency Fort was the at the start of our 2 week holiday in Mumbai. The location is excellent. Right in the centre of the Fort area of Mumbai. Restaurants, shops, museums and some well known heritage attractions e.g Victoria Terminus, were all walkable with no problems. We really enjoyed the area and if you are up for exploring there are some interesting neighbourhoods e.g Khala Ghada nearby. Our room the first night had no natural day light so we asked to be moved the next day  which was no problem at all. Staff were friendly and attentive to all of our needs. Room and hotel were clean. Breakfast was ample with western and Indian options. For the money you pay the hotel is excellent value.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Lucy C
Review: Excellent location and very good service
Detailed Review: We stayed here for the first three nights of our India trip. The service is very good indeed. The staff are all very friendly and go out of their way to make you feel at home. Our first room had no natural light but the next day we were moved without any hesitation to a room with a large window. The hotel is clean and the breakfast was more than satisfactory with delicious loose leaf tea. We also had complimentary masala chai in the lounge one afternoon which was also delicious. The location of the hotel couldn‚Äôt be beaten - we were able to walk to VT, Crawford Market and Fabindia, and the Gateway is just a short tuk tuk ride away. The noise from the metro construction is definitely noticeable. We just put it down to experiencing part of Mumbai‚Äôs history in the making.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Jetadi
Detailed Review: Stayed here for 3 nights with my family along with my 3 year old niece. Very nice hotel and staffs are super nice, very helpful and always cheerful. Would highly recommend if you are looking for a bed and breakfast kind of place.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Chris M
Review: Very Comfortable stay in an great area of Mumbai
Detailed Review: We spent 4 nights at the Residency Fort Hotel-Mumbai. We were well and efficiently received on arrival, and check-in went easily. Over our several days, we received excellent service, especially enjoying breakfast's wide range of options, and plentiful coffee. We really appreciated Peter's warm welcome, and competent management. The neighborhood is active and interesting, and we walked to the Gateway and other South Mumbai areas.  The room was very comfortable, and the gentleman who cared for our room, and helped us out early in the morning as we left was outstanding. We also appreciate the help from Gopal, who made sure we had what we needed. One note that guests should be aware of (as of early November 2019) ‚Äì there is local construction for a new Metro line in the‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: diannsouthgate
Review: Perfect location for visiting the sights
Detailed Review: Exceptionally helpful staff, nothing is too much  trouble, booking taxis room service all provided with a smile.  Room was clean, bedding changed daily, toiletries provided very comfortable bed.    Excellent breakfast served in pleasant dining room.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Kate O
Detailed Review: This hotel was brilliant start to finish. Great location, great staff offering good advice, and very clean. Breakfast was very good for a small hotel, complimentary newspaper in the morning all just added extra beyond and above what was expected. I would highly recommend for tourists on a mid range budget who want to do ‚Äòsights‚Äô and restaurants.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: benjamin lin
Detailed Review: good location, near by Victoria old station and church gate station.  and closed to sea bay in15 min by foot.  and there were few cinema around  400meters.  the staff are always smile face. and give you help anytime.   it's a friendly stay in hotel residency fort.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: PSh
Review: Average Mumbai no brand hotel for mid range price range, close to the International Airport
Detailed Review: The hotel is close to the international airport.  Offered airport pick up for competitive price.  Room and bathroom were small but clean and functional .  A good option for an overnight stay near the airport.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Patrick UK
Review: A good hotel in Bombay for business stay
Detailed Review: This is a great little hotel in the heart of bustling Andheri East. Its conveniently around 15mins to the airport. There is a very good in house restaurant which serves food at all hours. The reception will do all they can to accomodate your needs. I had to cancel one day -  no problem sir. Around the hotel is quiet, but its take a small walk up to the roundabout and you have all the restaurants, shops, barbers, market. The hotel is clean, quiet and professionally managed. I would recommend to all.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Martin H
Review: Four day holiday at Hotel Le Grande
Detailed Review: Our stay at the Hotel Le Grande has been an absolute delight. The kindness and helpfulness of all the staff has been fantastic. This is our first time in Mumbai and was a little daunting. But the management were super helpful. A special thank you to the manager who helped us in so many ways. The rooms are a nice size with good air conditioning. The bathrooms are large and we'll equipped. We particularly enjoyed the food from the restaurant. Having breakfast every day and an evening meal on one occasion. Try the chicken biryani,   my wife and I liked it very much. Overall a great stay and I recommend it to other travelers that visit Mumbai. Best wishes to all at the hotel Le Grande Martin & Cheryl Harper üòÄ

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Tom D
Review: Very helpful staff and decent value
Detailed Review: We spent a couple of nights. The hotel is upstairs a flight, but the staff helped carry our bags up. We had checked into a very small room and when the manager saw our bags he said that we could move to a larger room the next day, which was not much more. The manager was very helpful throughout, gave us tips for going to visit some sites, and made sure that our stay as well pleasant as possible. The larger room was very adequate and allows us to move around easily despite our bags. Breakfast is served in the back hallway, very clever use of space (the front hallway serves as the front desk and has chairs to enjoy the newspaper and afternoon tea they procure for free). The breakfast  selection  rotates everyday. Nothing special (we were disappointed with the idly, but the omelets‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Manish Pandit
Review: So polite and helping staff, high class hotel for low price
Detailed Review: When u reach the hotel, u may feel did u book something wrong. But as u move to first floor, where hotel is situated, u will soon realize the standard of this hotel. For CST area of Mumbai, having this kind of hotel is really a blessing. All prime locations of Mumbai are at 10 mins distance from this hotel. The room is comfy, breakfast is good. The only one drawback is that they dont have restaurant and hence for lunch and dinner, u need to order food from outside. But thats due to space restrictions in this area, I think. The hotel is very very secure and has very good massage and foot spa chairs. Good for families too as kids wont feel bored here despite the small size of this hotel.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: panda_powpow
Detailed Review: After spending a month in Mumbai, staying in hotels and hostels of various quality and cleanliness, this hotel wins by far. At street level, it is hard to imagine such a quality hotel as the facade is not noteworthy. Simply walking up the stairs to the hotel entrance, you are transported to a impeccably neat, clean, and orderly hotel. They had my reservation, the one I had made 3 months prior, and they welcomed me with tea and a snack. Wonderfully run hotel and absolutely worth the price. The staff are very polite and hard working.  It is walkable to Crawford Market. The superior rooms were small but comfortable and very well maintained. The breakfast in the morning was good and filling. It was the perfect way to cap my Mumbai trip.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: karvam
Detailed Review: Having to climb a 40 steps staircase to get to the reception is quite an effort, but it is rewarded by an extremely nice welcome. The staff is courteous and helpful, the rooms are clean and stylish and breakfast is simple but adequate. With a convenient location neat Crawford Market and Masjid railway station this is an affordable and relaxing accommodation in central Mumbai. Enjoy the newspapers, the afternoon tea and the massage chais in the lobby!

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Sujitc75
Detailed Review: The hotel is located in south Mumbai and the connectivity is very good (VT station is near by). Room rent is reasonable and the service is also good.Rooms are in good conditions. Room size is although small. Breakfast is not good. No in house restaurant available. Overall, value for money.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Ramadas R
Detailed Review: Really a excellent hotel, for the price we pay , in the heart of the city,that too along with breakfast. Reception persons and services in the hotel is very good.  The place is very close to Crawford market and other important places.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Aditya D
Review: Good Stay But a bit Cosy one
Detailed Review: The Stay was Good. But i felt the room in Victoria suite a bit small. The Overall Service was Awesome. The free option for foot and back massage is very nice Experience. Hotel is very near to Mumbai port trust. Just a minutes walk. Breakfast which was served complimentary had only one item to serve and was limited.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Tauseef Narangi
Detailed Review: I have stayed in this hotel for all my Mumbai visits and I have to say that my experience keeps on improving each and every time...this property deserves more than 5 stars. The management is very polite and helpful and Mr Hemond the manager what a gem of a person gave us a warm welcome each and every time and assured us that we enjoyed our stay. my special thanks to Mr Hemond. Waiting for my next visit here....

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Eshita Shah
Detailed Review: Amazing hotel in South Mumbai. A worth visit if want to stay in a luxury hotel. Service and ambiance was good. The restaurant has good food options. I didn't get much time exploring as I was on a business trip

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: amcaJamaica
Detailed Review: There is the construction of an underground metro station so there is construction noise 24/7 - wait a while to stay....the staff are FABULOUS!!!   It is in a great location though.   Perhaps in 2 months time.  It was very clean.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: wes232
Review: Amazing service, well positioned hotel in Mumbai!
Detailed Review: We based in the Residency hotel for a sight seeing holiday in Mumbai, the location was great and easy to walk around the Fort and Colaba area from. The staff were very friendly and helped us arrange anything we needed, and the price was very reasonable for the area the hotel is located in. Thoroughly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to visit Mumbai.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Topxi
Detailed Review: The facility to easily arrange transport from the airport was a prime motivator in booking this hotel.  It worked very well.  Even though our luggage was delayed at the airport our driver was waiting for us without any disquiet.   The journey during the day time hours is quite long and very busy.  An area near to the hotel has a lot of underground metro digging in progress.  Nothing the hotel can do about it.  It did not cause us a difficulty.  We had a room in a very close by annex that was very convenient and private.  The bed mattress was good but a protector would be a good addition. The hotel's staff are able to arrange lots of things.  Breakfast was adequate with dosa prepared on request.  The dining area is quite compact.  Complimentary afternoon tea was made available to‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Adam S
Review: The best place to stay in Mumbai.
Detailed Review: We stayed twice at the Residency - 2 nights at the start of our India trip, and 5 nights at the end when we joined a friend also staying there. She had recommended it from s previous stay. We will definitely go back. Spotlessly clean, convenient, and all the things that would want from s reasonably priced hotel. The best aspect was the staff - we enjoyed getting to know everyone, and they looked after us so kindly. We enjoyed the banter at breakfast, and we had a lot of laughs. When one of our party was suffering heat stroke, the staff were very kind, noticing immediately she hadn't come down for breakfast. Genuine, personal, service. I can't recommend the Residency enough. We really enjoyed our stay and will certainly go back.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: naomi c
Detailed Review: This hotel is really good value for money. The room was small and functional, but it had everything we needed including a kettle. There was a lounge with complimentary tea for guests and a staff who were very engaging and helped us in all sorts of practical ways. We were able to stroll out to markets and monuments and we really felt like we were in the centre of things. There was some rather noisy building work going on (building the metro I think) which only stopped for a few hours in the middle of the night, but we weren‚Äôt in Mumbai for the peace and quiet, so it didn‚Äôt trouble us too much!

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: PrinceKL
Review: Great Staff - 5 STARS and I would stay there again without hesitation
Detailed Review: The Staff made up what the hotel needed to be a five Star hotel. It is an old hotel and it is being refurbushed. There is the construction of an underground metro station so there is construction noise but it is bearable - we had a room at the rear side from the construction work. We got the Indigo Suite 311 it was very roomy and basically everything was working and clean as one could/would expect from a older hotel and for the price of the rooms and its great location.  The breakfast was great - there is a Chef would will cook you fried eggs, omelettes and Dosa to order and expresso coffee of your choice  As everyone has said the front office staff was great, when we left they organised a UBER car for us INR450 to the airport.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: BrianCassey
Detailed Review: Just completed my third trip to Mumbai in just over a year ... and my third stay at the 'Residency'. The place just keeps getting better ... I was greeted like an old friend on my arrival this latest visit by Abhijit on reception with the news that I had been upgraded to the new 'Club Heritage' wing of the hotel. Very impressive ... a larger and more comfortable well appointed room that even sported a four poster bed ! A great new addition (will expect an 'upgrade' next visit too now :-) ) Once again all the staff were fantastic ... a special Thank You to Peter, Roshan, Gopal, Rajesh, Akmal, Pansingh, Kesar and Abhijit ... you guys make the Residency what it is.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Thezentinel
Detailed Review: Arriving into a very festive and busy Mumbai at the start of Diwali we were quite weary of the type of establishment one would need in Mumbai where you can just relax and be assured of comfort. That was indeed what we experienced at the Residency Hotel Fort, where it‚Äôs evident that the staff pride themselves on service excellence from the word go...  I‚Äôd like to thank the management and very specifically concierge Rajesh, who looked after us with exceptional care, just what we needed after a long journey, a definite asset to this establishment.  I‚Äôll definitely recommend to anyone!

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Tmoszkowski
Detailed Review: Great quality for value, especially when reserving a room in the new wing. The service is excellent, the rooms are tidy, and the breakfast is really good. It's good to have breakfast earlier in the day in order to avoid the overcrowded cantina. Good location, within walking distance from the Railway Station and the Gateway of India. Highly recommended.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Maria
Review: Lovely hotel in a lovely city
Detailed Review: I warmly recommend this hotel! Perfect location for experience Mumbai. Very clean and the staff is excellent! So helpful and friendly. Specially Rajesh and Gopal did there very best to make my stay wonderful.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: pieter b
Review: The best place to visit Bombay!
Detailed Review: This hotel is in the centre of Mumbai. On walking distance of gateway to India. The hotelrooms were clean and the beds were soft. But the best thing this hotel has to offer is the staff! They are so friendly! They gave you a warm welcome and made  it feel like home! Especially concierge Rajesh is a great man! Because of this man and the rest of the staff I will definitely come back!

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Tushar naik
Detailed Review: Awesome atmosphere very helping staff good food... Mr Ravi mehta manager very helpful and good nature.... Each and every movement was good..good place to visit... Will give reference to friends and relatives to visit the hotel once...

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Roy v
Detailed Review: We had a very good time, enjoyed our room, breakfast and excellent service from all staff (gopal and others). All very helpful with everything! We recommend this place. Kathelijn and Roy from The Netherlands

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Krishna Kumar
Review: Excellent and refreshing stay in Mumbai
Detailed Review: i recently been to Mumbai for my office work...the stay was fantastic and excellent...the hotel is equipped with all the amenities and luxury... i was amazed with the service...there food was excellent and good in taste..overall 10/10 expirence..

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: MTruss
Detailed Review: This was my first stay in India, and I so happy to have stayed at Residency Hotel in Mumbai. Before this experience, India was a once in a lifetime destination for me. After having met so many great people, I want to come back. The rooms are affordable & very clean, the location is good and the people are really great.   Special thanks to: - the concierge Rajesh for being a great person and providing help on getting a Sim Card.  - Pan singh & Gopal for the great tea and fun talks. - Peter & Mr. Patil for being open and nice. - Giresh for the the delicious breakfast. - Rajpal & Umish for cleaning and being nice - The rest of the team for the great hospitality and the welcoming attitude - Gufran for the great tour of mumbai and the slums.  Thanks to everyone in the team for always‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: SanjuR
Detailed Review: Me and my guests were staying at hotel for 2 days. Stay was excellent big and clean rooms. My colleague who visited first time in India we're really happy. Priyanka manager at reception took very much care of my guest. She advised them better places for city tour.everything was arranged in advance.all services were excellent.. helpful and friendly staff. We will surely come to stay again..kudos to holiday inn

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: marianoa
Detailed Review: We are the type of travelers that favor function over style - this hotel is exactly what we look for.  - Very clean - Comfortable beds - Great shower - Good location - Great Breakfast included - Amazing staff, everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. Gopal and the team really know customer service and we felt at home right away. We had to wait a long time in the lounge for our flight home and they took care of us wonderfully. Hospitality at its finest. Our Uber driver was having difficulties finding the hotel due to the surrounding construction and Gopal called him to give him directions. Gestures like this one kept coming one after another. Very refreshing!  We lucked out we got upgraded to a large room which was an added bonus. Overall I highly recommend this hotel.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Per U
Detailed Review: Very convinient location. All staff fantastic and welcoming and helpful. Great serviceminded. Standard rooms, clean and they contain what you need. Good a/c and very good wifi. The breakfast buffet is plentiful With a lot of (mostly) Indian Choices. We will recommend this hotel. Taxi price to hotel from airport should be around 5-600 INR.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Steven P
Detailed Review: The team at Hotel Residency Fort made us feel really special, and were always happy to help us. Special thanks to Gopal who was always there to assist us both within the hotel and outside such as the best place to find a SIM card and water!

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Margarita G
Detailed Review: The hotel looks classic on the outside but the rooms are very modern, small but comfortable. The location is good to visit some of the city main places. The best of the hotel is the staff, people are always ready to help with and make your stay easier.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Eugene
Detailed Review: The hotel's location in Fort area was a perfect base for me to explore the key sites in south mumbai, such as Gateway of India/Taj Mahal Palace. The hotel was also abt 10-15 mins walk from 2 rail stations (Churchgate and CSMT), providing easy train access to central and north mumbai. The hotel staff were perhaps the star of the stay. Mr Peter, Gopal, Rajesh and Lawrence were exceptional - they were always there for the guests, always ready to extend a helping hand. Daily breakfast was good, and also a big thanks to the breakfast/room service crew. The hotel also provided after-checkout luggage-holding service, which I really fully appreciate! Overall, excellent stay at this hotel!

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Marie O
Detailed Review: The staff at the Residency made sure we had a quiet room away from the noise of Mumbai, they helped us get taxis and generally took great care of us.  Peter, Lawrence, Rajesh and all of the team are incredibly professional and we cannot recommend them highly enough. Marie and Fiona

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: BeanoBoys
Review: excellent service in a central area
Detailed Review: The hotel was centrally located, we were able to walk from the train station and could explore Mumbai on foot. The staff were extremely helpful and accommodating and nothing was too much trouble. Because of road works nearly they had moved us into a room a further distance from the road works so that we were not affected by this. The staff were more than happy to provide us with complementary drinks and snacks on arrival and bottled water was provided in the rooms. They provided us with an excellent dinner recommendation, happily stored our bags on the day of departure and arranged for an Uber to take us to the airport. There was also a buffet breakfast included which had plenty of choices for everyone. The room included a king sized bed, fridge, safe, TV and ensuite with lovely‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: 989ChrisG
Detailed Review: A very welcoming and comfortable hotel. Peter and the staff were very welcoming and helpful during our stay. We stayed in the new wing of the hotel. Our room was large, very comfortable and beautifully furnished. There were many restaurants to choose from within walking distance, as well as the historic train station, Gateway of India and Marine Drive. Highly recommended.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: mesn1
Detailed Review: Staff at the Hotel Residency, especially Peter, treated us like royalty. They upgraded us to a club room as it was our honeymoon. The room was stunning! Breakfast was incredible and we will certainly be back.

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Praful Sheraji
Detailed Review: We have stayed in super deluxe rooms of this hotel and we found it very comfortable, as we were there for day stay hence cant review for breakfast and other amenities, our overall stay was superb and loved it.

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Nandita Narayan
Review: Very clean and well maintained room!
Detailed Review: 2 of us had gone on business, so we booked 2 executive rooms via MakeMyTrip. We reached there a little earlier than check-in time, so the staff was kind enough to check us into 1 room and later gave us another.   To our luck, one of the rooms were upgraded to Super Deluxe (not sure of the category).  The room was exceptionally clean, from the sheets, to pillows, to the toilet.   The hotel does not have a restaurant but round the clock room service. The food was quite good (although a little overpriced).  Over all it was a really comfortable experience. I would definitely go back there and surely recommend it.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Adrian W
Detailed Review: The Elphinstone is a lovely hotel, staffed by the most frindly and helpful people. The rooms are clean and comfortable, the breakfast is nice and the hotel location near Crawford Market is very convienient. The levels of customer service were superb, the staff really were brilliant; they organised laundry and helped with taxis. The entrance to the hotel is up some dark stairs, you then arrive at the front desk to meet the nicest friendliest people.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: meng lee
Detailed Review: It was a good stay at the clean and comfortable hotel. The hotel manager and staff were very helpful and friendly. The bed was very comfortable and room was very spacious. Hot wafer was very consistent with good pressure. After we checked out and waiting for the late night train, the manager, Hermond, kindly let us use the suite to freshen up and it was much appreciated. I would definitely return to this hotel if i come back to Mumbai again.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Bhairav shah
Detailed Review: Very lovely hotel...Recomended for all.Well maintained rooms, neat and clean, good ambience...Great services...Always recomended... Lovely Experience Also nice place, and good staff support Thanks for lovely co operation

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: dcw_1245
Detailed Review: This was my third visit to Mumbai and I wish I had found this hotel sooner. The hotel offers exceptionally high standards of service, far above what one would expect given its price point. The staff were friendly and proactive from start to finish. The property is well maintained and very clean.  I stayed in the new wing and the room (one of the "Heritage Rooms") was beautiful. There was a little noise from the road below but that's hard to escape in India. There is a television lounge on the ground floor of the building. There is also a pleasant sitting lounge in the main building adjacent to the restaurant with complimentary tea and coffee.  As others have noted, the breakfast buffet is high quality -- among the best I've had on this three-month trip.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: mpicko1
Detailed Review: I have just come back from a business trip to South Mumbai and fort in particular. I can honestly say I would never go anywhere else. The service is amazing, the restaurant is just what you need and the staff are incredible, welcoming and friendly they can not do enough for you. Ideally suited for everything in Fort and beyond. It is not too far to walk anywhere, from Marine drive and the Wankhede stadium, to The Gateway of India and the Taj Hotel and even down to Colaba and markets. 10 Minutes walk to Mangaldas Market and Crawfords with all the hustle and bustle, but the hotel is tucked away off the main thoroughfare giving you an unprecedented amount of Peace in this manic city. Special thanks has to go to Concierge Rajesh. Literally anything is possible with this man helping‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Saravan
Review: Automatic Hotel choice for South Mumbai
Detailed Review: We reached hotel by 8.45am, hoping that we could at least drop bags. But to our surprise, we were checked in and offered beverages too as compliment. Rooms were small but sufficient. The hotel staffs were courteous and helpful. Good location to roam in South Mumbai. The breakfast was their USP. I was able to hold luggage after check out too. Finally, I must say that one of their staffs Gopal was really exceptional and he deserves my pat on the back. Overall, an excellent hotel one must not miss !!!

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Lucy
Detailed Review: When we first arrived it was about 8am, we only intended to drop our bags off but they let us check in which was fantastic. Room was lovely and modern and staff couldn‚Äôt have been more friendly. Breakfast was nice, a self serve with plenty of options. If I ever needed to come back to Mumbai I‚Äôd stay here again.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: lengelcj
Detailed Review: The customer service at the Hotel Residency is unbeatable! I have visited twice before, but this was my first solo business trip. (My colleagues were staying at the Taj Lands End, but I chose to stay at the Residency instead--which tells you something about how much I appreciate the warm reception at this hotel.)  The front desk staff is friendly as well as efficient (a special shout-out to Roshan, and thanks to Abhijit and Gopal as well). Peter and the rest of the wonderful breakfast staff, including Balu, Akmal, Kesar, and Pan Singh, make mornings cheerful--and the food is always really good and plentiful. A buffet offers local treats like vada pao, idly, and poha as well as muffins, cereal, fruit, and so on, and there is an omelette and dosa station ready to take orders.  ‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: niteeg
Review: Loved the hospitality and warmth of the hotel staff!
Detailed Review: Was here on a solo trip. The location couldn't be better. The staff let me check in early which was much required. Breakfast is well planned and you wouldn't be wanting for anything else. The rooms are well appointed and functional. Peter and other staff were ever smiling and helpful. Wonderful and memorable experience!

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Harshal Goyal
Detailed Review: It was a nice experience staying at Goldfinch, courteous staff and great room service indeed. Liked the breakfast menu and service, people greet you with smile and always ready to help you. Would suggest this place for your stay in Mumbai !!

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: gerrysalm0n
Detailed Review: In an age of budget hotels and hands-off business models, it‚Äôs nice to find a place that still values good old fashioned customer service. These guys are great. I‚Äôve been well looked after by the whole team (Peter & Rajesh deserve a special mention) and they also arranged an airport pick up and drop off by the hotel team (nice driver too). Rooms are contemporary and simple. Breakfast lounge is excellent. Location is great for tourist locations.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Charles A
Detailed Review: My wife, and my mother and her husband stayed at Residency Hotel Fort very recently and we're very pleased with our stay. The hotel is very comfortable, with nice beds and very clean. The staff is helpful and kind. The breakfast is also quite good with both Indian and international options (chai, coffee, fruit, dosa, eggs, etc.)  I would very happily stay at Residency again on a return visit to Mumbai.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Bernadette W
Review: The only place to stay in Mumbai!
Detailed Review: My husband and I spent two nights here & we only wish it had been longer! The hotel is perfectly situated and has all the facilities you need. The food is also fantastic but the absolute best part about the hotel is the staff! Everyone who works here is friendly & helpful, they all go out of their way to make your stay special. Special mention should be made of Peter, who runs the breakfast service - he is incredibly helpful & a consummate professional - & of Rajesh, who was our concierge. Rajesh was absolutely wonderful & always on hand to make sure we had everything we needed! Staying at this hotel was a highlight of our trip to Mumbai & we will definitely be back! We could not speak more highly of this establishment.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Sanjito
Detailed Review: The greatest thing about this hotel is the level of customer service they provide. We were very happy with them. The front desk staff, especially Rajesh was very helpful to us. They were very accomodating and when we asked for a room change due to noise from the ongoing construction on the mumbai metro. Overall we enjoyed our stay here and would likely be back again if we travel to mumbai.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Melanie
Detailed Review: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay, the staff are super helpful and friendly, breakfast was excellent, and we were within half an hour walking distance from most of the attractions around the gate of India. Our room didn't have a window, and was a little damp feeling, but that didn't worry us as we were only there to sleep, and it was super quiet in our room despite the roadworks going on outside. We were very happy and would definitely recommend.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: fareha khan
Detailed Review: OK I remember my visit to this hotel for a friend's wedding.we stayed there for 3 days.I had an amazing experience of food and facilities.we had enjoyed a lot there.The greenery and the pool was my favorite spot in those 3 days of stay.Their Banquet hall was spacious and comfortable.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Rehan
Detailed Review: Hii the best thing their is the hotel the rooms are very big and good it‚Äôs the best hotel I have ever visited I would recommend this very single person in thane world to visit their it‚Äôs the best hotel

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Monica
Detailed Review: This is my fourth visit in this hotel Staff is very nice and readily available Rooms are neat and clean Breakfast is very good Staff is always ready to help you at any time It is in south Mumbai and many places to visit are nearby

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Joebeard
Detailed Review: If you find yourself in Mumbai and want a great value with superior service, hotel Residency Fort is a must stay. Great location and the people are fantastic!! Make sure to ask for consierge Rajesh!! He will make you feel like a true VIP!! I will definitely be back!!

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Sam_Wilson
Detailed Review: Staying at the Hotel Residency Fort was a very good experience. Being within reach of many of the places I visited from and is in the heart of the city (I suppose). The Gateway of India was a spectacular watch and must see. The room was clean and to my expectation and the buffet breakfast was sumptuous and delicious, specially the pav bhaji (though a bit spicy). Regardless, a nice and clean place for one's stay.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: kungfunc
Detailed Review: Hotel is about 30km/1hr/$8 usd from airport.  Once you arrive it is close to everything. I traveled for vacation and was solo so it was just me in the room.  Raj helped me get a sim card and got it working quickly for 1000 rupees. You could get it cheaper on the street but there‚Äôs no guarantee that it will work properly or get it working quickly so use the hotel. I enjoyed the breakfast especially. The manager and staff are very friendly and provide good service. They have omelettes chicken sausage coffee tea cereal fresh fruit and a variety of Indian options as well. Call the hotels in an excellent location and I found that I could walk almost everywhere. Call within 2 km there are many sites. If necessary, it was close to the train station which I used a couple times and‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: DayTrip641522
Detailed Review: Visited the hotel with family 2 couples it‚Äôs situated in Coalaba walking distance from the train station, The Taj and Gate Way of india. The hotel staff were lovely even managed to sort out a local SIM card for us. The hotel can do with a bit of an upgrade but for a semi budget hotel not bad at all. Breakfast was good but dining room a little small. Try and get an upgrade to the bigger rooms in the next block.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: JennRain
Detailed Review: The service at this hotel is the best! It‚Äôs a little in need for renovations but they make up with it with the service! They make you feel like family, everyone goes out of their way to help you and please you. Breakfast is amazing, beds are comfortable. If your in Mumbai this is the place to stay! Also if you need a trustworthy guide while in Mumbai see Gufram. He will take you places most people won‚Äôt, friendly fun and affordable.

Source.Name: Hotel_Residency_Fort-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Bori67
Review: A GREAT hotel with great staff and very clean rooms!
Detailed Review: Residency hotel offers very clean and comfortable rooms,furnished with style. The staff of the hotel were very accommodating and helpful! Also the location of the hotel is central and there are many taxis around which makes exploring Mumbai very easy. Special thanks to the team and especially to Gopal for the great hospitality !

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Shivabha
Detailed Review: The hotel is very nice the staff are extremely helpful clean rooms good location near to international airport this was our second visit .I had a nice airport view room the check-in was hassle free breakfast buffet was good and free WiFi provided a home away from home...... Cheers to team Le Grande

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Oscar P
Detailed Review: On 14th we had conference the arrangements were perfect .the setup was done as oer request.the buffet arrangements were perfect food is tasty .Narayan was there to  handle all the queries .even front office manager was supportive .we are planning to keep all the meetings in hotel Le Grande henceforth.  Good job team hotel Le Grande

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: vivekjpatel2002
Review: Clean rooms, friendly and decent staff, good food.
Detailed Review: I stayed with my family for one night. I reached too early, then also I was provided a room to get fresh up. On request my breakfast was also accommodated according to my convenience. I had some issue with a room which was resolved without any arguments. Overall it was nice stay. Polite, friendly and helpful staff, specially  Pravinbhai, the smiling person on reception. Food was good, staff was polite and decent.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: pravin j
Detailed Review: Icame to Mumbai for the first time and my stay was in hotel Legrande but my family  and we felt like home away from home all the staff are courteous, reception staff arranged me package car for Mumbai darshan breakfast buffet and food is delicious overall good experience

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Snooker S
Detailed Review: Hotel staff and front desk are the worst people (Shiv and Shivu) they really don't have any kind of professionalism with the guest , i strongly recommend not to be part of this hotel. think 100 times before you want to check in

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Vijay
Detailed Review: This was our first trip to India and we found the service provided by all staff to be very down to earth and sincere. They were humble and professional at all times. This made our trip a good trip considering this was our first experience in India. Amey was amazing and went above and beyond in his constant help and care of our needs. Without Ameys  assistance things would have been difficult for us. We appreciate him very much. Allwyn in the bell department was amazing re our travel advice and organising our trips. He was very friendly and felt like family to us. We knew we were in good hands always. Surrender in House keeping was beautiful and a very honest boy. Extremely helpful and kind to us always he was. Jyoti in housekeeping was very kind and efficient in ensuring all our‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: SMITA2782
Detailed Review: Mr. Ajay Kamble was of great help. he assisted my mother in law very well. I really appreciate the hotel and the entire staff for the generosity extended to assist her. I would surely recommend this hotel to stay and we will stay in this hotel again.

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Rahul Jena
Review: Value for money and perfect for a comfortable stay in Mumbai
Detailed Review: I had come to Mumbai to join a post in a nearby hospital. For the time it took me find a decent place I stayed at bawa regency hotel. I was very comfortable, the rooms were decent sized, very clean. Housekeeping changed the sheets and cleaned the entire room and toilet every day. The staff was courteous and friendly. I remember an incident when I forgot my phone in a taxi near the hotel. Immediately the staff of that hotel room me around on his vehicle to track down the taxi and retrieve my mobile phone. During my stay I had to extend my stay a couple of times and there was absolutely no hassles in Booking the hotel. It is conveniently close to KEM hospital and Tata Memorial Hospital about 1 km away. And it's easy to catch a cab to all popular tourist destinations from here.‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Ragavaraghu
Detailed Review: I stayed here two times, hotel is situated near mumbai port trust.  Hotel is at first floor, entirely different experience from looking outside and inside the hotel. Neat and clean rooms, excellent service. Nice experience... Great stay...

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Ashfaq A
