AC was working fine but making some noise as old one . bathroom was clean but very old and deteriorating. Service is good. Staff( reception and room service) was helpful and courteous .as the hotel is under renovation on third floor we get disturbance . we were there for exams. I raised issue with manager n they immediately changed our room on ground floor which was delux room without any extra charge.  We stay there for 5 days. Go for new rooms on the third floor.. It's pretty good . overall satisfied with the hotel n service.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: ChelseaLCanuck
Detailed Review: The Elphinstone is a wonderful little hotel. The rooms are small but tidy and have everything you need. The breakfast is nice - your choice of eggs with toast and tea. But I'm glad I read the reviews and was prepared before we went, here's why:  The building next to the Elphinstone caught fire on our second night there. Of course, this is not their fault, and the staff - namely Hemond - handled it with grace and professionalism. By the time we got to the hotel late that evening, he had already arranged for us to stay at a sister hotel - with transportation. So no complaints about the Elphinstone itself.   The problem, as I had read in other reviews - is with the sister hotel who repeatedly tried to charge us more, since their rooms are 'more expensive' and tried to charge us for‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Dries D
Detailed Review: The hotel has a good location but it's pricy especially for india, one very small room sets you back 35$us per night. Staff is not so friendly and doesn't bargain at all (in india!). Told them BOOKING.COM is cheaper at the desk! They wouldn't believe me so i booked through booking with their wifi and ended up paying 150rupees less??!!! (. The water was cut off due to maintanace, from 7-12 in the morning! 'Complimentary' Breakfast is ridiculous, 2 toast with jam and 2 eggs and tea or coffee.   Good things: very powerful ac (because the room is so small). The beds and sheets arr okay.  My suggestin  rather avoid, actually avoid mumbai at all. Its very dirty, even for india, coming from Rajjastan people are rude here, not a good 'vacation' place...

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Dylan S
Detailed Review: Stayed with my wife before leaving for a cycle tour of India. Excellent service, friendly people, convenient location, and complimentary breakfast was a welcome way to start the day. Very clean rooms and exceptional service without straying from its roots as a quality Indian guesthouse. Special thanks to Hemond for reaching out to offer pickup from airport, assistance with our oversize baggage, and extensive information of the local area. When we return, we will stay at Elphinstone.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Wouter D
Detailed Review: Good location near CST station friendly and helpful staff. I like the water cooker in the room and the little refrigerator many tv channels. Breakfast is basic but good, several restaurants in the street. Good bed!

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Sangita B
Detailed Review: The stay was okay. Bit problem for a family to adjust. The food was good and the price was okay.The staffs were helpful. The hotel was very closr to the marine dtive and big cinema. Cabs were easily available infront of the hotel. Very close to VT STATION.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Tituscat
Detailed Review: Me and my partner are on a bit of a budget as we're putting the majority of our months travelling money into the Andaman Islands at the end of the trip. This being said I have never had such an uncomfortable night in a hotel in my life. And this is not the cheapest we've stayed in either. Do not be fooled by the small but well kept reception area, it's down hill from there! We have learnt to expect shabby along the way so the stained walls, masking tape in the shower and ants running across the bathroom to bedroom did not faze us. What did however was the stench of damp which seemed to be in the hallway of our floor. We arrived late and were only staying one night so we didn't make a fuss. Ordered room service which made us both ill with different meals and decided to get to‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Ashferns27
Detailed Review: Stayed here with family for just 1 night. This hotel has its positives and negatives.   Positives:- Prime location, 10 mins walk to VT railway station and similar distance to marine lines station. Very welcoming front office staff, we had to check out at 6am to catch our train, so hotel arranged light breakfast at 6am, which was much appreciated.  Negatives:- Paid approx 2400/- per night and the quality of room was average. Size was smaller then a match box, no windows in the room and bathroom. If lights are put off, it makes the room pitch dark. One can only feel claustrophobic when inside.   The room though was neat and clean. Clean bed linen and towels.   In a nutshell, I would avoid booking this hotel again as for the price we paid it was not worth it.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Gugy
Detailed Review: The only good things about this place are the proximity to the airport and the fact they provide a free airport shuttle. Make sure to call and reserve the shuttle if you want somebody to wait for you at the airport otherwise they will not answer your emails.  Cleanliness was our main issue with the room. The bed covers were dirty and there was so much dust around the room. There was also a lot of noise from the other rooms on our floor and we had to ask the reception to do something about it since we couldn't sleep. Sketchy neighbourhood.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Samriddhh
Detailed Review: During My Recent Visit to this beautiful hotel called Hotel Le Grand√©, I encountered A whole new level of International Class stay which involved Amazing Food, Luxurious Rooms & Excellent service. One of the best things about this hotel is that it is very closely connected to the City's International & Domestic Airport. Also, it is based in the city's commercial & corporate hub making it easier and more convenient for visitors to be connected to any part of Mumbai quite reasonably. Another Highlight is that The Menu is very exquisite & honestly very healthy & delicious. I personally loved the Coriander soup followed by warm rotis & spectacular choice of Chicken Delicacies & finished my dinner with hot, mouthwatering applejalebi & malai kulfi. On a Personal Note, I would suggest,‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Storyteller676197
Detailed Review: I had 1 day stay with my father for some official work in Andheri (E). The behaviour of the staff,the quality and cleanliness of the rooms, room service was incomparable to other hotels of the same range. The breakfast and dinner bouffe had a variety of items comprising of veg and non veg both. Car facilities for dropping to near by places like airport was excellent as well. All in all it was an enriching experience.  :)

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: hadi s
Detailed Review: I had a bussiness one night stay in this hotel.has nice and helpful staff.breakfast not good.location is far from city center in .nice and clean rooms.good service like most of hotels in india. modern style.althogh for a 3 star hotel the price was too high,but generally i had a pleasant stay.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Manas P
Detailed Review: Hotels stuffs are very helpfull.situated near airport.foods are very testy and hygienic. travel desk also very helpfull. overall experience very good.room service also very good.Reception also very helpfull.

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Sandeep R
Review: Quality Hotel in heart of city
Detailed Review: One of the good property in Dadar with economical pricing. Good services, nice rooms, quality food, good and decent staff. What's more it's a walking distance from Dadar station. Although I was on a business trip hence solo but it's a decent hotel for the families too

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: SUJOY BHOWMICK
Review: Quality hotel but a bit Pricy
Detailed Review: Maximum Rooms are great with modern amenities... few large old fashioned rooms are available in ground floor....Food quality is awesome.... some budget hotel available outside.....  Complementary Breakfast available, you need to order timely in the morning....  Free wifi available, ask for username password.....  if you see your room is loaded with foods, beverages etc.... then please ask which are complementary and for which you have to pay if you consume it during your stay... Room service and all the staffs are nice and helpful.... just have to ask for any kind of help..... Rooms are digital card locking facility... for any problem ask for their help... only negative point is a bit pricy for the service and quality they are providing..... but you won't regret.....

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Madhavan Rajagopalan
Review: great location and connectivity to market place
Detailed Review: Very near to Crawford market and yet away from the crowded area. The rooms are very clean and comes with all modern amenities including a free wi-fi with good speed. They also provide complimentary breakfast. Since they do not have in-house restaurant, the breakfast is limited with 2 choices (Bread Butter Jam / Sandwich) with tea/coffee. The staff and the front office executives are friendly and helpful. They also have a laptop which guests can use to check their e-mails.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: miladam20
Review: Not appealing on the outside but fantastic  once stepped in...
Detailed Review: Based on the 1st floor so don't let the ground floor put you off. Good location near gate of India. Walking distance to all shopping centres. Taxi on door steps. Very clean rooms,friendly and helpful staff. Price is affordable for Mumbai. Highly recommended will stay again.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: travelerKolkata
Review: Good value for money for downtown stay
Detailed Review: The hotel is located walking distance from VT station.The room sizes though small are neat and clean. The entrance to the hotel is shabby. Further there is no lift. The hotel is located on the first floor. The staff is friendly and helpful. The breakfast is very simple with limited options. Further near the reception area they have provided with massage chairs which is quite a hit with the guests.The Gateway of India is about 3-4 km from hotel and taxi costs around Rs 60-70/-

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: In√™s G
Detailed Review: Basic, but clean (to indian standards) and very confortable (specially tha beds). Very professional staff, with very pleasant little details that made us feel welcome. It's a good place to stay in this range of hotel (it's not a luxury hotel).

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Abbie W
Review: Good for a comfortable stay downtown
Detailed Review: Don't panic when you pull up to this place! Once you get inside you get a wonderful reception from the staff and a very clean, basic and comfortable roof. Wifi reception varies but this is not usually due to the hotel service. We were able to walk easily to the train station and a couple of markets and everything else was a quick taxi ride away. You are able to book a car from the airport too which is useful. Overall good value for money and would recommend staying here when travelling through Mumbai.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: sunny8601
Detailed Review: Hotel is really good. . Location nearby Chatrapati Shivaji Terminus. . Walking distance from Railway Station. .  Staff and Manager- very helpful.  Rooms very good. . Cleanliness wise very good.  Overall Experience was nice.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: bhavna j D
Detailed Review: This centrally located hotel was perfect for my needs. The facade of the building is not fancy, but as soon as you step through the front door, it presents a warm welcoming atmosphere. Rooms are small but clean and well equipped and so are the en suite bathrooms. The rooms open on to a wide corridor with large windows, which serves as a sitting area. There are comfortable chairs and tables placed at intervals, and everyday at 5.00 pm a big pot of 'masala chai' is on offer, for guests to help themselves to, as they relax or mingle with other guests. The staff is friendly and very helpful. Breakfast is free and the food is quite good. All in all a pleasant experience, and affordable as well.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Filip P
Review: Best value for money I could find in Mumbai
Detailed Review: Don't misjudge this hotel from the way it looks in the street and just wait until you see the lobby. Because thats how clean it really is, as well as the rooms. I stayed in a Superior room and despite I was alone, I believe it will fit two just fine. The staff of Elphinstone is one of the friendliest I've ever experienced. I've always been kindly helped out with all my requests, even with the unusual ones (train ticket booking, contacting the Mumbai taxi lost and found office, etc.). For a price that is already great you even get a complimentary breakfast and an afternoon tea. The wifi is pretty solid and works in the rooms too. The location is a short walk from the historical sites, easily accessible from all directions and the nearby bridge serves as a great point of reference‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: mahlegrand
Detailed Review: Entrance looks poorly, but on the first level it gets much better. The staff is great and always there to help you. (Thanks for that!)  You will be welcomed with a nice cold bottle of water and some crisps.   The deluxe rooms are clean and beds are comfortable, but the space makes it a bit claustrophobic. You cannot walk in the room with 2 persons at the same time.  Bathroom is small as well and the whole room gets wet while showering.  They didn't clean the room while we stayed there 2 nights. So I think this is not included. Free Breakfast was nice! You have a few options and they will make it straight away.  Close to the main sightseeing points like: - Indian Gate & Taj Mahal Hotel (10 min with taxi) - Train station (10 min walk) - Crawford market (5 min walk) Taxi to get‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Rajesh
Detailed Review: Very congested rooms and bathroom. luggage security is doubtful.  No parking available. I lost few money from my trouser pocket and one Fasttrack Goggle. Good point is that it is near to  marine drive .. cst is walking distance. As cost of price in view of location hotel is ok . I give 1.5 point out out of 5 marks

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Abir20
Detailed Review: The room we got was spacious. The hotel offers free airport transfer which is pretty helpful. The staff is helpful and caring. No problem in staying in the hotel. A good value for money. I enjoyed staying there.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Mallikarjunsheelvant
Detailed Review: It is very good hotel ,booking system , pickup ,restaurant & food . Staff is very polite and caring . I enjoyed the stay .I visit Mumbai regularly on my business tour and prefer this hotel .This hotel can be recommend to others.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: bebjietenoch
Detailed Review: The welcome was excellent .The staff here are very polite,helpful and go out of there way to assist you.No problem too big they sorted out my banking problem. The beds were clean and the room was excellent .It was a very good experience for a foreigners .You as a visitor should make yourself comfortable .Will reccomend this hotel to others.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Paramasivam R
Detailed Review: I stay in this hotel. Near to the airport and the hotel provide airport pick-up/drop-off services. Room was too small for the money you paid. Limited choice for the buffet breakfast. Staff Mr Abdul was very helpful.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: clarantha s
Review: An Average place to stay in Mumbai
Detailed Review: I stayed in this hotel in September.   Staff:  Very helpful, they try to do their best all the time. very nice people. Front desk , House keeping and room service( restaurant).  Food:  Tasty, clean and good value for money. only problem is that you have to pay too much for bottled drinking( Mineral water) water.   Rooms:  Small but clean enough 4/5 points. i stayed in 402 there was no telephone shower, and what was there was a wall mounted unit, and you practically cannot take a body wash without your hair getting wet and water just sprays around you and you have to go around chasing the water. But, the housekeeping persons tried to fix it with limited tools they had but they could not.  The hotel should consider having a technician in house to attend for such things.  Then I‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Diksha R
Detailed Review: The service of this hotel is too good . The food is delicious. The scenic beauty is awsome. The rooms of this hotel are waooow they are specious. It was rejunevating hanging up over hear  Good experience Thanq so much

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: sumit m
Detailed Review: Sorry to say... Hotel Elphinstone is not at all recommended ......wen I visited the hotel at around 2 pm (of my booking date dat too after cross checking my booking with them on telephone) they made a excuse .... dat we forgot to keep a room for u and just felt sorry for dat. I was on a business trip and this hotel was near to my work place. Worst part was they didn't have a realisation .... for the kind of mess they have created for me. After making dem realise .... they offered me another of dere property near Wankhede stadium which was far away from my work place and also in an isolation. In short dey were trying to create a worse kind of scenario for me...   No hard feelings for this hotel but being a regular traveler ...concerned about traveller who is out of his town and‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Thomas O
Review: Clean, Comfortable and more than sufficiently adequate for a Budget Hotel
Detailed Review: The Hotel is centrally located, staff are friendly, the services are prompt and adequate. The rooms are quite elegant, clean with hot/cold water , clean filtered drinking water etc. Staff are friendly and very helpful for assistance in getting lunch or dinner from nearby hotels around. The free Wi-Fi internet is good and quite fast. They even have a good foot massager chair set up for the tired guests, after a long walk touring down town Mumbai streets. The prices are very reasonable compared to the other budget hotels nearby. The Deluxe rooms are good, however there is a noise from the water pump that keeps kick starting often, but i guess only  audible to the rooms adjacent to pump room as i stayed in room next to it, but forgivable considering all the other good aspects.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Tanita C
Detailed Review: great hotel, great staffs The hotel located near to the Gate of India, VT station. The place is really nice, clean and comfort. Complimentary tea is really great. Nice to staying and definitely be here again when I back to Mumbai.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: OliverH8
Detailed Review: As we know Mumbai is higher priced than other Indian cities. At Elphinstone Annexe you absolutely get value for money. The complimentary breakfast (which was not mentioned before) wasn't that good, but you have to take into account that this breakfast was not even mentioned. Restaurants (good Indian breakfast for roundabout 80 Rs.) and even a bar where you can have a beer just at the hotel. Extremely helpful staff (esp. front desk guys) who give you lot of Information about places to see, shopping areas etc. The area looks a bit scary at night (in fact is just looks scary, it isn't) but no problem: you'll get taxis right in front of the hotel. If you prefer to go on foot: Gateway of India ist a bit less than 3km away.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Elizabeth C
Detailed Review: My friend and I stayed in a deluxe room, was super nice..very clean and very comfortable beds. Our problem was that the noise from the water pump was very loud and disturbing in our room, but the friendly hotel manager was very nice and offered us another room and mentioned that this was just a temporary problem. Free breakfast is included, pretty standard not great and was in a small corridor along with smokers and not much atmosphere. But otherwise, we had a really nice stay and the hotel is right next to Crawford market. All in all, pretty good!!

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: McGreevyTeam
Review: Clean but upgrade to a Deluxe vs Superior
Detailed Review: The hotel is exceptional value, very clean, not far from the main attractions.  Definitely take a Deluxe room, unless you want a windowless room with twin beds and a foot and a half between the beds. You can almost touch both walls.  Very friendly staff.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: georgefarley16
Detailed Review: Firstly it was expensive for Indian standards but perhaps not for Mumbai as it's an expensive city.   The staff were very kind and helpful and allowed us to arrive and check in at 2am. Not much information was provided about the city but they let us use their phone to book tours etc.   The room was very small and windowless. It needed some ventilation as it got very humid in monsoon season and the walls were dripping with water until we asked them to clean the room, which they did well.   It can get noisy in the evening and morning because of the busy road outside and people in the corridor.   Overall average but the staff are friendly.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Soumya
Detailed Review: Stayed here for a couple of nights for business. The hotel is not far from the airport. The stuff was helpful. The room I had was big with a double bed, complete clean. The bathroom was also big, with enough towels and amenities. The breakfast they served was delicious.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Prakash S
Review: Great Hotel, Great View, Peaceful location in busy Andheri
Detailed Review: This great hotel is located between International and Domestic terminals. Undisturbed view of both Airports and flights from the window is undoubtedly a treat. Humble and motivated Staff, Great food and most peaceful location in busy Andheri.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Nidhisata
Detailed Review: We had visited hotel le grande on 7th August they extended our check out time upon request as I had a delayed flight. The staff is very helpful and cooperative and the service provided was excellent. They also provide free pick up and drop at airport. overall an excellent experience with the hotel

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Prarthana
Detailed Review: Booked the hotel in month of August. Its a budget hotel nearby Chatrapati Shivaji Airport.The hotel provides free airport transfer.  Room: Rooms are nice and clean but a bit small. We booked double bed room but room provided was having two single beds joined together. Bathrooms are clean with continuous supply of hot water.  Location: Good Restaurant and Food: Good Staff and Hospitality: Great Hotel provides frequent cab services(Paid). If you want to hire cab for sightseeing you can easily contact the hotel staff and the cab shall be arranged at a decent price

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Lance_Dsouza
Review: Good Hotel, Great Staff , Excellent Service !
Detailed Review: Had very good experience throughout the stay.   Well-appointed rooms with all amenities with comfortable bed.  The staff were friendly, courteous, accommodating  and would always check you had everything you needed. Special Thanks to Mr. Sameer Deb.  After a tiring day in Mumbai , what better than to unwind in elegant surroundings With the hotel‚Äôs higher floor rooms that provide a glittering  panoramic view of the large stretch of both Airports of Mumbai.  I strongly recommend this hotel  for family n corporates looking for a stay closer to both the Mumbai airports !

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: anishkappil
Detailed Review: Strongly recommend for hotel Le Grande.  Rooms are comfortable, good  housekeeping, friendly staff and that too in a great budget. Location of hotels is good and airport is nearby. Great hospitality that keep this hotel top of my list.

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Mehul C
Detailed Review: bawa regency Dadar east property one of the best property i ever stayed in mumbai ,i will give 10 as a rating to this property.... special appreciation to Maninder{sales manager of bawa group}  to maintain the healthy atmosphere including all styles and amenities .food,staff,housekeeping and cleanliness...all 10/10 the food quality excellent with staff well trained ....for all the travellers across the globe please contact the sales head maninder for any enquiry

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: markhenry901
Detailed Review: stayed for almost 1 week and it was pleasant stay where i have feel like home ...food was excellent & services was very good . entire staff is very co-operative especially Mr.Maninder and Mr.Amey who made my stay memorable and surely i will visit again in future and i will recommend this hotel to my friends and colleagues . Thank you team Bawa Regency .

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Amit K
Detailed Review: I had an amazing stay at Hotel Elphinstone Annexe. I stayed there for three nights  Hotel staff was very polite and proactive.Plus point for the hotel is its location,Very near to Gateway of India,Marine drive and Nariman Point.  I will consider it again for visit to Mumbai in the near future.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Karni M
Detailed Review: Very nice hotel. The stuff is very polite, kind and helpful. The room was clean and comfort. Nice and simple breakfast with eggs of your choice. Great location including a free pick up from the airport

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Vineetyadav1973
Review: Very good ambiance in budgeted hotels
Detailed Review: It is the best budgeted hotel in mumbai for business as well as family trip. Having good location , helpful staff, clean room & bathroom. The lobby area feels like we are sitting in a Luxury hotel.  Only problem is space in this hotel. Most of the rooms are very small and don't have any window as well as no proper ventilation in bathrooms, dining area also very small will fix breakfast menu.  But Overall it's give us completely family atmosphere.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Lewis C
Detailed Review: Clean modern room, great air con and fan, bathroom is clean and shower is great. Staff are extremely helpful and professional and they even looked after our bags and assisted with a late check out as our flight was late in the evening. The hotel is also in a good location.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Radim S
Detailed Review: I've booked this hotel because of positive reviews but somehow nobody mentioned that there are absolutely no windows. It's just really tiny room with no window. The moment you turn of light it's pitch black no matter what time of the day it is :) anyway the staff was nice and room was somewhat clean when I checked in. However they didn't clean room nor changed a towel during my entire stay, which is something I consider a standard in other hotels. Location is not very nice but it's Mumbai so it's hard to find anything nicer anyway. The hotel is not far from Gateway to India and other tourist sights.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Sergitravel
Detailed Review: Small and nice hotel with a good location at Mumbai, the room was very clean and staff was really helpful with us. We have booked a city tour around Mumbai at the reception as well as they have booked a taxi to go to the airport and everything fine, very faithful. Strongly recommended!

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Arun Puri
Detailed Review: The location is excellent, if one has work in downtown Mumbai. And the connectivity to the Eastern freeway and the Mumbai CST railway station is a bonus.  The rooms were a little pokey. But I guess the value-for-money room tariffs make up for that.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Suparna S
Detailed Review: SuraJit Gosh was a very good person, very kind and helpful. He helped us a lot during our vacation. I'd really like to visit him again. The hotel was also very good Indeed. Clean and beautiful. Hope for the best for the Hotel. ‚ò∫

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: AMK
Detailed Review: Its a great hotel for people who want to catch an International Flight as you can see the T2 building from the hotel window! The hotel rooms are clean and tidy and have an AC for Mumbai's humid weather. WiFi access is great, but is rationed. They give you vouchers for 4 hours per device. For prolonged access, you need to ask the reception for more usernames and passwords. That gets tedious for those who  need prolonged access. The hotel has an attached restaurant, where they serve complementary breakfast. The food could do better taste wise. The room service is prompt and should you need an extra bed in your room, it could be provided. The landmark is Bombay Cambridge school, Chakala, and rickshaw/ taxi drivers should be able to get you there. Follow Google Maps to get to this‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: amitjoshi79
Detailed Review: This is one of the best hotel I have stayed on my way to a international tour. It's best feature is the excellent staff, close location to the Airport and all this at a very low rate compared to its peers. I have made several bookings for my friends too and one Mr. Ashok, who is the manager, has helped us out of the way even when he was on leave with bookings. I strongly recommend this hotel for airport stay for family n friends! Great going Le Grande!

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: sunnyshah123
Detailed Review: Its really  fantastic facility provided by this hotel, like Airpirt pick up & drop up facility. Good break fast. Very co- operative staff, neat & clean rooms with all required facilities.  In short nice to stay with family or as a business people.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: sachinsehgalbpl
Detailed Review: this hotel is one among the best in adheri east , they have well trained  staff. fresh food is been served and the staff is really helpfull and well behave and  well mannered.......they deserve to be great peoperty . regards  sachin sehgal

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Keval C
Detailed Review: Staff  very good , good food , Service nice ,room was clean n very nice .this was my 2 visit n as useval all things r best .good service aswell. Airport n railwayis near by hotel üëåüèÉ for me this hotel üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Mohammed F
Detailed Review: Have been a frequent user to this hotel since the past 10 years...never had any complaints so far. The rooms are good, very near to the airport, free pick up and drop, even the morning complimentary breakfast is worth it....all in a reasonable price.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: karinanz2016
Detailed Review: I stayed here for 1 night in transit to southern India.  A truly great stay and very good price point.  Everything was modern, convenient, great service, really good food.  Airport transfers there and back were seamless, very stress free. I would certainly use this hotel again.

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Kavithakk74
Detailed Review: Book the newly renovated rooms very nice Ô∏èÔ∏èstay enjoyed the hospitality . Food is amazing and staff are helpful . Not very expensive and location is strategic as well . We enjoyed our visit to mumbai thank you bawa regency

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Madrr49
Detailed Review: Location is excellent ... Friendly staff and must say the food is delicious. Perfectly priced . Legacy property of Bawa . Very close to the station and room are old but well maintained interms of cleanliness

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: sabaa382
Detailed Review: I had booked the basic room, but was disappointed with overall experience. The bathroom stinked and we were quickly offered another room. Room interiors were old and there was old sofas in the corridor. So strictly a budget hotel with AC, pictures of the rooms are deceptive. Delux room are good but low on reading lights. May be i am expecting too much from this chain of hotel.

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: swapnil s
Detailed Review: Had been there in early morning , waited 1 hour for checking begging for room. Got room which was a worst i had ever in my life till now for a big price of Rs4000/-. Dont very take any chance of been there u get lots of good hotels less price then this

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: santoshnicobar
Detailed Review: Nice Hotel  ..Nice Staff. ..and have amazing time. ..late check-in  was allowed.    Room was cleaned and nice decorated. ..toilet was cleaned. Loved the stay ..only thing was they make late checkout kept me waiting for half an hour without any issues. ..just because the clerk was busy with work. ..rest fine old but gold..

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Otaycec
Detailed Review: The hotel is very clean, and the staff could not be more helpful. My luggage arrived five days after I did, and the hotel manager was diligent to contact the airlines on my behalf every day until my suitcase arrived. Since I am here for nearly three weeks, I asked for one of the larger rooms, which could not be nicer, though I have not had any hot water for showers. It's so hot here this time of year, the hot water is not entirely necessary. Stay away from the Crawford Market, however, as I was robbed there in the middle of the street in the middle of the day as I passed by on my way back to the hotel from the train station. I was accosted by two young men who held my arms while a third man quickly rifled through my shirt and pants pockets robbing me of my cash in about 5‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: hemanthalaksiri
Detailed Review: Value for money and very good and very friendly  staff . Clean room and bed sheets.. Hot water. free of charge  2 hours late check out for me .  bit small room. difficulty find hotel building and bit dirty area. But all good for money

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: plug89
Detailed Review: Don't expect a luxurious hotel, rooms are small and bed sheet were not the cleanest I have ever seen. However considering the price you pay, it is definitely a great deal if you are just looking for a place where to sleep. With all the limits of a small-size business the customer service is efficient and they are often able to accommodate your requests.  Wifi is complimentary, however sometimes it doesn't work. Unfortunately the rooms are very close and you can easily hear what's happening in neighbor rooms and in the corridor. This negatively affected my sleep.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Crissthetraveler
Review: Good location ...nice staff...accomodation could be improved
Detailed Review: The room was not noisy and that was perfect for us.It was clean but the sheets had stains on them. The air conditioning worked ok and the bathroom was really clean. The staff was very helpful and they let us store our luggages till we came back from shopping and we took the taxi to the airport. The location is perfect if you want to go shopping in the bazar and you don't want to waist your money on taxi :D... the hotel is just 10 minutes walk from the bazaar market! The breakfast was poor (3 slices of bread with jam and coffee) and in an area where was really hot...Let's say that the breakfast area is not really suitable for eating!!! We had a deluxe room and a superior room...the only difference between ours and the superior was that the superior was smaller and much cleaner‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: BrunoMascarenhas
Review: Excellent ! Neat Rooms, Wifi, Hot Water, Courteous Staff, Value for Money
Detailed Review: Excellent hotel  Excellent !   Neat Rooms,  No smell Furniture spot on Linen speckless  Wifi is free and was quite fast Hot Water 24 hours,  Courteous Staff, Value for Money  Breakfast was toast with omelette (not buffet)  Check in procedures were quite easy

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: arundey805
Review: i am planning to visit again lovely stay
Detailed Review: The room was nice and comfortable. It was normal but well organized. Had most of the amenities. Had a sofa on the superior room  gives an exotic feel. They tried to give the bathroom a conventional style. It's normal but looks good.  Malfunctioning AC. -Breakfast/meals area is good . The property is very near, in fact inside a local market, lot of options to explore. Had a pleasant stay. It was a superior room that I booked

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: tarundas448
Detailed Review: Amazing property with great location and helpful staff. 1.SERVICE‚Ä¶4 2.LOCATION..5 3.ROOMS‚Ä¶4 4. FOODS..4 5.STAFF..5 STRONGLY RECOMMENDED THIS HOTEL TO ALL.because of their behavior and service is so polite and nice. I would definitely come back again.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: sankey12
Detailed Review: Pros: - Rooms are nice and clean. - Food is average - Complementary pickup from the airport.  Cons: - Location is not so great. - Lot of traffic and surrounding noise. - Staff was not welcoming - Overpriced for the facilities provided.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Priyaranjan1980
Detailed Review: Good hotel for 1 night stay only, as the only bad thing about this hotel is, its having very small rooms, 2 persons can't stay in a room. Now everybody has moved to flat panel televisions, but here you'll find the old CRT TVs. Other than this, the rooms service was excellent, the reception guys were very good and helpful, food was great, WiFi was great, location is also best if you're preferring flights and buses.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: 55karthik
Detailed Review: i visited hotel le grande with my group. we were stayed there 3 days. location and food everything were excellent . my group members were very happy with hotel le grande. Reception and restaurant team was helpfully with us.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: kevyx-11
Detailed Review: Was there with my family for a couple of days. I must say that I have really enjoyed my stay. It was my first time in Mumbai and was very happy. The staff are very kind and helpful. The food was very good. For sure whenever am visiting Mumbai, I will be staying there..

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: psvraman
Review: Hotel offering comfortable stay for transit air passengers in Mumbai
Detailed Review: We stayed in the month of June in Le Grande for one night as  transit passengers.Booking the hotel on telephone is very easy  with no advance payment.Free airport pick up and drop is quick and hassle free.Room is quite spacious and well furnished with coffee maker..Toilet is clean and bright with complimentary bath  items like soap,shampoo etc.TV provides national and regional channels.Staff are courteous and friendly.Since our departure was by early morning flight, we could not avail the complimentary breakfast.Restaurant is good with standard menu.You get money's value in this place.Location of this hotel is not on main road,but close to main road through a side road.But it is not difficult to locate the place,as it is next to the well known Cambridge school.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: RK Puri
Detailed Review: Stayed there for two night while on business tour. It's one of the most ideally located near Airport and with facility of pickup from the airport. Rooms are clean with small toilets. Good restaurant with good food. The only thing that irritates you is rationing of a basic requirement of Wi Fi. They give you slips that allows you four hour and only twice in a day. A kind of joke by a little overpriced hotel

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: aakashcreed
Detailed Review: A beautiful hotel in a prominent landmark near Chathrapatti Shivaji Terminus from where almost all important places are covered.The service provided by the staffs and the receptionist  is very good. There are a/c rooms available for family, couples and friends. Visits to nearby places are being arranged by this hotel. So, If you travel to Mumbai, definitely this hotel would be promising one!!!!

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: tamoghnag
Review: Clean Hotel at an affordable price
Detailed Review: Stay was really nice and comfortable. Although rooms are quite small but consist of all required amenities for comfortable stay. Rooms are well maintained and very clean. Best part is that one can make tea of his/her own inside the room as an electric kettle, tea leaves, sugar , milk powder are provided in each room. Staffs are very helpful. The hotel is well located close to CST Station.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Passport249833
Detailed Review: I first got there and i was slightly confused. But as soon as I was directed to the 1st floor, I saw a completely different place. They do currency exchange there. They offered me tea, water and snacks while I waited for room to be ready and currency exchange. The workers helped me find a local place to have dinner, which was one of the best meals I've had, and a bakery/breakfast shop the next morning(I left too early and wanted snacks for my friends). Super nice and friendly, room was clean, I think there was some wallpaper missing but a lot better than a similar priced hotel in the US. I wasn't sure where the water in the room came from so I used it only for hot tea.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Aasif A
Review: I would say GO FOR IT
Detailed Review: For business tour and if u have work near Muhammed ali road this is ideal , specially if u can afford suit it's awesome - neat and clean a/c is perfect , service at its best , front desk Sunil was a gem for this hotel polite and professional staffs , outside coffee tables is a positive too          ''Don't judge the book by its cover''  From outside its crap just Go for it   Negative :- pls put exhaust fan inside the toilet and delete this negative point   3200Inr worth it

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: worldtrvler76
Detailed Review: The hotel is very well located. The room was clean and comfortable. A/C was silent and powerful. You can't beat this at that price. From the front desk to the kitchen, staff was very helpful and nice. Breakfast is basic but this is all you need to start your day.   The management is sensitive about having visitors in the rooms, which might be an issue for some guests. They have an intrusive policy about non-married opposite-sex couples that only seem to apply to Indian nationals.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Sophie R
Review: Must visit Pai's restaurant while at Elphinstone!
Detailed Review: We stayed at Elphinstone all 3 times we visited Mumbai. It was a lovely hotel and really a hidden gem in the bustling streets of Mumbai. The staff were always so helpful and had a smile on their face. I really REALLY recommend going downstairs to Pai's restaurant. It isn't much to look at from the outside, but the food is AMAZING and so so cheap! They absolutely loved having us and we're so grateful that we came back every time. I can't stress enough how good the food is! Especially the Veg Kadai and the Chana Masala!

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Rosey S
Review: A fantastic hotel at an affordable price!
Detailed Review: We stayed at Elphinstone on 3 different occasions, we couldn't resist going back. It was in a good location and affordable. The gentlemen on the front desk were always willing to help with any enquiry and always had a welcoming smile on their face. The complimentary breakfast was also really yummy. Thank you for everything Elphinstone, you really are a hidden Mumbai gem!

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Phumzie1818
Detailed Review: I stayed at this hotel for two nights. I arrived at the Mumbai airport very early in the morning, essentially 6 hours before check in at the hotel. So, I asked for an early check in which they allowed after they let me wait atleast 2 hours at the reception...it was terrible but I was grateful for a room after such a long travel! The room I was given was on the ground floor and had no windows. I couldn't believe it! I literally couldn't breath in there, even though the air conditioner and fan worked well, I just couldn't breath. I asked for another room with windows I was told to wait for another 3 - 4 hours. Luckily I was given another room on the 4th floor, which was much better. Having windows was the best thing about it. That it was small, fridge didn't work and the aircon‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Wiggle59
Detailed Review: Very small rooms even for Mumbai. Bathroom facilities substandard. No room to put luggage. Spent more time in the cramped lounge using wifi than in the claustrophobic room, which had no window. While the location was convenient to tour Mumbai, the poor service was no compensation. Breakfast was definitely substandard and would not recommend eating in this hotel. Definitely need for renovation to met modern demands.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: payalmandol
Detailed Review: We stayed at the hotel to celebrate my wife's birthday and had an overall awesome experience. The staff was courteous .They also sent a nice birthday cake for my wife which was truly special. The room was spacious and bathroom was absolutely clean. Though on the higher side in terms of cost, would definitely recommend this hotel. Their breakfast menu is amongst the top in Mumbai for sure. Amazing breakfast , lunch and food. Ambience is outstanding and so is perfect room size. Very good stay overall but at cost.It was a memorable experience with extended coutesy from the hotel side. Everything from staff to food,and other facilities were just fantastic. I really appreciate complimentry breakfast. Rest was amazing.It was a amazing stay of mine,good property like a heritage‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: chandrashekar M
Detailed Review: Rooms are not good and very small. Not recommended for family stay. Facility also not good in the hotel don't try to book a room in this hotel waste of money. Only location is good and near to gateway of India

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: LeeMoore86
Detailed Review: We stayed here on a G Adventures trip. Reception is small, staff friendly. A glass 'walk over' fish tank had seen better days, the glass needed a good clean. Wifi worked well in the lobby and was free. Restaurant was 4/5 tables in a long room, with a camera watching us. Rather big brother ish. Our waiter was lovely, broken English but tried hard to get our order right. Food ok, chicken burger is poor and the chicken club sandwich had cut up chicken, the bad bits. Needs a nice fillet piece. Rooms were good, standard. Basic and comfortable for Mumbai.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: AshimMitra
Detailed Review: At first I have to say this Hotel located near by Airport, Andheri (E), and address is very neat and clean you can find out easily Adjacent to Bombay Cambridge School, Front Desk is very helpful and co-operative, Specially Operations Manager Mr. Sameer Deb, I was in Executive room, room is spacious neat and clean, view from room (6th floor) awesome, specially at night you can see the Airport (International) through the window, its amazing, they provide complimentary water in room, refrigerator, no locker, provide tea sachet, breakfast also complimentary from 7 am to 10 am. not plenty of items but it is OK and tasty. Guest is not allowed in room but you can welcome your personal guest at restaurant (This is secure, I like it), room service is very nice, every person welcome you‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Satya3030
Detailed Review: Very good experience in this family & friendly hotel,very good staff good buffet breakfast & very close to int airport & domestic airport, rooms are very neat & clean, above all the best thing is free wifiüëèüèºüëèüèºüëèüèºüëèüèºüëèüèºüëèüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèº

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Han T
Detailed Review: I absolutely loved staying in this hotel. It's very clean. The staffs are very friendly and welcoming. Nice breakfast and the food is amazing. Transport are available easily to go around mumbai. I recommend it to everyone looking for a good and clean hotel in mumbai at an affordable price.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Basilio S
Detailed Review: The people is good,  the food have to much piri piri the rooms was bigger have a nice space. The staff was helpful and assist you 24hrs.  The rooms is clean . internet service is good. The hotel was near the airport. Overall a good hotel for foreign travellers. Can reccomed this hotel.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Fausto A
Detailed Review: The staff here is good They assist You all the time.The food is Very good and delicious.they have a variety of dishes to choose.the room is good.the hotel is near the AirPort.the hotel is Also near a hospital.the √°rea is Busy and transportation is 24hrs.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Akshayjain123
Review: Good service suitated in a pleasant locality
Detailed Review: Frndly hospitality by the hotel crew had a pleasant stay food is nice and affordable.. rooms are clean, this hotel made our trip easy, because the staff members are so friendly and helpful. Whenever I will visit Mumbai, I will make sure I stay in " LE GRANDE "

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Cristian P
Detailed Review: The hotel has very convenient location close to the airport. Rooms are clean and the staff is very welcoming. They also have shuttle service to pick you up from the airport. Recomended for anyone travelling on a budget since their prices are low.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: JoanaKatrin
Detailed Review: We have been here in April 2016! Heman and his staff are wonderful and competent people, helping us a lot with the special requests we had. Places of interest are not far. Crawford market and harbour are just around the corner in walking distance. Thanks for all the support. We will surely be back!  Christoph & Joana, Germany

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Pavel S
Detailed Review: The rooms are quite small but if you are looking for a place to stay overnight that is very comfortable and well located and do not need huge suites for a reasonable price, this is your pick.  Yes, rooms are small but there are no mosquitos, aircon works great and due to the lack of windows you have less noise. If you bring extra ear plugs you won't know you are in mumbai anymore.  The restaurant downstairs, the one they recommend, is fantastic and serves amazing food and helps the newly arrived tourist pick exactly the right food to their palate.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: zztip
Review: Excellent value in heart of Mumbai
Detailed Review: We stayed here one night and were very pleased with Hotel Elphinstone.  We were initially hesitant when the taxi drove up as the street view was not all that attractive.  However we walked up one flight of stairs and were very impressed with the cleanliness  and the amenities of this small hotel.  The room was small but clean and had good air conditioning.  The staff were very helpful - assisting us with our luggage up and down the stairs (there was no elevator); giving us refreshments when we arrived and flagging down a taxi when we left.  We had a basic but good breakfast (which was included in the price).  The location of the hotel is central to many things, and a short walk to the Crawford Market.  Definitely would recommend this affordable gem in Mumbai.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: afzalfatmi
Detailed Review: Exactly as I read in previous reviews. Rooms are literally like a Shoebox but space management and cleanliness is very good. BReakfast was good. They are having Foot, Neck and Back Massage chairs also.  Staff was courteous and quick. If you are claustrophobic don't o f or superior rooms. Space is very well maintained and overall it was unique experience.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: lari15
Review: A very good decent Hotel, worth staying
Detailed Review: The room & bathroom is small but well appointed with all facilities. I though a Exhaust fan in the bathroom would have served well. The hotel offers complimentary breakfast. I am afraid is quantity is very limited, in my opinion, the concept is the guest must fill his tummy for a happy rest of the morning. with this I will definitely recommend people. One more issue it does not have lift. I must offer some help to guest who has some luggage with them.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: gibnamee
Detailed Review: Yes the room is the size of a shoebox & yes it has no window, however there is something quite charming about this hotel! Considering the cost of accommodation in Mumbai, this hotel is good value for money - a/c, ensuite, spotlessly clean, excellent wifi, tasty breakfasts. It's also good location, near the touristy areas but not in them. Staff are friendly & helpful. We enjoyed our 3 nights & would happily return

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: brittany s
Detailed Review: The room was clean had air con, great staff, comfy beds, all the basics and a good location! You even get free breakfast. The negatives were terrible Internet and it was quite noisy in the room.   FYI! I booked a city tour with them and was told it would go on for 8 hours but the driver wanted to et ride of us after 5 and ended up dropping us off early so we had to wait on a polluted motor way for our bus. Bit annoying, this doesn't change my rating on the hotel but just in case anyone else wants a tour.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: jbriggs926
Review: Clean, quiet, polite--a very good hotel
Detailed Review: I stayed at the Elphinstone in early April 2016 for four days. It's next to the Yellowgate Police Station--ten minutes by foot to Crawford Market or 10 in a taxi to Colaba.  The hotel is on the remodeled second floor of an old building. The rooms are windowless but clean and comfortable and attractively furnished. The AC is satisfactory and the WiFi usually has a strong signal. The best rooms, along the north wall, have windows, and because the corridor is fronted with big windows all the way around, guests in the windowless rooms use the corridor, which has comfortable chairs, as a bright veranda. The corridor is a good place to meet other travelers, and it gives the hotel a pleasantly old-fashioned feel. The staff, without exemption, are polite and helpful, and the front desk‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: NICOLE
Detailed Review: The hotel is in a verry good location, close to Crowfort Market and close to Fort. The price are verry good comparing with ather hotel from a same class.  The rooms not have windows and for this are verry humidity - probably if the staff are in and open the doors 1 time at the day, maybe the air are more clean.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: stuart m
Detailed Review: We had 3 excellent days here. The hotel is ideally situated for local sightseeing and is a 20 minute walk to the main railway station. The initial impression when I arrived at the hotel was slightly disappointing especially when I walked up the dilapidated stairway to the reception. However, on entering my fears were dispelled when I was greeted with a modern, clean and spacious reception area. The staff are pleasant and helpful, even to the point of providing extra coffee and milk for the room. I especially commend the manager who couldn't do enough to help me when I sustained a cut. The room, although compact, has all the modern conveniences one expects, such as tea and coffee facilities, excellent AC and a well equipped clean bathroom. I thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: MeRlin4_CZ
Detailed Review: This is like an oasis in the Mumbai jungle. Exterior deceives, because when you come inside it could be any European budget hotel. The receptionist are polite, the rooms fine and the collection of mirrors and historical Mumbai photos make you feel better.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Ritam B
Detailed Review: Stayed at this hotel with a colleague for two nights. Its a very okayish hotel, to be booked only if other options aren't available.  Good for: Location  Bad for: Service Food Rooms  I got it for a very cheap price online and hence found it worth.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Vivek K
Review: It's always a first choice to stay in Mumbai
Detailed Review: I have been staying in this hotel for last few hotels. it is at the best location for business travelers. Front office team and Service staff are excellent.  The food quality is good. I still recommend this hotel for business travelers. good for business travel..staffs are co operative. Its offer all things with respect and care for individual ,STAFF Caring and friendly ,At a Nice location and Service Perfect for Stay. It's always a first choice to stay in Mumbai and repeating for last 3 years. Worth it. food quality is excellent.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Sammie J
Detailed Review: Stayed here for 1 night before flying to Goa, staff are friendly and rooms were okay. Rooms were small so I wouldn't recommend staying if it's longer than 1-2 nights. You can hear everything unfortunately at all hours. Wifi works fine too, sheets didn't seem "clean" so I would suggest a liner...

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: trustascot
Detailed Review: Being apprehensive after some of the reviews we were pleasantly surprised with the Hotel Fortune. The location is excellent with walking distance to the local train and many other good locations. The rooms are very small but bed comfortable and clean. Reception staff a very helpful and wi fi available. Remember Mumbai is an expensive city to stay so do not expect to much at the rate they charge.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Martin J
Detailed Review: A perfectly good hotel except the rooms are tiny and no windows and down very narrow corridors Having said that it was clean Staff lovely Great value breakfast Free and good wifi in room Due to its small claustrophobic rooms I could not stay again

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Shan
Detailed Review: The hotel was centrally located and great location to do the city tour and there were a couple of good restaurants and bars close by. The hotel room was tiny and the bathroom very mouldy and small, staff were friendly and helpful and there was free wifi

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: kallol_b63
Review: Pleasant stay at Hotel Le Grande
Detailed Review: Myself and my daughter (studies in Mumbai and stays in Campus) wanted to spend time together after official trip to Mumbai for a day/night. We were looking for a hotel close to the Juhu Beach within a reasonable price. We are happy that we chose Hotel Le Grande. The hotel is around 6 kms away from the beach and an auto charged us some Rupees Eighty to drop us there. We reached the beach early morning just around after sunrise. The hotel is located a few hundred metres away from the Main road, inside a lane and this is an advantage in view of the peace that prevails in the vicinity; slightly away from the din and bustle of the Vehicles and commuters on the Main road. They gave us a room that had a good view of the Airport which is also quite close to the hotel. Room was‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Budgetbackpacker13
Detailed Review: A friend and I arrived from London to Mumbai at 1am in the morning we got an airport taxi to hotel le grande sit was very hard to find even for the taxi driver but after a few wrong turns we found it!  Hotel is decent rooms clean and modern! Staff helpful and friendly ( drove us to the shop to get drinks) 5 mins in a rickshaw to juhu beach  Lots of interesting things to do and see local to hotel  Interesting to have a walk around the local area of hotel! Good prices good hotel!  If getting a taxi here tell the driver it is next to the Cambridge school  That was our reference point to get around   Brekfast good (free)  Wifi good! (Free)

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: P P
Detailed Review: Hotel near main road and well contacted to all required places. Very good service and food. Staff is friendly and helping. Wifi is working properly. Location of hotel is good and well connected to business centre.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: kaushik1612
Detailed Review: Very nice people managing the property. Very hospitable front office staff. Complimentary airport pickup n drop that too 24*7. Buffet is quiet good. Very nice well furnished rooms all in all amazing little hidden gem. Complete value for money

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: allenferns1952
Review: Just right if you in transit
Detailed Review: Very decent rooms, with all the amenities required for that short stay before you leave for a flight,Staff helpfull, a drop to international airport, the hotel is really good value for money and if i return to Mumbai will surely use if i get a great deal,

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Oz B
Detailed Review: The hotel is good .the staff here is helpful .The food was good here .This hotel was value for money. Can recommend this hotel to others.There airport pick up and drop are complimentry  .This hotel is near the airport.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Kalpesh T
Review: Poorest hotel in mumbai so far
Detailed Review: This is the poorest and silliest hotel in mumbai. Washroom taps embarrassingly dysfunctional; card not workin; poor attention to food requirements and at last staff most careless and insensitive. Quality of food poor. Staff didn't even inform me about card not working while I almost missed my flight as I had to go to atm (hotel arranged  vehicle as Atm was far) huge delay. They didn't even tell me amount and sent me to ATM

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Nripen Nath
Review: Nice hotel almost all services are very good
Detailed Review: My stay in this is excellents. Specially room services, room are very good well decorated ,foods are deliouseus , very testy and hygine.  Vehicle also provided when needed. Room services and all other requirments are satisfactory. Can always reccomed this hotel for stay in mumbai

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: deepsathya2016
Review: Very Neat and Clean Budget Hotel
Detailed Review: I stayed twice in this hotel in March 2016 for official purpose. Elphinstone Hotel is maintained very neat and clean. Staffs are very good and very co-operative. Mr.Hemond, Manager is very good in all aspects and he is very co-operative also. I enjoyed staying in this hotel. This year I am planning to take my family to Mumbai and stays in this hotel only. When ever I go Mumbai I stays in this hotel only. It is very much budget hotel. It is very near to VT station and other market area. If anyone looking for budget hotel in Mumbai they can stay in this Hotel without hesitation. Rooms are excellent and even bathrooms are very neat and clean. It is very much budget hotel. Thanks to all staff and Mr.Hemond.  Sathya Prakash Bengaluru

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: boban z
Review: Might be our favorite Indian (budget) hotel
Detailed Review: ...compared to most of the others we stayed at, Elphinstone was a knight in shining armor! Everything seemed sparkling clean, we had a refrigerator, excellent bed mattresses,  tea kettle, nice looking bathroom with a separated shower; also, very nice staff & convenient location. The only real con was lack of soundproofing - there seems to be a cafe next door that plays really loud music until 1 AM every morning, and you feel like you are in the middle of it. We were tired enough not to be bothered by it, though, and slept well anyway. So yeah, definitely one of our favorites. One correction: I'm not sure why the name on TripAdvisor has Annexe in it - it does not appear anywhere on the hotel official materials.So yeah, when the taxi drops you off in front of the big "Elphinstone"‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: JRBailor
Review: GREAT PLACE TO STAY!   Modern, contemporary, very clean...good staff with excellent service!
Detailed Review: Don't let the exterior of the building, the stairs up to the hotel deter you.  You will be very pleasantly surprised when you open the door into the long modern & contemporary hotel lobby.  The hotel staff all are very prompt and it takes no time to get processed with your passports and all. You are brought a refreshing cold drink upon arrival. The lobby is very clean, the tall ceilings and the big windows make the area feel very open and the lobby is very quiet and restful.  You are shown to your room which is contemporary.  The beds are very comfortable, plenty of hot water & the pressure is great.  The rooms have flat screen TV's, wardrobe, hairdryers, kettle, complimentary bottled water, refrigerator, A/C and decent shower design that does not get the entire bathroom wet! ‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Lia A
Detailed Review: we had great stay in this hotel. breakfast is ok. clean, nice beds. however it's kinda loud during the day since it's on the 2nd floor of a building aldo there is a nightclub downstairs. this hotel should really have their own building, since they have a very nice hotel.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Rob C
Detailed Review: Friendly staff and great location for exploring Mumbai.  Clean with ac and complimentary breakfast. 24hr reception which was appreciated at 3am. Refreshments on arrival was good. Walking distance to CST and Colaba.  Clean and comfortable room.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Terence P
Detailed Review: Great location, great service, great value. Staff really helpful and courteous.  Complementary breakfast  served in pleasant surrounds a bonus .   As a solo traveler the basic room was adequate, for a couple could be cramped. I stayed 4 nights and had to change Wi-Fi password daily.   TIP  If arriving at CSTM and can walk, go to platform 18, leave through sub station, walk to main road turn left and walk for 4/5 minutes until multi junction look across road and there is Hotel Elphinstone This can save a hefty taxi fare!

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: scoff
Detailed Review: Stayed here with friends for the cricket. Staff in the Elphinstone were fantastic. So helpful and genuine!!!! Dont be put off by the outside. Very clean and rooms are fine. Just take some ear plugs. Everywhwere in Mumbaii the same. Cars beeping all the time. Worth every rupee this hotel!!

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: NatDe123
Review: Great place, good prices, we'd book it again!
Detailed Review: fair price clean rooms friendly service and helpful staff good complimentary breakfast: toast and choice of eggs (scrambled, omelette...) good location near Crawford Market/CMT train station welcome drinks and snacks recommended restaurant was good only negative point: no windows in the rooms, if you don't like sleeping with aircon on, this could be a problem... stuffy air

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: RajeevRajeshuni
Detailed Review: The tarrif here is 2000rs.  I got it in goibibo for 1200rs.  Honestly speaking the hotel was even worth it for 2000rs. This is a hotel on the budget end, don't expect to much.  But you get more than what you get at other hotels.   Pros: 1) The hotel is very near to CST and all other tourist attractions.   2) Friendly staff 3) The rooms are neat and tidy (However the rooms are tiny.  Literally the rooms has two beds and a place to walk) 4) There are good restaurants near the hotel.   Cons: 1) There is no elevator in the building.  The hotel is on the first floor.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: agentbey
Review: Good Price. Good Location with One Flaw‚Ä¶
Detailed Review: The Superior room is very small however it's clean. But I am used rooms in Asia being small. Centrally located which gives you great access to Crawford Market and CST train station. The wifi work s very well. Not the fastest but it is consistent. I would say better than average.   Mr. S. was very helpful with recommending activities during my stay. Great price as well, for what you get. Breakfast also come with the room. To be honest I was very impressed with the room and was singing it's praises. That was great until nightfall.  Here is the straight bad news. Directly below is a beer bar. Google and learn more about that scene. Anyway the music is pumping loud.  You can audible hear each song being played. It's starts about 8:00 PM and goes until 1:30 AM. This was confirmed by‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Julien S
Detailed Review: We stayed there for 2 nights.  The staff is really helpful and explain us a lot because it was our 1st day in India. They organised for us a taxi at 1am from the airport and we check in without problem.  The room was good. Clean and prefect for sleeping. The shower was really nice with hot water,  soap and shampoo for free.  In the morning a good breakfast as well. The only negative point is the noise. Because of the street and some music from somewhere else around.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: anisarkar
Review: Perfect For Business Class And Family
Detailed Review: Well, Lets Start from the Beginning, I Booked double room for my family, and when i arrived at hotel, it was no empty, so they provided me 2 BED room might be super deluxe. without any problem. That's their Kindness  for this. Area = Full with Restaurants, Groceries Shops, Wine Shops, Provisions Stores. Main and Most Convenience is Just opp railway and Metro Hub. Area is really awesome. every medicals are just next to Hotel. Rooms = Big, Spacious, With  Clean Bed Sheets, Clean Pillows, Everything was Cleaned. Staffs & Reception Desk = They are as good as mentioned. Always Ready to help with warm Welcome. Room Service & Food = Room Service is too good.   U will received everything from the Restaurant, Which is their only. Food is really awesome. Qty of food .Food is also good.‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Uttam B
Review: Good stay, good food; average on services
Detailed Review: Package Breakfast was excellent, will stay in future for it. I love its location. Excellent location. Safe and comfortable stay for a single woman. Located at very convenient place. Good room service and also house keeping. Bell boy,  service was good. Attendants staff is very good. Quality food and service at restaurant. Breakfast was excellent

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Kathryn R
Detailed Review: This is a very compact hotel.  The lobby is very small and that carries on with the rooms. Although appointed with the amenities, the room was barely big enough to fit the full size bed. The bathroom was so small that if I bent over I would hit my head on the sink.  And it was a miniature size sink.  The room I had did not have windows.  I went for breakfast in the top floor restaurant the first morning.  The restaurant was a windowless room with one long table that everyone shared.  The toast was limp and dry, the coffee was suspect.  Although somewhat central, this is not a place where you would do anything else but sleep.  Not a place to relax and enjoy the surroundings.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Anastassia164
Detailed Review: Rooms are small and had no windows. Staff was nice and the place was clean. Good wifi.  AC worked very well. We didn't have hot water though( which is kind off norm in India) The location is very good. Close to banks and restorants. Not bad at all.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Anna K
Detailed Review: I was a bit worried when we first arrived at this hotel, as I've read a lot of bad reviews of this place. But luckily none of them were correct. We had a nice room, no bugs and a small window. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom has the same standard that a lot of Indian bathrooms have, so not an issue with me. The location was good, close to markets and restaurants and with friendly staff. Yes, the room was a bit damp, but when in India :) I didn't expect much from this hotel and I was not disappointed.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: itzzsonali
Review: A pleasant surprise in a Good Hotel n Great Hospitality
Detailed Review: This hotel is located exactly opposite to Bombay hospital, If you plan to travel in local trains, this is the best economic hotel. However, this is a bit far from the tourist location, i.e., Gateway, marine drive etc.  , maintenance are pretty good. All in all a good experience.  nice place for stay hotel staff very cooperative totally value for money. It was the best hotel that I had stayed, private and nice. Everything was perfect with this Property,Staff was very cordial and helpful, No issues as such i faced , Everything was up to the mark and overall it is 5 star Property. best accommodation in Mumbai n best price excellent location

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: tarundas448
Review: . Affordable and Amazing service by the management
Detailed Review: The hotel fortune is a class act with the kind of service and quality they provide. I had a official trip to Mumbai for about 15days and i found this hotel to be near to my office location in dhobitalao, and to my luck the hotel turned out to be really good with their maintenance levels and also service capabilities. The reception staff  has been a true champion, he was available all the time to address each and every point raised or requested with a smile. I would totally recommend hotel fortune for their service quality and staff friendliness

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: hapibambolbi
Detailed Review: A centipede greeted me in the bathroom and later on a cockroach, but what the most annoying thing of all was the cloying smell of cigarette, probably a remnant smell of a previous inhabitant that left the room smelling unbearable. The room had no windows so the smell stayed throughout and made me nauseated and it was hard to sleep. Walls are paper thin and you can hear your neighbors. On the upside the WiFi was the best I've ever had in India.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: yaqoobismaily
Detailed Review: Came from oman for a leisure trip.The hotel was good for the price not expensive like other hotel.The staff ,the manager here were very cooperative and helpful.The food is good but cannot have the same type of food need a change.There airport pick up and drop is good.The wifi has good speed.The only drawback little difficult to find if you dont know the directions

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: ManishMody
Review: Nice location. Hotel needs urgent renovation
Detailed Review: Location is good. However everything is extremely old and never renovated and the hotel and rooms need urgent renovation and up-gradation. Although the things are working but the room gives you a feeling of being in the 80s.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: saad05
Detailed Review: The Location of the place is brilliant especially for people having work in South Mumbai, Crawford Market Area. Very helpful staff, Very clean well maintained rooms. Only negative is the music from the bar below carries to some rooms.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: sun_shine_mh
Detailed Review: Visited this hotel in March 2016. Clean enough. A/C room and fan.  Little hard to find, on the 2nd floor, among other businesses, but once your in, it's fine.  Staff was helpful, gave us some advice on location of the attraction and help us to arrange a taxi back to the airport the next day. Located about 20-25 min walk to the Gateway of India.  Be warn, it's located on top of a bar and the music plays loads until 11pm/midnight ish.  Considering the price of most hotels in Mumbai, and traveling on a budget, this was perfect.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: dredsound
Detailed Review: Location is really nice, 5 min from Crawford Market. Not so close to the main train station. Good place with AC and really excellent service. We felt there like in a movie The Grand Budapest Hotel. Great place!

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: dragon_zero
Detailed Review: I stayed at Elphinstone hotel for a night. I was with friends. They were very welcoming. I had a decent stay there for sure. They also offered us complementary breakfast free. They were also willing to hold our luggage after checking out, so that we could travel and come back and pick the luggage before we left.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: 906muhammeda
Detailed Review: Had an awsome stay there. With friendly staff and the best location in central mumbai.though a bit disappointed with the size of the room,the stay was a pleasant one. Cheap rates with best room. Awsome location. Dont miss savry restaurant at a minimum can fare and have the mutton sheekh kebab from there.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Mauzee
Review: Excellent hotel, friendly and experienced staff, safe and good value
Detailed Review: I stayed here 3 plus 2 nights. The really clean hotel has nice hotel rooms with good facilities. The staff is friendly, helpful and very experienced. Location is perfect. Just a short walk from Crawford market and 10 min from CST and 5 min form Masjid station. The hallway is a good place to meet some people and there is free tea from 5-7pm. It's a little noisy, but it's Mumbai, so what else to expect.  Excellent value for money.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: RobleyG
Detailed Review: I stayed this hotel two different times in a month for like three days. I found it to be clean, comfortable and in a convenient location very close to the main railway station (CST) and crawford market. Although some of the rooms were a bit small for my expectation I would definitely stay again in this hotel. Breakfast was good. One thing you have to remember is finding a good budget hotel in Mumbai is difficult.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Jennifer B
