Review: Don't be put off by entrance
Detailed Review: Entrance is insignificant and dark but once up the two flights of stairs its another world,staff friendly and welcoming with water and snack to revive you. There were six of us (three mature couples) and we had the deluxe rooms,which were nice and clean and comfortable with shower gel etc provided,we used to get a lovely waft of curry in the mornings from caf√© next door,but could be noisy owing to meeting place at the back. Complimentry breakfast was limited to eggs or toast,tea & coffee so could get repetitive.Free Wifi ok but you had to change username/password each day. In a good area for exploring Crawford market and Mohammed Ali Road but also a short ride to India gate area by taxi,great Beer bar next door for a cheap drink,didnt try the food as husband went to toilet and‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Arundhati2015
Review: Luxurious stay at affordable price, close to main attractions
Detailed Review: We had stayed in a suite room in the month of February 2016. The rooms are pretty clean, well maintained with modern furniture and a small refrigerator. We received a warm welcome from the staff. The hotel is located close to the main attractions. There are a couple of restaurants on the ground floor.  Overall it was quite a pleasant stay.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Charlie_Roadster
Review: Very good stay in busy Mumbai!
Detailed Review: Pros: Near harbor gate, good location to major attractions, spacious rooms, modern furniture and all well maintained. All amenities like air condition, hot and cold water, fridge, safe deposit box, towels, soap, shampoo provided and running. Very friendly and welcoming staff. Cons: Noise from the beer bar on the ground floor until late night. Basic complimentary breakfast from the menu but enough.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: veryitchyfeet.com
Review: Clean, quiet and central in chaotic Mumbai!
Detailed Review: As some of the other reviews mention, walking up the stairs to the hotel can be a little off-putting ... but persist, walk up and through the hotel's doors and it feels like what perhaps Alice felt when she walked into her wonderland. You are greeted with a super-clean, professional and comfortable environment.  Upon arrival we were asked to sit down and we were then provided with water, snacks and a towel to clean our hands (got to love that in India!) Onto the room; we chose the smallest, most economical and windowless one, but it was still exceptionally clean with exceptionally comfortable beds.  Breakfast was included as were both a chair with foot massage and another with back massage.  Bliss! It's also central to many better than average restaurants, Crawford Market and‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Heather C
Detailed Review: I was arriving late by train in Mumbai and picked this hotel as it was so close to the station. I received a friendly welcome on arrival and complimentary water and snacks which were appreciated! The check in process was very smooth. My room was very clean and comfortable with a soft bed and good AC. Although the shower was a bit temperamental there was plenty of hot water. The staff looked after my luggage after I checked out and even offered me a cup of tea. My only small criticism was that it wasn't clear whether the breakfast was included or not and if so which items? However the service provided at breakfast was good.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Doug W
Detailed Review: This is a boutique hotel. Rooms are very small, beds are comfortable, reasonably clean, quiet. It is a bit out of the way. The rooms are air conditioned. Wifi is available. The hotel serves a reasonably priced breakfast on the upper floor. Management very business like, not as friendly as some hotels. No windows and exit in an emergency might be a challenge.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Bec H
Detailed Review: So we stayed here as part of a tour group and it was pretty average. One of the girls had massive cockroaches fall from the ceiling tiles in their bedroom, thankfully they were moved to another room. Our room had no window so there was no ventilation. Then with our room, sewerage was coming up through the drain in our shower and flooded our bathroom and couldnt move us to a different room as they were fully booked. they did clean it up for us though but it was still disgusting. The whole room ended up smelling like sewerage for the rest of our stay. Avoid this hotel if you can.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: OneSoloBackpacker
Review: Good hotel with a lack of space
Detailed Review: I keep using this hotel in Mumbai as part of my job. The hotel is located in Dhobi Talao next to the Gol Masjid. Mumbai has a lack of space which can explain the size of the rooms. They are really tiny with no windows !! If you really want to sleep this would be the place though...Lol  The staff are very nice and very helpful.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: akashghosh786
Detailed Review: I had visit this hotel with my family. Its a great hotel Situated in the heart of the city. All the staff of the hotel Serves Excellent. Hotel was very well maintained, all the modern equipment and comfort were there. Hotel was fulfilled with all luxuries. The hotel staff very professional and courteous. The menu breakfast has adequate options to chose from, awesome breakfast. Hotel location is perfect it is just a few meters from the Mumbai marine drive and cst  and central railway station. I would highly recommend this hotel for all kind of stay, specially for business stay

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: anisarkar
Detailed Review: rooms are decent size. very clean property near bombay hospital and marine drive.all staff are very polite. checkin checkout  also very easy. restraurent food very nice specially chicken 65. nothing noisy here.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: payalmandol
Detailed Review: I've booked hotel fortune by phone. I must admit over here the entire transaction was a smooth ans haselfree. When we went there we got a warm welcome. Receptionist and room serivce came with us to give basic amenities ideas. Room was upto the mark and as mentioned by the Hotel and as shown in the website portal. We got high speed complementary Wifi too. Hotel allows you to bring your own favorite food and beverages. This is just awesome and beyond my expectation. Room had all the required stuff. It wss well maintained too. As promised we had been provided all the amenities. We had CP plan so I don't comment on food but in my opinion it should be good. Next day we had menu breakfast and it was nice too. Overall I can say we had a winderful time in the Hotel. This hotel is‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: kiranchowdhury03
Review: nice hotel to stay in mumbai
Detailed Review: Excellent place to stay at Mumbai...3 star,economical as well as good location! The airport pick up and drop is good.The wifi was good the food service was good over all a good experience to stay and thanks to sameer for making the trip successful

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: 740rahim
Detailed Review: Good rooms and are spacious. Great food. Good ambience. One of the place to stay nearby airport. Cab services are helpful to roam around the city. Staff and room services are also good. Good experience.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Arjumand_03
Detailed Review: I wish to express my sincere thanks to the Owner and the Manager of the Le Grande Hotel. They gave us an excellent room with the best services.  Even though there was renovations in the building Mr. Sameer {Manager} made sure that we are taken care off. The entire staff and the Front Desk were very good. Early morning breakfast was Yummy and the kitchen staff were excellent.  Please keep up the great work.  Mumtaz Canada.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: PoojaSanjay
Review: Safe and Homelike for Women Business Travellers
Detailed Review: My preferred hotel when i am in Mumbai for business meetings and i have many reasons to say that it is my first choice: - Strategically located and Airport is just 10 mins drive - Prompt service staff. Very helpful and caring - Chef and Kitchen staff is accommodating to your choice of food - Tariff fits in your budget, esp. when you are a start-up - The manager- Sameer is helpful, friendly and extends support at all times - They take your smallest of concern very seriously and promptly responds to it - House keeping staff does good work  I only wish if they could place a few green tea bags in rooms than just serving it during breakfast :)

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: sunny28346
Review: Everything you need for a budget stay
Detailed Review: I stayed at this property for 2 nights. Initially, getting there by cab was tough as the location of the hotel is within a lane and not on the main road. Currently going through a renovation, the exterior does not look too pleasing. The service standards and rooms however exceeded my expectations and made my stay absolutely classy. The rooms were really clean with good working condition a/c and fan. Tv for your entertainment and in-house room service are available as well. Wifi was strong and good. Toilets had no issues from towels provided to amenities. The best part about this hotel is that they would provide you with an airport pick up and drop back as they are situated very near the international airport. This comes at no extra cost and the staff will help you transfer‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Samar D
Detailed Review: We stayed in this hotel for 3 days it is worth the price.The food is good .The staff here are very helpful.Specially the manager was always there to guide us with sight seeing and places.The rooms are of a decent size. The plus was the airport pick up and drop.Some renovations were happening at the reception but nothing in the floors.Would recommend this hotel for stay.Also the hotel is in a bit in which is little difficult  to find.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Neelam S
Detailed Review: The location is very good,in a  safe place, hotel staff are also good,food quality is so- so or can say o k, very near by to the airport,noice free place, next to main roadprice are little high but in mumbai its o k

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: SharonacP
Detailed Review: hotel is in the wrong side of town, in an alleyway that no taxi driver or tuktuk could ever find. The windows are not sounproofed at all and loads of wild barking dogs  and the odd muezzin disturbed us all night long. Not friendly staff either.  bed comfortable  , bathroom adequate

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: mzunguobama
Review: Ideal for overnight stay near airport
Detailed Review: This hotel provided everything I could want for an overnight stay near the airport with a flight the next day. Airport pickup and drop off are provided free. The room has everything one needs and is quite modern (although not the elevator, but who cares?). A/C and internet work. Good facilities all around. Decent breakfast and good service and attitude.

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Lalit T
Detailed Review: I have been wanting to write a review since a long time since my stay in Jan 2016. So I was here with my office colleague after a long event in Parel which got us really late. The location of the hotel is very shady inside a small lane. When we were checking in, the receptionist asked us the purpose of visit with a very Nasty look on his face looking at the girl. I sternly said that it is a business purpose. The rooms were not so clean with damaged walls because of leakages. Felt like staying in a government hostel. This place is a total disgrace to Bawa standards as I have stayed in other Bawa properties which offer excellent experience.

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Biplab N
Detailed Review: I was there with a group of 12 people for the Mumbai Marathon in January 2016. We arrived before 9 am and they gave us couple of rooms at around 10 am.   Location - Excellent. 500 meters from Dadar East entrance. That makes it very convenient for travelling in Mumbai.  Food - They do not have a restaurant but they do have an excellent room service. We needed warm water to drink and make coffee on the marathon day and we got it at 3:30 am. Time taken for room service is quick too.  We had complementary breakfast once and it was fabulous. We are like crazy. They serve the breakfast in the room itself. For us they gave Aloo Paratha, Bread, Omlet , veg sandwiches and of course tea/coffee.  Room Details - Rooms were decent in terms of size, cleanliness was good, Bathrooms were neat.‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Vijay K
Detailed Review: Though having an advantage of locality and brand name as BAWA, it does not live up to its expectation. Rooms are very old and noisy; one can hear the water draining sitting at your room also, even this couldn't be eliminated when the TV screening is going on.  The pity is non availability of restaurant. And the only better is locality. Only thing that looks new is TV..ha ha..rest one can imagine.  Considering all the cons and a ONLY pro, it is not worth what they charge to you. 3.5k for a room sounds nominal to any frequent traveler, but it is not worth to do the same frequently from the overall service/stay experience perspective.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Albie H
Detailed Review: Super value in a great location. Stayed one night at Elphinstone and could not believe that I could find this place for this price in this location. Super friendly staff, basic but clean rooms and superb location in the heart of South Mumbai

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Mikemmistry
Review: If you can get past the entrance you will be allright.
Detailed Review: So i was a little hesitant on booking this place but i took the word of fellow reviewers and took the leap of faith. So if you are like me who while travelling loves to have a decent hotel with clean beds and bathrooms to get a good nights rest so i am fully energized for the day ahead and don't care much for the ambiance and paying the high dollar to stay at a marriot or shereton while traveling abroad, you are gonna love this place. Centrally located with walking distance from crawford market and a small taxi drive from gateway of india and colaba this hotel is def an oasis in the dessert. The entrance did scare me a little with a small doorway leading to the 1st floor thru a dingy staircase but once you actually enter the hotel its a sight for soar eyes. The rooms are a bit‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: NaazneenSof
Detailed Review: I had gone to Mumbai with family for a 2 day trip. We reached Mumbai few hours earlier than our check-in time. We called the hotel for early check-in and they happily accommodated us early. We had booked 2 deluxe rooms, but they provided us with a bigger superior room. We were really delighted with the kind of reception we got at the lobby. Complimentary water, chips etc! The rooms and bathroom were very clean and pretty.You can also get complimentary tea in the morning and evening and complimentary breakfast (Though the breakfast is limited, I was happy since I love tea). Overall, their behavior was really nice, me and all my parents loved their stay. Also, the hotel is very near to gateway of india and located near masjid bandar, so you can take trains to most places from that‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: peargrower
Detailed Review: Previous reviewers have commented on all of Elphinstone' s assets and we were so pleased to find the hotel living up to its reputation in all categories.  Our room was small but comfy with a window and fridge.  The complimentary breakfast was an unexpected bonus.  But the best of all was Hemond and the staff. . .professional and friendly.  All of this for US$ 39, tax included.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Tzippi M
Detailed Review: In Mumbai you will want something central, very quiet and clean.This hotel has all that.  We reserved the less expensive room which is truly tiny-just enough space for two twin beds- with the area between them a narrow passage to the bathroom. We did't care as most of the day we were out touring and when we returned, it was to very comfy beds, incredible quiet, and kind staff. Hammond made sure we got our luggage which had been delayed, and was there to answer questions and help out- a consummate professional. Breakfast is tea, toast and omelette- very basic again, but very good eggs. Another fringe benefit which we didn't have time to try is the massage chairs. Probably would have been great at the end of a long day of walking!

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Anna R
Detailed Review: We stayed here for eight days, and enjoyed the experience. The room had everything we needed, and the staff were really friendly and helpful. The level of cleanliness is very high, and the price for our stay was well worth the experience we had. My partner got a little sick whilst we were in Mumbai, and the chef at the Hotel (Mr Singh) too a lot of care of him, and always asked how he was. Thanks very much Elphinstone Annexe for a great start to our trip!

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: rigas61
Detailed Review: The location is very good .Close to Crawford market on foot. The staff is very polite ,cooperative and helpfull. The rooms are a little tiny , had no windows ,so no sun light but AC supplies fresh air.Internet is almost good . Free breakfast is enough good. ƒ±f i come to Mumbai again my adress will be Hotel Elphinstone Annexe. regards

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: IbrahimAnchal
Detailed Review: I liked the security consciousness, when the insisted politely on  producing the identity cards of our family. Yes, looking from outside and climbing all the way to first floor is not a pleasure but inside its amazing.  Liked the pathway though not big but room was quite convenient and clean. nice hospitality shown. Helped with good advice on the local tours.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: sachindei65
Review: Loud Noise and vibration in room
Detailed Review: I have visited the hotel on the eve of Mumbai Marathon and I have given room No. 119,  It goes all well till night. In night there is a loud noise from the Beer Bar on lower floor. As I have to take rest I asked manager to ask them to lower down the music or change my music. First of all, Manager denied for any problem. Then He might have asked to Beer Bar authorities to lower down the music as manager told me but there is no reduction. Nor Did manager changed my room nor he provided any solution even on repetitive calls.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Anthony M
Detailed Review: I think people get put off by the exterior of this hotel and the dodgy staircase leading to the lobby. Once you get inside you are greeted by amazing and friendly staff. The rooms were great and clean. For the same price however you can get somewhere far closer to the action.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Uttam B
Detailed Review: Stay in this hotel was very nice and service is really appreciable. Location too is comfortable to reach. Staff was cooperative. Overall there was nothing reprehensible about this hotel. Got a nice time in this hotel.. It was a satisfactory experience, no hassle at all. Overall totally Satisfied with hotel and hotel services. All together it was a comfortable experience

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Soumya P
Detailed Review: I checked into this hotel during SCMM full marathon. The only advantage of this hotel is location as it is close to Azad maidan, from here the FM starts. Other than this, I do not find any bog reason to stay here. Rooms are extremely small ( at least one assigned to me) bed are like benches, very suffocated. I could not understand to go with A/C or fan. I checked into a delux double room, but could not sleep properly. The picture of the restaurant given in this site is not in actual. Very limited option. Also, last day i got couple of hours late ( check out at 4 ), and they charged me extra 1/2 day though i requested them a lot and rooms are empty also that time. Overall, looking into the cost, i will not visit this hotel again.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Gagan K
Detailed Review: * Located a walkable distance from Churchgate and CST station and near Metro cinema  * Most of the rooms have no window or ventilation  *  the rooms are small and toilet is even smaller  *  the complimentary breakfast is the worst I had experienced in recent times. The menu is fixed means two slices bread, one omelette, one tea, that's all. Anything extra is chargeable.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Fiona T
Review: A nice place by the airport
Detailed Review: My friend and I stayed here for one day last week before flying out of Mumbai to London and needed just a simple place to leave our stuff, nap and refresh before flying. We were only stopping in Mumbai for the day and were able to go straight to the hotel to drop off our stuff before heading into town. We were in a twin room on the 7th floor which was much nicer and more modern than we had expected with a lovely view. The room was very clean and nicely laid out. There was also a small modern, clean bathroom with shower and hot water.   The staff were all helpful and gave advice about travel into town. They also gave us a card with the hotel details to make it easy for us to get back. I would recommend caching a map of Mumbai on Google Maps and saving the location of the hotel to‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: jai t
Detailed Review: The stay in the hotel was good.The food was excellent.They have free pick up and drop from the airport.The apperance from out never looked nice but inside was a great experience.The staff was helpful and coperative.Would recommend this hotel in mumbai.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: VDNaik
Review: Great hotel to stay near airport
Detailed Review: I was here for 1 night. Room was good and clean. Room service was good. Food I ordered for dinner was delicious and free breakfast was best. Overall experience was great and I recommend it for further stay. They are giving free airport pickup and drop facility too.

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: richans
Detailed Review: Centrally located is main USP of this hotel....ITs good for travelers on Medium budget.it has a restaurant which is open 24/7...which can b an add on....the hotel has a tie up with OYO rooms so check it if get a good deal.. rest nothing great but not bad at all...there are cheaper options available in d vicinity but den u will have to compromise on the quality of service...

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Dan H
Detailed Review: Good budget hotel in Fort district of Mumbai. Close to Crawford Market and a 5min taxi to Chappatti beach.   Clean rooms and hot water.  Very helpful staff and manager.  Good value.  Located in a much busier part of Mumbai than many hotels. Good access to the market regions of the city.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Marek
Detailed Review: We stayed at Hotel Elphinstone in the standard room (called superior here) for two nights. It was very clean, hot water available all the time, wi-fi working fine, A/C. There were two separate beds - we would prefer one double but the room is so small I guess it would be very difficult to fit. There is no window, but it is actually an advantage as you don't hear outside's traffic. There is a party pub downstairs, so you will hear the music half of the night (we were there on Thursday and Friday).

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Titan0929
Detailed Review: From the street, all you can see is an old building. As you walk up the stair, you will realize that it is a very decent hotel. Staff are polite, we are welcomed with wet towel and chilled drinks. Room is well maintained. Keep it up!   Transportation wise, you able to get taxi easily. The landmark nearby is yellowgate police station. Most of the taxi know the location.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Warren C
Detailed Review: I stayed in this place a few weeks ago and considering how expensive accomodation is in Mumbai it was fairly good value. I haven't got any real crititcism on the place except to say that the breakfast included is not so good but the rooms, while being fairly small are clean and comfortable and the desk staff are friendly and helpful..Enjoy your stay in Mumbai.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Mohammed A
Detailed Review: This hotel is great, the staff were superb and cleaned the room everyday. The receptionists were exceptionally helpful. Heman and his team helped us get around the city and also provided us with a number of tips for Mumbai. The rooms were very clean and had great space. Overall a superb hotel close to everything you need. Will definitely be coming back!

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Abhi
Detailed Review: Staff was courteous, very helpful like all mumbaikars..kudos to them. But when it comes to hotel..we can call it good for a night stay or for a business trip but not for family or couple trip... its a sophisticated small building housing many rooms..with almost no ventilation.. extremely small bathrooms.. but that is what is expected from a 2.5 star hotel in Mumbai.. best part is location.. marine drive..CSTM, taj..etc. etc. all are almost walk-able..lot of eating options nearby..

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: mimi460
Detailed Review: very nice hotel. comfortable stay. spacious room. very hygenic.breakfast aws good. all important places are very nearby. i strongly recommended this hotel to all.all rooms are very clean. service is good.room service also very good.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Chantelle L
Detailed Review: I stayed here twice during my visit to India, first was with a tour group. We got a nice spacious twin-share room on the 3rd level, very friendly accommodating staff. The next time I stayed, my room was quite small and compact, didn't enjoy it as much as the first time.   Either way, friendly staff, wifi and great A/C - central location, minutes away from markets and restaurants. Only a short taxi ride away from Colaba and the Gateway of India.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Kai_holidays
Review: Ok for budget and short stay in Mumbai
Detailed Review: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights.  Hotels are very expensive in Mumbai and I would say this hotel is an "ok" place to stay if you are on a budget, want to be near the tourist sites and just want a bed in the evenings - but don't have any high expectations of your stay here! This was my first time in Mumbai, so I can't really say if you can find anywhere else better for the price.  I had a room on the ground floor, at the back of the hotel. It was small, you could just about walk around the bed to go to the bathroom - I only had 1 back-pack but you would struggle if you have more than 2 suitcases. The bed was comfortable and sheets were clean. As the room was at back of hotel, it was quiet, so I did sleep well. The room had no window but it did have air-con and a flat screen‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: shashi664
Detailed Review: i am coming to Mumbai from so long but couldn`t find this hidden gem ,But luckly this time my agent recommended this hotel its worth visiting here.its located in heart of mumbai very near to marine drive ,crafford market and kalba devi. The staff were very freindly and they serve very nice breakfast.hope to visit soon . ambrish tiwari  room no 403

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: koushikdas2015
Detailed Review: very good service. nice room . very tasty food. room is spacious very clean.breakfast was good. well decorated room.good amenities. i strongly recommened this hotel to all for family friends or business.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: karthikswamy
Detailed Review: The worst place ever. You cant even put it into any rating. Lodgings are better than this. The place does not even look like a hotel to me. My travel agent booked this place for me last minute & i was highly disappointed. The rooms are so shabby, the staff is arrogant, rude. The rooms are so small no place to move around, the moment you enter you sit on the bed & the only space to stand would be near the bathroom door. Location is also not that great. Very bad experience.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Trancy C
Detailed Review: As a frequent business visitor, i have stayed the hotel for 5 times in whole year of 2015. It is a really valuable to stay around Mumbai, specially around Airport area. 1) Clean room. 2)  24H friendly service. 3) People with hospitality. 4) Complementary WIFI in all rooms. 5) Free breakfast. 6) Complementary airport pick and drop. 7) 5 minutes to intl airport and 10 minutes to domestic airport. Currently, the hotel is renewing and it will be more business style and comfortable hotel.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Jatin B
Detailed Review: I stayed here with my fimily members for 3 nights and the hotel is very close to airport.They provide good as well as free transport from airport.The staff members are very helpful.The rooms are very clean and big.Food preparation was excellent.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: PramilKhandelwal
Review: Customer Service & Very good airport choice
Detailed Review: I stayed along with my guest 3 nights booked 5 Rooms, excellent customer service & Rooms are big,Clean & well maintained.Hospitality was very good. renovated dining is very good. Very close to domestic & international airport

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Sushil P
Detailed Review: Very hard to find, unless your Taxi driver knows the location or you have a GPS on your Android. Situated at the dead end of lane, the first impression is "Oh why did I book this hotel " but once inside you are happy you booked it. Quite comfortable rooms , clean bathrooms and excellent , excellent room service. I would recommend this place for a overnight halt to catch a Plane . Near to both the airports, suitable for a overnight halt.

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Elitevt
Detailed Review: I visited this hotel in November  for my official work. I landed at 7am and they managed to get me a room before check in time. The food was ok but the service was very nice. Internet speed was excellent.  The location is very convenient as it is easily accessible.  Rooms are nice and maintained.  It is smaller than the other Bawa properties but service is better than other bawa hotels that I visited. I would definitely recommend it.if I happen to be in Mumbai again.....it's always Bawa now.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Jon L
Review: An island of peace in the hectic city
Detailed Review: We arrived to this hotel after our international flights and because either was late at night we were quite unsure about the area when we arrived. Although the outside is nothing spectacular we were pleasantly surprised to find spotless rooms, great staff and a well appointed interior. A pleasant, modern and comfortable hotel all around. The location is convenient enough to coldaba and the sights of Mumbai. We walked to the sights and had no problem getting around. Would recommend to other budget conscious travellers looking for a clean, comfortable and convenient launching point for Mumbai.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Ravinder  C
Detailed Review: Good staff and very nice location  All the attraction are nearby.Rooms are very  small but in mumbai food rooms at affordable price.  Will definitely stay there again whenever  will go to Mumbai. I would recommend  to visit Crawford  market nearby and try apple shake , it was awesome and do go to shree Thacker bhojnalaya only 500 m from the hotel

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Michael S
Review: A great budget/backpacker  hotel let down but some frustrating niggles.
Detailed Review: Don't be too put off by the externals of this hotel - it looks pretty grotty from the outside, and the area itself is a bit rough, and right next to a very busy road junction which gets pretty manic at rush hours.... But hey, this is Mumbai, what else do you expect? Inside, the lobby is clean, cool and we'll presented. Staff are friendly, courteous and professional. My room was a bit small (I did choose the cheapest option), but it was generally well presented with aircon, TV and shower.  The first reason I've marked this hotel down is due to loud music being played until very late by a neighbouring premises, which was very clearly audible in my room, but oddly not in the lobby areas of the hotel. I didn't bother to move rooms, as I had earplugs, and was only there for 2 nights.‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Alex M
Detailed Review: Mumbai accommodation is pricey. It's something that can't be avoided. The elphinstone however represents great value when compared with its peers.   The entrance is a bit unusual but once in the hotel, you feel relaxed. The friendly staff and complimentary chai, snacks and water are a nice touch too.   Rooms are compact but functional. This hotel rightly has good reviews. It's a little far from the main attractions but one of the staff will gladly put you in a cab and ensure its on the metre (which is hard to do for foreigners), and the ride in to town is no more than 70 rupees.   Would gladly return.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Praveen V
Review: Clean hotel with a reasonable price
Detailed Review: Overall a nice experience for Mumbai standards. The staff were helpful and the room very clean with modern decor.  Downside was that my room had no windows. wifi was sufficient for basic needs. Complimentary breakfast was nice. Lack of space means the eatery consists of a table and chairs in the corridor, however it is a clever use of space and gives the property character. Would recommend for the budget conscious traveler.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Manish
Review: A very well located hotel, especially for those planning to travel from CST Mumbai
Detailed Review: My first suggestion would be to hold your opinion of the hotel till the time you are at the front desk. The hotel is very nicely renovated and feels just right for short stays.  The staff is very warm and polite. Though its a B&B, if you need to have lunch / dinner, just request the staff and they will arrange for the same as they are always so eager to make you feel comfortable.  They do have some nice massage equipment in the lobby which is free for guests, so don't forget to give it a try!  I would highly rate this for anyone who wants the best value hotel.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: jake_rhys
Detailed Review: After the hotel I stayed in Delhi I did not have high expectations for Mumbai... Upon arrival I was greeted with a bottle of water and crisps (much needed) and showed to my room. The air conditioning was and the amenities were brilliant! The staff are clearly what makes this hotel though! Every member of staff is so attentive and helpful. I would have no issue in reconnecting this hotel to any one of my friends and family and I hope to stay here again in the future! Thank you hotel elphinstone.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Handyhans
Detailed Review: Stayed at Elphinstone for three nights. Very nice and helpful staff. Very clean rooms and good looking bathrooms. We got the gateway suite, and that was great. Big and comfy beds and ac working very good. Will recommend this to every one going to Mumbai on a budget

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Vivek K
Review: a good and friendly hotel in mumbai
Detailed Review: A good hotel for short and long stays...the staff members are cooperative and the service is good...rooms are clean but a execellent is  the air conditioning they always help me when I book a stay without any hassels as I travel and stay in this hotel frequently...thumbs up if you are looking forward to book this hotel...the staff members are not like the other hotel staff people...they are really helpful and cooperative which helps the travellers' stay comfortable.service was good. i will definitely come back again.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: hayatu187
Detailed Review: I stayed at this hotel for one night with a friend so we could attend a friend's wedding reception. The service was amazing and the staff is incredibly helpful. The rooms are pristine and the beds are super comfortable but my personal favourite experience was time spent at the marine drive There is service provided at the restraurent and you can order all kinds of food.  All in all a great experience.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: businessfamilyLondon
Review: OK is as good as it gets
Detailed Review: I booked and paid weeks in advance and was given room 109. It had no window. The room was clean but tired and very small. The bathroom was miniature. the breakfast room was again clean and very tired, but the Indian breakfast (puri baji) was excellent.   This was my 4th hotel in India, all about 4,000 rupees a night and the other 3 were excellent with large rooms, windows, complimentary bottled water, tea, coffee etc. This was a hostel in comparison.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Luke D
Detailed Review: Nice location within walking distance (under an hour) to all the sights. Taxi rank more or less outside the door and lots of options for breakfast just round the corner. Rooms are quite small with cold showers. Wifi works quite well up in the rooms. The lift can just about fit 2 people into it so be prepared to carry your bag up the stairs!

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: finnickytraveler
Review: Barely average, from service to room quality to wireless internet
Detailed Review: First, I must admit I am a spoiled american.  So I am used to even a moderately priced hotel in america being clean, the service decent and the internet functioning fine.  None of this happened at Hotel Fortune.  The internet signal was horrible, and did not work the first day, and finally was barely operational the second day.   i was there for two nights.  Apparently they were sold out my first night, so I was upgraded to a bigger room.  If this was the upgrade I would hate to see what  the average room was?   It was dirty and noisy.   On the second day they moved me to a smaller room with twin beds, which was actually cleaner.  The best parts of my stay was the included breakfast which was fine, the room AC worked properly, and the bell staff who actually seemed to care about‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: NicolaRalston
Detailed Review: Excellent customer service they couldn't be more kind and helpful. The room is excellent and very clean. They did their best to get us booked in for one more night as our tour agent had let us down. They made umpteen phone calls on our behalf to help us sort our problem. The food in the restaurant was excellent. The service in the restaurant was very good and again the level of cleanliness is the best I have seen so far in India in our two week trip.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Leigh_Whitworth
Detailed Review: I stayed here for one night before a flight to Nepal. The reception though small was efficient and check in was swift. The helpful staff were not pushy. My room was large, clean and modern with a fan, air con and big comfy bed. There was in room WiFi and the attached bathroom with shower was equally modern. There was a flat screen TV with cable channels. A free transport both to and from the airport was provided as required. Although the hotel was in a frenetic area with street vendors, car repairers, schools and such like it was perfectly safe and enjoyable to walk around to stretch my legs. The restaurant downstairs served very tasty food. Both vegetarian and non-vegetarian options were available. The sizes were large and the choice very good. I paid about $3 for a large‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: velayutham v
Detailed Review: Stayed in this hotel with a Malaysian group for two days we all liked the hotel there services, there hospitality .Me and my guest has niece time here.The WiFi speed was nice.There is some renovation happening next to the lobby but it was quite upstairs.It is bit interior in a byline.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: drdaskkj@gmail.com
Detailed Review: The Hotel is very close to airport and their transport from airport was excellent , almost 24 hours service .All the staffs are gentle and helpful, most important hotel is very very clean , food quality is good enough...you can stay with your family in a homely calm atmosphere....

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Edo P
Detailed Review: Arriving in Mumbai the airport lost my backpack and Whit out the lovely staff's help it I could not have gotten my backpack back in time. Great staff! Besides that big nice clean rooms and a proper view of the city.

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Tarun580
Review: One can stay for short period and not for leisure or in holiday mood.
Detailed Review: I have changed three rooms (117, 114 and 115). All are in the ground floor and are said to be double deluxe !  Room 117 has a small bathroom with toilet facility having almost no leg space.  All room are devoid of proper water supply. Kindly keep your eyes open while choosing a room by your own. We suffered a lot.  None of us could take bath properly in all the days of our stay.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Henry H
Detailed Review: We booked a triple room for 3 nights and were upgraded to a suite room. Nothing too fancy but given the good rate and excellent location it's a good deal. Very close to CST, short walk around 1km or Rs.30 taxi ride. Gateway of India is Rs.60 taxi ride away and there are a few restaurants within the proximity of the hotel. Wifi is renewed every day and speed is ok. Massage chairs in the lobby are free to use. Service is beyond excellent. Breakfast is simple but cannot expect too much for the rate. Most rooms are facing internal and are relatively clean in Indian standard (Bathroom and floor are very clean only the bed sheets and mattress can be cleaner). Will definitely come back when we visit Mumbai again.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Dom_Breen
Detailed Review: Well we arrived early in the morning, hot and bothered after a sleeper train. The first thing we noticed was the air con, the second how clean and inviting it looked. We were given a packet of crisps and a chilled bottle of water whilst we checked in. Due to arriving before the check in we were also offered tea or coffee which we gladly accepted. The staff are super helpful, they will bend over backwards to help you. If you needed a taxi a member of staff would walk out with you to get one and make sure it was on the meter and not a random figure plucked out of thin air by the taxi driver. The room was clean and crisp. We weren't expecting air con but it was on and the room was lovely by the time we got back after a busy day of sight seeing. The complimentary chai is also worth‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: ElenaF9111
Detailed Review: This hotel is quite ok for budget trave¬≠llers who need to stay a night or two in¬≠ Mumbai. It's quite cheap for Mumbai,cau¬≠se the prices here are incredibly high f¬≠or India. The location is quite good cau¬≠se it's not far away from Gates of Mumba¬≠i, Marine drive, Leopold cafe, Colaba dis¬≠trict, Dhobi Ghat, and other sightseeings you may want to see. The hotel and it's rooms are of average cleanliness. The rooms are very tiny :) just for sleeping. The linen was washed but with stains. The personnel is very nice and helpful.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Blesson M
Detailed Review: they have utilized room space very well..  I really liked my stay for 2 nights after arriving in Mumbai. The shower was great! The bed was fine!  It's moderately priced and totally worth a stay.  Enjoyed stay here...

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Mohammed O
Detailed Review: This hotel has undergone a dramatic change ever since the new manager has joined. I've stayed here in 2013 & 2014 but it used to be a conveniently located, reasonably priced place. Just that. Today, I look forward to my Mumbai visits because I have found a home, away from home. A congenial atmosphere, ever smiling staff, comfortable rooms. You can't ask for more at the tarrif, whether it is the Superior or the Deluxe Room. Go stay there, next time you are in Mumbai and you'll have a hassle free experience.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: cardio.karma
Detailed Review: Visited there for a conference. Rooms were average. So was the service. Washrooms also average. Even though their room prices are good. Expected a better experience. Wifi also dint work properly. Buffet breakfast and lunch was also decent. Nothing extraordinary. Nothing negative about hotel experience, but everything was just average. Nothing extraordinary. I guess plenty of other good options available in mumbai at the same price or lesser price.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: abhishekjain100
Review: Pathetic rooms, rest all is good
Detailed Review: Service - 2/5 Room is very small - 1/5 Location 4/5 local transport taxi is easily available. CHECK ROOM as they are very small not even proper space to put your luggage. Washrooms are also very small.  Breakfast is good.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: NS_Rajbhandari
Detailed Review: The people at the front desk werent that helpful from the start. Rooms were poorly furnished. Shower was for name sake, rest of the rest room was crampy. Location was ok. Money minded people with poor breakfast. Not worth the price. But we would suggest all to look for some other hotels of the similar range.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: abirchaki
Detailed Review: hotelfortune a great and best hotel in mumbai. all the staff and restraurent staff are very polite.rooms are very spaicous.all rooms are very clean.house keeping staff are 24hrs at yours door.marine drive is just 5mins from this hotel.cst railway station just 5 to 6 mins form this hotel.bombay hospital 2 mins from this hotel.hotel air condition are very nice.bathroom shower is very good condition.from checkin to checkout all process is very nice. i recomened this hotel to all.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: keith72
Detailed Review: Stayed in this hotel on a group  tour.   There must better in the area.   The rooms are small, loads do not have windows although  the air con worked.  I have this issue  as to why basic cleaning and maintenance  cannot be performed in guest rooms. We felt it had not been cleaned  since the last person with having doubts on a change of bedding which were discoloured  and stained.  Complimentary Shampoo were empty, the bin was dirty as was the toilet seat which was also hanging off dispite the  I have been cleaned  tape.  Small open shower  which soaked  the toilet area.  I will be sending my coments  to the tour organisers.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Reviewer_kkr
Detailed Review: Nice Hotel to Stay in Andheri. Rooms are good. Food is ok. 24 hours room service is good. But if you have work in Andheri west then you may have to face a lot of traffic to travel from Andheri east to west. Rest hotel is good for business travellers.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: varunsethi
Detailed Review: This is the edited review...After I rec'd a request from the hotel manager that my review was harsh...when he read my original review. The hotel needs a lot of improvements...which the manager promised will be taken up. So lets see if at all I get a chance to visit again...what all improvements will be effected by then. But to others I would like to highlight upon the issues faced...firstly there is a lot construction work going inside the premises, the lift is very congested, the phone kept in the floor lobby of the rooms, rings at odd times, disturbing your sleep. Housekeeping can be improved. Food is good but sometimes too spicy.  A plus point is that it is quite close to airport. I hope after reading this edited review...the hotel management works for the improvements it‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: saddy0073
Review: very bad service as well as pathetic food
Detailed Review: we stayed at this hotel on last week. we found that the room service and food of this hotel was pathetic. room was dirty,hot water was available all the time. The manager of this hotel was very much rude mannered guy he does not know how behave with the guest. kindly check in at this at your own risk.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: NotHereOrAmI
Detailed Review: Stayed here as the location is very near the airport. Hotel located in a funny place but Google Maps was able to locate it easily.  Rickshaw drivers couldn't find the location when we went out so I had to show  The room was surprising massive. We booked a twin bed room, located on the 7th floor. Very clean and spacious.  Flat screen TV with loads of channels (including the sports ones!) and the bathroom/shower was big enough.  At night there was the odd dog barking but much quieter on the street than in the daytime.  Breakfast was very basic, please be aware. Staff were very friendly and helpful.  Currently on the ground floor they are doing works to expand but they take this into consideration and stop at a reasonable time.  Wifi does NOT work in the rooms, only on the ground‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Vinay K
Detailed Review: Tucked away in the bylanes off Sahar Road, it is a bit hard to find on your own, but they have pick-ups at the airport.  Quite close to the airport.  About 10 minutes in good traffic conditions.  It is pronounced "ley graan-dhey".  Room was spacious, very modern, and very clean.  Excellent a/c, good water pressure in the shower, western-style toilet.  Staff are highly competent and helpful.  Housekeeping is very conscientious.  There are two lifts, but one or both would constantly get stuck at high floors because guests keep forgetting to pull close the inner door.  Wifi is available "on demand".  Just ask the person at the front desk for a time-bound username and password, which remains valid for 4 hours after first login.  Wifi speeds are good.  In-house restaurant serves‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Betsy H
Review: Good place for woman solo traveler
Detailed Review: While at first this hotel seems like it caters to business men, I found that many of its facilities and services work well for a solo woman traveler (close to the airport, free airport shuttle, simple but elegantly styled rooms, good but not fancy restaurant, room service). I was only in Mumbai for one night, staying only long enough to make a connecting flight the next day. The hotel offered me a safe and pleasant retreat in the middle of a chaotic city that I didn't have time to explore.  The staff was very accommodating to my requests. They allowed me a late check out so that I could conveniently arrive at the airport when it best suited me.  The only down side to the hotel is that they are in the middle of a big renovation project, but the work is well-scheduled and it‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: asoked
Detailed Review: Nice and Excellent experience. Very Convenient, near to the Dadar Central Station. Good service, nice and clean room.  Staffs are courteous and helpful. My stay was very much pleasant. Hope to visit again.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: C K
Detailed Review: We stayed here for 5 days.  Pros  - clean rooms - free wifi that actually works in the rooms - free breakfast - walking distance from CST  - helpful and friendly staff - free chai in the afternoons - great value for Mumbai - air con and fan in room - hot water was always reliable  - rooms maybe small but they are perfectly formed - arranged pick up from airport at midnight via taxi company  Cons - hotel is a little bit out of way for tourist areas which might bother some people - it was a little bit noisy at night (beeping from road which you can't avoid outside and some nights there was a sort of disco near which shut down at about midnight) but earplugs ensured we weren't disturbed too much  We like walking so the 20 min walk to some of the central city parts didn't bother us‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Julieta L
Detailed Review: We've never been to India before and were nervous about our trip. So thankful to have booked at Elphinstone Annexe hotel for the beginning of our holiday because I can't imaging negotiating Mumbai without their valuable help. This hotel is amazing, the staff extraordinary. Our room was nice and so clean. It was quiet during the night-time and the beds were very comfortable. We would highly recommend this hotel for anyone.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: My Info K
Detailed Review: Stayed at this hotel for our first three days in India. The staff was more than helpful and accommodating, they offered amenities before we even had a chance to ask or inquire.  Safe, close, and walkable distance to many sites and to the heart of the city. Would recommend to others and would stay again!

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Daniel V
Review: The best service you'll ever get!
Detailed Review: The rooms and nice clean and a great value for the price, the crew is amazing! They are carrying, nice and help you as much as they can. They location is good and a short taxi or a walk distance from india gate or the markets.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Dustinho
Detailed Review: Mumbai is known for steep prices accomodation prices with little to be desired but this hotel was the exception. The rooms were incredibly clean and the luxury was a welcome reprieve from the chaos going on outside in Mumbai.  Don't let the location put your off. It really is a well-run and well-managed hotel. Getting taxis to the hotel could be a problem but if you use the Police station next door as a landmark most drivers knew where it is. It's a relatively close drive to Collaba and at a good price if you tell the driver to use the meter.  If you opt for Superior rooms they are comfortable but quite small. The hot water was also more lukewarm than hot.  Noise pollution from the people in the corridor facing reception can be a problem if you are a light sleeper. If this is‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Silver S
Detailed Review: I was there for 2 nights. Its located at the heart of bombay near the princess dock area. South to it are all the famous locations of bombay however the Northern part shows the real development level of bombay(and India). Free Breakfast Tea and coffee provided. The staff are very nice and helpful. The rooms are a bit suffocating and small. The wifi was very poor though due to some maintenance.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: nnunn
Detailed Review: Very friendly and helpful stuff, only the Superior Rooms are a little bit too small and without wondow. Luxury rooms are perfect. And Service is also very good. If you visit Mumbai for.one or.two days, this hotel is a good starting point to the markets and other sightseeing highlights.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: anirbandas258
Review: best hotel in mumbai near bombay hospital
Detailed Review: hotelfortune really a best hotel near bombay hospital. hotel staff are really very very friendly and all managemenrt staff are so friendly.all the room of this hotel are very nice and very clean.breakfast are so nice.restraurent staff are so efficient. housekeeping staff staff are 24 hrs at your door.reception staff are very friendly and very helpful. i strongly recommened this hotel to all .

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: hawah
Detailed Review: I was happy to find the staff helpful, the location extremely central and the rooms clean and hassle free. Its a good buy for Mumbai for the price.  I needed a car and the front desk organized it. the driver was not all that good and didnt want to drive later and the desk staff were nice enough to make an effort to right the situation. Rooms were kept clean and the AC worked fine!

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: pdawn
Detailed Review: Only advantage was the hotel is near to airport. Otherwise there was not much choice in breakfast and food was not tasty, wifi was not working, one day i have ordered fish & chips, it was terribly bad and salty. Fan was not working and AC temperature was beyond control. The hotel also not very clean, some work was going on in the hotel. Staffs were also not that friendly. Overall it's an average hotel.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Sheel_tomar
Detailed Review: This hotel is a total package right from the complacent room amenities to sumptuous buffet to effectual staff members and last but not the least, the reasonable prices. Totally loved my stay at the hotel.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Ganesh S
Detailed Review: We stayed in this hotel last week on our short trip to Mumbai. Pretty decent hotel for the price (I got a 2.5 k/per night deal via clear trip). Food was good (Quality of food ordered via room service was much better than the quality offered for free breakfast. However, since the price was reasonable, we have no complaints about this)  Rooms were neat and clean with good lightnings and the TV channels were elaborate with excellent clarity. Staff was very polite and courteous. They were flexible to accommodate our late check-out request.   Location was good too. It takes only 30 bucks for an auto to the Andheri RS which can hook you to anywhere in Mumbai easily.  Overall it was a good experience and I would surely stay in this hotel during my next visit to Mumbai.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: balaji_jp
Detailed Review: The hotel is close to airport. They provide free airport pickup and drop. But the driver may expect high tips if you're going to international terminal. The hotel is good for one day or two days stay especially for transit. The hotel is located near residential area. The deluxe room is small and not as big as it is in the pictures. But it is comfortable for 2 people. The food is good for a 3 star hotel. Wifi signal is poor in 6th floor.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Sleepingbics
Detailed Review: The Hotel provide a free pick up and drop off service from the airport which was fantastic... on arrival we had to search for our driver as there was no name board which was annoying and then we had a further 30 minute wait whilst he bought the car.  Venturing out on your own with a rickshaw was what we did, but its a pain finding the hotel again as not even local people are familiar with where it is. Its hidden down a side street, took us a few attempts to get our bearings. Once you end up near the cigarette factory in Anderi East its about a 10 min walk from there.  The Wifi is a abysmal! Do not book this hotel if your looking for Wifi... you have to stand in the hallway to connect to it as there is no Wifi in your room ad even then it only lasts for 4 hours and then you have‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Ravi Jain
Detailed Review: I have been visiting Mumbai every month. Stayed in this hotel for first time. I reached hotel around 6.15 am. According to their policy, check in time is 12 noon, but they allotted me a room at 7 am. Though room was not good, but it was clean enough to get ready in morning. I locked in luggage and left in room after getting ready. During day time, hotel staff shifted my luggage in a proper room. Its a decent hotel to stay in heart of main city.

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: samratkothari
Detailed Review: Rs. 4000 for 1 night without breakfast in a 2-star like room that they call executive. Poor cleanliness and service. No drinking water in room. Required to call housekeeping to clean the thermos and bring water. Commode seat was stained and dirty. Air conditioner made loud groans every 5 minutes. Attended rudely at reception itself. P.S.- I stayed in The Orchid the next day for Rs 6000 only(5-star hotel)

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: AerinmundF
Review: Very nice hotel but poorly advertised rooms
Detailed Review: The hotel was spotlessly clean with hot showers and the staff were always helpful. I think that it is also well priced compared with other hotels in Mumbai.   I would not give 5 stars as the rooms were advertised in pictures as having double beds when in reality they are all twins and it is awkward/impossible to rearrange the beds to form a double. Also do not pay to upgrade rooms as it seems to be that there is basically no difference between the 'supreme' and the 'deluxe' rooms!

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Ajay G
Detailed Review: I alone visited this place. My flight was late so came to hotel around 9 in the evening. as all the superior room were booked they eagerly upgraded me and provided me suite. i was greeted well and with water and chips along with wet tissue to refresh myself. it was a present surprise. though they don't have kitchen but there are good restaurants downstairs. room were super clean with all basic amenities. will visit again...

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: aromalkollam
Detailed Review: I stayed with my family for two nights in two rooms... Small but nice and clean rooms, very friendly and helpful staff...Please don't get upset while seeing thebuilding entrance.. When you get the first floor hotel entrance, you will see an entirely different world.... I'm more impressed than satisfied....

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Solo-Abenteurer
Review: Clean Room Doesn't come in Cheap
Detailed Review: When I was arrived at this hotel, I thought I've got con by reviewer. Totally ruined my mood when i need to take those old and dirty stairway. But and then, I saw hotel entrance. Thanks god, It just a stairway only. This hotel is clean and located at the middle of main tourist attraction like Mumbai Gate, CST, Taj Mahal Hotel Palace. You just can take a walk to get there. Also if want to find muslim food, there is Gulsham-E-Iran nearby at Crawford Market. 5-8 minutes walk from the hotel.  Pro 1. Clean room and toilet 2. Staff were nice. Just one staff, I think he is a manager. He face never smile. 3. Safe box 4. Good services 5. Free foot and body massage (machine) 6. Nearby tourist attraction 7. Good welcome meal. (mineral and snack) 8.Hair dryer  Cons: 1. Expensive 2. Waste‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Andrew C
Detailed Review: We were travelling on a budget and the value of this hotel was excellent (although there was a deal on Expedia at the time of booking) - although the outside is a bit haphazard, inside the hotel is really nice - clean and well maintained. There were also some improvements being made whole we were there so the standard will be good. The hotel is very close to Mumbai CST and either a good walk or a short rickshaw ride from South Mumbai's main attractions.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: shou_9
Detailed Review: first of do not be put off by the outside of the building.it is rather dirty and not attractive but u will be pleasantly surprised once inside the hotel itself!!!it is very clean and has very helpful staff to attend to your needs. the rooms are cleaned daily and the water pressure in shower is just amazing!!plus u get free wifi in rooms and in lobby also.. there are two great massage chairs in the lobby and its such a nice welcome after a long day walking around..plus its free for all!  I did not try the breakfast so cant comment on that..as for room service all u need to do is call reception and they send sumone to the room so u can give yr order,give the cash and they bring yr food in a matter of minutes!!the food tases good..im not sure if its from the hotel or from outside‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Oliver R
Detailed Review: I originally chose this hotel for its location near the main station. In the end it's great value for money and you can reach most places on foot. The staff is really helpful and friendly, everything is clean and looks quite new. We really enjoyed our stay!

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: kajol34
Review: very very decent hotel in your budget
Detailed Review: really a good hotel in near bombay hospital. very friendly hotel with good service and very good hospitality. i like this hotel. thanks fortune for a nice stay .all the staff are very polite and friendly. very good ambience good location. i recomened this hotel to all.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: sourav804
Detailed Review: Excellent Hotel in terms of ambiance and room quality. No doubt about it. Room charges are quite decent as compared to the room quality. We got upgraded to Executive room from deluxe category. Great value for money with respect to amenities, services and cleanliness. This is a very nice hotel and value for money i must say. this is situated just behind the metro big cinema and golmosjid this is close to marine drive. I stayed at this hotel during my holiday visit to Mumbai for 3 days and 2 nights. The stay was perfect and amenities were top class. Food from the hotel was not expensive and it tasted great. Complimentary breakfast! Great! I was pleasantly surprised to find a good hotel at a very reasoanble price near cst and churchgate.Nice room, good spread of breakfast and roof‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Ambani2015
Detailed Review: I had taken a booking trhough OYO Rooms with no IPVU2386 in Hotel Fortune for 3 people from 17-19th of Aug15 for Rs.7598. On reaching the Hotel they had shown me a cramped and stinking room where even 2people can not stay. They showed another room with a extra bed then where asking for Rs.2200 extra per night. Both the rooms where stinking and so I had the worst experience of my life that too in front of my friends I was on the look out for an alternative at 10pm in Mumbai.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Bharat_Jain_0601
Detailed Review: This is a very well managed hotel. I booked it through OYO Rooms for a business purpose. It is situated at a very great location near Kalbadevi. Friendly staff. Good hotel. Serves Veg and Non-Veg Food.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: cb19632015
Review: Dishonest and judgemental management. Avoid this hotel.
Detailed Review: Manager on arrival lied that there is a law prohibiting a foreign guest and Indian guest staying in the same room. There is no such law and most hotels have no issue with this although some Indian hotels adopt a moralistic and racist policy that discourages this. The manager insisted there is such a law, which was a complete lie. This is completely humiliating for the guest and the hotel should therefore be avoided.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Octman
Detailed Review: On arrival in India  On arranging a pick up from the airport via email direct with the hotel several weeks before and having email confirmation we thought our collection would be fine! Always double check a few days before leaving again as there was no one waiting for us!!! Not a great start to our trip, We made our way down to the taxi rank on the lower level of the airport. Walk to the far end, where you'll find a couple of guys organising journeys, have your hotel address ready, for an air conditioned taxi it will cost you roughly Rs 680 (¬£7.50 roughly and NO need to tip the driver on arrival).   On arrival at hotel Once at the hotel, we checked in fine and asked why we hadn't been collected as we had arranged a pick up from the airport via email, we showed the receptionist‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Pradeep K
Review: A decent hotel with difficult access
Detailed Review: I had booked the hotel along with my flight. They provided free airport pickup and that is needed otherwise you will be lost in getting there. Good to have a landmark (Cambridge school) which really helped in conveying to the Taxi.  Had been with my family and they provided additional cot with bed as requested. Its a decent hotel with courteous staff who helped me in arranging the cab (for a decent price) for the site visit. They provide complementary breakfast and got the rooms at a decent price.  WiFi didn't work, but not much impact though. Spacious room with clean washrooms. Reception is cringe and if multiple family comes then waiting will be bit embarrassing as one has to wait on the steps.  I would recommend this for decent budget family outing. 2-3 kms from railway‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Cweeta
Detailed Review: It's a good hotel very close to the airport.  Staff are really helpful especially the bell boys were very helpful.   Bombay is expensive and this hotel provides a reasonable price. I would have given it a 5 star if it was not for the mouse running inside my room.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: sunderraj22
Detailed Review: A good hotel that gives good services at a very reasonable price in Mumbai. They give airport pick up and drop that no one gives at this price, complimentary breakfast is good,room service and the manager was very helpful. Executive rooms are so good at little higher prices. Wish to stay again with my family.

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: atsona
Review: BEST LOCATION and MOST REASONABLE DADAR  HOTEL
Detailed Review: Best thing about Bawa Regency is its location, behind Chitra theatre opposite Dadar Fire Brigade office and walking distance from Dadar Station.  Staff was co-operative. Check in was smooth and easy. The value for money is good.  The property is a bit old, the furniture was lookign old and dusty, but Linen was clean and so was bathroom...  There is no wi fi in the rooms.  Not a leisure hotel, u can take it juz for emergency and essential stay.  Will book it once again, most reasonable hotel in Dadar.

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: zeebaz2015
Review: The staff makes up for everything!
Detailed Review: Since I was travelling alone with my minor son, I made a lot of research and finally chose Elphinstone. I made direct booking with the hotel for three nights since payment mode was convenient for travelers like me coming from Iran i.e "Cash on arrival". I also had to find something good and value for money. After going through the reviews I went in for superior room which was the cheapest. The entrance as been described by many did not have a nice view. In fact it did not look as though we are entering a hotel. Staircase were old and dirty. The hotel is in the first floor and it is from there that the place looked decent to enter. Even though we reached the hotel late due to flight delay, the Manger was present to welcome us. We were given fresh towel, water and snacks. We were‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Elphinstone_Annexe-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Marjolein M
Review: Clean rooms and incredibly kind and helpful staff
Detailed Review: Rooms are spotlessly clean and have all the comfort you need. Breakfast was complementary (basic omelet and toast) and complementary chai is served in the lobby every evening, which was a nice touch. The staff is what really makes this hotel so great, they are incredibly helpful and kind. Our flight into Mumbai had been a bit of a nightmare, long delays and our luggage was lost somewhere on the way. However, the staff at Elphinstone made sure this hiccup didn't ruin the first days of our trip. They were on the phone with the airport for us several times a day, pushing for our luggage to be delivered to the hotel before we left Mumbai. With success! The hotel staff received the luggage for us, so that we wouldn't have to hang around the hotel waiting for it to arrive. The staff‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: mimi460
Review: Excellent and Pleasant Stay away from the hustle bustle
Detailed Review: We were staying at a ground floor room which was very nice. Rooms are very decent and clean... Service and staff is very nice.... restraurent is big and well maintained. Hotel is close to market. Food is average you will get better options in the mark. The restaurant food is good & service is quite prompt. The room service was also fine. The staff is extremely good & polite, always smiling & ready to help. The rooms are quite big & fine.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: subirchaki
Review: Nice n  perfect family hotel to stay with Peace Environment and nice food
Detailed Review: I stayed this hotel for holiday trip with family. it was 1 night stay so i booked fortune deluxe room but they free upgrade me to fortune superior plus Executive Room. the room was perfect and nicely decor with modern furniture. Food is nice and good choice of Menu. The stay was perfect and amenities were top class. Environment is very pleasant b food also very good n really awesome. Staff is very good n restaurant s are awesome, 	  I was a bit afraid went to Mumbai, then flight time also very long to kolkata.We arrived very late being welcome by a very nice staff from reception..they explain about hotel facility and the rest. their kind gesture makes my worry a bit less. Then the service or the staff also the sweet treat in our room really make us feel special.   I never‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: jayantmehta123
Detailed Review: The hotel is nice and descent. The staff is courteous and nice. The best part is the location of the hotel as it is located in Marine Line near Metro cinema and is near to Colaba, Marine Drive, CST Station and Fashion Street which is just 5-10 mins drive and the taxi will charge you Rs 35 maximum for Colaba and Marine Drive where in for CST and Fashion Street you can even walk down. The only part which disheartened me was that they charged me tax at 18% approx on rack rate where in in mumbai the tax is 10% Luxury tax and rest 8% approx Service tax on the rate which you have booked the room. So for me it should have been lower because I booked it through Cleartrip. One more thing to add there was ants in room which I told them on the next day of my visit and they got my room‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: VASUDEVAN1532344
Review: This was a brief in house work shop and entertaining luncheon
Detailed Review: This Hotel is located at the  busy Palm Beach Road,  as yet serene as the front area is inset, without facing the road side. Spacious conference room and delicacies of lunch made the business session an entertaining event

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: pereira407
Detailed Review: Needed to stay for transit reasons as it is nearest to the airport, was looking for a budgeted hotel and so decided to stay here, nothing great about the hotel, rooms are just ok, it is ok for a 1day, cant stay more, only good thing about the hotel is that you get a pick and drop from the airport.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: shitalvaidya
Detailed Review: Stayed here with my wife the hotel was good and decent The staff at this hotel were nice and helpful .The room size are decent to stay.The food was good. The rooms were neat and clean. The WiFi speed was great. Can recommend for families. The only drawback was it is bit inside but everything was fine.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: SMNirmal
Detailed Review: Hotel is excellent i stayed here for 12 days with my family.The staff at the hotel were  helpful and cooperative for all the things we required. Food is good .The service cleanliness  and all other facilities are really to our satisfaction.hotel provided pick up and drop facilities. Overall i must say hotel is excellent.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Pradeep Ghosh
Review: Best for a short Stay in Mumbai
Detailed Review: This Place is best for both Business & leisure. The hotel offer complimentary Airport Transfers & Buffet Breakfast. Rooms are getting renovated and are very cozy for single stay of double. Avoid this place if you have a small kid as the rooms are very small in size as it is in Mumbai. Although Rooms may be small but the services are very good. Staff is extremely courteous and Airport Transfers are in good quality AC vehicles. Tje process is also very hassle free, you have to send the arrival details (Booking date & Name and Flight Details) to 99300 33180

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: sonalshomakash
Review: Decent & Budget Hotel for a short stay near Airport
Detailed Review: Staff was helpful & courteous. Single room was small but decent enough for a short stay. Room facilities were good. However, 3 grey areas; 1) breakfast variety can be better. They must add fruits variety, 2) Free Wi-fi but found it to be slow so had to use my data card only to get moving & 3) They offer free pick up & drop facility & I used drop off facility but driver asks for GOOD tip off. I was in a way insisted to pay him & when I didn't, he didn't hv friendly & courteous expressions. Either hotel shd get this corrected or else it will bring a bad name to it or they shd advise clients to better pay up. Hopefully, Hotel will look into it. Rest, this place can be recommended & visited again.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Adebayo A
Detailed Review: Booked this hotel online from Nigeria having not been to india in the past. I initially had doubts and worries especially as I arrived far earlier than the expected time and I did not call them from the airport or anything like that, I simply sort of 'winged it'.   I took an Auto Rickshaw and the staff were most helpful. they were actually expecting me and would have picked me from the Airport had I bothered to inform them of the changes in my flight.  Hotel's very clean, very friendly and helpful staff and the delicious varieties of indian food from the restaurant was amazing.   Honestly I dont understand what some of the other reviewers are writing here but my experience has been very beautiful.  PS I stayed on the 4th floor and the force of water from the shower was always‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Harsha P
Detailed Review: I stayed here for a night. Had booked it simply becaused they offered airport pick and drop service. I would have rather booked a cab and stayed somehwere else. The night staff is extremely rude and unhelpful. I had to checkin at night which was informed to them yet I had to arrgue with the staff for like 30mins. Their policies are not completely mentioned on the booking page. Beware! They can say anything and claim it as 'hotel policy'. Location is in an extremely seluded area.
