I don‚Äôt know why they have put two beds separately. They should have combined that and made it a little bigger. The room itself was small and not worth for the money spent. The restaurant is in the open terrace.‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: ZapZoom
Review: Good comfortable accomodation near to the airport
Detailed Review: To me this hotel is a no-nonsense business hotel. Nothing very lavish but still very comfortable, clean and convienient. Its near to the airport and priced reasonable ...considering that the prices for hotel anywhere near the hotel are very high and not so clean...I booked the place thru cleartrip at Rs 3200 per night. Highly recomended if you want something near the airport. I got the room that is just above the entrance- facing the road which becomes noisy early in the morning due to traffic of school buses and if you are not a early riser you might not like to wake up to car and bus horns at 6am. Avoid these rooms. I am sure the helpful staff shall be most eager to accomodate you.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: KMangal
Detailed Review: This hotel is a safe business hotel. Nothing very lavish but still very comfortable, clean and convenient.Its near Road even tho very calm & quite place.Very helpful staff! Its near to the airport & priced reasonable ...considering that the prices for hotel anywhere near the hotel are very high & not so clean...I regularly stay in this hotel. Highly recomended if you want something...

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: MKP297628
Detailed Review: I stayed a night at the hotel during a  family visit as my flight was arriving late night. Check-in was easy and quick, room was spacious with 2 beds although i was alone. Hats off to the Housekeeping staff and Front desk as I had forgotten my wallet with my U.S passport, Credit cards and some cash at the hotel next morning when I checked out. It was only after 2 days that I realized I had forgotten my wallet at the hotel.  I tried to reach the hotel desperately and their phone was ringing with answer. Finally I got in touch with the MD and he informed me that they did find my wallet and it was at the Front desk & i could pick it. I rushed back  and was handed my wallet  with everything intact.  I truly admire their Housekeeping staff's, Front Desk  honesty and service. I highly‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: SN1001
Detailed Review: My boyfriend and I booked and paid this hotel online well in advance. By email the hotel confirmed to us that it would not be a problem for us to stay with them even though my boyfriend is Indian and I am an Indian with a European passport. Upon arrival the room was very tiny and dirty, but the bell boy was sweet and we decided to stay the night. We went out for dinner in the night, but when we returned to the hotel, the clerk at the reception called us in our room at 2 am in the morning to tell us, that we were not allowed to share a room. At first we really tried to understand and explain that we had booked from home and that if this was the policy they should have adviced us upon arrival. But after a while the clerk got really rude and would not allow us to go back to our‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: aforth
Detailed Review: Be careful of this place.  The staff while not glowing with joy mean well enough, and there is a lovely rooftop terrace that serves reasonably priced food.  I made my booking online and this was honored without any trouble.  But the photos on the website are basically fraudulent; the rooms are in very shabby condition with paint falling off the walls, all kinds of stains on the (very uncomfortable) mattresses, etc.  The television, unsurprisingly, didn't work and no attempt was made to fix it.  The window in my room facing the street did not lock or even close all the way owing to a cord from the air conditioner running outside.  The open windows meant problems with mosquitoes and did not make me feel terribly secure.  All in all pretty poor for $50 a night, even in Mumbai.  The‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: fantazbaz
Detailed Review: This is a basic hotel with attentive staff and very good and affordable food. TV was unavailable at time of visit as they were changing service providers.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: RobnDoug
Review: Clean but in rooms in bad shape
Detailed Review: This hotel is in a tremendous location.  Close to Marine Drive, Churchgate station and a 5-10 (50 Rupee=$1) minute taxi to Coloba.  The lobby and the hallways are much nicer than the actual rooms, however the young staff do try very hard to meet your every need.  Unfortunately the rooms are not very nice...paint pealing off the walls and the bed was not comfortable and we were in a deluxe room.  I would only recommend this hotel to someone who has traveled India a lot and is beyond caring about a nice room.  It is safe has good AC and is for most part very clean.  There is a great Indian restaurant to the right of the hotel...on the corner...you will not be disappointed.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: pinktokio
Review: Charming hotel that makes you feel like you are really in India, close to airport
Detailed Review: This hotel was quite decent - the beds were comfortable, there was warm water, great service, nice breakfast, and it was pretty close to the airport (you can take a tuktuk to get there). It's maybe not the best place for someone that wants to be near Colaba, but Andheri E has its own charms. The only downside of the hotel was the mosquitoes (in December...) and it was located next door to a school, so if you are a somewhat light sleeper they will probably wake you up in the morning... all the better to explore Bombay!

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: marufsust
Detailed Review: Me and my wife stayed in this hotel for just one night. They gave us free Airport Drop. Room is clean and management is nice and trustworthy. Breakfast is ok if you compare with price. Location is a bit remote so its good for short stay/transit I recomend.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: anattaa
Detailed Review: Firstly, you may be confused by the varying reviews on this site. The reason for this is that there are 2 Fortune Hotels in Mumbai - one is in Navi Mumbai and part of the Fortune Select Group of Hotels, which is a luxurious 4 star hotel chain, while this Fortune hotel is at Marine Lines in South Mumbai and is a hell hole to be avoided at all costs. If you see reviews which mention golf course, swimming pool, continental food, wifi, they are NOT refering to this hotel, so please disregard them. This is more like a hostel, with tiny smelly rooms, and no pretense of luxury whatsoever. Check carefully to be sure which one you are booking.   I booked three nights here, but left early because it was so bad. The check-in was smooth and efficient, but when we got to the room (twin beds‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: donalkelly
Detailed Review: this is a pretty crappy hotel especially for the price, but mumbai is so expensive compared to the rest of india we had to double our budget and it still was worse than lots of the other places we stayed in. bad points: really bad breakfast, tiny not so clean rooms and not so clean bathroom, not so clean sheets good points: good location  Mumbai is a dump of a city anyway so the least time you spend there the better.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: love4travel19
Review: Not a Hotel - it's a Hostel
Detailed Review: I would not recommend this Hotel to anyone looking to stay in an actual Hotel. If you're looking for a Hostel, then this would be for you. We walked into a very small room and saw two single beds and an extremely small bathroom. The blanket and sheets on the bed were stained yellow (like an old pillow). It was so disgusting and filthy that we looked for another Hotel and took the hit on the cancellation fee.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: ATULJAIN1408
Detailed Review: Overall hotel is very neet & clean, room service is excellent, location is also fine as church gate, marine line station & crawford market is on 10 - 15 min. walking distance but other locations are more than 2 k.m., very professional, they are not interested to help you in site visit or hire a taxi / cab, even if once you check out  & make the payment & if you asked for a glass of water then they are not happy to offer a glass of cold water, they will offer for their own bottel or ask for purchase a bisleri.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Biju Nair
Review: Decent VFM hotel near Mumbai airport
Detailed Review: The hotel is located off the highway between the domestic and international airports. It is a bit hard to find amid the alleys. So keep the hotel number handy so that the reception can guide you to the place. The rooms are spacious for a hotel of this grade in Mumbai, especially near the airport. The hotel also provides complimentary airport drop / pickup, which is handy for a business traveller.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Rohit1000
Detailed Review: Good to stay in this place. Good amenities. Clean hotel. Staff was co-operative. Nearest to Juhu, Bandra. Good breakfast. Calm and place in the hotel. Transport available throught the night to go any place.

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: cdrnet
Review: Located in busy area of Dadar with average quality of rooms and service.
Detailed Review: The hotel is situated at Dadar (East) close to dadar railways Station on Central Railway route. The rooms are average, with renovation carried out for old property. Room Service was available and the quality of food was average. The staff was polite and helpful. Suitable for single travellers.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: rajdking
Review: value for money, good service, no frills
Detailed Review: iam a frequent traveller to mumbai, atleast twice a month. le grande has an excellent airport pick up service. always on time and responsive.  it is ideally located between the domistic airport and international airport. for people who are likely to have meetings in the city as well as in the suburb the location is ideal. hotel looks nice and pleasent from outside, pleasently cool lobbly, in the heat of mumbai feels great. quick check in will take you to small but decently managed rooms. must have stayed in almost all rooms by now! le grande needs to improve upon the linen cleanliness and the complimentary breakfast- i always wish there was a little more variation. complimentary internet (wifi) is fast suits, the business traveller well. it is a supremely value for money hotel‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: shubz81
Detailed Review: its value for money ........................ really good offer all round the year

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: sundar_amu
Detailed Review: We booked this hotel through TravelGuru.com. We reached the hotel at 36Degree hot and a room boy asked us to wait for hotel manager to finish his Lunch.  We waited for 20 minutes.  No A/C.. not even FAN on the lobby!  Room was very very small... I never seen such a small size bed like Train sleeper before.  Small bad smelly toilet...  Water would't come all the time...  The only good point is their food.  Somewhat good.  Nothing else to mention about this hotel !   We did a bad decision to choose this hotel.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: anand431
Detailed Review: one of the best hotels i have visited . very well maintained in the heart of navi mumbai.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: N A
Review: Neat and Clean hotel - good location
Detailed Review: We were transiting Mumbai and needed a room in the expensive city for three nights. This hotel was perfect in terms of location and cleanliness. It seems to be recently renovated with everything looking new which is usually not the case with hotels in old mumbai. We landed really late and took a taxi from the airport to the hotel. The security guard was helpful with our luggage and  got upgraded to a bigger room as the smaller ones were full. A bit pricey but then when you are looking for hotels in Mumbai you have to pay that much.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: TeaserAshish
Detailed Review: A nice decent place to stay and you feel really relaxed by the excellent spa facilities in the hotel.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: sumitindore
Detailed Review: Alongwith my collegues, I enjoyed the services of Hotel Fortune. Great Hospitality provided by caring staff. Nice Location of the Hotel. Food, Cleaniness - everything was excellent.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Perazzi
Detailed Review: Very good place for overnight stay, but not more, because room was very small. Poor breackfast. Clean place. But there is smoking allowed. That disturb. Nearby was nice bazaar and school, where at 7.45 children start to play drums and trumpets. That replace alarm-clock!:)  Sympathetic staff.  Hotel placed  a great distance away from Mumbai downtown, but very close to domestic and international aeroport.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Nol P
Review: Very small room. Nolt too clean. Small breakfast.
Detailed Review: I stayed here with my cousin for three nights in room 201, the cheapest room rate available. The room is very small and the bathroom is also very small. The room is not dirty but not very clean. They never came to clean the room during our entire stay. Staffs are sometimes helpful. Breakfast is small as usual, like in many Indian hotels.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Harsha12345
Review: Its a cramped place but the place is good for business meetings
Detailed Review: The place is effective for business meetings as the staff is very co operative. The rooms are built in such a way that there are minimal interference from your neighbours. And the breakfast they server is awesome!! :-)

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Yashwan
Detailed Review: Good hotel, nice rooms, very helpful staff, 24hrs room service. Spent a superb time in Mumbai. The negative point is that the restaurant is small. Otherwise, it was a good stay for 6 nights.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: SJ_Indb
Detailed Review: I used to stay in the Hotel for a night in Nov-2009. They are having good staff providing good services. The staff have taken care of our needs. The rooms are having moderate facilities. Hotel was neat & clean. Food quality was good.  But, the location and infrasture of the Hotel is not good. Overall, we may say that the Hotel is good hotel with average location.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: piyush_eng
Detailed Review: Date:22th nov 2010 it was the day when we were returning from the mumbai we want to stay at one good place and someone pointing us to stay this hotel. this hotel was really excellent and service of the staff is also very good. we have  a lots of fun.  i can say that this hotel is almost providing good service in all the criteria.we never forgot this trip.  thanking you to the all the staff member of this hotel for serviving us.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: JakTarr
Review: Oh, dear. This really won't do.
Detailed Review: We booked 3 nights at this hotel to round off our stay in India but 3 minutes was more than enough to convince us we'd made a bad choice. The room we were offered was dirty and fly-infested. We were offered an alternative which would be ready about an hour later but, rather than stay to see what was on offer, we just hopped into a taxi and headed for Colaba. (The sea front hotel we selected was only a little more expensive but worth the extra). This could be a decent place to stay because the location isn't bad but it really needs a major clean.

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: footsoldier77
Detailed Review: The hotel is conveniently located near the domestic airport. i had booked after reaching mumbai airport. the cab took 20 mins to arrive and was a shared cab. the stopover was very short, so i had no food there. Rooms are ok, bathrooms are very small. Cable services were not working properly and had too many marathi channels for an out of town traveler , and no channel guide was provided. The best thing was the staff, very courteous and woke me up for an early flight and the vehicle was waiting to whisk me to the airport. Overall , if one has to spend <2500 rs , not a bad choice as proximity to the airport and the corresponding rates are good.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: bwera
Detailed Review: This hotel has a good location, but that's all! The room was  not clean, and no window (I know it's usual in India, but not for that price!!!!). The breakfast was poor, the staff was friendly, but nothing else! Do not go there!!

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: girish s
Review: What you see is what you get ! (--)
Detailed Review: I stayed here for a week. And the experience was really good. The hotel staff is cordial, the restaurant serves decent quality food, rooms are exactly the way you see on the hotel website. (--) It is located right in the heart of Mumbai. Marine drive is at walk-able distance, CST is about 1km from the hotel.  The rooms are small as compared to some other hotels. But they are very clean and well furnished.  I stayed in a deluxe room ... it  just enough for two people but three is a crowd. The standard rooms are slightly smaller and do not have windows. To sum up, space is trade off for well furnished and clean rooms

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: bottletrader1
Detailed Review: This was one of the worst hotels I have stayed at in India. The photos shown are 50 years old, and man they have not cleaned or painted since! I changed my travel plans after I walked into to front door. They agreed to refund my advance minus the one night I stayed and a one night cancellation fee. Well, I did get a refund, but they ripped me off by another $100 dollars and everytime I call I am told the person who can fix this just left for the day. Stay in the streets of Bombay, it will be safer and cleaner than this hotel.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: SJainBhopal
Detailed Review: During my business trip to Mumbai, I used to stay over there. Tarrifwise it is budget hotel with caring staff.  Location wise it is not so good, but Room Service and Cleaniess was very good. Due to caring staff, we enjoyed pleasant stay over there.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: rohanp
Detailed Review: I have never experienced such attentive and over the top service or treatment. We knew from the meticulously dressed and mannered doorman to the courteous and efficient front desk staff that we would have an experience like no other.

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Atul_Yadav
Detailed Review: Red Rose is convinently located at walking distance from Dadar railway station. Close to public transport. room are average. Parking is on roadside. No internet connection. Food is average quality and too oily. Service is fast.

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: devesh
Review: A decent place for business traveller
Detailed Review: It was a two day stay, the room was ok with normal size might be 100 sq feet. The food was of but very heavy and oily but tasty. A normal hotel for stay for low cost business travel to mumbai. The location was good for my purpose, unable to comment for public at large as i am not very much familiar with mumbai. The reception is small but fast. The room service is good and fast. The AC are new in the hotel.

Source.Name: Bawa_Regency-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Ousie53
Detailed Review: BE WARNED! This the dump you need to keep away from. It is nothing like what they represent on the WEB. These guys should be charged for false advertising. The place is filthy and infested with cockroaches. Even the sign in register is eaten and shredded. We got the hell out of there. Ozzie

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Suhanyaa
Detailed Review: I found the hotel to have a good location, guest rooms were excellent with the bathrooms well appointed, always so important in a hotel! breakfast buffet had very nice things to eat. business centre and services were friendly and efficient. Staff were friendly and were able to arrange for any requests made with regard to the city.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: charoon
Review: Good value hotel with great location
Detailed Review: We booked this hotel on the strength of the only review on here as al of the others that we tried were fully booked (and we tried loads!). We had a deluxe room which was absolutely fine, clean and spacious although we did have to change rooms as the hot water wasn't working in the original one. A lot of the staff didn't speak much English so this was a bit tricky at first but we soon got moved. Breakfast was included but imited to tea, coffee, toast and omelette. If you wanted more than 1 coffee then you were charged 20 rupees for it! The hotel is only 5 mins away by taxi from Leopolds and Gateway to India and 1 hour from the airport by taxi. I wasn't expecting much from this hotel but was pleasantly surprised.

Source.Name: Hotel_Fortune-Mumbai2.csv
Name: Debu G
Detailed Review: The most luxurious and best hotel in town. The trip was official but it seems a soothing environment. All i say the Best!!!

Source.Name: Le_Grande-Mumbai2.csv
Name: https://www.tripadvisor.in//ShowUserReviews-g304554-d1135593-r245469865-Hotel_Le_Grande-Mumbai_Maharashtra.html
Profile url: It was good in la grande .. it has got good fecilities n all what I want .. n good food n good room services .. good responce from reseptionest n good atmosphere... n good transport fecility .. like taxi comes in time in

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: AnnZurich
Review: Peaceful retreat in the big city
Detailed Review: After the long flight we were very happy to arrive at the Colonel's Retreat and be welcomed so generously.  It's a perfectly lovely hotel, calm and peaceful and friendly.  The rooms were spacious and comfortable and we loved the beautiful roof terrace where we ate breakfast and dinner.  Wonderful food, which we enjoyed so much that we also attended the cooking class offered -- and were even given a book of recipes to take home with us!  The service was excellent throughout our stay.  On our first full day there we set out on foot to explore the nearby bazaar, and of course managed to get lost trying to find our way back to the hotel.  After a few minutes of aimless wandering (kicking ourselves for not having memorized the address), we were delighted to see the hotel's doorman,‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Kate H
Detailed Review: Approx a 30 min drive from the airport (depending on the chaos that is Delhi traffic), we arrived to a very friendly welcome and a lovely cup of tea with banana bread. The room was very comfortable and clean. The main selling point of this guesthouse though is their food. We would say that we had some of the best food of our holiday here. It was all freshly prepared, plentiful and extremely tasty.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: ValsNed
Detailed Review: Very nice hotel with adequate rooms. The real bonus was the quality and price of the the food on offer. We all found it very tasty and hard to beat especially for the money. Due to the time of year the roof top terrace was very cold which was unfortunate.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: LassiComeHome
Detailed Review: Stayed for 2 nights and loved it - I will stay here again for sure. It is excellent value and in an excellent location - nice and quiet and easy walk to some great cafes & restaurants in the Defence Colony Market.  Arun was super helpful. Great rooftop for breakfast, high tea or drinks and dinner. Wifi excellent. Rooms spacious and comfortable. Great place!

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: pclb2015
Review: Peaceful hotel, lovely staff and food
Detailed Review: Stayed for just two nights at the end of our trip to India. The hotel is in a quiet area by Delhi standards and is clean and welcoming.   The food is great and sitting on the roof terrace for meals and afternoon tea is a delight, the staff could not be more helpful.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Baiju N
Detailed Review: Such a nice hotel with excellent staff and neat rooms. Easy access to fine restaurants nearby and walkable distance New Delhi railway station. Every penny is worth staying here. I will definitely recommend to my friends and business circle.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: lr0el
Review: HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. Great hotel, Fantastic professional management
Detailed Review: If you start your holiday in India in this hotel you'll be sure that your journey is going to be safe and smooth, because of the great care of Mr. Rachid. You will be in good hands with him. The service is outstanding!!!! The room was great and the shower was superb. Nice warm/hot water. The food in the restaurant is AAAMAZING one of the best Thali's we have had in India!! I highly highly highly recommend this hotel especially as your first start from Delhi.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Hazelwood09
Detailed Review: On the whole, the staff were very helpfull, especially in printing out our boarding passes at the end of our stay. The location is good with a super cake shop across the road where we had breakfast each day. There is a restarant in the hotel where we did eat  one evening, it was good and reasonably   priced. Easy to get taxis and tuc-tucs right outside the hotel. The room was OK, bed comfortable, a little noisy some nights, Housekeeper please note the toothbrush holder in room 204, desperately needs changing, then the bathroom would be OK. Note Tuc-tuc from Hotel to nearest underground station less than 100 rupees. The underground in Delhi was excellant and cheap. There are also some good shopping malls as well as the markets. The trip was a good experiance.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Victorianlad
Detailed Review: This reasonably priced colonial era hotel in the tourist district is an easy trip from New Delhi International Airport using the excellent Delhi Metro Orange Line to New Delhi railway station - why pay for a taxi as one gentleman was doing at the hotel reception - and has largely friendly, efficient staff, especially the 50s man who looked after the second floor.  I paid around Rs. 2200 a night, very good value.  I had no troubles on my second stay in checking in at 1050 hours after arriving by Indian Railways.  It took male Sunin a while to find my stored suitcase, and longer to find laundry I had left, as the gent who arranged this had a day off.  On my first stay, the Rs. 300 auto rickshaw fare was reimbursed by the hotel when the hotel's arranged complimentary driver failed‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Lehra
Detailed Review: Good hotel for shot stay and the staff was very co oprative and very profeshnal.Hotel room and bathroom was properly clean and the food was good.Good hotel for family .Highly recommend this hotel to all the tourist

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Lehra
Detailed Review: Good hotel for shot stay and the staff was very co oprative and very profeshnal.Hotel room and bathroom was properly clean and the food was good.Good hotel for family .Highly recommend this hotel to all the tourist

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Francis E
Detailed Review: Jugaad is a decent play to stay for your Delhi experience. It's outside of the hustle and bustle of the city center(10-15 min). However, I was let down because my experience did not match the reviews and photos. There seemed to be no social atmosphere at the place and it wasn't as nice as the photos portrayed. I personally cannot believe that Jugaad is in the top 3 in the Delhi hostel scene. I stayed in a private room for 4 nights and for the price I paid(was definitely expensive for Delhi), it just wasn't nice. Although the food is decent, it is quite expensive. I would not stay here again and would not recommend this place to anyone looking for a social atmosphere.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jane
Detailed Review: When I am back in Delhi - I will definitely be staying at Jugaad again. The staff are amazing. Available 24/7, friendly and incredibly helpful. They helped me book train tickets, sorted me out with an India SIM card in just 15 minutes, gave great advice about how to avoid potential scams and answered any questions I had about how to get to places. The hostel is cute with a pretty rooftop. I stayed in the twin private room which was clean and comfortable. The hostel walking tour was great - our guide even came back in the evening to take us to the local jazz bar. If you are a female travelling alone for the first time in Delhi and are arriving late at night, I highly recommend using the hostel‚Äôs pick up service. Firstly, you avoid the hassle of haggling at the airport. Secondly, the entrance to the hostel is in a poorly lit alley. It‚Äôs somewhat intimidating at first and I wouldn‚Äôt have found it easily on my own.‚Ä¶

However, I was let down because my experience did not match the reviews and photos. There seemed to be no social atmosphere at the place and it wasn't as nice as the photos portrayed. I personally cannot believe that Jugaad is in the top 3 in the Delhi hostel scene. I stayed in a private room for 4 nights and for the price I paid(was definitely expensive for Delhi), it just wasn't nice. Although the food is decent, it is quite expensive. I would not stay here again and would not recommend this place to anyone looking for a social atmosphere.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jane
Detailed Review: When I am back in Delhi - I will definitely be staying at Jugaad again. The staff are amazing. Available 24/7, friendly and incredibly helpful. They helped me book train tickets, sorted me out with an India SIM card in just 15 minutes, gave great advice about how to avoid potential scams and answered any questions I had about how to get to places. The hostel is cute with a pretty rooftop. I stayed in the twin private room which was clean and comfortable. The hostel walking tour was great - our guide even came back in the evening to take us to the local jazz bar. If you are a female travelling alone for the first time in Delhi and are arriving late at night, I highly recommend using the hostel‚Äôs pick up service. Firstly, you avoid the hassle of haggling at the airport. Secondly, the entrance to the hostel is in a poorly lit alley. It‚Äôs somewhat intimidating at first and I wouldn‚Äôt have found it easily on my own.‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: stanbaltazar
Detailed Review: We truly appreciate Harish for all his help during the first leg of our trip as we arrived in India. It was very easy to get in touch with him even prior to our arrival, and he was really helpful with our concerns as first-time travelers in India. First, our flight was set to arrive at midnight and he helped us arrange for an airport pickup service, which helped put us at ease right away. Second, we also had to extend for an additional night in Delhi, which he generously blocked off for us. Lastly, his staff were also all very friendly and were receptive to our needs. May it be getting a driver for a one-day tour of Delhi, exchanging foreign currency into rupees, etc., they were quick to respond to our requests. We're truly grateful for the warm service.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: miss_watson
Review: Good location, OK room, helpful staff
Detailed Review: Smyle Inn was our first stop in India. Got an Uber from the airport (approx 4000 rupees). Hotel staff here are helpful- sorted out a SIM for us etc. Good roof terrace. Small room and tiny bathroom but enough hot water.   The area is right in the middle of the main bazaar so plenty of choice for places to eat. Very close to main train station.   We stayed in Wing 1. I think wing 2 might be more modern, but for the price we were happy with our stay.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: stanbaltazar
Detailed Review: We truly appreciate Harish for all his help during the first leg of our trip as we arrived in India. Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jenny5555
Review: Great base for a trip to Delhi
Detailed Review: This was our first night in India and it ticked all the boxes.  The owners are delightful and very friendly the rooms clean and comfortable.  The food is very good and the banana bread does live up to its reputation.   It feels more like a homestay than a hotel but that's a good thing.  The rooftop restaurant/terrace is lovely although as we stayed in November, a little chilly at night so take a jumper!  Very good location for exploring New and Old Delhi.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Kay N
Detailed Review: Having been met at Delhi airport, we were driven first on main highways,then into a quiet residential area where Colonel‚Äôs Retreat is hidden! We were given a warm welcome and taken to reception then the roof top for coffee and cake - ‚Äòhomely‚Äô from home!  Our room was soon available; comfortable with en suite, fan and/or air con. We were given a map of the area with vague instruction as to where market areas were so we set off on foot to explore ! Felt safe, but quickly got used to ignoring (‚ÄúNo‚Äù not part of the local vocabulary !!) all offers of rides in Tuc-Tucson / Rickshaws . Lovely quiet park near the Retreat. Back for complementary tea and cake on the terrace, and a chance to chat with other guests. Chose to eat in that evening, so pre-ordered a couple of dishes.  Dinner‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Maria L
Review: A hidden gem in the heart of Delhi
Detailed Review: My husband and I started our trip to India visiting Delhi and we had the fortune of spending two nights at this marvelous guesthouse. What Sumant and his husband Arun Khanna have build here is a reflection of their characters: love, friendliness, warmth.... you can see how much they care about their guests just because of the little details like the afternoon tea that is served at the confortable rooftop, the selection of books and newspapers available and their AMAZING (in my husband's words) homemade banana bread. The staff is warm and friendly and the food they serve for dinner is top notch. Sumant made us feel like we were "home away home". Given my food allergies she went "above & beyond" to make me feel safe and to ensure that despite of it I could have an amazing culinary‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: polly2d
Detailed Review: We love Colonel's Retreat.  We appreciate the friendly, helpful staff, the warm family welcome, the comfortable and spotlessly clean rooms, the wonderfully prepared and tasty home-cooked food, the location and the peace and calm provided after a day outside.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: 849AB11
Detailed Review: We decided to stay at Colonel‚Äôs Retreat for our first night in India as we wanted to stay in a smaller hotel with a more personal approach. It did not disappoint. Spotlessly clean rooms, plenty of seating areas to relax, delicious banana cake on arrival and a warm welcome. We ate dinner on the roof top terrace and chatted to our lovely hosts. A beer and home cooked food certainly went down well..delicious. A great place to stay in Delhi, good location for sightseeing and easy to reach from the airport. Couldn‚Äôt recommend more.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Florian254
Review: A quite place with some points
Detailed Review: The location is in a mostly residential area, a short walk from a small park, but all attractions need a longer transfer.  Rooms: Nothing to really write home about, all nice and clean but nothing too big and if you have one on the lower floor (especially the one directly to the main entrance) a lot of commotion might prevent an early slepp or a long sleepout. The bath gets enough hot water. Food. The breakfast is nothing too special but a nice starter for the day the evening meal is a very good, rich and welltasting affair. One minus is that the jets to Delhi fly directly above the hotel, as they are landing they are not too noisy but still (and with directly, yes, directly).  For one/two nights in Delhi to come in or leave fully ok, for a longer stay I¬¥d look for alternatives.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Elsie  J
Detailed Review: I have stayed at the Colonel's on a previous trip to India and I came back.  It is a good place to stay in Delhi, in the Armed services area, a quiet and unhastled place.  The Colonels is comfortable and homeley without being obtrusive, the staff are happy and efficient and the management approachable and willing to stop and talk.  A great place to stay.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Travelling Warbies
Detailed Review: We stayed two nights at the Colonels Retreat for our first stop off in India, and we were very pleased. The staff made us very welcome, the rooms were comfortable, the service quiet and unassuming, and the food was delicious. The rooftop restaurant was nice to sit at the end of the day enjoying a beer and having a home cooked meal. The owners made sure to greet all of their guests and took time to explain the different food on offer. Breakfast was excellent, and the complimentary tea and cake, not to mention the banana bread, was a nice touch to come back to after a full day exploring Delhi. It was amazingly quiet at night and the bed very comfy so a good nights sleep indeed.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Raj S
Review: Average hotel in a good location
Detailed Review: I booked a suite for my family but got a room which was very ordinary. The room was old and poorly maintained. The water pressure of the faucet in the washroom was so high it would wet your clothes every time. No space to keep your luggage if you are carrying more than 1 luggage. But for the price I should have been prepared.  The washroom was old and looked very untidy. Breakfast had very limited items & mostly pure Indian breakfast. Early morning you would not like to start with fatty puri bhaji, dal sambaar.  Reception was good and did not take time for check-in. I saw few rooms better than mine, hence, if you plan to book this hotel, ask for newer rooms at the time of check in.  Big up is the location. Just near to the railway station and walking distance to the main road,‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ankit Panwar
Detailed Review: Had a nice stay with my family...though Water bottles are not complimentary even if we stay in suite (that should taken care of) but apart from this...It‚Äôs in proper city so it‚Äôs easy to explore the city and plus metro station is close to the hotel so it‚Äôs convenient.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Safari traveller
Detailed Review: The Hotel Ajanta is a very suitable stay to explore New Delhi. The hotel is clean, very helpful and friendly staff for all things around stay and city tours. Rooms are comfortable, well equipped, with reliable and stable Internet connection (free) .Good restaurant, especially for non veg food.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Rowan
Detailed Review: The hotel does exactly what it says in the tin! Honestly for the price it is excellent value. Spacious room, bright and clean. We had a fourth floor room with balcony. It even had beautiful Frangipani trees in pots! The staff are super friendly especially the manager, she was always so cheerful and attentive. Breakfast was OK, not my favourite breakfast ever but again value for the price of the room. I have read other reviews saying how disappointed they were, and I can understand if someone had never been to Delhi before finding the Hotel Ajanta disappointing, it‚Äôs a busy street with the hustle and bustle beyond its doors. But again... this is part of the charm of Delhi!! If you want 5* there are plenty of hotels offering this. At 5* prices!! It‚Äôs not the perfect hotel but I‚Äôd‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Berber B
Detailed Review: I stayed for 10 days in Delhi in hotel Ajanta. I surely can give good recommendations about this hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms very clean and cosy. Especially the ones with balcony. The breakfast was great, try the Indian breakfast as well. The area is in Old Delhi and you‚Äôre at the middle of all. It was my first time in India and it‚Äôs overwhelming to all your senses but I loved it. Surely coming back to this hotel. I wanna thank Avanish by whom I booked my stay very easily by WhatsApp from contact the website of hotel.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Scott B
Review: Great value in the heart of Delhi
Detailed Review: Staff are very friendly, rooms are clean and tidy, breakfast is a nice small buffet cafe does one of the best coffees in the area. The hotel organised our airport transfers and everything was really easy

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: CleopatraLuxor
Review: Not great start to hotel (SCAMMED) but fantastic stay!
Detailed Review: Communication at outset of booking was great. I had changed my credit card prior to arriving and had forgotten to update the hotel. I sent an email to advise and was informed it was not a problem and the booking would not be cancelled (what a relief). The hotel had kindly arranged a car to collect us from Delhi airport but after waiting for an hour (in the arrivals lounge as advised) nobody was there. We decided to locate a taxi and proceed to the hotel. What followed was very upsetting.  We asked a man with government id where we could get a taxi to our hotel. He seemed legitimate (so we thought). There were many of these black suzuki cars (green stripe down the side) at the airport so along with the government id we thought all would be ok. There was a driver and his‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ankur Sharma
Review: Great hotel, location, breakfast ans service
Detailed Review: Excellent staff, very attentive to your requests.  Great buffet breakfast with many options.  Superior rooms are excellent and we'll equipped with amenities. They also come with a complementary pickup/drop from/to the airport (on request). Overall a great experience.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: pourianaghipour
Review: A budget hotel in New Dellhi
Detailed Review: First of all, I need to mention that Ms. Avinash Kumar was very helpful lady and she answered to my each and every different questions patiently. About the hotel, the important part is that it's looks nothing like photos and pictures. Initially, you might get confused when you enter to the room about what you saw on web pages and what you see in real condition. Nevertheless, I recommend this hotel to individual traveler who are not  looking for a very special accommodation and their level of expectations are limit.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: LI YU QING
Detailed Review: The hotel location is just perfect. It's situated very close to centre of Delhi Connaught place, near Metro Station, rail station etc. Rooms a well air-conditioned and gives a warm feel. Restaurant is 24 hours plus hotel has a coffee shop. It was pleasure staying here. Zahoor helped me translate one his phone and asking if I needed anything as I don‚Äôt speak English. It was wonderful no unpleasant surprises or problems

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Pascal S
Detailed Review: Rooms are very clean . The staff are very helpful and they can provide you a lot of services. Just ask and you will be satisfied .The hotel is a few minuts from the New Delhi railway station it's convenient. I came two years in a row...i felt at home. Thank you for every thing ! See you again.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: H·ªì Ph∆∞∆°ng Mai
Detailed Review: Everytime our group stay here, all staff support a lot of thing. Thank you very much for your great services. Highly recommended Amax Inn Hotel for clean, nice accomodations (very near New Delhi Railway Staion)

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Pankaj
Detailed Review: The rooms are very nice.I like the furniture and the interior.The linen was nice and the servicw from  houskeeping was also great and prompt.Full privacy was maintained.Reception was also great in guest handling

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Nickbramble
Detailed Review: We stayed just one night but it is a great place to stay near the railway station. Anil and his staff are really nice and helpful with train tickets and changing money at a good rate. The rooms are clean and quiet and safe and a bargain at the price

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Shamshad
Detailed Review: I use Amax Inn from many years while my visit to Dehli.The Rooms are perfect which are very clean and bathrooms are super clean as as lasts on my visit.  The staff is helpful.Mr. Anil is always available for your help for all your local needs. The reception us welcome. The food is yummy and ecnomical.  Definitely Recommend Amax Inn.  Coming back soon.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Shamshad
Detailed Review: I use Amax Inn from many years while my visit to Dehli.The Rooms are perfect which are very clean and bathrooms are super clean as as lasts on my visit.  The staff is helpful.Mr. Anil is always available for your help for all your local needs. The reception us welcome. The food is yummy and ecnomical.  Definitely Recommend Amax Inn.  Coming back soon.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Casper799
Detailed Review: In Jugaat-hostel you've found the perfect combination of a vibrant place with a good atmosphere, clean rooms and a nice rooftop terrace in a relatively quiet part of Delhi (that is to say: there are plenty of restaurants, streetfood and cafe's, but you can easily access one of the parks nearby). However, the best part of Jugaat is it's staff. Salman (and his brother) are some of the friendliest and knowledgeable people that we've met in India. If you have the time, make sure to sit down with them and get to know them! ;-) Definitely recommended.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Manna
Review: Great place to stay for lots of reasons!
Detailed Review: I initially chose Juggard as it was close to the Indian embassy FCRO as l had lost my passport and needed to get an exit visa to leave India. It was actually only 8 mins walk away. However do remember to ask the staff to give you your C form before you head to the FRCO. They don‚Äôt automatically give you one. This will save you from wasting time coming back for it . I ended up staying in Juggard for nearly a week whilst waiting for my visa and l really enjoyed it.  I really got a feel of the area. Felt safe even as a single female there. It was non touristy, people didn't try to rip u off in the market outside. Although rickshaw drivers might! In the market they just genuinely wanted to say hello and have a chat with you without pressure to buy. It was close to the metro which‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: AlistairOB
Detailed Review: These guys sure know how to run a hostel! From the moment they picked us up from the airport, to the moment they dropped us off, felt nothing but warmness! Helpful in how to get around, and what to see. Definately the type of place you want to stay- especially if you're new to India !!

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Casper799
Detailed Review: In Jugaat-hostel you've found the perfect combination of a vibrant place with a good atmosphere, clean rooms and a nice rooftop terrace in a relatively quiet part of Delhi (that is to say: there are plenty of restaurants, streetfood and cafe's, but you can easily access one of the parks nearby). However, the best part of Jugaat is it's staff. Salman (and his brother) are some of the friendliest and knowledgeable people that we've met in India. If you have the time, make sure to sit down with them and get to know them! ;-) Definitely recommended.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jessica F
Detailed Review: We arrived very late in the night and they waited us so this is good. We spend 2 nights in this hostel in main bazar (very Crazy and funny place) it was okay for the indian standard and the price .. very close to train station (3 min)!

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: @mikybover
Detailed Review: It is on the very city center Main Bazaar, staff helped us when we had problems with a driver we contracted from outside helping us with their phone to make some calls. The terrace is very nice to relax a bit after a day out in Delhi.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Martin Wave
Detailed Review: Medium hotel quality for Paharganj, very nice and helpful personel, sells train tickets as well as tourist sim cards. But terrible kitchen. AC not working, but thats normal in India. Pretty noisy and filthy hotel surroundings.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jessica F
Review: Good location, OK room, helpful staff
Detailed Review: We arrived very late in the night and they waited us so this is good. We spend 2 nights in this hostel in main bazar (very Crazy and funny place) it was okay for the indian standard and the price .. very close to train station (3 min)!

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Mavis57
Detailed Review: Hidden away amongst tree-lined streets and mansions, all with security guards, is this gem of a hotel. Just 16 rooms, carefully presented, lovingly serviced, it is a real home away from home.  The home cooked food is mouth watering and the amazing breakfasts really set you up for the day. Meals are served on the roof top terrace and it is easy to fall into conversation with fellow guests. A most agreeable place with delightful staff and friendly helpful owners.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Paul P
Detailed Review: Firstly the location is not good, in terms of access to restaurants and other points of interest. Secondly, whilst the room was fine in terms of size, the door frames, a/c unit controller and bathroom generally were simply not clean. there was nowhere in the bathroom to place a washbag, shaving kit etc. Hospitality was good and food was ok, but being faced with 3 unsealed jam jars, one of which was half empty, at breakfast was very disappointing.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Caravanjane
Review: Hopefully won't be the first visit
Detailed Review: A lovely place to visit a little oasis, staff so friendly, food was delicious and homemade, so homely and spotlessly clean, thank you for letting us share your home! Hopefully return again some day it was our first trip to India

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Bewray
Review: A historical retreat in need of updating.
Detailed Review: We read glowing reviews of this established, suburban hotel, but regrettably it did not really live up to them. On the positive side, we were welcomed cordially by the owners, and service was quiet, but willing and efficient. The hotel has a number of floors and there are a some interestingly furnished and decorated sitting rooms, seemingly on each stage.  We ate in the simple, open-air restaurant on the roof and the food was unexceptional but good quality.   Nevertheless, we believe that our bedroom was below par. It was small and in need of some basic upkeep. The shower leaked onto the bathroom floor as did the drain hole in the bathroom floor when the basin was emptied, and we could not get one of the electric sockets to work. The paintwork around the door handles was brown‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Julie G
Review: Unique hotel hidden away in a unique city
Detailed Review: This family run hotel is situated in a quiet, residential area and is small, quirky and comfortable.  The rooftop restaurant was amazing and  the food was varied, beautifully cooked and presented.  This was the first hotel visited on our tour in India, and the staff were all friendly, efficient and professional.  Hygiene is very well adhered too and we were amazed that we could order alcohol at dinner, which we weren't expecting, but it was lovely to have a beer or glass of wine with our meals.  Every single one of the staff were lovely - welcoming, friendly and happy to help in any way they could. The bedrooms weren't huge, but were comfortable, and the communal sitting rooms on each floor gave added space if you want to sit and read or chat.  Definitely would recommend this‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Globetrotter
Review: v poor value for money. Super slow service but genuinely nice staff.
Detailed Review: v poor value for money, definitely not for business travellers. Basics are not provided. safe drinking water, No refridgerator in rooms despite claiming it is there! even a basic health faucet in bathrooms missing! No tepephones in rooms. After charging 4K + taxes, one pays additionally for terrible quality breakfasts  Your cell phones dont work - all networks are jammed in the area. Very slow and poor wifi service...  There is not even a decent desk in the room to sit and work on.  This property  is a huge let down.  It has one good thing going - the rooms are super clean, the staff and really nice, but slow and incompetent.  Dont go by reviews of great food - it is absolutely pathetic. the Dinner is inedible. the breakfast is barely edible. Its a great hotel if you are ageing‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: scoodyscoobydoo
Detailed Review: The Colonel‚Äôs retreat was an oasis in a city going mad with Diwali. The rooms are clean and elegant and the service very friendly and attentive. The food was universally excellent whilst the hospitality made it feel almost like a home stay. The owners were  charming and made everyone feel welcome and valued. Can‚Äôt recommend too highly Pretty convenient for the excellent metro too.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sarah H
Detailed Review: We thoroughly enjoyed our 2 night stay here at the beginning of our tour. The room was comfortable, breakfast was amazing. Best breakfast we've had on whole Rajasthan tour. Nice to have the pretty rooftop terrace too to relax with a cold beer. Great location in a big city. Thanks

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: SuperKa
Detailed Review: The Colonel‚Äôs Retreat truly lives up to its retreat name, a quiet & peaceful sanctuary to rest after spending the day touring chaotic & crazy Delhi.  It was the perfect hotel to start our Indian honeymoon adventure. We arrived early in the morning & received a warm welcome & a lovely breakfast on the rooftop which we weren‚Äôt expecting. Our room was huge with a comfy bed & pillows and the bathroom was big too. We enjoyed a couple of evening meals at the rooftop restaurant, food was delicious on both occasions and plentiful. The complimentary high tea was much appreciated too, a chance to de-stress after a day sightseeing.  Nothing was too much trouble and all the staff were really helpful & friendly, we felt very well looked after.  I liked the fact they refilled glass water‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: kev_russ
Detailed Review: We spent 2 nights here and we enjoyed our stay in the quiet neighbourhood of South Delhi. The room we had was pretty big & each floor has it's own communal space. The breakfasts were excellent aswel as the homemade banana bread. We had dinner on the rooftop and the food was good but pretty expensive for Indian standards.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: murugan p
Review: A nice decent family hotel to stay. Courteous staff and everything in walkable distance
Detailed Review: I visited this place in October 2019 for our family vacation, initially surprised at the location it was located and later realised it was one of the best. With courteous staff, well decorated rooms, a metro which connects to all stations in Delhi, handful of good restuarants around Hotel Ajanta will definitely be a place to go next time I visit Delhi.  Unfortunately couldn't click pics in the room, as the room was always a heaven for us for the five days we stayed, welcoming tiresome 4 people and giving a peaceful sleep.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Vising S
Detailed Review: Hotel was very clean ,friendly staff especially Ms Gunjan which was very helpful Breakfast buffet was awesome with many varieties (especially non spicy) I highly recommend this hotel ,which is near connaught,akshardham, karolbagh

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Karen p
Detailed Review: This hotel looks nothing like the photos and has been massively doctored..its basically down a busy..dirty congested street and is run down and very shabby. The photo makes it looked like its in a quiet area but it's in a very built up area ..there is no gap next to it..certainly no trees visable ..for miles... no roof top restaurant. You only get wifi for 30 minutes ... and the food isn't great either...

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: anusmita
Review: Best place to stay in New Delhi.
Detailed Review: A nice stay for their hospitality, co operation and behaviour..I stayed there three times and each time they cared the best for my family.I specially express my thank to Milan Panda who is so helpful in arranging all kinds of necessity.I recommend hotel  highly.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sayantani
Detailed Review: Room, food & reception services is good.  Locations & room service also good. From New Delhi station only 700 mtr to the hotel. Auto rickshaw driver didn't not want to go there when we first reach Delhi. They told me the hotel is not good for family but it was totally wrong. We take Uber from there and reached hotel. That's why plz don't trust them. The hotel was nice. Be careful From this type of driver. We have to come again to Amax for there behaviour.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sudippal
Detailed Review: We are Very happy with the service of this hotel.The Room was nice.The wash room was also clean.They have a rooftop where u can spend Ur time.Normally launch and dinner we taken there.Food also good in reasonable price.One thing don't compare this hotel with outside area.The staff was polite.We stay not long there but it was nice experience.Thanks to all of them.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Joydip S
Detailed Review: Room was nice and bathroom was nice.But sonetime the toilet flash was not working.The path near hotel remains very dirty.The concerened person should look into the above matter. Otherwise everything was nice.My family feel safe when stay there. We want to come again .

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: N. I
Review: Best place to stay with Family
Detailed Review: I was traveling with my family and I stayed there for three nights.Room was clean as I seen there website.Room and bathroom was clean and everything working properly.The hotel staff was polite to us.We like this place very much.It was a nice stay with Amax.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: anusmita
Review: Best place to stay in New Delhi.
Detailed Review: A nice stay for their hospitality, co operation and behaviour..I stayed there three times and each time they cared the best for my family.I specially express my thank to Milan Panda who is so helpful in arranging all kinds of necessity.I recommend hotel  highly.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: angad singh
Review: well managed. comfortable. value for money.
Detailed Review: this is the second time i have stayed at jugaad hostel. it's really well managed. i especially like their quick responses and late check in feature. apart from that, the stay is comfortable and the place has got a generally good vibe. overall, great value for money.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Noah b
Detailed Review: it's on the top floor with a rooftop, super clean hostel with attentive staff, very helpful. The rooms are spacious and clean. nearby metro station and airport. Delicious in-house kitchen food served for dinner. Excellent WiFi.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Meg W
Detailed Review: Jugaad was just the most brilliant start to my India trip. I hadn‚Äôt been before and so was a bit nervous of being overwhelmed by Delhi. But on arriving here Salman made sure everything was smooth and relaxed. He sorted a SIM card and a train ticket for my plans to go to Jaipur - even fixed my adapter all with total grace and generosity.   The hostel itself is a peace of calm in Delhi. Clean and functional rooms - terrace is gorgeous. I‚Äôm already planning staying again before my return flight.  Thanks Salman and team.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: D√©sir√© R
Detailed Review: The staff here were really helpful with all of our needs and concerns! The airport pickup was key! This place is located smack dab in the middle of the main bazaar of the Paharganj district which makes a sojourn here a very unique and intense experience. Buckle your seatbelts folks!

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: D√©sir√© R

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Gemdazo
Detailed Review: Ok room with very comfortable bed.¬† We were on the same floor as the lounge and kitchen so was a little noisy.¬† Fridge hadn't been cleaned out and there was a packet crisps left in a drawer. We were brought coffee and banana bread on arrival, unfortunately the milk was off but the banana bread which is home made daily was delicious.¬† We asked for our kettle to be exchanged as my husband got an electric shock from it - there were bare wires - this was changed very quickly.   We stayed 2 nights and ate at the hotel both nights - we had 4 different curries between us and all were delicious, not too hot and with every accompaniment you could think of.¬† A little on the dear side but good food.¬† Breakfast was also nice with eggs cooked to order however you liked them - would recommend‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: lizzybee99
Detailed Review: I was booked to stay in the Ajanta.  Months before I was due to leave for India, I read a review on trip advisor saying a lot of building work was being undertaken at the Ajanta.  I started sending emails to them asking when the work would be completed. At first they said 2 weeks. After 3 weeks I sent  an email to ask were the works been completed.  One more week ,so after two weeks I sent an email to ask were the works completed . Yes great news . Sent a final email before I left to ask were the works completed . Guess what they were still in full swing when we arrived. They gave me a dinghy room with water from the aircon dripping on the TV. The smell of paint and thiners was overwhelming and the noise was terrible.  I checked out immediately and  told them they had lied to me‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Shrik
Detailed Review: Enjoyed my stay at the hotel, all the staff were welcoming and extremely helpful. Also making arrangements for tours Delhi, Agra and Jaipur were made so quickly andeasily by Rashid at the travel desk.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: GyanTheTraveller
Detailed Review: Staying at Hotel Ajanta was the worst decision of my entire Delhi trip. It was a total nightmare staying at this hotel. To begin with, we reached hotel at around 11am and though the rooms were vacant the reception person (extremely rude and arrogant) denied for early check in on request and insisted us to pay Rs.826/- for early check in. I had no other option but to pay, which I did but despite of that I was given my room only after another 25 mins. On entering that room I was totally heartbroken as the images shown in the website or rooms were absolutely misleading. Room was extremely small. There was not even a dustbin placed at washroom, there was no bathroom mat, hotel reception said they don‚Äôt have dental kits even when I said I‚Äôll pay for it. They charged me another Rs.50‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Steevi M
Detailed Review: We stayed for 2 nights. We booked this hotel based on the good reviews shown here. Rooms are not that great and the service by the staff is below average. It is like those shady hotels of the city. Based on our experience my observation are as below.  Pros 1. Nearby to New Delhi Railway Station 2. OK for those travelers who want to use it as transit stay. 3. Price wise economical  Cons 1. Cleanliness and  hygiene standards are below average. 2. Situated around busy and crowded market. 3. Ambiance is poor. 4. Food is bad. 5. Rooms are small. We stayed in Double Air Conditioned Luxury Room 6. Quality of towels & bed sheets are poor. 7. Toilet and bathroom were not very clean

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Maya
Review: Worst hotel I've ever been in
Detailed Review: The hotel is located in an unpleasant alley of a crowded street. The lobby is dark and narrow. We recieved our room on 4th floor which was much smaller than in the photos. The sheets were dirty and the AC was from the 60s. The worst part was the bathroom - small, unclean, and there were visible electric wires on the wall of the shower!  Very disappointed from everything and would not recommend it at all, especially for a first time in Delhi, which can be quite overwhelming for itself.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Steevi M
Detailed Review: We stayed for 2 nights. We booked this hotel based on the good reviews shown here. Rooms are not that great and the service by the staff is below average. It is like those shady hotels of the city. Based on our experience my observation are as below.  Pros 1. Nearby to New Delhi Railway Station 2. OK for those travelers who want to use it as transit stay. 3. Price wise economical  Cons 1. Cleanliness and  hygiene standards are below average. 2. Situated around busy and crowded market. 3. Ambiance is poor. 4. Food is bad. 5. Rooms are small. We stayed in Double Air Conditioned Luxury Room 6. Quality of towels & bed sheets are poor. 7. Toilet and bathroom were not very clean

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Marie-C√©line
Review: Close to airport, nice rooftop and super nice staff
Detailed Review: I only stayed one night there in between 2 flights but it was a really nice stay. The staff is super friendly and helpful, the location is super practical for the airport and the rooftop is a nice chill place. The rooms are a bit older than on the pics but it‚Äôs ok, I recommend the women dorm because we have AC and 2 bathrooms for only 6 women. The building is secured, the area is a bit rough but many shops so lively until late.  I recommend it.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jabob
Detailed Review: One of the cleanest dorms/dorm washrooms and common areas I have come across in recent times. Delicious in-house kitchen food served for dinner. Pro active staff. Excellent WiFi. Its the second time I reserved the facility within a short period. Hospitality at best! Its the best choice for solo travelers looking for a pocket friendly stay including all the facilities

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Reilly H
Detailed Review: Great place, very comfy with ac in the dorms. It is not very close to old Delhi and the tourist attractions, but is located in a very nice quite neighborhood. So it is ideal for those who would like to retreat from the hustle and bustle of the big city.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Uri A
Detailed Review: Great staff-very friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and comfortable and the chill out area as well as the terrace are nice places to rest.  Very good location in a magic neighborhood! Far enough from the big Delhi mess.  Thank you very much Salman for the great stay!

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Felix
Review: Helped us after we got scammed
Detailed Review: First at all, we didn't made it to the hostel, so we can just write about the manager Harish. Our problems began, when we arrived at the airport and weren't able to connect with the WiFi (later we got told that only with an Indian SIM card we could receive the SMS for the password of the airport WiFi). So we took the Metro to the station one kilometer from the hostel and decided to walk from there. Making our long story short, we fell for a scam on that way and ended up paying a lot of money for something we did not want. Since we thought we had no other option we still did so. When we didn't arrive at his hostel Harish mailed us, asking where we ended up. After we told him, he helped us to get our money back. On the way he showed us some really nice places that are not so‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Pistog
Detailed Review: Nice and cool place. Room are confortable, refreshing and peaceful. Also, breakfast will be a good starter for a heaty day in Delhi. Thanks to the nice and welcoming staffs !  The place is near by the metro, it will help you a lot.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Felix

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Marnie G
Detailed Review: We stayed at Colonel's retreat on a medical retreat from Afghanistan, and the visit was just wonderful.  Cozy, attentive staff, great rooms, excellent food...a home away from home and definitely will be back on our next trip.  Thank you to all. A badly needed respite.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: andrew w
Detailed Review: People will either really like this place or not and I didn't.   WiFi is terrible in the house and Airtel mobile coverage is next to useless.   Booked for two nights but towels not changes. They are wonderful towels but I really want clean ones.   Because of flights I was checking out early so went to pay the morning before. This is a complaint about the B&B but also a comment on people in general. If I am stood there as an absolute guaranteed customer with a bank card in my hand wanting to give you money then why the hell are you ignoring me and answering the phone? Why do people do this. It is so rude.   A short tour of the house would have been good as I had no idea what room was what.   Thought only replacing one water bottle was mean, should have hidden half drunk on in‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Fatikhatul Muizzah
Detailed Review: I was expecting this hotel same as on the picture, but again i am a bit disappointed with it. For the restaurant isn‚Äôt proper during breakfast, but for the food ok lah. For the room are clean, but the staff have to check if they wanted to put amenities (snack) do they check for the expired? Because I almost eat lays expired. The guy who handle my tour was nice, also my driver dilip dhada thanks for both of them.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Advice India Tour
Review: Very Bed Hotel & Service By Staff
Detailed Review: Its Really Feel Very Bed There Staying at 4 Night But Room Is not So Good But Price is very Expensive one Staff Is Really Not Good if Any Help Need not any help by staff room is not good staff also fight with tourist please not stay this hotel

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Nick W
Detailed Review: This really is a mixed bag of a place.  Pros: Free collection from the airport Decent breakfast Good travel agent in the hotel who set us up with a great driver to go to the rest of the Golden Triangle  Cons: Construction work ongoing in the hotel; they were literally building new rooms in dead space in the corridors - massive amounts of noise, wet cement and dust everywhere. My friend had to move room as they were building a new room outside his door. I came back to find three men in my room. Guy didn‚Äôt speak enough English so called the manager who told me he was repairing my AC, despite my not having reported it broken and it working fine. Second excuse offered was that the three were cleaning my room (despite having no cleaning equipment with them). Very dodgy. Poor WiFi. ‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: mukul91086
Detailed Review: I stayed at hotel Ajanta for a night and it was the best in The city.  Close to railway station along with connaugut place markets.  I had a great stay in the hotel  Hotel staff was so cooperative and the food taste was great.   Hotel also has its bakery which has great taste.   I recommend to everyone.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Nicolas_rdvc
Detailed Review: The rooms of the hotel are big and comfortable. The food is very good and the staf is vert nice and helpful and they speak english vert well. The price is tye best of Delhi. I recommend this hotel for everybody !

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Nicolas_rdvc
Detailed Review: The rooms of the hotel are big and comfortable. The food is very good and the staf is vert nice and helpful and they speak english vert well. The price is tye best of Delhi. I recommend this hotel for everybody !

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Tam B
Detailed Review: Clean bed, clean bathroom. Very useful to have a safe in the room. Small breakfast. Nice loft area and cheerfully decorated corridors. Staff is respectful, friendly and helpful to arrange tours or give general information. Location is a bit dodgy, specially if this will be your first stay in Delhi or India, since the entrance to the alley where this hotel is situated begins with a public urinary. other than that, it's ok.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Tam B
Detailed Review: Clean bed, clean bathroom. Very useful to have a safe in the room. Small breakfast. Nice loft area and cheerfully decorated corridors. Staff is respectful, friendly and helpful to arrange tours or give general information.
