Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: CintiaCastello C
Detailed Review: We enjoyed very much at Colonel's Retreat. Our room was really beatiful, big and clean. The food was amazing, the staff really kind and the rooms and decoration really cosy and comfortable. Don't forget to try the home made banana bread!

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: JEOchs
Detailed Review: This is our second stay at the Colonel's. We love the quiet location, breakfast service, comfortable rooms and attentive staff. The gate guard even recognized us from our previous visit -- 6 years ago! This has become our home away from home in Delhi.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Aneesh
Detailed Review: One of the best boutique hotel we have in Delhi, I recommend it to every traveler who is coming to Delhi if they want to see history about how was Delhi they should stay at Ajanta. It's not hotel it's an institution

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sharmila T
Detailed Review: Comfortable stay. Staff were helpful. Foods were very tasty. Enjoyed one night stay. Very close to station. The managers and all the staff are very professional. Serve us with a big smile. They would arrange everything for you. The room was neat and clean. Bed was big enough for two people.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Rebecca B
Detailed Review: Upon arrival, we were collected from the airport by a very friendly and enthusiastic person sent by the hotel. Despite not having a complete plan of our 3 week trip to India, we were offered a driver who would give us a tour of Rajasthan. This included all accommodation, travel and tours which lifted a massive weight off our shoulders. Our driver, Anil Kumar, was excellent. He was so helpful and helped us experience a truly authentic time in his country- we consider him a true friend!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Kishlay S
Detailed Review: The hotel is a world most beautiful. The hotel room is very big and very clean. The hotel cook making for the foods very delicious and tasty. The hotel staff is very respectfully. The hotel management is very nice.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sharmila T
Detailed Review: Comfortable stay. Staff were helpful. Foods were very tasty. Enjoyed one night stay. Very close to station. The managers and all the staff are very professional. Serve us with a big smile. They would arrange everything for you. The room was neat and clean. Bed was big enough for two people.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Rebecca B
Detailed Review: Upon arrival, we were collected from the airport by a very friendly and enthusiastic person sent by the hotel. Despite not having a complete plan of our 3 week trip to India, we were offered a driver who would give us a tour of Rajasthan. This included all accommodation, travel and tours which lifted a massive weight off our shoulders. Our driver, Anil Kumar, was excellent. He was so helpful and helped us experience a truly authentic time in his country- we consider him a true friend!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Kishlay S
Detailed Review: The hotel is a world most beautiful. The hotel room is very big and very clean. The hotel cook making for the foods very delicious and tasty. The hotel staff is very respectfully. The hotel management is very nice.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Shivi
Detailed Review: One of the cleanest hostel I have come across in recent times. Delicious in-house kitchen food served for dinner. Pro active staff. Excellent WiFi. Located close to Chankyapuri for any Visa, Passport or FRRO related work.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Rrrn
Detailed Review: If you are searching a nice and cheap accomodation in delhi and you are travelling solo this is the right place. You meet a lot of great people, and you can get a little taste of the Indian culture in delhi. The staff is very helpful, you can ask for any kind of help and the hostel has a great rooftop to chill!

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: ZenPower
Review: Made for cheapskates and staff is very backward.
Detailed Review: The bathrooms are tiny and showers are deliberately slow and water is very erratic. Breakfast is paid for approx 210 per day. Or eat outside, Mohammadpur village is a small place, not many options and overtly local, prepare to sit in tiny, dingy eating arrangements with no AC, too much salt and chilli, and surefire DellyBelly. Lounge area is small, old rusty guitar, way smaller space than other far better Hostels at the same price. Madpackers hostel is 100 times better in every way, similar rates, way more backpackers, which means excellant conversations; included breakfast, which is very well put together, also an electric piano and semi acoustic guitar and a large hall to hang out in. The bathrooms take the cake, really big and well styled, total value for money.  But the‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Joco
Detailed Review: Very friendly, helpful, honest staff. Working hot water and AC. Great location off of bustling bazaar with lots of shops, restaurants, atms, etc. Close to metro and intercity train. Nothing fancy but good value!

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: RKT
Detailed Review: The staff at Smyle Inn is probably the most forthcoming I have encountered so far, and I have been travelling quite a lot. They were helpful with every question and need we had. Even after we had big problems to arrive at their place after we got stuck in a traffic jam for half a day, and could not arrive in time for the first night we booked, the staff was friendly and helped us out with everything.  The rooms are a real bargain. The whole place is very clean, quite and therefore worth a stay.  Thank you very much for all the kindness.  Hopefully see you again

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Vasiliy
Detailed Review: Stayed in this hotel for almost a week on my return trip from the North of India to Russia. I have some experience in staying in different hotels in Delhi and in other cities of India as well. And i'd like to note that Smyle Inn for me is the Best hotel I Stayed in Delhi so far.  Marvellous rooms - very clean, lighty, airy and comfortable. Great terrace on the rooftop, where you can have your breakfast or sip a drink. And, of course, simply gorgeous personnel - very kind, smiley, polite, attentive and always ready to help!

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Helena B
Detailed Review: This hotel is situated near the main bazar but is so quit and peacefull. The rooms are big and clean and have some extra's like ac and a tv. The people were really friendly. You can get breakfast but the portions are rather small.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: RosaSM89
Detailed Review: The hotel is conviniently situated in paharganj, the backpacker's area, within a narrow and smelly street although all the area is similar. It is modern and basic, with simple facilities. When I did my booking through the email they promised me a 5% discount announced in their website and they didn't keep the promise. We were allowed to check in earlier. The standard room is small but ok, and you have to be on top of them to get the facilities offered activated such as the ac and hot water otherwise they won't do it. The mattress was too thin and hard. The breakfast is simple, too simple. The guys who work there are trying to sell you tours, flight tickets,etc even when you go to breakfast. Average was ok for backpackers.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Joco
Detailed Review: Very friendly, helpful, honest staff. Working hot water and AC. Great location off of bustling bazaar with lots of shops, restaurants, atms, etc. Close to metro and intercity train. Nothing fancy but good value!

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Chrissy M
Detailed Review: I stayed here for 6 nights and my stay was incredible. It was clean, the air conditioners worked very well, and the staff is so kind and helpful. I was sick one day and the staff made me a traditional meal to help with my stomach and checked on me as well. Would highly recommend this place to anyone traveling to Delhi!

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Renatha Flores
Detailed Review: I‚Äôve stayed in Delhi in several great places, but this has specially managed to balance convenience, great healthy food on breakfast, great staff, perfectly placed, reasonable price, and top quality facility. Great bed, towels... great selection of Indian photographies on the walls... compliments are all over the place on our stay here. Don‚Äôt hassle yourself as I did going to places with no elevator and people to help you 24/7, as I did so many times. Highly recommended Colonels Retreat!

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Samira C
Review: Lovely and safe place to stay
Detailed Review: Colonel‚Äôs Retreat is such a great place to stay in Delhi. Very well situated in a safe neighborhood, with everything you need at the Defense Colony market. The room is really clean and well decorated. Nice bed and calm place as well. The people and the Owner, Suman Ma‚Äôam is always ready to help the visitors what made our stay even more agreable. We will for sure stay here many times üòâ Samira

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jimbo L
Detailed Review: I have been coming to this hotel for a few years now and I love the rooms as they are very spacious and well equipped and clean especially the manager Aman and his crew was super helpful when we needed a fast getaway to airport for a good big taxi .. looking forward to seeing this place again for my next visit to Delhi

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Raj
Detailed Review: I am used to stay here for the last two years , whenever i am coming for official work in Newdelhi.  The Rooms are clean, hygienic and comfortable. The place easily excusable from Airport Metro / New Delhi  Railway Station and connaught place its walk able for 1.5 Kme. The staff is welcoming with smile. The best place for value for money. Coming again for the next visit.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Paradise08124727929
Detailed Review: Hotel was nice and clean. The Staff Was polite.The room I was stayed little smaller but clean.Air condition was Working properly but when electricity gone you have to turn on aircon again.Only that was the problem.They have multilingual staff.The hotel staff was very helpful. It was only 800 mtr from New Delhi Railway station.I will come again.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Rishab S
Detailed Review: Hotel staffs are very good. Clean room. They are very helpful and friendly. Wifi speed is not so good. Hotel place is in gali but It's lonely area. Their services and behaviour very good. Feel so good in this hotel.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: shapandatta B
Detailed Review: We travelled with our friends to Delhi for two Night.We chose this hotel and taken family room there.The Room was good with air-conditioning.Bathroom was clean.We Enjoy nice stay there.The staff was nice and welcome us nicely.We feel better than other place stay in India this trip.Thanks to all of them.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Raj
Detailed Review: I am used to stay here for the last two years , whenever i am coming for official work in Newdelhi.  The Rooms are clean, hygienic and comfortable. Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Rishab S
Detailed Review: Hotel staffs are very good. Clean room. They are very helpful and friendly. Wifi speed is not so good. Hotel place is in gali but It's lonely area. Their services and behaviour very good. Feel so good in this hotel.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: shapandatta B
Detailed Review: We travelled with our friends to Delhi for two Night.We chose this hotel and taken family room there.The Room was good with air-conditioning.Bathroom was clean.We Enjoy nice stay there.The staff was nice and welcome us nicely.We feel better than other place stay in India this trip.Thanks to all of them.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: AVANTIKA CHAUHAN
Detailed Review: PLACE is good . Location is good . All other staff is great.  There is guy named Salman who handles reception in this hostel and he is purely a Anti-India guy. We were having a discussion on rooftop of this property about present political condition of India. Suddenly he jumps in and starts abusing a Member of Parliament on the basis of   her religion.Openly abused Hindu religious feelings about COW and eating beef and openly said in front of guest that if this was his property he would have openly served beef and no one cant touch him against it. He openly abused a organisation which is supposed to be biggest Hindu Organisation in world for creating gaps in current society of India and supported freedom of Kashmir on basis of religion. Justifies Triple Talaq as sharia law and‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ian the traveler
Detailed Review: Oh dear. Arrived at night and got ripped off by the night manager. Money exchange rate wrong and some beers sold for 3 times the normal cost. Taken to superior room, no windows and small. Brochure said city views. The money exchange was fixed when I accidentally talked  to the owner. The rest of the staff were really nice and my room was changed after one week. It‚Äôs in a good location but has a place for men to urinate in alley about 20 meters from front door and it smells really bad. Day managers were very nice fellows. Paid for taxi to airport and the hotel taxi organiser put me in a non air condition car because I forgot to tip him when I arrived. 43‚Äô  C.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Vashisth Tiwari
Detailed Review: I stayed in Smyle Inn in June. The place is fairly close to New Delhi metro station and is very reachable (you need to cross the railway station towards the Paharganj side). The host, Mr Harish, was very prompt in helping us in finding the place through messages. He also recommended places to visit in Delhi and helped us plan the day.  The place is amidst a busy market so can be a bit noisy but it's definitely worth the cheap price tag (and free breakfast üòÄ) it comes with.  Will definitely recommend.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Bunny Rajput
Detailed Review: The place is really nice and clean.The owner is really really helpful and also the staff.If you are looking for staying in budget and need some information about Delhi.You should stay here.It is really wonderful place.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Darlene d
Detailed Review: This is a wonderful hotel that is warm and welcoming.  On every wall there are pictures and saying that brings laughter so organically.  The name is on point.  It‚Äôs quiet simplicity is very homelike.    This is the 3rd time residing at Smyle Inn and will have no problem returning for a 4th time.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Lamont S
Detailed Review: A Pleasant stop along the way in Delhi. Outstanding service.  Easy on the budget. Close to the MARKETPLACE!!!  Humorous and thought-provoking statements (lots of smiles) posted decorating all the hallways.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Bernie R
Detailed Review: What I enjoyed the most was the decor, not just the room but the whole building; it feels like a b&b since it is a small building with a few rooms in each floor sharing a spacious living room and dining room areas. In general the place is decorated with good taste; I had a short stay but managed to have a meal in the terrace and it was delicious; they also were gracious enough to pack a to-go breakfast since I had a very early flight.  The area is nice and close to a busy part of town. Service overall was good and was surprised they do take AmEx

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Anand D Nanavati
Review: Very good hotel to stay in this area.
Detailed Review: We booked a quad suite. Pros and improvement together:  Good service though some things could be taken care of while readying the room for check-in, like number of towels etc. depending on the number of people in the room.  Though whenever we called room-service the response was very quick.  Breakfast option were reasonable but sometimes there was rush due to less place and first day had to remind for the eggwhite multiple times which never came or may have gone to some other table.   All in all if you want to stay in this area, this is the best hotel.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Dnl
Detailed Review: It was a memorable stay  Excellent hospitality Superb cleanliness Mouth wondering food Best services in all kind Hotel arrange pick up at 4 am and drop at railway station We will ever choose for our next visit to Delhi

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Misti Dutta
Detailed Review: It was a pleasant experience to stay over here. The room service,  breakfast was good.  Every staff was working hard. They were trying hard to serve best experience. I spent my last weekend so nicely .All in one it was a nice experience.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Prashant K
Detailed Review: We book this hotel Amax Inn online. First we were bit confused with Hotel location.oncecwe entered the place we feel energatic. The reception was welcoming with smile. The family room was amazing super clean with hygienic bath looks like big hotel room if star category. The price is so reasonable for this type of quality. We are sure coming back soon .

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Misti Dutta
Detailed Review: It was a pleasant experience to stay over here. The room service,  breakfast was good.  Every staff was working hard. They were trying hard to serve best experience. I spent my last weekend so nicely .All in one it was a nice experience.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Prashant K
Detailed Review: We book this hotel Amax Inn online. First we were bit confused with Hotel location.oncecwe entered the place we feel energatic. The reception was welcoming with smile. The family room was amazing super clean with hygienic bath looks like big hotel room if star category. The price is so reasonable for this type of quality. We are sure coming back soon .

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Pieter B.
Detailed Review: This hostel is a clean with enough toilets and showers. The staff is really helpful and friendly and help you with every problem. They have as well a nice rooftop to chill out and to enjoy the sunset. As well food and drinks are available in the hostel. Prices are really responsible as well. Specially the location is as well really nice. If the chaos is to much it's a nice to come back in the hostel. A really peaceful sphere is here.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Azam Nawaz
Detailed Review: Jugaad Hostel is one of the best places to stay when you‚Äôre solo or in a group. It has parking space, a peaceful terrace and wonderful staff who are extremely helpful. Just about everything is great about this place. The only issue that bothered me was the issue with their Air Conditioning in the dormetery. It does get quite warm in summers in Delhi and you definitely need the air conditioner to be working at its best. Apparently they have a system where the AC‚Äôs room temperature will not go below 24 C (believe me it‚Äôs not enough) it gets sweaty at times. This is a major spoiler in such a nice place. Upon request they did lower the temperature by 1-2 Degrees which is unsatisfactory. The staff can‚Äôt do much about it (they‚Äôre only doing what they‚Äôre told) as they‚Äôre not allowed to‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Katy B
Detailed Review: We stayed in Judaad on our first night in Delhi & back again now. The staff are friendly, and the free breakfast is definitely a bonus!   If you‚Äôre looking for a clean place to stay then look no further. Rooms are air conditioned so you can stay cool in the heat of Delhi.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: goyourownwayround
Detailed Review: You have two options at this budget hotel. The basic rooms which has AC, TV and private bathroom or the upgraded rooms which has the same facilities but the rooms and bathroom are a lot bigger however both types of rooms are dated. We stayed in both and I would recommend the upgraded room at a few rupees a day more as the extra space made a big difference to us. The hotel is in a great location to adventure around the main bazar but you also have connaught place near by with lots of shops, restaurants and bars; so best of both worlds. The metro and New Delhi station are also close by so you can travel around most of Delhi at ease and take in the sights or if you prefer they will organise a tour for you. We did both. The staff at the hotel were friendly and very helpfully at all‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: TravelIndiaMay19
Detailed Review: Staff is totaly unable to help in any way and can be very cocky when the manager is not there, always for spectacular reasons ¬´ he went to hospital ¬ª...  A very bad experience there, as i was going to take airplane at Terminal 1.  Then, those people who make a point to give smiles for no reasons and when you ask for nothing,  can rudly make faces right away.  You are supposed to be the customer and the client, not a piece of cattle.  The staff doens speak good english, dont try to adapt the breakfirst, they will serve you what they decided to serve you, and not what you like  At the entrance of the narrow  path that lead to Smyle Inn, you have public lavatories in open space, and everyday is a strong smell of urine that ¬´ welcome ¬ª you when you pass by The narrow road is‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: retep4691
Detailed Review: Stayed in early April for one night I can say that the service is excellent and the hotel very relaxing. We ate at the rooftop restaurant in the evening and the food was very good and very well priced. The staff helped us print our boarding passes for the flight home offering us the use of a computer. In the morning we had breakfast before leaving and again very nice indeed, with the relaxed atmosphere and the view from the roof with the sites and sounds of India an absolute joy.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Bevie2010
Detailed Review: We chose this hotel after reading the reviews and have not been disappointed in any way.   The hotel is quiet, clean, and well priced and the food is really nice.  The hospitality offered by the staff is second to none.  The beds are comfy and the pillows are great.  I like a smaller pillow not these great big things that break your neck.  This hotel is everything we needed. A welcome tea on arrival with their famous banana bread was delicious.   Meals on the terrace on the top floor were great and breakfast was different as you would like, or cornflakes and toast.  The air-conditioning in the bedroom is quiet and efficient.  Each bedroom has an ensuite and every floor has a shared lounge.  TV is in the bedroom. Anything you need or want can be provided if requested.  They have‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Hamid D
Detailed Review: Good hotel in a central location right in the thick of the Delhi hustle but as you step through the peace and calm is there.  Great staff particularly the lady receptionist who was helpful and fantastic.  Great family room which slept 5 people without feeling cramped at all.  Good breakfast with a nice selection which kept everyone happy.  The hotel is undergoing renovations so although it was a little noisy at times never after dusk. The hotel also lacks a central communal area so you can‚Äôt sit and relax anywhere outside your room! This really is the only downside: there is a roof terrace so I hope they do something with this.  The restaurant next door which I think is associated with the hotel is not great so personally other than breakfast I would avoid it.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Pasquettes
Review: Fantastic clean hotel in Delhi centre
Detailed Review: We stayed at hotel Ajanta for 2 nights and very much enjoyed it. Gunjan was particularly welcoming and charming at the reception desk. We were a family of 4 and they gave us two rooms and two bathrooms to sleep in. The beds and bathrooms were spotless. We would highly recommend the hotel. Fantastic value for money. Highly recommended.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Chris F
Review: Large clean rooms, helpful staff, good location
Detailed Review: This hotel has large and clean rooms with well equipped bathrooms. Staff were extremely helpful. It‚Äôs on a busy street near the railway station so there is always background noise from the street, but you wouldn‚Äôt stay in this part of Delhi if you were looking for peace and quiet. The restaurant does a good breakfast and has a standard menu for evening meals. The Red Fort and Connaught Place are both a 15 minute auto rickshaw ride away. My only negative comment is that rooms seem quite expensive for what they were, although Delhi is expensive.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: BibiJ
Review: Easy close access to metro and rail service
Detailed Review: Clean, freshly painted, kind staff, great facilities, and everything worked.üëå Roof terrace overlooking kids cricket pitch. Character street full of action, but quiet room. Adjoining restaurant open all hours: delicious food!

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Samrat
Detailed Review: I stayed here for 1 day. Only advantage is its close to railway station. Otherwise Rooms are very small. No complimentry water bottles. AC remote and fridge was not working. Matress are not at all comfortable to sleep. If you need anything thn you will need to remind them multiple times.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: O_barbara888
Detailed Review: We've stayed at Amax twice, each time for 2 nights. It was a fine stay, totally as we had expected. The staff is very friendly and welcoming. There are air conditioning, fan and a fridge in each room, and you can also order any dish from the menu to the room. We felt very safe there.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Nihal A
Detailed Review: We had twice visited with Our Family Hotel Amax Inn in New Delhi . It was wonderful experience. The Room are very clean look modern. The bathrooms also shine . The staff was helpful and smiley.  The food service was excellent. We are coming back next time

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Raman
Detailed Review: It's always good to be back here the food is good and the staff are wonderful they know me well as I'm a regular guest here, Duty manager Ankit and lady Christina assisted me and make sure I'm happy I enjoyed the stay here always

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sam
Review: Very good hotel...will recommend it to families...very close to railway station
Detailed Review: Its a very good hotel with cooperative staffs and ckean rooms...we took three rooms...and later asked to change one room..which they did immediayely....food was very good...u get many varities...yes the street leading to hotel looks very busy and clean...but the hotel is awesome...Had a pleasant stay.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Triplegem2017
Detailed Review: If you are looking for a clean, decent hotel in Pahar Ganj this is just the place. Down a small alley, the staff are friends and helpful, the Doubles are bigger and better than the Twins, especially on the third floor, where the Wifi is spotty at best, nonexistent most of the time.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: jasidmaroc
Detailed Review: This is my business trip, always using Amax inn services, The hotel itself very clean and staff is great. This property is value for money, I had read some review about this hotel, some people want a five star services in budght hotel. I stayed in this hotel more then fifteen times, and stayed in many rooms, all rooms are very clean. The owner Mr. Anil is very attentive, taking care of his guest personally. The food they provide its yamee too. I recomend this hotel Will come back.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: JpS
Detailed Review: Me and my friends visit this place in April for our holidays. The services  are fast and rooms are very  hygenic. Staff is polite. Food is very yamee at fofftop. Its in a small alley but when you go inside, you feel that you are in a very clean and perfect place. I recommend this place to all. Definatly come back

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ali
Detailed Review: I am staying  in this  hotel from last five years.  For my business, the rooms are  super clean  and staff is attentive.  Ac working  well. The rooftop  is a good  place  to chat with  another  tourist. Front desk person  always  ready  to  help.  They have a travel  counter inside for booking  all your  needs.  Will come back soon. Thanks  Amax team

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: moziz52
Detailed Review: Stayed here twice on this trip both times great help from staff with luggage checking in. Nothing is to much trouble any information you need staff are here to help. Anil the owner is kind and helpful person and takes time out to meet his guests. Will definitely be staying here again. The rooms are basic but clean and it‚Äôs great to meet other  travellers on the rooftop terrace. You can‚Äôt get this type hospitality for the price you pay

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: O_barbara888
Detailed Review: We've stayed at Amax twice, each time for 2 nights. It was a fine stay, totally as we had expected. The staff is very friendly and welcoming. There are air conditioning, fan and a fridge in each room, and you can also order any dish from the menu to the room. We felt very safe there.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Nihal A
Detailed Review: We had twice visited with Our Family Hotel Amax Inn in New Delhi . It was wonderful experience. The Room are very clean look modern. The bathrooms also shine . The staff was helpful and smiley.  The food service was excellent. We are coming back next time

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Raman
Detailed Review: It's always good to be back here the food is good and the staff are wonderful they know me well as I'm a regular guest here, Duty manager Ankit and lady Christina assisted me and make sure I'm happy I enjoyed the stay here always

Thanks  Amax team

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: moziz52
Detailed Review: Stayed here twice on this trip both times great help from staff with luggage checking in. Nothing is to much trouble any information you need staff are here to help. Anil the owner is kind and helpful person and takes time out to meet his guests. Will definitely be staying here again. The rooms are basic but clean and it‚Äôs great to meet other  travellers on the rooftop terrace. You can‚Äôt get this type hospitality for the price you pay

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: victoria-mcloughlin3
Detailed Review: We‚Äôd been travelling a while and Jugaad was a welcoming respite from the intense sensory experience of Delhi! The comfortable air conditioned room and private bathroom were a relief for my slightly unwell husband. As was the security after a dodgy Uber driver encounter. They even helped organise food for my hubby‚Äôs sore tummy. But mostly it was the owner Vasu who made this place for us! As soon as I met him, he was doling out wise and friendly advice to weary travellers around him. Within no time, he‚Äôd helped me plan out the rest of our journey including a guide Neggi (who was amazing at a reasonable price) and at no extra cost a stay at his other beautiful hotel Ekaa in Agra! It is truly amazing when someone takes time to really help ease your path. This is what hospitality is‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Radha
Detailed Review: Awsome place to stay. The people that work there care about everything and help out a lot. Therefor it was no problem to travel alone as a woman in India. Thanks for all the help, tipps and nice stay. The breakfast was freshly cooked and yummi. the rooms were clean and the rooftop just amazing

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Estel M
Detailed Review: Loved the good vibes in this hostel!  We had a private room that was simple but very comfortable and big.  There is a great terrace area we loved! Perfect for lazy evenings and to meet other travellers!  They make really nice homemade food! Had their thali for dinner both nights we stayed there! And both nights it was  different and really tasty. There is free breakfast (that‚Äôs an indian dish they prepare every morning) or paid one with other Indian and also western options, we went for western and it was very nice and good coffee!!!   The location is not the best as it is a bit far but it is a safe area so you can wander around.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: JoJo And Darcy
Detailed Review: My friend and I got in around 1am and though we were the only people there, it took 40 minutes to check us in and pay. The staff weren‚Äôt friendly at all. The only positive was that the breakfast was good.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Virgile R
Review: Simple but Good! Nice rooftop terrace!
Detailed Review: In the middle of Main bazar  Clean, and nice rooftop terrace! 5 minutes walk from railway station convenient to travel to other city. Hot water on demand, pick up service for airport. Perfect for backpackers or low budgets

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Melanie
Review: Highly recommended in the heart of Paharganj!
Detailed Review: I have stayed at Smyle Inn three times whilst passing through Delhi - each time the room was clean, quiet, hot water available and good water pressure. The WiFi is reliable, in the mornings a simple backpacker‚Äôs breakfast is served. Next door there is a small cafe serving delicious parantha if you are in the mood for traditional food. The staff is very attentive, always available and interested in your comfort. You may call from your room or email them with fast reply, if you need anything or have any questions. Both buildings sport large and quiet rooftops with great city views - full shanti in the middle of bustling Paharganj. Airport transportation can be arranged for any time of day or night, paid at the front desk. Snack shops and simple food stalls line the alleyway, and‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Robert L
Review: Great place to stay in New Delhi
Detailed Review: My wife and I have stayed many times at the Smyle Inn. Every time we have been very happy with the service and comfort. The staff are great, they help you with anything needed. Very comfortable, and accessible to numerous New Delhi attractions. If you're looking for a place that's professional, accommodating, safe, fair priced, the Smyle Inn is the place for you!

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Pieter-Jan C
Detailed Review: Don't expect anything amazing here, it's just simply OK. Rooms are average size, and are superficially cleaned. Toilet didn't flush and shower was could. Don't be tempted to accept the breakfast, it's just not good. People are friendly and location is great!

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Virgile R
Review: Great place Great people Great travel agency
Detailed Review: In the middle of Main bazar  Clean, and nice rooftop terrace! 5 minutes walk from railway station convenient to travel to other city. Hot water on demand, pick up service for airport. Perfect for backpackers or low budgets

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Michael D
Review: What a gem of accommodation in Delhi
Detailed Review: This was the place we stayed at on our arrival in Delhi. The hotel reminded us more of a home-stay or B&B but the room was spacious, the rooftop dining in open air exceptional and our hosts warm and welcoming.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: jonathan h
Detailed Review: We stayed at the Colonels Retreat in March 2019 and we highly recommend it. Located in a pleasant, residential area of the city and close to the metro. Our room was spacious and clean. Meals were served on the roof under the stars. Very romantic. The food was excellent. The owner, Arun Khanna was very friendly and his banana bread was delicious!

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: grampus
Review: No frills quiet and reasonably priced
Detailed Review: This is a simple hotel with probably fewer facilities than some might want.We had a good sized room on ground floor. Clean quiet and comfortable. Spotless bathroom. Roof top restaurant very pleasant and food good and interesting. An excellent bolt hole from the clamour of Delhi!

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Debra K
Detailed Review: My friends and I stayed at the Colonel's retreat at the beginning of our time in India and also just before we left the country. The retreat is conveniently situated near the subway system and a market area. All staff are incredibly helpful, kind and efficient. The rooms, common areas and rooftop dining area, all immaculately clean. Everything you would ever need for a very comfortable stay are provided. We enjoyed happy hour and many meals in the rooftop restaurant. Every dish  was delicious. The design of the guest house gives many areas to lounge and relax. Arun and Suman were incredibly helpful and available when needed. When we returned for our second stay after over 3 weeks away we were welcomed back very warmly. A wonderful place to spend some time. Thank you for your‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Andrew Graeme K
Detailed Review: A wonderful calm oasis.  The rooms are fabulous as is the rooftop restaurant where they serve their wonderful banana bread as well as delicious home cooked meals!  The owner and staff are all extremely welcoming and helpful and they all definitely go the extra mile to make your stay as comfortable and memorable as possible.  It‚Äôs only 10 minutes walk to the nearest metro station which makes it extremely easy to reach all the main tourist attractions.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jeff M
Detailed Review: Located in a residential area ,you can enjoy a walk in the neighborhood, perhaps see kids playing cricket, visit the small park nearby.  Though a quiet neighborhood, it is directly under path the air travel of large planes that fly over frequently.  The food is very good but only available at certain times,  The terrace is lovely.  Most of the staff was very good but not everyone.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Frans C
Review: Great Food at The Colonel‚Äôs Retreat
Detailed Review: We stayed in The Colonel‚Äôs Retreat in the Defence Quarter. Great place to stay although the entrance is not obvious, not much signage. It‚Äôs marvellously different. It has small number of rooms arranged on a number of floors and a roof terrace at the top where breakfast and dinner are served. Our room was next to the lounge area so we treated the lounge area as an extension to our room! The staff are brilliant and the rooms great, but the best thing about the Colonels Retreat is the food, eating dinners on the roof terrace was a joy. The food is all home made and tastes fantastic. For breakfast try the banana bread, a house speciality, and the Bombay Eggs. They also do complementary afternoon tea on the roof terrace. There is a small bar so you can have an ice cold beer when you‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: sophia27
Detailed Review: In a quiet residential location. Our room was comfortable, no view except that of a small dark courtyard. Residents lounge. Meals served on the rooftop which is a pleasant spot . Food is very good. Nice to be offered afternoon tea. Service when we were there was very slow, staff kept saying drinks/ the bill were coming but nothing materialised until we chased and chased. A nice enough place to stay if you have set plans for a day out in Delhi. Not much to do in the immediate vicinity, walk to a small park or the Defence Colony market will take no more than 1-2 hours so not ideal for a 'chill' day.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ken N
Detailed Review: We visited for 4 days in early March 2019 before our hiking in the Himalayas and later stayed for 2 more nights prior to our departure. The guesthouse was spotlessly clean, well set out, with friendly and professional staff. A very efficient laundry service was also provided as well as looking after our general needs. Each floor had its own relaxing living area where you could chill and read. The restaurant located on the rooftop provided delicious breakfasts. We also had a few dinners here as well which were exceptional. You could even get a cold beer and a gin and tonic! Arun and Suman were the perfect hosts and provided us with practical touring advice (thanks for recommending the National Museum where we viewed a selection of the Royal Jewels). they even provided us with‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Evelyne E
Review: Nice guesthouse in a quiet area
Detailed Review: We arrived around 3:00am and we were welcomed very friendly. Rooms are a little bit small but comfortable. We enjoyed starting the day with an excellent breakfast in the open air rooftop, this is plus for this hotel.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Meg14Ireland
Detailed Review: This is a small very comfortable guesthouse in a residential area of Delhi. It is very well placed for accessing the airport.  Staff were very helpful and the place was spotlessly clean. They have a restaurant on the roof but we didn‚Äôt eat there so can‚Äôt comment on the food. The Defense Colony market is a short walk away with a great variety of restaurants.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Lesclem
Detailed Review: Nothing is too much trouble for this lovely family business, they were so hospitable and kind. The food is absolutely delicious breakfast and dinner. They give great advice on trips and make everyone from every country very welcome.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Richard W
Review: A lovely house in a peaceful part of New Delhi
Detailed Review: Our group of eight very much appreciated our overnight stay in this home-like residence in a leafy suburb of New Delhi. Its location is convenient for access to all parts of the megapolis as well as to the airport.   The rooms were super-clean, spacious and ideal for our needs.   Magic moment is breakfast on the roof terrace with both Indian and European tasty delights for the palate! The hosts are most welcoming and rather than staying in an impersonal international hotel, the Colonel's Retreat offers a refreshing venue which we thoroughly recommend.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Nidhi
Review: An outstanding stay - really friendly staff
Detailed Review: My wife and I stayed at Colonel's retreat during a business trip to Delhi. We were looking for a laid-back environment where we could relax and have our own private time. This hotel is very comfy and the staff makes you feel right at home. They are always available to help and really go the extra mile to make you happy. We both felt that the value for money is very good. Food was delicious too! Highly recommended.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: PFTraveller62
Detailed Review: After all the hustle and Bustle of a day‚Äôs sightseeing, this hotel is a welcome retreat. Between to stay in a small local hotel where you are greeted personally by the owner. Nice rooms with everything you need. Attentive staff. Near the Metro that can get you back into town if you don‚Äôt have a driver.  However, what makes this place is the wonderful local and home cooked food. Both Breakfast and dinner were delightful and eating on the terrace watching the Kite‚Äôs made it prefect. Washing it down with a beer or G&T also helped.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Mohit Singh
Detailed Review: Hotel ajanta is very pretty and amazing Hotel. I love the food, room, room service, view, everything. When I stay in ajanta,I feel like I am in home. So thank you so much guys. You are amazing ‚ù£Ô∏è. Mohit Singh

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Maria Eugenia
Detailed Review: We (two people) have expend on the way on 3 days in N Delhi living in Ajanta Hotel. Lovely room doble with bathroom very clean and confortable. Service excelent  We have booked a 10 days travel to Tamil Nadu with the Hotel Agency.  From Chennai through the cost till Madurai by car with driver from the 6th of March to 16th March, We have vistit the old Temples through Dakshin Chitra, Mamallapuram, Kanchipuram, Pondicherry, Aurovind. Tiruvaramalay, Chindambaram, Gangaikondachola, Thanjavur, Tiruchirapalli, Tiruchirapalli, Srirangam,  Chettinad and Madurai  Very well organized with plains from Delhi to Chennai and back from Madurai to N Delhi.  Hotels from 4 and 5 stars very good and with breackfast. Our driver was a very good guide of the places very well informed and very good in‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: GlobetrotterSue
Detailed Review: Our stay was divided into 2 nights - trip to Golden Triangle - further night at Ajanta. Our luggage was safely stored for us. Check in was straight forward on both occasions though room allocation not so good on our return. One member of party on different floor and in what did not appear to be the superior room paid for. Rooms clean and well equipped. Lift available but very small. The breakfast was adequate but room small and chaotic.  Staff helpful and pleasant. Good location with plenty of eateries on same street. Short tuk-tuk ride to  buzzing Connaught Place. Overall a good stay.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sally R
Review: Great location for seeing the real Delhi
Detailed Review: Ideal for what we wanted. Good service, nice clean room, good location, helpful staff. Appreciated mini bar ( no alcohol but chocolate , fruit juice and water) cafe over road was great for coffee and snack whilst watching the tuc tucs and carts going by. Would definitely recommend it . We were two ladies of over60 travelling alone and felt quite safe and looked after there. Very comfortable beds!

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: la_1977
Review: Great Location, close to railway and markets
Detailed Review: We only stayed 2 nights as we arrived at 4am. Our room was ready but the fold out bed was not. Our group of 3 shared a room, fold out bed for 3rd person wasn't in the best of shape a little wobbly but ok for our stay. Rooms are not modern but are clean, so was the bathroom. We chose the hotel as it was really close to the railway since we had to be there really early in the morning and it is quicker to walk than get stuck in the crazy traffic. Great cafe across the street. Great rates to exchange money too. Friendly staff. Value for money.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Dave T
Review: A Great Hotel in a Bustling City Street
Detailed Review: This hotel is less than a five minute walk from New Delhi Railway Station and a 20 minute stroll along Chelmsford Road to Connaught Place. We were given a warm welcome by the reception staff and were offered a choice of rooms. Warning, the first room had curtains, but no window, but they were quite happy to put us in a nice room looking out on trees and a little side road, so it was relatively quiet. The room was clean and comfortable and even had a fridge. We ate in the restaurant next door and found the food and service to be very good. They can arrange very well priced tours and we will certainly stay there again during our next visit to Delhi.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Gala2812
Detailed Review: Our group had complimentary pick up from the airport that helped a lot when arriving to Delhi the first time. Hospital reception. Currency exchange if needed. The rooms were not too spacy but enough to fall asleep and well equiped (teabags and teapots, water, nice soapbars in the bathroom). Hot water was there. Clean sheets and comfy beds. Though walls were a bit shabby and rooms generally needed some renewal. Poor soundproofing as happens in most hotels. Elevator - but just one  and is often not enough? have to wait or use steep stairs. Good buffet breakfast with both Indian and European food.  Generally good value for the quality balanced, Ajanta would fit those travellers looking for simple but comfortable stay in Delhi without overpaying for not needed luxury (but luxury‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Daydream621990
Detailed Review: Our stay - two rooms/ 4 people - got off to a bad start: we had booked well in advance but when we arrived we were told no rooms were available, even though it was 1.30pm.....  We were encouraged to take rooms across the street in what we were told was "the other part of the hotel", a place that had no 'front-of-desk' and that seemed very shabby. We stood our grounds and although the management seemed a little chaotic the staff were nevertheless doing their very best to ameliorate the situation. In the end we were given good rooms, even though on the first night one of the rooms had no windows. The staff are bright and responsive and extremely pleasant, the restaurant that adjoins the hotel is good and also very responsive, and the rooms are good value. The area - Paharganj -‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: veena
Review: We like the service of Hotel Ajanta and the best support of all the staff members all the times.
Detailed Review: Execellent service from Hotel Ajanta and very satisfy with their great support from the staff and the Management.Our clients was so happy with good coordination of the hotel team and the food by Arranging in same place to save lot of time.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Bazzajmcg
Detailed Review: I was visiting Delhi for 8 days so wanted a hotel close to all amenities. A friend of mine who used to work at the High Commission recommended Ajanta, close to the Railway Station, Metro and the Main Bazaar Road and Connaught Place is a short cab ride away. Don‚Äôt be put off by being close to the Station it is all part of vibrant India. The hotel itself is perfectly run by Mr Rashid and his staff, nothing was too much trouble - running errands, taxis , changing money etc.- the hotel might be be 3* but the staff are 5*. The rooms are clean and I would recommend taking a suite for only a small extra charge. Breakfast buffet is served in their restaurant next door. All in all a good base to explore India and enjoy the hustle bustle of Delhi.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: thewanderingeducators
Detailed Review: Hotel Ajanta is located in paharganj area of New Delhi.  A few shopping hubs are nearby to the hotel and some places are easily accessible.  Also the railway station is just a 5 minute walk from this hotel.  The hotel rooms are very spacious and ideal for a couple or 3 people.  The room consisted of a king size bed, hair dryer,  huge bathroom with hot and cold water facility along with the basic toiletries provided and fresh towel, led TV and a cozy sofa. The staff was very kind and arranged for airport transfers which was included in the booking.  A good recommendation from our side for families or a couple to stay at this hotel once in Delhi

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Scenic45115100521
Review: Good accommodation in Delhi but watch out!
Detailed Review: Great bed, hot water, working AC,working fans in room , free pick up from the airport upon arrival, but please be vigilant!  We paid triple room on booking.com  Receptionist showed us to double room saying this is what we paid for ! She added they have not prepared the room as they have to move out 2 chairs and one table from this room and bring in one single bed.  We were suggested an alternative upgrade which turned out 3 bed room superior as she said but it was an upgrade for 14000 rupee - the same price we paid already! We declined this offer.  Another alternative was shown and we would need to pay 6500 only for upgrade. We also declined and walked out from the room saying that we want the room she showed us first. We said ok please prepare the standard double room by‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: israr mansuri
Detailed Review: Hotel ajanta is good super clean hotel I like the hotel clean facility I love the food and good natural with great food and I love the facility there nice affordable price I love the DELHI weather nice

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Carly B
Review: Big room size & super helpful staff. (Tips for location!)
Detailed Review: We stayed here for four nights and it was perfect for getting about Delhi!   First up tips with getting to the hotel! We took the metro from the airport to New Delhi metro station and had a confusing journey on foot the long way round to Arakashun road, it‚Äôs much simpler than that but not obvious on arrival (and we didn‚Äôt have phone service yet).  If you arrive to New Delhi metro exit the station then and walk across the road past the vendors and tuk tuks to the main New Delhi train station. Basically ignore EVERYONE that tells you to go around because they will. Pop your luggage through the bag scan and take the escalators up in to the train station and walk all the way to the end and exit. The metro is on platform 16 side and Paharganj is on platform 1 side. Cut through. If‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Rebecca M
Detailed Review: Me and my partner stayed here for a 3 night stay and were pretty disappointed. The pictures we saw online were completely different of the room to the one we received. It was very difficult to sleep because of constant noises from outside. Also, the manager stopped taking interest in helping us once we said that we didn‚Äôt want to buy a driver through him. The WiFi in our room did not work, we explained this to the staff, including the manager, 3 times and we were told they will ‚Äòfix it‚Äô which they didn‚Äôt. The food in the restaurant was ok and well priced.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Kuda
Detailed Review: We spend one night in the hotel Amax inn. Great place, private bathroom, AC, TV and working/eating space in the room. Staff was really helpful. They gave us great tips how to spend two days in Delhi.  They have transfer options and also you can ask them to find driver for a daily tours.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Lidageorgia
Detailed Review: Great place with private bathroom and AC.Staff was really helpfull,they gave us a lot of amazing tips on how to spent time in Delhi.Location was preatty close to Delhi center.They can organize all kind of transfers and tours for you.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: julien p
Detailed Review: Really nice hotel, with nice and helpful staff. Good services. The wifi works. Nothing to complain about. Clean room, hot water as expected. You will see a rooftop were the restaurant it's based if you prefer to eat outside instead of in your room.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Alok D
Detailed Review: The major hitch about this Hotel are two...  1) Its distance from the main road. 2) It doesn't have its own functional restaurant though room service is good.  It is surely a good option to stay. The overall feel was close to good.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Natalie B
Detailed Review: Stayed here for 3 nights. Location is very central however this meant the area was extremely noisy with the traffic passing by and sleeping was difficult. I would recommend ear plugs. Also as soon as you leave the hotel you receive a lot of harassment and unwanted attention from the locals, we found this especially difficult being two white female travellers.  Room was clean and the size was okay, WiFi temperamental. However we did enjoy the hot and powerful shower! Large bed and blankets provided. The ‚Äòrestaurant‚Äô on the rooftop is not what I would call it. Open space with a few tables however you have to use the phone to call your order and multiple times we experienced very long waits for the incorrect order to then arrive. They also will bring food to the room if you like,‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Eoril
Detailed Review: Overall it was nice, I was expecting worse given the tales about the area. There's a big sign on the street so it's not so hard to find, the staff was very nice and welcoming and they let us check in before the official check-in time. The room was ok, with nice furniture (a wardrobe, a table, a small table, and a chair) but the TV did not work.  It was quite inconvenient that the AC was right on top of the bed, and a lot of noise came in from there - it felt like we had an open window and the room was humid and cold at times. As it often happens in India, the bed sheets were not the cleanest so we used our own. The bahtroom was nice and we had an amazing hot shower.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: sarahhhh83
Detailed Review: Stayed here a total of 3 nights at the beginning and end of our India trip. The rooms were clean and spacious. All the staff were friendly and the owner so helpful and accommodating. Great budget option. Hotel is in a good area to be able to walk to main bazaar and shopping.  Would recommend!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv

Basically ignore EVERYONE that tells you to go around because they will. Pop your luggage through the bag scan and take the escalators up in to the train station and walk all the way to the end and exit. The metro is on platform 16 side and Paharganj is on platform 1 side. Cut through. If‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: All Things Lush UK
Detailed Review: I have stayed at a few hostels around India, and this is by far the best one I have come across. Clean and well designed, the rooms, beds and other features give this place a nice feel about it.  The rooftop terrace is a great place to soak in Dehli, whilst meeting and socialising with new people. The breakfast every morning is fresh and different, and super tasty. The staff are super helpful and friendly, and I felt super comfortable there throughout my whole stay. I would definitely come back here again, if I was to visit New Dehli again.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: sanjaychauhanji
Detailed Review: I am a travel guide   I have traveled to several countries in the world. Stayed in several types of hotels from luxurious to cheapest possible.   I generally write a very few reviews  It was the first time I had booked the hostel . I have found this place excellent safe and a wonderful place to stay . The staff is not only polite but ever ready to help you .   Frankly speaking you can't find a place worth like Jugaad in Delhi.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: vivian s
Detailed Review: This my first hostel experience in India and Selman & the all other staff made my stay beyond comfortable. The beds are great, its a clean place and most of all, its a safe place. For a blonde female solo traveller Delhi can be an intimidating place, but Jugaad felt like a home. The rooftop is magnificent - they have free tea and the wifi works good. Definitely recommend this place.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Scar Kim
Detailed Review: Finding safe, clean and good traveler/budget hostels in good areas were hard to find every time I traveled to Delhi. Situated in RK Puram, the location of Jugaad i.e, near a marketplace may seem chaotic initially but it is far better than the experiences I have had with hostels/stays in Paharganj, especially for solo female travelers. The hostel itself is clean, comfortable and the staff is kind and willing to help with anything hostelers may require. A+ for the hospitality and maintenance! Highly recommend!

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Rojan
Detailed Review: I stayed there for 3 nights because I had to arrange something. I felt at home there; Good people,good food,good view. Place is clean and not crowded. Good location close to all the sites. Hope to come back some day.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Bashir Ahmed M
Detailed Review: Booked this hotel online through booking.com. When visited there, it was very hard to find it as it is located inside very narrow gully, no sign board on roadside. Terrible location, even piza boy could not locate it and went back. Very bad smell in this narrow gully, and room size very very small than what was given in description by booking.com. There were zero facilities against described by booking.com, it was very hard to use toilet as very small, very hot, hotel manager was tough to allow to use AC, though AC room was booked. However, Breakfast was excellent. The hotel manager tried to charge extra on credit card, so customers should be aware about it.No Indian customer was found there, only foreigners who are picked up by hotel manager from airport stay here. I do not‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Helen W
Review: Great place Great people Great travel agency
Detailed Review: Dnt hesitate to book here right in the heart of local life. Market life be prepared for absolute chaos. If u want to book travel for yr stay around India do it here very honest people and very professional. Change money as u wnt get ripped off.  Would we stay here again absolutely yes

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: SannelMehta
Detailed Review: It is smack in the centre of paharganj - great place to stay! Very affordable with good service. It is close to all the major old delhi attractions. I would definitely recommend this place to solo travellers!

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Daniel
Review: Easy accomodation nearby railway station and central area
Detailed Review: Good stay. Very affordable and a good location if you want to be nearby all of the tourist areas in Delhi. Very nice owner and accommodating staff. Many people's bad reviews were mostly about the smaller rooms, noise, or public toilet at the end of the lane. These things are all very minor -- if you want an affordable place to stay in a good location, this is the spot. Good WiFi too.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: tripguide.se
Review: Very helpful staff and great value
Detailed Review: Manager and staff are incredibly helpful and was very concerned in helping us. Our first incident was that our flight to Delhi was cancelled so we arrived one day later, but manager let us use same booking.   Then when we where on our way to the airport the bag with passports was stolen. So we had to spend a week applying for all the necessary paperwork to leave the country. Under this time everyone in the staff was genuinely concerned about us and helped is as much as they could.   As we where here an extra week we had to work online and I must say this was a great place to do it from. WiFi was 50Mbps with good signal on the nice rooftop terrace where we could sit and work. It's very quiet and nicely decorated and a good place for a beer in the evening :)  Location is good as‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ali Vaseghnia
Detailed Review: This hostel is a great value for money and is located in one of the busiest neighborhoods of Delhi.   The rooms are quite small, and the bathroom is even smaller. Though the beds are comfortable.   The only real problem is derived from the hostel‚Äôs location! Being in the bazaar means lots of noise from the streets until late night.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Harry
Review: Happy with what we got for the price we paid
Detailed Review: Happy with what we got for the price we paid. Very helpful staff! Got us sorted with SIM cards no trouble. It‚Äôs right in the middle of Paharganj Ganj, so if you want to experience the craziness of Delhi firsthand, it‚Äôs awesome.
