Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Pauline O
Detailed Review: We stayed at the Colonel's Retreat for a couple of nights in February 2019 while touring Delhi.  The hosts are actively involved in welcoming every guest and seeing to their daily needs.  The staff is great.  The rooms are very nice.  The rooftop dining is awesome and the is the best we have had during a 35 day tour of India.  We would definitely stay here again.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Philip W
Review: A quiet and comfortable homestay, highly recommended.
Detailed Review: We stayed two nights at the Colonel‚Äôs Retreat at the start of a 3 week trip in India. It was a lovely place to stay, a nice room, comfortable bed, clean and spacious. Good shower in the ensuite bathroom. There was a cold spell in Delhi at the time of our stay, and they had provided a heater in the room, which was very welcome. There is also a lounge area where we were able to sit with our travelling companions in the evening after dinner. The staff were friendly and helpful and attentive. The rooftop terrace restaurant was excellent, with lovely food for breakfast and an excellent evening meal. The afternoon tea was also a nice treat. Colonel‚Äôs Retreat is a quiet and comfortable homestay, and I would highly recommend it.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: lanawaterlily
Detailed Review: Great customer service. Got picked up from the airport late in the evening. Had a lovely meal when  I settled into the room.  Back to the airport the next day. Left an item at the hotel. Was in communication with the hotel who  came up with a great solution to getting the item to me upon my return to Delhi.  Can be frustrating as didn‚Äôt reply to my emails.   Would recommend this place.  Lift on premises which makes luggage easy.  Thank you

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Segaria226
Detailed Review: We stayed two nights. It‚Äôs in quite a good location not far from Lodi gardens and only around 25 minutes to New Delhi station. There is access to the metro a few minutes walk away and amenities nearby (10 mins walk) at Defence Market such as restaurants. Also not far from the shops of South Extension.   The place itself is a converted house on an estate of quiet streets spread over four floors with a roof terrace. Each floor has a lounge area and some en-suite rooms. The rooms were comfortable if fairly basic compared to a hotel. The rooms were a little cold at the time of year we visited.   The best thing about the place was the excellent food served on the roof terrace in the evening. We were told we would have to book food in advance but didn‚Äôt - however when we arrived they‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: frankp94
Review: Very "basic" room but the food was delicious
Detailed Review: My wife and I stayed 1 night at the Colonel's Retreat.  To be fair, we arrived at around midnight, but had a very poor "welcome".  There was no food, lounge, or comfortable place to relax and minimal staff available.  The room was very small with just enough room for the double bed.  I will say, that in the morning, we had a delicious breakfast on the room patio which is the reason I gave it poor rather than a terrible rating.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Shirley S
Detailed Review: Our very 1st night stay was at the Colonels Retreat and everything was excellent. The staff were very helpful, the food was very good and the rooms were very comfortable. A good base for both Old Delhi and New Delhi.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: 22Penelope
Review: A quiet little place with a lovely littlle rooftop!
Detailed Review: This was not quite what we expected (the photos on the website are a bit flattering compared to our actual room) but a peaceful little place, room adequate, had a heater as it was unusually cold when we were there. Staff all very helpful and the food, served on the little rooftop (with the necessary blankets and patio heaters) was all freshly cooked and excellent.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Nip
Review: A peaceful stay out of the chaos of the city for 2 nights.
Detailed Review: Not quite what we'd expected when we arrived but our room was clean and comfortable, with a heater as well as it was a bit chilly for the time of year.  Food is served on the roof terrace with heaters and blankets as required, and whilst only a small menu, the food is excellent and all freshly cooked.  Staff are very friendly and efficient.  Would happily recommend to anyone wanting a stop over in a quiet part of town.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Andrew T
Detailed Review: This was our first visit to India and the Colonel‚Äôs Retreat provides a perfect way to ease yourself into to the City. The owners and the staff were fantastic as was the food and the service. The rooms are lovely and comfortable and immaculately clean. Simply can‚Äôt fault it - and the banana bread really is amazing.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Doris
Review: 3 days in Delhi with my 2 daughters
Detailed Review: Everything nice, just one thing to mention, the door to the terrasse could not be closed properly, even if they tried twice. Clean, nice stuff, nice room, hot water, electric heating, free Wlan, indian breakfast.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Dianemaytime
Detailed Review: Stayed in this hotel for two nights while seeing the sights surrounding Delhi including India gate and the new memorial to the soldiers lost in the last two wars.  The staff here were very helpful and all spoke good English. Their restaurant was very good and the waiters very experienced about western tastes. I would visit again.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jessica D
Detailed Review: We stayed at Hotel Ajanta for a few nights whilst visiting Delhi. The hotel is fine - clean etc. but in a questionably area with little around for the evening which means unless you take a tuk tuk you need to dine in the hotel (food is average). We also had one horrendous experience whereby workmen were undertaking some renovation work outside our room until 1am!! There were many complaints from all guests the next morning partly because despite repeated calls to the reception they refused to ask the workmen to return to complete the work the next day. To be clear the renovation was inside the hotel so this could easily be done. Staff were not very helpful during this whole incident. That said there is an on-site travel agency, Friends Travel who are great. Mr Rashid assisted us‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Detailed Review: Im sorry but our experience did not match the reviews here, on arrival we were taken to our room which seemed to be being cleaned, he then took us upstairs to another room , said we could have this room if we liked it, it had no window and was stinking of gloss paint.  We asked if we could please have the room we booked as it had a balcony.  We were then taken to room number 3 and told our original room was inhabitable due to a smell and we were offered a 10% refund.  We accepted the room as it had a balcony, the room was ok but the street outside was filthy ,noisy and the balcony also was filthy.  The bed was not fresh, the headboard greasy looking and just under par on the whole, also no hot water! I would not recommend nor would I return, the food was not so nice either.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Lindsay Z
Detailed Review: The desk staff here was very helpful and nice. They helped us arrange taxi‚Äôs, held packages, and determine our train tickets.   The place was fine for what we needed: a couple of overnights in New Delhi without crazy western hotel prices for a room we‚Äôd barely be in.   It was very difficult to get in touch with them in advance. We had scheduled airport pickup and had travel changes and attempted to change it, but with no responses for days. We ended up taking a taxi from the airport, but know if something comes up last minute, the email is not regularly checked.   To say the hotel was 3 stars would be generous. The hotel was most certainly 3 stars years ago, but has been neglected for years. The listing pictures are old and not an accurate representation of the current state of‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Rosa L
Detailed Review: The room was clean and with all basic services as wifi, tv and hair dryer. Kind staff. The restaurant is one of the best I have tried in India. Reception staff also can help you in renting a taxi/driver.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Hotshot47150
Detailed Review: We ended up here at the last minute after a bad experience at another hotel. They took us in, gave us a beautiful clean comfortable  room with breakfast included. The manager, Zahoor Baktoo made sure we were comfortable and arranged a day tour of Delhi for us. The staff were friendly and accommodating, the food was delicious ( thank you Anand, our waiter). The team at Hotel Ajanta turned our visit to New Delhi from a potential disaster into a an enjoyable and happily memorable trip.  We can‚Äôt thank you enough!

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Artur M
Review: Helpful people working inside/Good hotel to stay for a few days
Detailed Review: Was staying with a group of people in Ajanta hotel for few days. Some rooms are better than others, but overall good to stay for few days. Breakfast was quite good too, there was a variety of meals to choose from. Reception crew stays helpful 24/7. Most importantly, there is a nice guy named Rashid who works near the lobby in IncredibleIndia office. He helped us with the ticket booking, suggested good ideas. A wise and pleasant man to talk with.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Global54300428062
Detailed Review: Was Excellent and the room service was better . Further staff was very humble. Secondly it was nice staying was peaceful.  Best rate and good service location easy transportation available. Thanks for cooperating.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Pioneer21450452786
Detailed Review: As usual I had a good stay at Hotel Ajanta. Staff is attentive and give good service. The location is good and the rooms are clean and nice. For a hotel in this price range it is very good. Their complementary pic-up service from the airport is an extra attraction. Good and effective.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sach
Detailed Review: Had been to this property many times, centrally located. Decent staff. Except standard other categories have a nice spacious, clean rooms. Superior hits the list. Don't have varied options in breakfast. They should improve on it. The staff of room service  needs to b upgraded, As they r way lower to 3 standard category of hotel. Plz improve on it.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Carlos C
Review: Best hotel in India in the heart of New Delhi
Detailed Review: Great hotel in the center of New Delhi and much higher standard than in all other regular hotels in India. Breakfast was simple but sufficient. Personal was kind and great. Rooms were very clean and has everything needed.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Showtime
Detailed Review: Tucked away on a side street is a real gem of a higher end budget hotel. With free airport pickup (except the parking fee150 inr) and an included breakfast buffet. The hotel Ajanta offers relatively quick customer service and in house room service. Prices were reasonable though maybe a little bit high for India. But well worth it for the convenience.  The room was more like a large bedroom than a hotel room. The bathroom was narrow but the shower was good sized.   Ok fair warning this is INDIA there is constant horns honking and dogs barking all night and day. You will hear it. Accept it and move on.  We will be back again in a few weeks as we conclude our adventure.   I‚Äôd say give Ajanta a try use it as a base to explore Delhi.   Oh one other tip. There is a nice bakery with‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: TheBarkingOwl
Review: Good location, little things need to improve.
Detailed Review: Stayed with a family of 4 for 3 nights in Feb 2019. Upon checkin there was only one towel in room, and one bed was missing a doona. The room was clean and comfortable and is well located. Restaurant was good, although a bit pricey for the area but there were plenty of other restaurants close by (check out laneways behind hotel). Outside noise was a big negative, the room we were in was not very soundproof and there was dogs barking most of the night, along with normal street noise. Staff were very friendly.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sonia
Detailed Review: Good hotel to stay and relax in the heart of New Delhi. The hotel is also affordable and nice place to stay and relax and enjoy. Can plan a visit here if you are in New Delhi for a few days and be here to stay.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Frederic M
Review: Good place to stay in Delhi
Detailed Review: We booked Hotel Amax Inn when we came to Delhi to visit India. The staff is very friendly and especially helpfull. They organized for us a 15 days trip in Rajasthan, booked the hotels and the driver (excellent driver !). The hotel is a treaky street, but well situated near of the town center. Many thanks to Anil and his team for the nice trip we've made in India.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Michael
Detailed Review: The hotel itself is ok. The staff are friendly and will help with anything you need. Be warned, Paharganj is a slum.   As soon as you leave your hotel expect to be hassled by the majority of people. I wouldn‚Äôt wander around at night. My advice would be before you leave to see New Delhi have an idea where you are going and have an Uber/ola waiting outside for you.  However the hotel is decent enough. Has hot water and WiFi (WiFi doesn‚Äôt work in the rooms unfortunately) and the food is ok.  It‚Äôs just a shame about the location.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: anjan2mon
Detailed Review: I had visited New Delhi in the month of February for some work and stayed in Hotel Amax Inn for 8 nights, I booked the hotel for 4 nights 1st as I wanted to check the hotel but after staying I was pleased and then extended for next 4 nights in the same hotel.   Delhi is like my second hometown, I spend 15 years in Delhi. But this was my 1st visit after I moved out from Delhi, this time I was visiting for some work and need to stay at hotel in New Delhi, I wanted a hotel that has clean room with clean bathroom at same time room and bathroom with spacious area. After lot of search I found this hotel Amax Inn. The hotel is great neat and clean. The food served by the hotel is also good and tasty too.  The room at the 4th floor are best since there is open space where one can spend‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: snodonia
Detailed Review: Turned up and they'd given my room to someone else. I booked a deluxe double room, and I got a 4bedded dorm (see pic). They then tried to charge extra because they usually make more money off 4ppl from the dorm!  They also charge 800rs for airport pickup and it's only 400rs by taxi. Get the taxi from the booth that says Delhi police. Then ignore the 'porter'.  Misrepresentations: -not modern or new -i got my double room eventually but the air conditioning was dated and not working, neither was the shower -there is only WiFi at reception, room WiFi does not connect -there is no restaurant on the top floor -it is very dirty  Also Paharganj is a bit of a slum so be warned! It's interesting and I liked it but its not for everyone. Also all the massage place here are for something‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Hilary G
Detailed Review: Arrived and had to wait for a while to get into room. Very dark room, window looked out to a wall a foot away.  Shower good, Mimi bar! Was mouldy fridge.  Checking out very difficult. Could not take credit card as machine apparently not working !

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Mshawan123
Detailed Review: Very good servic, nice clean room with very attentive staff. We love the food they served us on the roofto.  Food was very tasty, also good chat with other tourist. Good arrangement for booking train tickets and other tours. Will come back soon Thanks Amax

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ananra
Detailed Review: The hotel is at perfect location just walkable from New Delhi railway station.  The rooms are clean with upgraded bathrooms. The staff is welcoming and helpful. The roof top is good choice for food for breakfast and dinner.  Recommended place for travellers looking for good place for best price.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sonia
Detailed Review: Good hotel to stay and relax in the heart of New Delhi. The hotel is also affordable and nice place to stay and relax and enjoy. Can plan a visit here if you are in New Delhi for a few days and be here to stay.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Frederic M
Review: Good place to stay in Delhi
Detailed Review: We booked Hotel Amax Inn when we came to Delhi to visit India. The staff is very friendly and especially helpfull. They organized for us a 15 days trip in Rajasthan, booked the hotels and the driver (excellent driver !). The hotel is a treaky street, but well situated near of the town center. Many thanks to Anil and his team for the nice trip we've made in India.

As soon as you leave your hotel expect to be hassled by the majority of people. I wouldn‚Äôt wander around at night. My advice would be before you leave to see New Delhi have an idea where you are going and have an Uber/ola waiting outside for you.  However the hotel is decent enough. Has hot water and WiFi (WiFi doesn‚Äôt work in the rooms unfortunately) and the food is ok.  It‚Äôs just a shame about the location.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Mshawan123
Detailed Review: Very good servic, nice clean room with very attentive staff. We love the food they served us on the roofto.  Food was very tasty, also good chat with other tourist. Good arrangement for booking train tickets and other tours. Will come back soon Thanks Amax

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ananra
Detailed Review: The hotel is at perfect location just walkable from New Delhi railway station.  The rooms are clean with upgraded bathrooms. The staff is welcoming and helpful. The roof top is good choice for food for breakfast and dinner.  Recommended place for travellers looking for good place for best price.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Freja M
Detailed Review: Before I hated the times I had to go to Delhi. Now - after I found the jewel Jugaad - I completely changed my mind. I love it!! Jugaad is the best hostel I ever stayed, with always so helpful staff, beautiful common areas, a breathtaking rooftop and spotless rooms. I‚Äôve stayed in both the female dorm and in a private room and I have no complaints. The traveldesk - with nice Salman - is such a good thing to have on hand. Go and stay here!

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Nori
Review: Perfect hostel in hassle free area
Detailed Review: Had a convenient stay at this hostel! Location is perfect in friendly area, 15min walk to closest metro station but many available tuktuks.  Helpful staff and possibility to buy a simcard for only 500 rp.  Room was nice, clean and quiet.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: kathinkasop
Review: Great Stay in Delhi for single travellers!
Detailed Review: I had a great experience in Jugaad Hostel. The common rooms are really nice, especially the rooftop terrace. The rooms were fine and clean, just don't expect too much comfort or privacy in the shared rooms. The beds are good and do it for one or two nights. The staff is super friendly and helpful :) and it's a great place to meet other travellers... All in all it was a really nice stay and I would recommend it to any backpacking not high maintenance traveller

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Silvana P
Detailed Review: I really enjoyed my stay here and the staff did everything they could to make my experience memorable, helping me organize my stay in Delhi, as well as my Golden Triangle tour, buy a sim card, book train tickets and so on. Thanks for everything Salman!

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Intaier
Review: Sita had better stay on Lanka, I believe
Detailed Review: I was mostly NOT pleased with my stay with that hostel.   Good sides: this is a hostel neatly designed for backpackers and international young travellers. The design of the rooms, dorms, private rooms and common room... (*loft-sryle) was quite nice. There are books in common room, free supply of coffee, tea and sugar. Breakfast is included. From the FIRST glance (impression) reception staff people are helpful and friendly.  I'm also thankful for a receprion employee (young man with black earring and sikh bracelet) who was very generous to answer my religious request and placed picture of Shiva with FULL parivat(family) (not only with bala Ganesh, but with Karthik Swamy too!!) on one of the walls.  This was inportant sign of *hindu* (followers of Sanatana Dharma) space & special‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Emily F
Review: Reviews very misleading; fine if you are looking for very basic accommodations only
Detailed Review: I am writing this review not because I had a particularly horrific time at the Smyle Inn, but because I rely pretty heavily on Tripadvisor when travelling and have never been so shocked by the discrepancy between reviews and reality.   Make no mistake, this is a 1-star property with nothing special added. I feel like the reviews made this place sound like a hidden gem that was a great bang for your buck. In reality, it's super basic, not overly clean, and not in a great area (although neighborhood is obviously subjective based on what you are looking for). If you are looking for a cheap bed with a roof over your head and don't care about anything else, then this will suit your needs, but don't read reviews thinking you will get any more than just that.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jamie
Detailed Review: When we first arrived we had an issue with our booking. This was quickly and politely resolved. Very happy so far.  Apart from the tens of bugs roaming around in the bathroom, the room seemed fine.  Next morning we awoke to loud banging and talking coming from the hallway! There were men doing construction work right outside our room. Not exactly the start of the day we were expecting.  For some unknown reason there wasn't a phone in our room (top floor). So we went down to place our breakfast order with reception at 10:00. 50 minutes passed with no sign of any food and we had to check out in 10 minutes!  When I went downstairs to ask where our breakfast was, I was told that orders have to be placed before 10:30 and that they would not be giving us breakfast. They could only‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Emily F
Review: Very helpful staff and great value
Detailed Review: I am writing this review not because I had a particularly horrific time at the Smyle Inn, but because I rely pretty heavily on Tripadvisor when travelling and have never been so shocked by the discrepancy between reviews and reality.   Make no mistake, this is a 1-star property with nothing special added. I feel like the reviews made this place sound like a hidden gem that was a great bang for your buck. Name: Jamie
Review: Happy with what we got for the price we paid

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: NotttinghamJak
Detailed Review: Spent a couple of nights at this treasure of a place situated in a smart part of town . Each floor has its own attractively furnished day area servicing the bedrooms on that floor. Our room was spacious with good quality bed linen and accessories. The housekeeping everywhere was to a very high standard . The meals, all served on the terrace were delicious both in presentation and flavour . Staff were really great too. Super stay all round .

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Haveyougotthemap
Detailed Review: This was our first accommodation of many on our Indian Adventure. We were not disappointed despite the unexpected rain and cold temperatures. All meals were taken on the outside roof terrace. Service was excellent and the owners presence to explain our choices was most welcome. I can't comment on the neighbourhood as we were collected and delivered back to the door, but it seemed pleasant. The rooms were as expected with bottled water provided. The bathroom was spacious. There is a lift but not quite to the roof terrace, where a short set of marble stairs leads to the dining area.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Tomoko
Detailed Review: Our first place to stay in India, located in south of Delhi, a nice quiet neighbourhood and it is safe to walk in the evening.( we had a lovely dinner at Defence colony market, apx.10 minute walk, a few restaurants there)  As Delhi is so busy and noisy, it was nice to come back to a quiet place at the end of the day. A room is spacious and there was an electric heater to kept us warm.( it was colder than average year in January) All the staff were helpful and friendly, we enjoyed eating on the roof terrace watching the sun set. Dinner was very tasty, and breakfast was lovely too. Recommend to anyone who wants to stay away from hustle and bustle of the city.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jambalya1
Detailed Review: Our bedrooms looked nothing like the photos, they were small and dark.  We arrived with no information on Delhi and asked the staff to call us a taxi so we could explore. They said something about waiting for the owner, who turned up four hours later.  We ate in the hotel because we had gone out to find a taxi and a restaurant and got soaked in the process. The food in the hotel was 1000 rupees even for a veg biriani! Breakfast on the terrace was cold as the heaters they used only warmed the tops of our heads. Our rooms  on the ground floor by the entrance were noisy inspite of the owner telling us everyone was in we could hear the lift going and people dragging suitcases past our room at 3am. Not a great experience.  This hotel was booked as a part of tour and  I have no idea‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: scrappying
Detailed Review: when we arrived, it was in the evening.  the place advertises that it's in the heart of the city and close to the metro. just by looking around the area, I didn't feel comfortable venturing on my own here.  It's just a bunch of buildings surrounded by busy roads. there's an elevator here.  still there are a few steps to get to the first floor.  the whole place is four stories.  the layout is the same on all levels.  I wish the agent told us what to expect here.  I accidentally walked into someone else's room because I wasn't aware that it was one of those places where the room is yours but you share the living room/computer/dining area/kitchen.   place is clean.  there's a lot of storage for your clothes and suitcase.  the lock to the cabinets are a bit annoying to use as they‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: NipaT
Review: A great choice and very good value for money
Detailed Review: It takes around 40 minutes from the airport to reach the Colonel's. I stayed there with my family for 2 nights in January. The surrounding area is a quiet safe suburb. It is 5 minutes walk to the nearby market place where you can find some shops and restaurants. Our room at the hotel was on the 1st floor. It was decorated with wooden, Indian style, furniture. The room was quiet, clean and comfortable and even the extra bed was already in place and fitted in rather nicely. The washroom was modern and spacious. There were brand new fluffy towels and no water spilt from the shower to the floor.  Upon arrival, we were greeted with a cup of tea and cakes, which was just the thing we needed. We did not feel the homely atmosphere during our stay though. The staff members were polite‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: PhileaFoggg
Detailed Review: Found a gem with this place! Central location, very comfortable, clean and cozy rooms. A beautiful terrace to have breakfast at with home made bread and jams! Everyone is super friendly and hospitable!

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Velama
Detailed Review: Stayed in family room - no sleep on both nights due to dogs barking from streets, and also deliveries during night time. suggest hotel to install secondary glazing.  No bath mats in bathroom  A/c: not central air-condition and had to ask reception for heaters to keep the room warm.  Positive: rooms recently refurbished and well made up.  Location - fantastic

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Eva & Teddy
Review: Great Experience on one-month India trip
Detailed Review: We stayed at the beginning of our India Trip at the Hotel Ajanta and made good experiences. The rooms were clean, the beds new and the Employees were attentive.   Included in the Hotel Ajanta is the Travel Agency India Tours, where we booked an arrangement for almost one month travelling around India. Mister Rashid from the Travel Agency did a great job in organizing a 16-day-trip through Rajasthan and afterwards to Ranthambore (and yes, we were lucky and saw the Tiger at the Safari!), Agra, Varanasi, Khajuraho and Amritsar. On this tour everything was well organized, so we just could enjoy the journey and the landscapes. During the Tour, Mister Rashid was always available for us and was asking from time to time, whether everything is ok or whether we need something. We thank‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: JFK777
Detailed Review: I hated going to this place but for my wife‚Äôs suggestion. The dirty roads, dusty winds, narrow road, busy traffic.were some of my reasons... But I‚Äôm glad I came here, for it‚Äôs where real Delhi is. Yes, all that I listed above... This is value for money and in close proximity to the city. Spacious rooms, fine furniture and comfy bed. But the plumbing is a disaster and you have to keep on calling for help to turn a tap, flush, shower - on or off. Beautifully painted. Cosy restaurant downstairs.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: shoutaloud
Detailed Review: The Good: Restaurant is very good and made my food not spicy to order. The bathroom was very clean and shower hot with good pressure.  The bed was comfortable. The room had a small refrigerator. It was nice to have table and chairs. We may have had one of the nicer rooms in the hotel on the 3rd floor. They held our luggage during the day since our flight was at night, and later on let us freshen up and use the bathroom in a small room on the ground floor. That was very helpful.  The Bad: Our room was on street-side and very noisy in the morning with lots of traffic, and at night with many dogs barking. The two single-size comforters (for a double bed) looked grungy. They were not sparkling white and made us wonder when they had last been washed, though the sheets were clean.‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sukumar S
Review: Satisfactory stay , but a bit costly
Detailed Review: Nice and clean Rooms. Booked a suite and stayed for a day. The ambiance in the room was awesome & the decor is quite good. Reception is very helpful and the check-in process was smooth. But no complimentary water bottles provided, even in the suite room. Also, I had to constantly remind the housekeeping staff to provide towels, doormat, and toiletries. Even after several reminders doormat was still not provided. Need to rectify the housekeeping staff response time very much. The cushions on the lounger were torn and not proper. The toilet pot was dirty and had paan stains, for which I had to especially call the housekeeping and get it cleaned. The hotel should get the rooms thoroughly checked before handing it over to the guests. The housekeeping staff mocked me when I asked for‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Nicola
Detailed Review: Very helpful staff and professional  guys on the Travel Desk who sorted a driver in Delhi and Mr Singh who took us to Agra and back. The hotels  restaurant is good and their coffee shop across the road has great coffee and brownies!

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: hinchan
Detailed Review: As usual I‚Äôm back again to this boutique hotel because I have great faith in their services rendered. I stayed here many a times whenever I visit Delhi, always it‚Äôs the beginning or the end of my Hindustan holidays. I‚Äôm glad that some of the staffs can still recognised me! The hotel offered free taxi service to their customers from the airport to the hotel that I truly appreciate.  Upon reaching the hotel, I was assigned room 219 that I‚Äôm truly satisfied. I paid 2400 rupees per night for a single deluxe room. There are complimentary teas and coffees. Electric kettle and fridge are also available. Even though I don‚Äôt understand much Hindu, but I still enjoyed some of the programmes being shown in the TV. Whenever I‚Äôm back to the hotel, the hot shower is always available. The bed‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: maria s
Detailed Review: Thanks to the hotel and specially to Santosh and all the staff that helped us so much. I was travelling with my elderly parents and the patient and help were very important for us. I recommend the hotel, it is in good location near Main Bazaar but it a better street with restaurants.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Happiness60067
Detailed Review: We stayed as a family of 6 and we couldn't be happier. The service was good particularly the tour company rep Mr Rashid went out of his way to help us re our choice of destinations and places to visit. Very accommodating and persinaliaed service by him , worth visiting Ajanta and then booking a tour from them. We did 2 triangle tours at awesome costs and the adventures are our best memories.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Parbs
Detailed Review: I stayed at this hotel twice with my parents and 2 young children and would say it's a good hotel, not great but probably one of the better ones in Pahargunj.  The staff at this hotel are very good, and by this I mean room service and door men.  When we came to this hotel the first time round we were made to wait for ages, so be prepared as front desk are super disorganized in the afternoons and busy periods. They will however offer tea and biscuits which is nice.   Unfortunately for us the first time we stayed the lift kept breaking down and they took over a day to fix it; this annoyed us as my father is elderly.  The breakfast buffet is 200 per person but isnt all that. The tea here is lovely, the toast often stale.  In terms of cleanliness I'd say they are clean. If you have‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Aks2na
Detailed Review: We stayed there 6 days with my family.My family enjoy there stay in Amax Inn. The staff and the owner was very helpful. They have a service of local tours.The room was clean and the bath room was more clean than the room.They have a open roof top restaurant. I will come back again to this place. Big thums up for them.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Florence M
Detailed Review: I stayed 3 weeks at Amax in and it has been perfect. Always very helpfull with any guidance. The price and the quality are super. The food is very good and never got sick from it. I really recomende and will come back. Thank you to all Amax time.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: gareth90m
Detailed Review: Bedding and towels were damp on check-in and the replacements were also damp. Friendly staff who kept asking if they could help by booking taxis or trains but when we asked them to do this they weren't interested as we could get it cheaper elsewhere. Poor nights sleep due to dogs barking all night and pigeons nesting on the window ledges making noise all night long.The rooms are not really as nice as they are in the hotel pictures. WiFi worked well and the food in the upstairs restaurant was excellent, very tasty food.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Mahdi Jafari
Review: Safe, Affordable, good management and always in service
Detailed Review: I had a good experience in Amax Inn Hotel it was really good to me when I saw their hostilities and services.   Their food was also delicious and I found it really nice and affordable thanks again for everything.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Anshu
Detailed Review: Its a simple small hotel and value for money. Was here for  1 night only and that too most of the time was out. Rooms are compact but comfortable. If your on budget and dont mind room size then stay here. Friendly service.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Surendra J
Detailed Review: I had stay this  place with my small family. The rooms are super  clean and service  is very  good.  The staff always  ready  to help. Great  food on rooftop and it's cheap too. You  can have chats with another  tourist  I recommend  this hotel Will come back soon

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sashika H
Detailed Review: Not the fanciest stay by any means, but for the price we paid was comfortable and suited all our purposes. Our room was clean, and we were provided with towels. It's not the easiest place to find but our driver managed to ask around - it's tucked away in a laneway. The restaurant at the top was good and was cheap! The staff there were nice but were slightly intimidating as there were 5 men just standing around (note it was me and another female traveller - so it was a bit weird, but it might just be an India thing haha!) Overall, given our late night arrival, it was a decent stay for the one night we were there.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: scottday
Detailed Review: I have been a customer of Hotel Amax Inn for many many years. There is good reasons I keep coming back, again and again. The service and facilities are top notch for the category. The staff is happy to provide advice about the city, with a smile. I‚Äôve stayed for a week and for long periods, the quality Of service never wavers. The facilities are clean and everything works, if there is ever a problem it Is quickly solved. Security is rock solid. Great value for your money, and they do everything they can to make your visit memorable. You can reserve knowing you will be well and truly looked after. I look forward to visiting Hotel Amax Inn again, the staff have become like family. They are the best. Enjoy your visit.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Samar786
Detailed Review: I am back in Amax Inn after long time.  Its same quality of the Room.  The Rooms are clean and well decorated. The bathrooms are super clean.  The staff is helpful and adjustable.  The reception is welcoming. Mr.  Anil is available for your help to sort out your problems.  Coming back soon.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Aks2na
Detailed Review: We stayed there 6 days with my family.My family enjoy there stay in Amax Inn. The staff and the owner was very helpful. They have a service of local tours.The room was clean and the bath room was more clean than the room.They have a open roof top restaurant. I will come back again to this place. Big thums up for them.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Florence M
Detailed Review: I stayed 3 weeks at Amax in and it has been perfect. Always very helpfull with any guidance. The price and the quality are super. The food is very good and never got sick from it. I really recomende and will come back. Thank you to all Amax time.

Poor nights sleep due to dogs barking all night and pigeons nesting on the window ledges making noise all night long.The rooms are not really as nice as they are in the hotel pictures. WiFi worked well and the food in the upstairs restaurant was excellent, very tasty food.

Detailed Review: I had a good experience in Amax Inn Hotel it was really good to me when I saw their hostilities and services.   Their food was also delicious and I found it really nice and affordable thanks again for everything.

The facilities are clean and everything works, if there is ever a problem it Is quickly solved. Security is rock solid. Great value for your money, and they do everything they can to make your visit memorable. You can reserve knowing you will be well and truly looked after. I look forward to visiting Hotel Amax Inn again, the staff have become like family. They are the best. Enjoy your visit.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Samar786
Detailed Review: I am back in Amax Inn after long time.  Its same quality of the Room.  The Rooms are clean and well decorated. The bathrooms are super clean.  The staff is helpful and adjustable.  The reception is welcoming. Mr.  Anil is available for your help to sort out your problems.  Coming back soon.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: FStockman
Detailed Review: I was only at Jugaad hostel for 1 night but can honestly say it was a very positive experience.  The roof top is the perfect setting for a good time and rooms were also clean. You can make free chai anytime and play your own music on their speakers.  But most of all, they helped me post a package back home to Australia and even covered the difference in costs that were unexpected at the time. Because I had already left the hostel by the time this discrepancy was identified, they covered the costs and allowed me to pay them back via bank transfer. WHAT LEGENDS!

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Emdocmac
Detailed Review: Needed a place to crash between late night flight and early morning train to Taj. Worked out perfectly. Very accessable staff via phone or email and even forgot something there they immediately grabbed it for us on put it on hold until we can back through. Great value.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Vero
Detailed Review: Had a great stay at Jugaad, the roof terrace is cozy and big, good to chill out in hectic Delhi. The staff is also super helpful, especially Sid is a great guy, helped me out loads. Definitely recommended & definitely gonna be back!! Big love

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: O6013PMcamilled
Detailed Review: Scary neighborhood when you arrive at dark but okay during the day.  Clean beds, nice staff and helpful.  Breakfast is included but basic.  Bathrooms and shower were not clean and toilet paper always missing (had to ask the front every time using the bathroom but always okay to get some)  Easier to get Uber if walking down to the bigger street.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sohail Kapadia
Detailed Review: Mr Aalam at the reception and the rest of the staff were resourceful during my stay. They helped me with all my queries (as it was my first visit to Delhi) and also provided excellent room service.  Overall a good place to stay if you're new in Delhi.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Primestop
Review: Quirky and ideally located 5 mins from New Delhi rail station
Detailed Review: Just off Main Bazaar, so in a really vibrant area.  This is a budget hotel and like many in Delhi it's basic it's got everything that's needed.  Helpful staff.  Good street food very close to the hotel.  It's good enough that I'm going back on the final night of my tour.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sundarraj534242
Detailed Review: Dear team , I stayed in this hotel for 2 days with my family , Excellent hotel rooms,good service and communication of staff,for children special care was taken ,Hotel owner himself helps us if any help needed.I would always recommend this hotel. 5 stars for the same.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Viaje Connosco
Detailed Review: It's a great hostel. Amazing location in midle of Main Bazar. The staff is very kindless and they have delicious breakfast. They provide a lunch or dinner if you want. And another things to travel in India.  Amazing experience.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sohail Kapadia
Detailed Review: Mr Aalam at the reception and the rest of the staff were resourceful during my stay. They helped me with all my queries (as it was my first visit to Delhi) and also provided excellent room service.  Overall a good place to stay if you're new in Delhi.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jennifer W
Review: Relaxing/Enjoyable Experience in the heart of Delhi
Detailed Review: We found Colonel's retreat to be a perfect choice for 3 days in Delhi. The property and neighborhood are quiet and enjoyable (unique for Delhi)! The staff, breakfast and rooms are excellent. It was an easy walk to the Lajpat Nagar metro stop, which we found to be the best way to get around, and Defence Colony Market is nearby with many good restaurants and a great grocery store with wine! Recommended if you're looking for a great place to stay in Delhi!

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Joanna
Detailed Review: Like coming home...... I love the food too, with great breakfasts up on the roof, comfy beds and super helpful staff, this is always a haven in busy Delhi. I would highly recommend it and can't wait for my next trip!!

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: LONDONSEM
Detailed Review: This is the fourth time we have stayed at the Colonels Retreat and yet again the service, the comfort and the staff have been absolutely outstanding. Very conveniently placed neat Lajpat Nagar Metro Station and also the Defence Colony Market it offers a convenient location as a base to visit Delhi and its surrounding NCR area. The home food and baking add a welcoming extra to a sumptuous breakfast and food offering. Staff is unerringly helpful and welcoming and have a personal touch. The rooms and facilities are of very high quality and have been tastefully decorated. Recommend highly to anyone for a short or long stay.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: SingBob7
Review: Cosy place to stay - Clean and comfortable
Detailed Review: A nice place to stay in New Delhi- cosy, comfortable and clean.   Mr. Aravind, who greeted us when we arrived was professional in checking us in swiftly. The entire stay for 4 nights was enjoyable. The breakfast, except for the banana cake was insipid.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Lou G
Detailed Review: Best decision to stay here.  Rooms are spotless and the bed very comfortable.  The staff are all lovely.  The food is exceptional - breakfast thali and a wonderful dinner menu, all served on the peaceful roof terrace.  The hotel is in Block D - a peaceful and safe suburb. We travelled to all sites within 20 minutes on a rickshaw - budget around 120 rupees, and Defence Colony is a 8 min stroll... walk and enjoy the atmosphere.  Many amazing restaurants at the Defence Market - and dessert from local institution The Bakery is not to be missed!

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Mumbaisouthie
Review: Well Organized Hotel in Paharganj ...Comfortable Stay
Detailed Review: Stayed with my Family for 4 nights , nice clean and cosy room , stayed in a Suite room which had 2 LED which was something unique as my Son was comfortable watching his channels and we enjoyed our shows when relaxing in the room . Breakfast buffet was also great for us just that it becomes repetitive if you have a long stay. most important is the travel desk where you have vehicle made available within 30 minutes whenever required and found all the driver's nice soul .Tour guidance and arrangement is well planned and well managed .Front desk was always cooperative for any information sharing ,also they helped me with an early check-in and allowed me a late check-out when requested .   Restaurant is running through out the day and available late night as well with room service . ‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: ANINDYA MITRA
Detailed Review: our room was superior deluxe room... staff service is awesome... prices are very reasonable.., food is awesome especially the buffet breakfast.... the next time we visit delhi we will surely stay at the ajanta hotel ....

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Fabio
Detailed Review: I booked directly by phone this hotel with Mr. Rashid, got a very deal with pick up at airport and day trip to Agra, food was nice, location perfectly since next day I had a train to catch early morning . Nearby you can find everything you wish , staff is very helpful and Rashid has a great heart , always ready to help out in case of any needs . Definitely recommended stay at the Ajanta hotel , rooms are perfectly clean and confortable .

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: FritzLu
Detailed Review: On arrival in december i booked for the 8 time hotel Ajanta in Delhi. This used to be a nice clean hotel, not far from main bazaar. This year my experience was bad, i think they lost it. Rooms are clean, but the restaurant is dirty, with unfriendly staff, breakfast is poor, most of the food on the menu card is not available. Just a coffee in the morning seems to be a problem, they send you to the other side of the street to drink youre morning coffee. For me it was the last time i booked this hotel Rooms: clean Food: bad Staff: unfriendly Cost: expencieve for what you get

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Nikola
Detailed Review: Overall excellent stay, very clean rooms excellent service, the hotel is currently located. Also we wanted packed breakfast another day tasty food sandwich was very nice. I recommended this hotel. I really enjoyed!

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Nir
Detailed Review: We enjoyed very much our stay at the hotel. Very nice and clean rooms. The location is great. Specialy, the tourist information and advise provided by Mr. Zahoor baktoo was very good and helpful. We highly recommening it.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Salaj4
Detailed Review: !! We stayed at Hotel during our recent trip. The hotel lived up to everything that they told us...perfect location and an amazing and friendly staff! Restaurant service is also very nice  Thank you  Gunjan

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: protishtha c
Detailed Review: We spend 3 nights and 4 days in this hotel. The location is absolutely great and all tourist spots are easily accessible. We were a group of 4 women. At no point did it feel unsafe or uncomfortable for us. The staff is absolutely great. They were constantly helping us and solving all our issues. All the facilities provided by this hotel were also very good. We would always choose this hotel in future whenever we're in Delhi, also recommend everyone the same.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Aigul K
Detailed Review: We stayed for 2 nights at the hotel, triple room on the 4th floor. It seems like foreigners mostly stay at upper floors while locals stay downstairs.  In terms of safety, I felt quite safe with the presence of foreigners at the hotel. There is a nice outside terrace at the hotel where you can order food. The food is not great but is very cheap. In terms of cleanliness it is okay, even though we did ask to change the sheets. The staff brought new sheets for us. The blankets didnt have sheets on them but when asked they provided extra sheets as well. There was no kettle but the staff provided that as well along with the hairdryer. You would probably guess that we were very pleased with the customer service. The staff are very accommodating. If we had to come back to this area we‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Mishfa
Detailed Review: One of the best hotels in Delhi. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Especially Mr. Anil. Make sure to meet him. He's genuinely interested in helping anyone. The food is awesome. Hats off to the chef. All in all, deserves a five star.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Vishal N
Detailed Review: We are really enjoy our time at Hotel Amax. Room and staff was excellent. Food quality was good. They have a rooftop restaurent where we enjoy our time. They provide a car for local city tour in reasionable price. Big thums up for them. We will come soon.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Payal B
Detailed Review: It was really a nice stay.We stay there 5 nights.It was only 500 mtr from newdelhi railway station.The room and bathroom was clean.Food of the restaurrent was good.The receptionist was nice and all the staff was polite to us.They are very helpfull.We want to stay again.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Heena C
Detailed Review: It was really a nice  place..awsome room feel like a home.good staf.fast service.testy and haigine food.best hotel in delhiüòò The are really very helpful and with good behave. I give them 10 out of 10. We really enjoy our stay.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ashish Dhalawat
Detailed Review: AWESOME EXPERIENCE  with Good Service . Helpful staff and mouth leaking Food. Clean and tidy surrounding  . Best for Any age of people . I would recommend to all of my contacts to visit this hotel whenever they are around Delhi.  Thanks and Regards

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Vijay C
Detailed Review: Ihad stayed in this hotel for three days. The room was very big in size, qnd bathroom was super clean, that is the most important thing in a hotel. The rooftop restaurant is good place to have Relax, and its a good point for meet other travellers. They provide very good quality food for cheap price. The front desk working 24 hours, ready to help always with a smile.  Good service and hotel. Will back soon Thanks Amax team

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Maulesh N
Detailed Review: Fantastic hotal,service,all staf are behive very nice... Food are also very nice... Delhi all are place near by in hotel... Please anybody's come to delhi one visit this Hotel. All facilities are available in hotel..

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Relax362526
Detailed Review: i am the regular customer of this hotel. The food quality is really good and it is located at heart of city. The behavior of all ground staff and management people is really good. I would like to visit it again and again.i request all of you to try for once at least.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: protishtha c
Detailed Review: We spend 3 nights and 4 days in this hotel. The location is absolutely great and all tourist spots are easily accessible. We were a group of 4 women. At no point did it feel unsafe or uncomfortable for us. The staff is absolutely great. They were constantly helping us and solving all our issues. All the facilities provided by this hotel were also very good. We would always choose this hotel in future whenever we're in Delhi, also recommend everyone the same.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: trekkingwithtracy
Detailed Review: We had a great stay at Jugaad Hostels and will probably stay one more time before we leave India. This was our first time in India, and it was a perfect place for a first stop. We stayed in a private room which is a bit more expensive than other hostels but it was worth it for the comfort of our stay and the staff‚Äôs knowledge and assistance with booking other travel in India. They helped us get local SIM cards set up at a place nearby (do not buy at the airport - way more expensive).  We joined in the hostel‚Äôs walking tour of Old Delhi which was a really cool experience. We don‚Äôt usually do walking tours but this one was great because it took us to places we might not venture to alone such as inside a Hindu temple and a Sikh temple. It was also great to eat different and tasty‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: lifew0rthliving
Detailed Review: Overall a good stay. The rooms were basic but clean. Cons: you have to let the front desk know when you want hot water and then wait about ten minutes, sometimes it worked sometimes it didn't. 2nd con: the front desk could have been a little more happy to be there. Seemed like they were a bit tired of working at a hostel. Pros: the man on the third floor that helps with booking tours around the city as well trains and busses is extremely helpful and was not too pushy. Just happy to help and offer suggestions.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Mario
Review: Comfy bed, clean room and great wifi
Detailed Review: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights and we liked our stay very much. The bed was spacious and comfortable, the room was clean, there was hot water in the bathroom and the wifi worked nicely. The location was convenient as we could easily walk to many touristic places and the staff were helpful and attentive. So all in all, we highly recommend this hotel.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Gabriela Alvarez - Caminito Amor
Detailed Review: What stands out of this place is that it is super well located near the Main Bazaar where you can find everything that you can need, the cleanliness of the room and the bathroom 10 points, the cozy bed you can have an excellent rest.  The personality of the hostel is great and funny has many pictures hung with phrases that raise your spirits.  Breakfast was delicious and healthy and absolutely everyone in the staff very polite and attentive for anything you need.  We will come back.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Pablo F
Review: We were stayed 1 night just amazing
Detailed Review: Since we arrived they were so kind. The room was very clean, towels included. Breakfast included too. There is a common big roof to meet another travelers and chill out. They on third floor an office to give you any information you need about India. It was very helpful for us because they helped us to book train tickets, change money, and make a little plan about our trip in India. They are worry about you have a good stay in India which is so good üòä I would really recommend it. We‚Äôll come back!

Detailed Review: Overall a good stay. The rooms were basic but clean.
