Name: jc19742015
Detailed Review: Excellent value for money. Staff is very well behaved and accommodative. Food is good and rightly priced. Wifi is free and has excellent connectivity in rooms. Overall a very nice experience. Every time I visit Delhi I stay at Amax Inn

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: sultan k
Detailed Review: I Visited many times to delhi  but am not satisfied with hotels  when i got a hotel Amax inn  i think its end my unsatisfied hotel journey Now i finally got a satisfied hotels  i really enjoyed a room service  very good staff and helpfull staff Now Am very happy .........Thank you

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Kathy T
Detailed Review: We stayed here when arriving in Delhi for the first time.  Nice welcome from staff.  It is up an alley but don‚Äôt worry, hotel is nice and clean.  Staff are attentive. I don‚Äôt think we were given the nicest of rooms but it was still clean.  Food was lovely and tasty. It was a busy and vibrant location not far from central metro station.  We did try to walk it but got lost so hindsight we should have just jumped a Tuk tuk from the metro.  Metro from the airport is absolutely brilliant.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Lalte K
Detailed Review: We had stayed here with our families . The kids really enjoyed with atmosphere. The Rooms are clean and modern . The bathrooms are hygienic and clean. The rooftop was good spot for delicious food. We are coming back soon.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: sm a
Detailed Review: I stayed that hotel for one night with my friends.I got it online and I read good reviews  about them on trip advisor.That is true they  are excellent. There room was clean and perfect. The stuff was very polite to us. They have a rooftop restaurant where I had our dinner. Food quality  was nice. It not so far from New Delhi Railway Station. In this trip I stayed many hotels but Amax was Amazing.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: drp277
Review: The only hostel I will stay when I'm in Delhi
Detailed Review: I can't say enough about this hostel, I highly recommend it! Solo traveller stayed in private room. Jugaad sort of means 'make it work' and the hostel has done so in a unique and hip way. The location is close to Haus Kaus and nearby you will find lots of street food and shops for all sorts things such as laundry, printing, SIM cards, markets etc. Located on the 4th floor (hostel has elevator), it provided amazing views over Delhi. The room was basic but clean and comfortable. The hotel has an indoor common room and a large terrace where everyone hangs out and socialises. I made so many friends over the 5 days I stayed here. You will meet a real mix of people from all over the world here. The hostel also organises nights out where you can go to some of the coolest bars/clubs‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ravi Prasadi
Detailed Review: It is an easy location to explain to Rickshaw drivers: "just go to Citi Bank at Main Bazar." The rooms are very clean and cool, and the staff is nice (especially the owner Harish).  The rooftop restaurant was still under construction, so we went to one of the many restaurants nearby.  Great stay for a few days in New Delhi!! Good value for your money.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Paths Unwritten
Detailed Review: While I'm sure Delhi has a lot to offer, this is not the place to do it from. The Smyle Inn is in the middle of a bazaar area that is persistently overrun with trash day or night. To get to the two buildings that make up the hotel, you need to walk through an alley containing several public street urinals for men.  The interior of the building was a bit of a respite from the rest of the area, but not by much. Our room was adequate, but still not living up to the quality the pictures seem to display when I booked online. Perhaps the other building was nicer, but we didn't get the chance to see it.  They sold us each a SIM card which but supposed to last a few weeks, but ended up shutting down only 4 days later when we were in Jaipur. Thankfully, the hotel was able to arrange a‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Anna T
Review: Budget friendly and a fab location
Detailed Review: This place did the job nicely - my friend and I shared a cosy twin room in which everything worked. The staff were kind and attentive and the free breakfast was a good way to start the day. Location is one of the best in Delhi if you want good transport links (the metro is the best way to get around!). In a way it‚Äôs good the room wasn‚Äôt super luxurious because it meant you wanted to spend the whole day out exploring! P.s south Delhi is a cool place to go and get away from the buzz of Paharganj!

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: vitosm2017
Review: Nice place in the heart of New Delhi
Detailed Review: Very good room, super clean, a/c, hot shower available, TV, WiFi, breakfast. The staff is ok. Only stairs access (like all the hotels in this area) so keep in mind. Very good location, next to Main Bazar rd where there are many stores to buuy anything. Good restaurant just in front of the hotel. Train and Metro 5 min walking. (Metro airport line just there).

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Camila A
Review: Gave us a different room that reserved
Detailed Review: We made a reservation by internet and the room looks like very different when ww arrive. When we ask for the image on the internet reservation they told us this was a more expensive room but if ee want it we Can have it Pay extra. Beware when you reserve and make sure that is the right room. Beside of this, the staff was nice and the cleanless acceptable. No hot water. Small baths .

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Elisa R
Detailed Review: In a dirty place like India, i would say that it worth to book a more expensive hotel.  The Smyle Inn hotel price is really cheap, but the area where it is located is so dirty and crowded. There are annoying people on the surrendering area. When they see that you are a tourist, they try to benefits from you by making you so many questions in order to take you with and send the their related shops and tour guides. They were so annoying.   When you want to sleep at nights then please do not book the first floors. It is so noisy and we were not able to sleep.  The good think we liked about, was the breakfast.   We booked a tour guide from the hotel. It was a little bit cheaper comparing to another tour guide we asked. We did the golden triangle Delhi-Agra-Jaipur.  We had a personal‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Emma O
Detailed Review: Friend and in shared a double room which was great for the price. The hostel is a little runndown, but honestly for the price and free breakfast it's fine. Area is the "original hostel' area. Good if you want to get a feel of old crazy Delhi and be close to the train station.not goodnight you are searching for any kind of luxury while in the city. airport pickup arrangement was great as well.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ravi Prasadi
Detailed Review: It is an easy location to explain to Rickshaw drivers: "just go to Citi Bank at Main Bazar." The rooms are very clean and cool, and the staff is nice (especially the owner Harish). Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Amy L
Review: Authentic Indian Boutique Hotel Experience - Oasis in the Midst of New Delhi
Detailed Review: Located in Defence Colony, a wonderful neighbourhood oasis in bustling New Delhi.  Warm and friendly staff, very roomy and comfortably appointed rooms, lovely roof terrace restaurant.  Enjoyed three nights at the Colonel's Retreat and would definitely return and highly recommend for an authentic Indian boutique hotel experience.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: 1949jackie
Detailed Review: We stayed here for two nights, our travel operator said we would enjoy this hotel and he was so right. As previous guests have said the rooms were beautiful and the beds were very comfortable. The location was ideally situated to get out and about We had our two evening meals on the roof because the first meal was so delicious there didn‚Äôt seem much point in trying anywhere else. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, it was a really good experience for us.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jacquelyn R
Detailed Review: Wonderful stay!   Safe, quiet area of New Delhi. Colonels Retreat is very clean, and has comfortable beds with nice linens. Included is a fabulous breakfast on the rooftop terrace which offers nice views of the surrounding area. They will also provide a home cooked Indian  dinner for a small cost.  It is also very close to Defence market and the best pizza restaurant in New Delhi, Amici,  if you grow tired of Indian food. I would definitely stay here again!

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Liz M
Detailed Review: Well run, quirky hotel with lovely rooftop terrace.  Indian breakfast with homemade bread, homemade banana cake and homemade jam.  Dinner cooked from scratch and absolutely delicious.  Rooms clean and with great air conditioning.  We had an early start so they made us a packed breakfast.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Leah100
Detailed Review: Colonels Retreat was the first place we stayed in India and couldn‚Äôt have been happier.  The rooms were beautifully decorated, spacious bathrooms with a touch of home amenities.  The staff and family were very friendly and accommodating.  A stunning roof terrace where you can relax and watch the black kites hovering as well as have the most delicious dinner (a must).  Great homemade banana bread too.  You are also tucked away from the hustle and bustle of Delhi but close enough to all the key sites to explore. Would definitely recommend.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: martincj
Detailed Review: Excellent small hotel for brief stay in Delhi! We felt very welcome, our rooms were comfortable and we enjoyed the free afternoon tea! Dinner and breakfast were also good and the rooftop restaurant lovely. The husband and wife hosts were charming and helpful, and the hotel very good value. Thoroughly to be recommended!

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Abhijit N
Review: Stay at the Colonels retreat, New Delhi
Detailed Review: Nice cosy place to park yourself when you are in Delhi, polite, courteous staff, well appointed rooms, very homely feeling, maybe more so because the place is more like a home-stay. They need a few additions in terms of the crockery etc (like Ice Box). Otherwise an exceptionally great place to stay.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: PeterBarras
Detailed Review: Found through Trip Advisor and really nice place.  Not a hotel, more of a guest house but I'd take it over a guesthouse any day.  Breakfast has just been serviced and brilliant. Happily come back and would thoroughly recommend

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Suzanne T
Detailed Review: We have just spent 3 wonderful nights at this lovely hotel. We have spent 64 days travelling around India staying in 30 different places ranging from b&b's, homestays to luxury hotels and colonels retreat is our favourite. It may not be the swankiest but everything you can think of has been provided for.   We were so comfortable and sitting on the rooftop having breakfast and dinner before and after discovering Delhi was just so peaceful. The staff are very gentle and courteous and can't do enough for you. The food was delicious, home made, and extremely nutritious. The homemade bread and banana bread, devoid of preservatives but full of nutrients was delicious. We would heartily recommend this hotel to all our family and friends and to any travellers passing through Delhi.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: JacquesNicolas
Review: Colonel's retreat, the place to be
Detailed Review: We were 2 couples staying for 2 days after 3,5 weeks in India : Colonel's retreat is one of the best places to stay, for resting or for visiting Delhi. The dining terrace on the top is pleasant. We were invited at the hotel celebration of the Holi feast : nice idea High quality service, faire welcome, well located, highly recommended

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Julesfavouritehols
Review: A peaceful haven in the busy city
Detailed Review: Stayed here for 2 nights at beginning of golden triangle trip..beautiful homestay with very helpful and friendly staff. Very welcoming hosts and beautifully cooked fresh food served on roof top which is a peaceful haven from the madness of Dehli! Thankyou to all the staff for your welcome and hospitality. Would highly recommend

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: VJPOO
Review: Good hotel in the heart of the city
Detailed Review: The hotel is a good choice for staying in the centre of Delhi, with good rooms to stay in. The hotels real strength came from the staffs ability to help. A special mention to the lady in the front desk team (She is the only lady employee). She was very courteous and helpful and took stock of all our changes in plans and accomodated us. On the hindsight, the breakfast spread could have been much better

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Buncy Pagely
Detailed Review: We were frankly very surprised how nice our room was. Lovely clean, attractively furnished. Good lavatory Service. Included breakfast, nice Indian and western dishes. Front desk great help. Restaurant makes good dishes. Met a lot of Europeans Germany yoga teachers, England So many things nearby, railway station etc.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jacky P
Detailed Review: The staff was very courteous and helpful . The Front desk helped us in all aspects they could . I would recommend this Ajanta hotel to everyone who want a decent hotel nearby New Delhi station .  The location of the Hotel is good with a good restaurant of its own and also some good reasonable restaurants ..  I also visited a Mc Donald restaurant which was few blocks away ..

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Lindell van der Walt
Detailed Review: The Hotel Ajanta is a quaint hotel in Paharganj. Away from the busy market but still lively and bustling. It made the word colonial come to mind in association with the black and white tiled floors, room names and just general appearance. I loved it. My room had a french window. Something rare in New Delhi.  Food in the restaurant is average.  All together a nice enough place to stay.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Subhasis K
Review: Comfortable First Time Stay at Ajanta
Detailed Review: After going through detailed feedbacks for various hotels, we finally decided to stay at Hotel Ajanta during our first visit to Delhi for two days while travelling to Shimla via Kalka . And I must say it was worth staying there . Would recommend this hotel to everyone .  *Nearest to New Delhi railway station...Just 4 mnts by car/Auto *Reasonable rate compared to other hotels with similar ratings and feedbacks *Situated at Paharganj area which is very popular with lots of different shops/ restaurants/markets and mostly open till midnight (even beyond that) *Communication is also good as auto/ricksaw/e-ricksaw available in front of hotel gate until late night . *Front office staffs and all other staffs were helpful and behaved properly *Deluxe room is not very specious but clean‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sudha
Detailed Review: We stayed at this hotel for a night, it is centrally located to visit places like CP, Chandni Chowk, railway station etc. The room was ok, not very well maintained and didn't look very clean and hygienic.. The room allocated to us was on the ground floor behind reception area which was very noisy. The bathroom did not offer privacy as one side of the wall was made of glass, not recommended when travelling with family.  The reception staff was courteous and helpful. They were gracious to safeguard our luggage for few hours after check out and also provided us a room for sometime to freshen up in the evening after our check out. Good budget hotel, can improve on cleanliness though.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Pavan B
Review: One of the finest Hotels in Delhi
Detailed Review: I was in Delhi last week and stayed here for three days. My experience was just amazing. Convenient location, delicious food, clean room and friendly staff. I will go again and stay here only. I recommend you to stay here.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: BackPacker763037
Detailed Review: Stayed here for a couple of nights whilst visiting family in Delhi.  We were given a family suite with two bedrooms and two bathrooms.  Fridge provided in one of the rooms with snacks inside.  We ate in the hotel restaurant and also up in our room, food was good. I was happy with the service and cleanliness of the hotel.  Would stay here again.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: hsr5552018
Detailed Review: Positives: I booked this hotel through reviews. I'm writing this review through experience. This hotel is generally ok for a few nights as it's 5mins from railway station and about 40mins from international airport. People will generally rate according to their experiences and expectations. If your expectations are very high then this one is not for you as it is a 2-3 star budget hotel. The pictures advertised give grand imperial impressions similar to a 4+ star, but this is not the case so don't think you are coming to a 4 star hotel. You get what you pay for. It worked for us for few nights and it could work for you. For us we are particular about cleanliness which was adequate for us. Some rooms are better then others. Breakfast is not too extensive but gets you by in their‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Phuongster
Review: Caring and warm staff, clean and mix of modern and traditional rooms
Detailed Review: The best of accommodation that Delhi has to offer in my opinion. I had an extremely early check in at 5am, with the 24 hour concierge staff this was not a problem to arrange. Greeted with smiles and warm chai was like pure sweetness for a couple of weary travelers as we had just taken a long bus ride overnight. Santos and Lovinda were all too ready to cater  every request met with professionalism and made sure we were comfortable with the arrangements.   Breakfast buffet here was abundant in choice, both western and Indian foods. I recommend trying it if you are staying here as it is both high quality and value for the price. Room service was promptly delivered in 30 mins, and even after there was a mistake in the order we were served quickly our correct dish in under 10 mins.‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: nishantkamboj23
Detailed Review: Very good time spend out there. Enviroment was super good and location is also good easily acessible. Restraurent service is also good and staff. Was very nice.  Must stay if going out there. Rooms are good

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Frobshl
Detailed Review: The capital of the country is beautiful and when it is particularly about the monuments they are gorgeously erect, I was in Delhi for 1 day and I felt that it was the London of India. When we talk about the hotel the room was hygienic and it was beautifully decorated. The money that I paid for that was completely justifiable.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Krishna_Pujari
Detailed Review: As I have business in Delhi, I visit Delhi often. This is the best place to stay as rooms are neat and clean also reasonably priced. Friendly Staff.   This is also close to the railway station(10 to 15 mins walk)  Thank you.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: telali2
Detailed Review: We stayed here for three nights at the beginning of March, the area is not the best but very close to New Delhi Station. The hotel rooms were basic but clean , and the shower had hot water. The room only had one sheet on the bed and that felt damp. The room /sleep was affected by the dogs in the neighbourhood. The food at the roof top restaurant was nice. It was fine for the money we paid , but stayed in a nicer place for very little increase in cost.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Navigate727650
Review: Exceptional Service, Great Staff, Beautiful Rooftop
Detailed Review: This is my 3rd time staying at Amax Inn. Anil and his amazing staff do a great job providing a home away from home!! The rooms are clean and comfortable, and the staff are always willing to go above and beyond expectations to make your stay a pleasant one. The rooftop patio serves up awesome food and great prices. This is the place to stay in Delhi!! Always exceeding expectations!!  5 star service !!!! Thank you

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: V K U
Detailed Review: A home away from home, Thanks Anil and team. Me and all of my friends staying in this hotel from last fifteen years. Rooms are neat and clean. Bathrooms are super clean and hygienic. We always having food on rooftop restaurant. It's yamee

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Little_alice-1
Review: It was fine, irritating bits and probably wouldn't come back
Detailed Review: For the price I expected something a bit better... it was all fine, it worked, the food was fine, there were just niggles that I didn't expect to have to deal with when paying a bit more. They told me I could pay by card but at the end they said that only the room could be paid by card and food and taxis had to be cash. By this time it was night and I had to go to an ATM - the guy from the hotel came with me but still...mosquitos everywhere with no plug in mosquito repellant like most hotels use, they seemed to be breeding on my bathroom ceiling. Clean rooms but no soap/toilet paper which I had to ask for, and very different to pictures. Food also different from pictures. Efficient but overpriced taxi service and they held my passport which I never like. Friendly attentive staff‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: nishantkamboj23
Detailed Review: Very good time spend out there. Enviroment was super good and location is also good easily acessible. Restraurent service is also good and staff. Was very nice.  Must stay if going out there. Rooms are good

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Frobshl
Detailed Review: The capital of the country is beautiful and when it is particularly about the monuments they are gorgeously erect, I was in Delhi for 1 day and I felt that it was the London of India. When we talk about the hotel the room was hygienic and it was beautifully decorated. The money that I paid for that was completely justifiable.

Clean rooms but no soap/toilet paper which I had to ask for, and very different to pictures. Food also different from pictures. Efficient but overpriced taxi service and they held my passport which I never like. Friendly attentive staff‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Tara Johnston
Review: Booked it for the price, pleasantly surprised by all the lovely perks!
Detailed Review: During my time in Delhi I stayed at a few different hostels in search of something that fit my budget, was in a good location, and had a pleasant space in which I could feel comfortable. Jugaad totally impressed me with the cleanliness of their spaces, the location walkable to small markets/good food, friendly staff who were welcoming and excited to plan group outings (and discounted beer!), and all the little perks like a rooftop with hammocks and free tea and yoga upon demand by a quality instructor. Would definitely stay here again and I‚Äôm glad I stumbled into this spot for just 12 hours!

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Christa M
Detailed Review: Jugaad was such an amazing gathering space! The staff was kind and so helpful with pickup from the airport to arranging a trip to Agra. The terrace was beautiful, breakfast was served every morning and it was a fantastic gathering spot. Clean and peaceful-I would recommend!

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: everystrawmatters
Review: The staff!!!! Mindblown by Subham‚Äôs kindness and hospitality
Detailed Review: My stay at Jugaad Hostel was great primarily due to its amazing team who went completely out of their way to help me our running whatever errands needed to be ran.  The male team was super helpful and uber friendly, dissolving the negative stereotypes in a nonchalant manner.   A massive THANK YOU goes to Subham, who is simply an incredible human being. He helped me out with literally everything and also arranged a surprise print out from my husband that was waiting for me on my bed upon the arrival.  Thanks Subham, you‚Äôre great!  4/5 only because larger groups (+2) tend to be slightly disrespectful and careless to the needs of others in the dorm. Also, the showers could do with a bit more maintenance (cleanliness + water not going down in 1 shower).   Otherwise, all sweet and‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sridevi P
Review: Perfect for a quick Delhi trip!
Detailed Review: I was visiting Delhi for work and wanted to book a nice hotel for a night's stay. I came across many options and then this! The name Jugaad caught my attention and I knew it would be such a great thing to experience the hostel life after reading all the positive reviews.   Pros  Could be easily located on Google maps. Smooth check in experience Female dorms were clean and nice Common hall felt safe, with guests going on about their own thing Have a good library with popular travel magazines Nice rooftop to just see the world pass by Helpful staff to arrange for sightseeing or car rentals Have a fridge full of muffins and cakes for midnight cravings Free coffee and tea. Cappuccinos and a la carte charged at nominal rates.  Also Hauz Khas is just about 20-30 mins from Jugaad. You‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Roma C
Detailed Review: Its been the second times I am coming to Jugaad Hostel and each time it is a pure bliss.  Recently they added few small furnitures in the bedrooms and propose delicious home made cakes and beverages in the common room to make it even more practical and enjoyable - It is constantly evolving in a good way and I really like this caring dynamic.  Everything is super clean, the decoration looks really comfortable, people you can meet there are always great and the staff is more than helpful: adorable!  In brief its was a really nice stay and I would definitly recommend it to anyone coming in Delhi or arriving in India throught Delhi

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: rohancf
Detailed Review: Great Hostel in a good location. Clean and comfortable rooms. Helpful staff, especially Monu was very helpful. They have great facilities like a rooftop and a travel desk. Gret value for money. Would definitely recommend staying here.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: ettyp
Detailed Review: Perfect to spend some days , to visit Delhi , to make some shopping , all facilities are  available, people are very nice and friendly , you can have informations about the city , what to visit...how to move in the city

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Joe S
Detailed Review: Had an amazing stay here whilst travelling with my friends. We stayed for 2 nights. We had an issue with a taxi driver trying to scam us from the airport on the way to the hostel and the hostel came to our rescue and really helped us out!!! Would recommend booking travel from the airport direct with them as you will have no problems at all.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Tajammul S
Detailed Review: Room was good with AC, TV and Hot water for Bath. Very near to New Delhi Railway Station. Breakfast was good.  Hotel management was too cooperative. Overall it was a nice stay point. Would surely recommend to other for a stay here.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Japeth P
Detailed Review: DISAPPOINTING EXPERIENCE, I paid for one night that I only used for 4 hours and cancelled it because one of my friend that is Delhi resident is not allowed to enter the hotel.  I'm not aware of the rules and they did't post that information on their sites. and other booking websites

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Garima J
Detailed Review: The room allotted was really small and suffocating. Will definitely not recommend this hotel. I had booked a room for a friend and I was denied to even visit my friend since I had an ID proof with local address.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Priƒçe S
Detailed Review: Our room was much poorer than presented in the pictures. We got a room for three people to sleep in one bed (although we booked a room for two people) , the bed was unnecessarily big, and it practically covered the whole room, barely leaving any space for us to move around the room, leave our stuff, etc. The pictures show double rooms with much more space inside.      The bathroom facilities are poor.  The toilet doesn't function properly, you can barely flush it.  The washbasin was leaking, which we reported, but were just told that it's the way it is, and we shouldn't release too much water from the tap, otherwise, it leaks.     As for the staff, there are two main guys, one them (I sincerely apologize to him here, but I can't remember his name) was totally ok, but the other‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: rohancf
Detailed Review: Great Hostel in a good location. Clean and comfortable rooms. Helpful staff, especially Monu was very helpful. They have great facilities like a rooftop and a travel desk. Gret value for money. Would definitely recommend staying here.

As for the staff, there are two main guys, one them (I sincerely apologize to him here, but I can't remember his name) was totally ok, but the other‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Helen M
Detailed Review: This small hotel was just what we wanted for our first two nights in India. It's family owned and run, clean, friendly and with good amenities such as wifi, large bathroom, fresh fluffy towels and a rooftop restaurant for breakfast, complimentary afternoon tea and biscuits and lovely food in the evening. Rooms are relatively small but more than adequate. It was handy for touring Delhi, although we didn't go out in the evenings. It's not handy for the airport, but makes a lovely base for a stay in Delhi. We'd happily stay again.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Michael C
Review: Nice, relaxing stay in a quiet area
Detailed Review: Nice hotel in a quieter suburb of Delhi. A great shower, and comfortable room. A/C is great. Nice to have a rooftop terrace to chill out on. Would warn against booking travel/transfers through the hotel as they charge an extortionate commission fee, but the service is very friendly. Nice restaurants in the local area, and a metro stop nearby. Would stay again!

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Chirinjev P
Detailed Review: My thirteen American friends and I stayed at Colonel‚Äôs Retreat for a weekand truly loved every minute!  In the midst of sightseeing and Delhi traffic, Colonel‚Äôs retreat was an oasis of calm.  They have it just right, where it feels personal, comfortable, clean and not commercial. The owners personally greeted us every morning as we enjoyed wonderful breakfasts on the rooftop overlooking Delhi.  The staff is amazing as well; reliable, conscientious and accommodating.  I will surely go back whenever I‚Äôm in Delhi and will recommend it strongly to my friends as well.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: jbschmor
Detailed Review: This was my first stay on my first trip to India.  I had a place to collect my thoughts and to experience friendly Indian hospitality.  The highlight was a cooking lesson on the rooftop after my first whirlwind guided tour of new Delhi - and it was an amazing lesson.  You have to keep sharp - the lady of the house cooks with quick efficiency - but she also gives truly useful general principles across a range of tricky cooking issues.  Staff here are constantly giving their best. My room was spacious (especially the bathroom) and very clean.  What I remember most is that each morning and each evening I would go to the rooftop to be given the best home-made food - often too much!  I traveled India for almost a month afterwards - I never had a better made Dhosa, nor better coffee‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Stinewilcox
Detailed Review: This hotel has lovely, comfortable rooms, but the best feature is that each floor has it's own living space with couches and comfortable chairs.  The restaurant is on the rooftop and the service is wonderful.  It was a treat to stay here.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: AndieD50
Detailed Review: I have stayed here on several occasions and now it is like "coming home"!  The rooms are spacious and comfortable as is the bathroom, which is perfectly western.  The staff are so welcoming!  The breakfast is delicious and I love that they can prepare a proper Indian lunch or dinner with an hour's notice.  Because sometimes you just don't want to go out!  And, it is lovely to have tea in the afternoon after a long day of travel.  The staff have always arranged my transportation and it has been flawless.  The view from the rooftop is amazing and a great way to start and/or end your day.  The location is centrally located as well.  All in all, it is perfection!!!

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Laughing Cow
Detailed Review: Stayed here at the beginning and the end of our golden triangle adventure and was very happy.  Lovely sunny rooms, friendly, helpful staff and great banana bread.  The roof terrace and delicious home cooked food also helped! Would recommend.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Richard S
Review: Stayed for three nights in total, on way out to and back from the Himalayas
Detailed Review: This is a super hotel to stay at. The rooms are comfortable and adequate and the staff are lovely. Eating on the roof terrace is a real treat, the service is very attentive and the food excellent. However the highlight is the owners who come to talk to us at breakfast and at the evening meal. We were having difficultly obtaining rupees from the ATMs (tip: don‚Äôt rely on ATMs for cash, they are inconsistent and can‚Äôt be relied on. Get them at the airport) and these people gave us invaluable advice for which we were extremely grateful.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Amanda R
Detailed Review: Arrived exhausted from our flight, terrible immigration process and dumping of bags in the middle of the terminal!   So were very pleased to arrive at Colonels Retreat.  No fuss on arrival and straight to the room to get a much needed sleep and shower.    Spent our first meal at the hotel and watched the Colonel‚Äôs wife giving a cookery lesson on the roof top terrace.    Met the Colonel and had a lovely conversation, very interesting man.   We enjoyed it so much that we decided to have our second night there too.  Again met some lovely people and great chats.  Highly recommend the hotel, clean, lovely staff and full of charm and character.   Just hold your nose very tightly if walking to the main highway!!

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: 2016Kenny
Review: Excellent care, large and comfortable rooms
Detailed Review: We arrived very early in the morning after some problems at the airport.  The staff was all awakened to meet our needs, and everything went very smoothly.  The breakfasts were good.  This home stay is in a rather nondescript neighborhood of low apartment style buildings behind a wall, but was very adequate and comfortable.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Andy T
Detailed Review: We cannot recommend this highly enough. Rooms are beautifully appointed, staff are attentive yet non-intrusive and the owners very welcoming. The banana bread has a well-deserved reputation but the evening meal was truly outstanding. Local produce cooked from scratch, with memorable highlights being the red carrots as well as the tamarind sauce. Packed breakfast due to early departure was a tasty meal labelled 'One for the road' which sums up their attention to detail. We are staying at the sister hotel near the airport before we leave, and would recommend others to avoid faceless hotels and experience this Homestay.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: steveessex2
Detailed Review: We stayed here for 2 nights in February.  The people are very friendly and the food was excellent, it is something to sit on the roof terrace in the evening having your dinner with a brazier by your side to keep you warm.  But if you want you can eat inside just off the lounge.    Our room was by the kitchen but to be fair to the staff they stopped working in it by about 9pm and didnt begin breakfast till after 7am so we werent disturbed too much.  The room was a twin and it was simply furnished, the only problem I had was the bed, because I am tall and the bed as a solid frame to it I couldnt stretch my legs out when I went to sleep so ended up sleeping in an awkward position.  However other than that the shower was good, the room was cleaned daily and it was a good‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Bambi1964
Review: Wonderful hotel in a safe area of Delhi
Detailed Review: This is a fantastic place to stay in Delhi.  There are about 4 rooms on each floor , each of which have a sitting area, so you can meet with your fellow travellers.  There is also a rooftop terrace from which to overlook the city.  It is in a safe neighbourhood, however you will need either a tuk tuk or taxi or metro to see the main sights Delhi has to offer.  The food is delicious .  The rooms are cool and clean and the bed large and comfortable.  There is also a safe. The owners are fantastic and will do anything to assist you with your stay in Delhi.  I would not hesitate to stay here again if in Delhi.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: at_39000ft
Review: Island of calm in melee of Delhi
Detailed Review: Stayed her for two nights at the start of our Indian adventure. Rooms are very quiet and comfortable a typical home stay type hotel. Breakfast and dinner were served on the roof garden which was fabulous. In the evening it was romanticly lit and a charcoal fire bowl either side of the tables to subdue the evening chill. They served great food and the owners where the bestest hosts.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jill060
Review: Back Again To Wonderful Colonels Retreat
Detailed Review: This is my 3rd stay and it never disappoints.Wonderful location ,warm and welcoming staff and well maintained . Excellent breakfast on the terrace and the Thali dinner at night excellent value . I have recommended the Colonels to many people and a everyone has been delighted as Delhi can be a challenge  to find reasonable accommodation in a quiet area .I will be back

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Aparajita J
Review: Decent Hotel in a convenient location for train travel
Detailed Review: I chose this hotel for it's proximity to the Delhi Railway station, as I had an early morning train to catch. Have stayed here twice and find the staff to be helpful and accommodating, the room is adequate and as a solo female traveler, I felt safe here.  The first time I stayed, I forgot my Yoga Mat in the taxi which dropped vmecto the station. On informing the staff via telephone, they retrieved the mat and kept it in storage for me, so I picked it up ony way back through Delhi.  The restaurant downstairs is very reasonable and serves decent food. The cafe across the street, which also belongs to the same hotel, hadcsome great apple pie.  The market nearby has everything you could need and I bought a great pair of shoes there.  On my second visit, I didn't like the room as it‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Niraj K
Review: Excellent Rooms and excellent Complimentary Breakfast. Located in a very central area of Paharganj, Arakarshan Road Delh
Detailed Review: Excellent Rooms and excellent Complimentary Breakfast. Located in a very central area of Paharganj, Arakarshan Road Delhi. One thing is missing that they do not provide Electric Kettle and few Tea Bags in the Rooms. Another aspect they need improvement is Room Service and Massage Facility

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sukhjeet S
Review: sweet hotel with normal amenities and good staff
Detailed Review: hotel is in Paharganj(alot of hotels are there) nearby to Delhi railway station, take exit from the platform no 1 side, hire vehicle(do not pay more than rs 50/100) voila you are at hotel, hotel is ok to stay with friends, and amenities are also workable, free WiFi and complimentary breakfast, staff is good ask them what ever you want, book it online, offline it will cost you more

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: lks16
Detailed Review: Grotesquely overpriced for the room we received. Staff were not helpful in the slightest. Air con/fan did not work and the windows didn‚Äôt shut properly so we were awake all night with the sound of the road outside. Awful awful awful, avoid

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jaemin L
Detailed Review: The location was convenient (There are lots of hotels on Arakashan road, hence making the area travellers' hotspot). The workers were friendly and helpful. I used Delhi as a transportation hub so I was going back and forth to Delhi. This place offers luggage storage with Rs. 100 per day (which is about a dollar!), and this made my travels way much easier. Also the restaurant has great Indian food. And the price is relatively reasonable. Overall, I highly recommend this place.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: relaxinagain
Detailed Review: I found this Hotel on Trip Advisor and it was everything as recommended.  We stayed here on three or four different occasions and for the most part we had great rooms. .One time the room was small however not a big problem as we arrived at 7pm and gone the next morning at 8am.   We used this a our base over the two weeks in India. Spacious, very clean with excellent room service and prompt housekeeping good showers and beautiful furniture.  Many of the staff have been at this hotel for 15 yrs+ so a real friendly environment.   We also used their travel agent who was efficient, knowledgeable and spoke perfect English. He took great care of us. Highly recommended.  It is good to ask for a back room if you retire early as the street noise can go on till almost midnight.The hotel is‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Doron_J
Detailed Review: The reason the Ajanta hotel deserves an "Excellent" rank is the service provided by all stuff. It is outstanding. Over the years we visited many dozens of hotels all over India, from cheap and basic guesthouses to luxury resorts and when comparing with the Ajanta the service come up as the main differentiator. Any problem is always solved promptly, with a smile and good will. We had a double superior room, but the safe box was not functional, and they couldn't repair it. So quite quickly we were moved to another room, which was even better. We viewed several double superior rooms, all are spacious and comfortable. With a safe box and a kettle. Sometimes hot water is not available in the morning, just ask to turn on the water heater. The breakfast buffet is good. Location is‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Frances T
Detailed Review: This hotel is an excellent jumping off point for adventures in India. The doorman greets you with a big smile and the hotel staff are equally friendly. The rooms are clean, comfortable, quiet  and spacious. The bathrooms are of a high standard. Our room had a balcony overlooking a busy street but noise was minimal. The restaurant was good for an evening meal and an excellent breakfast was either buffet style or cooked to order. Taxis ordered by the hotel have very safe drivers. The Ajanta Hotel was a good start and good end to our holiday - and not too far from the airport.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jeri T
Detailed Review: We had a lovely 3rd stay at Ajanta. Hotel room was very clean and comfortable. Helpful staff and great restaurant. We ate here every day and had included buffet breakfast which was always good. The food was clean but we didn't have juice or fresh fruit or salad here.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: funny88
Detailed Review: My husband and I stayed at this hotel we both must say it was a lovely hotel  rooms are very good. Jack who was superb very helpful indeed.  All the staff at the restaurant deserve a Gold Star from us must Mention Prem who was our driver through out our stay in Delhi what a Gentleman.  Thank  you to all the staff at the Ajanta Hotel who made our stay very nice and comfortable. ‚ù§Ô∏èüòÄ‚ù§Ô∏èüòÄ

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Somnathsb
Detailed Review: I stayed this hotel for 3 nights along with my family. I made direct booking over the phone.  I have listed pros and cons about the hotel. There are more cons than pros. Pros: 1. Complementary airport pickup. (You have to pay airport parking fee. It costed me Rs 310 for about 1 hr. So if you are opting for it ,so add 30-45 min delay to arrival while informing to hotel) 2. Close proximity to New Dehli train station and Metro. 3. Many tour operators in this area 4. Hot water throughout the day which is must during winter days. 5. Hotel is having good restaurant. As Indian visitor felt it slightly overpriced.  6. Breakfast is good.  Cons: 1. First impresssion itself was not good, no welcome, no greetings at reception. None of the hotel staff  carries smile on face except one of the‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: R-M-XXXO
Detailed Review: Hotel is close to the New Delhi train and metro station. They provided airport pickup for a fee. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet. The breakfast buffet was good. Staff was kind and helpful. I stayed there twice and plan on staying there again before my flight home.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: tubbytigger
Review: Very friendly and helpful staff in a functional hotel
Detailed Review: On the plus side, the hotel is good value and in a great location. The staff are helpful, especially Gunjan, who went above and beyond the call of duty to find us a really nice room, even though the hotel was showing as 'sold out' on the internet. They also called a plumber pretty promptly when our hot water didn't work. The rooms are functional with a good shower too, and the restaurant, and cafe across the road, serve decent food, coffee and snacks. On the down side, and these are only minor as I did like this hotel, the rooms could do with a fresh lick of paint and the rooms on the front, which are bigger, can be noisy. Also, their enthusiasm to sell their car and driver tours, which for some may be helpful, can be tedious and feel a bit 'hard sell' when you've just arrived‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Anoop V
Detailed Review: One of the best hotels you can find in Paharganj. Rooms are spacious and priced nominally. Room service is reasonable and quality of food is good. Bed sheets and blankets are a little worn out. Staff is extremely helpful and provides amazing hospitality. Shout out to Mr. Ravinder Singh who gave us a room to freshen up in the evening even after we checked out at 11 in the morning. New Delhi railway station is just 1.4kms away. Hotel also provides complementary airport pick up.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Shishir S
Detailed Review: Fantastic arrangement by hotel ajanta staff... Specly flor Manager Mis Gunjan,we wish to visit again in hotel ajanta....Very cooperative staff,neta n clean environment,safe for all Best regards SHISHIR SRIVASTAVA

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Manjunath M
Review: Worst hotel i have experienced in my Trip
Detailed Review: There was no hot water facility and even staff don't even care, the guy in reception was too busy chatting with his girl friend when i checked in. The hotel restaurant don't take card only cash worst food.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Joy L
Review: Best Service we have had in India!
Detailed Review: Lovely clean hotel with fantastic service. Gunjay in particular made us feel very welcome and looked after. Food was good and hot water was reliable. Location was close to Connaught Place if you want some nice bars.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Shailesh M
Detailed Review: good interior. no complaint about room service. all staff were co-operative and provide service on time. best quality food available. breakfast also available. charges are bit high it will be good if they reduce rent.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: M A
Detailed Review: We were staying 5 days. So we had a very good service at our stay. Special thanks to mr.anil who is take cares all ways. Staff are very polite nd I'll give a five star to hotel Amax in. See you soon guys take care.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Mija28488
Review: Nice place with lovely roof top restaurant
Detailed Review: The rooms are clean and the service is very good. We very much enjoyed the roof top restaurant where you can find a bit of peace and quiet from the busy, noise streets around the hotel. You`ll find really good food for reasonable prices up there ‚Äì definitely try the Shahi Paneer!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ngao B
Detailed Review: I've been to Delhi 3 times and all 3 times I stayed in Amax Inn. The location is great, close to the train station (around 10mins walk), markets. The price is affordable. Rooms are clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The owner - Mr. Anil is a very nice person who helped us out a lot during our stay. Highly recommend and we'll return here for sure.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: lee w
Detailed Review: The staff are extremely helpful, quick and very friendly. The terrace is perfect to relax in the breeze and the food is excellent and reasonably priced. We used their pickup service from the airport as we arrived at 1am and it worked out perfect and our room was ready when we arrived. The room was spacious and clean, the showers were hot and the wifi worked well. The bed was comfy though could have used an extra sheet instead of the felt blankets and the a/c didn‚Äôt work for whatever reason but it wasn‚Äôt needed during our stay. The hotel also organized us to take a Tuk Tuk to New Delhi Train Station for a good price without the hassle of having to negotiate. The only thing we didn‚Äôt really care for was the area on the way to the station, walking that way was a bit dodgy and I‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Harshit Mahapatra
Detailed Review: I stayed at this hotel with my brother (both Indian) and 2 Austrian friends. The staff were noticeably unfriendly to me and my brother from the beginning. The amount of money they charge for picking you up from the airport is ridiculous by Indian standards. I would recommend international tourists to use a prepaid taxi, the metro or an Uber car instead. The hotel overcharges for simple beverages like chai, omelet, etc as international tourists do not initially have an idea about the price. Moreover the staff also accused us of using their wifi without having a booking, when we were waiting for our Austrian friends in the lobby. This difference in behavior towards Indian guests as opposed to international guests, made the hotel look very bad. We visited Delhi again in a week but‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Zane G
Detailed Review: Having stayed in this area 8 times in the last 10years, I'm very happy to have found this gem.  Clean well kept rooms, and certainly the most helpful and friendly staff you could hope for. Set back off the Main Street its quiet and walking distance to train station ( or 50 Rp in a tuk tuk) For the price you can't go wrong. Nice little roof top beer garden.  Rooms on the forth floor would be nice as they open up onto the roof top area.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Matt P
Detailed Review: This is a well located and reliable mid-range hotel with a very helpful staff, clean rooms, delicious roof terrace restaurant (with room service!) and nice bathrooms with plenty of hot water. Outstanding value for anyone above backpacker basic budget who does not want to stay in a high-end luxury hotel. Definitely recommended.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sa≈°a
Detailed Review: The receptoin clerk was weary friendly. The staff was good. the room was clean. There was hot wather in the shower. Nice terase on roof rop. And the best exchange rate from ‚Ç¨ to INR that we found in India so far.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: muntaseer m
Detailed Review: Room was wide and clean, interior was standard, bathroom tidy and clean,  all time hot water service. hotel staff very friendly. Food service available and severed in time. Much recommended in very affordable price.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Roshan K
Detailed Review: Superb hotel. They have very nice service. Nice looks.  Rooms are properly designed. They have super facility in there hotel. They are showing very nice and superb hospitality. There dedication towards there job is mind blowing.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Prashant P
Review: It was short visit but hospitality was excellent
Detailed Review: It was a tour from my college to delhi auto expo. We stayed in this hotel we experienced a very good service. The most cool thing I like was the roof top resturant. The food was nice & wifi spped was awsome.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: prince choksi
Detailed Review: Nice hotel,very good room  Salim bhai service is best.  Roof top restaurants best location  Clean room  Free wi-fi service with best speed   So, all-over it is the best experience with the hotel and hotel staff

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Aniket G
Detailed Review: It is nice hotel. Facilities of this hotel is nice. Services is nice. Staff of this hotel is good and humble. Hotel's atmosphere is neat,clean and calm. All facilities are nice. Food of this hotel is nice.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ohwhen19921
Detailed Review: Similar to what others have said, we booked a room roughly 6 months in advance on booking.com for Amax Inn only to arrive at the property to find out they were now suddenly 'overbooked.' As a compromise, we were taken to a neighbouring hotel and told we can have a room there for double the price of what we were meant to pay. The room they tried to pan us off in was essentially inhabitable and the hygiene standards of the bathroom were non-existent. The staff of the hotel kept pressuring us into it by telling us we would have to stay there as everywhere else in New Delhi was fully booked. We went against their advice and found another place to rest our heads through booking.com within 10 minutes that was of a much greater standard.  The hotel itself is hidden away in a dark alley‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sakina I
Detailed Review: Really neat and clean room  especially the toilet very clean. Staff all are very friendly. I stay around 10 days. The hotel is very near for all visiting place. Room service 24 hours. The all staff can speak english very well

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Idrees Gandhi
Detailed Review: Stayed here for 1 night on 31st Jan..Value for money...well behaved support staff and the owner...hotel cleanliness  good...prompt in solving my little prob..will definitely visit again...thanks Amax innüëç

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Shailesh M
Detailed Review: good interior. no complaint about room service. all staff were co-operative and provide service on time. best quality food available. breakfast also available. charges are bit high it will be good if they reduce rent.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: M A
Detailed Review: We were staying 5 days. So we had a very good service at our stay. Special thanks to mr.anil who is take cares all ways. Staff are very polite nd I'll give a five star to hotel Amax in. See you soon guys take care.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Idrees Gandhi
Detailed Review: Stayed here for 1 night on 31st Jan..Value for money...well behaved support staff and the owner...hotel cleanliness  good...prompt in solving my little prob..will definitely visit again...thanks Amax innüëç

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Tiago R
Detailed Review: The most amazing hostel in New Delhi, staff is super cool, the place is really clean and comfy, great environment and a nice terrace to chill and meet another travelers. Also, the walking tour it's a great adventure, discovering the city as a local, and of course the home made food is delicious. I highly recommend Jugaad Hostels, they made my stay in Delhi unforgettable, I will come back again for sure.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Colette
Detailed Review: I stayed here with a friend for Holi festival and had the best time!  First of all it was well sign posted, clean, hot shower and working bathrooms (which is hard to find in India).  The common areas were laid back and relaxed and always so welcoming.   The staff were great, they gave us advice on where to eat, where the closest ATMs were and were a great group to chill and drink with in the evenings. They gave us a really good tour around old Delhi and had a Holi party organised for everyone to go to which was great as me and my friend were very new to India at the time; and as female tourists it‚Äôs not safe to go out into the streets to celebrate Holi but the party we went to was super safe, super chilled and a great time!     Vasu and the gang will make you so welcome when you‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Adam D
Detailed Review: I stayed here for four nights at the beginning of my Great Indian Adventure.  I could not have picked a better spot if I spent hours researching.  From the moment I arrived I felt welcome on their beautiful roofdeck.  Everyone would congregate there in the mornings and evenings, and it definitely helped that the crowd when I was there was amazing.  Vasu, one of the owners, was around quite often, and even took us on an amazing tour of Old Delhi.  We got to know each other a bit on the tour, and became closer after that.  Soon I was finding myself hanging at his friend's mother's house, drinking their whiskey and eating her food.  Your results may vary, but it was truly an eye-opening experience, especially only a day or two into my trip to India.  I got to see many facets of‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Chad Q
Review: Awesome first time in Hostel for the wife.
Detailed Review: First time to India and the first time my wife has stayed in a hostel. I recommended we should try it but was nervous she might not enjoy it as much as I have.   She loved it!! The people made it.   Jugaad is away from the chaos but still close enough to enjoy anything you want to see. We hired a car tour and participated in an Old Delhi walking tour through the hostel. Top notch.   I cannot say enough good things about the hostel and it‚Äôs management philosophy.   Zasu is the best!!! Loved the education about yummy mummies.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Marcus U
Review: Fantastic Place, if you can find it
Detailed Review: This hostel is located in South Delhi a bit off the Main Tourist areas. So you cannot depend on Taxi or tuk-tuk-drivers to find it without help. So prepare for that by asking the hostel for a pickup or using Uber. Once you get there, you are in for a treat. Not only is this place very clean but it has a great rooftop terrace. And since you are not in Central Delhi, it is not as loud and chaotic as the Backpackers district. Perfect for relaxing after a stressful journey.  Getting to town is cheap and easy. Either you let the fantastic staff book you a driver, you take a ride with an Uber cab or you take a tuk-tuk to Green Park Metro Station and use the excellent Delhi Metro.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Michael
Detailed Review: We absolutely loved this hostel. The huge roof top with its beautiful sunsets is just spectacular. Ideal to socialize, eat, do yoga and meditate. Bedding and bathroom were very clean. Shower very hot with high pressure. Staff was very smiley and helpful. They have a fridge with homemade burgers, sandwiches and cakes. All vegetarian. The broccoli burger was so divine and the cakes unbelievable tasty. They organized a bar tour and took us to a very nice local place and we even got 2 cocktails each free. I didn‚Äôt spent anything that night. We didn‚Äôt want to leave this hostel :) Thanks so much for everything guys :)

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: born2travelit
Detailed Review: We have stayed at Smyle Inn with my bloggers team for 2 nights. it's located in Paharganj area right opposite the New Delhi Train Station. A very nice and central hostel, excellent choice for those visiting the Indian capital. great wi fi service, comfy bed and nice reception

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Patricia P
Detailed Review: The room was not very big, but comfortable. The only problem is that I was on the same floor as the front desk, and if you want to rest during the evening the noise from the street may bother you. Breakfast simply, but ok, water, coffee or tea, a banana, and something sweet.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Satori D
Detailed Review: This is a great place. Good location, great service and good price. Good free wifi. Breakfast (with cappuccino) included! The room was small but super clean. Hot water... Slept like a baby, good bed. We arrived late and stayed only one night, but we will definitely come back. They booked our train ticket to Agra, simple, swift. We recommend this place highly!

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: surftravelife
Review: Awesome place super friendly and helpful
Detailed Review: Awesome help with day trips and places to eat! Safe breakfast!  Clean comfortable rooms! Beds are a little hard! No worries though! Hot water is decent but only lasts 10 min maximum maybe only 8! Affordable!  Airport pick up was on time everytime!  Stayed here off and on at least 5 times through my 60 day india trip! Travel desk agent is a blessing!  Awesome dude and super helpful! Hope this helps hope everyone is blessed happy and healthy!

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Mario W
Detailed Review: Smile Inn Hostel is the best option that I could be taken. The room was very clean, hot water, good connection to the internet, at a good cheap price. The location is perfect, just in Mean Bazar of Delhi. The best tourist place to be. To all this must be added the staff, people with a pure heart, among who I wish to highlight to Arun, Keshor and Mantu, who helped me to solve all my doubts and questions. Selflessly, behaved very well with me and I wish them the best in the life. I am very grateful towards them, and really happy of the decision taken to book this hostel :)

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: VikkiGBAU
Detailed Review: Good Basic Hotel in convenient location. Room was clean, Breakfast basic but good, and staff are helpful. Not that easy for a taxi to get to the door, this is not a big problem but if you have a lot of luggage be aware you may need to carry it a short distance.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Pooja G
Review: Clean, basic rooms at the heart of Delhi
Detailed Review: Smyle Inn is a reliable property that offers clean, basic rooms with breakfast in the heart of Delhi for cheap prices. They also offer a lot of services like currency exchange, tours etc. We were picked up from the airport at 3 in the morning with no problems and our overall stay was very good. The staff is accommodating. The wifi is probably the fastest we experienced during our whole stay in India. It was possible to leave luggage at the hotel for a small charge while we went to the Andaman islands. Overall, good rooms for good value and the shopping street (Pahargunj main bazaar) is just outside the hotel, so it was very convenient.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Josh J
Detailed Review: I would recommend Smyle Inn.  We were traveling as a big group and Smyle Inn was great in meeting our needs and making us feel welcome.  They rose to the occasion to meet our groups special requests even though they could have said "No, we can't do that..." It was much appreciated.  I will look to use this guest house again for future teams. It's a good price, good location, and the stay includes a surprisingly good breakfast. Aram and Anil were especially helpful. Thanks, guys.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Anthonhi
Review: Good place at a good price
Detailed Review: Room was clean and bed was ok, bathroom very small though.  Service was good and helpful. At the beginning, they offered us lots of tourist packs we didn‚Äôt want, but in the end they helped us to book a train (with a little comission).  The rooftop terrace its a very good place to unwind and leave for a while the hectic city.  The location is quite centric.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: born2travelit
Review: The mecca of backpackers in New Delhi
Detailed Review: We have stayed at Smyle Inn with my bloggers team for 2 nights. it's located in Paharganj area right opposite the New Delhi Train Station. A very nice and central hostel, excellent choice for those visiting the Indian capital. great wi fi service, comfy bed and nice reception

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Patricia P
Detailed Review: The room was not very big, but comfortable. The only problem is that I was on the same floor as the front desk, and if you want to rest during the evening the noise from the street may bother you. Breakfast simply, but ok, water, coffee or tea, a banana, and something sweet.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Satori D
Detailed Review: This is a great place. Good location, great service and good price. Good free wifi. Breakfast (with cappuccino) included! The room was small but super clean. Hot water... Slept like a baby, good bed. We arrived late and stayed only one night, but we will definitely come back. They booked our train ticket to Agra, simple, swift. We recommend this place highly!

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: surftravelife
Detailed Review: Awesome help with day trips and places to eat! Safe breakfast!  Clean comfortable rooms! Beds are a little hard! No worries though! Hot water is decent but only lasts 10 min maximum maybe only 8! Affordable!  Airport pick up was on time everytime!  Stayed here off and on at least 5 times through my 60 day india trip! Travel desk agent is a blessing!  Awesome dude and super helpful! Hope this helps hope everyone is blessed happy and healthy!

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Mario W
Detailed Review: Smile Inn Hostel is the best option that I could be taken. The room was very clean, hot water, good connection to the internet, at a good cheap price. The location is perfect, just in Mean Bazar of Delhi. The best tourist place to be. To all this must be added the staff, people with a pure heart, among who I wish to highlight to Arun, Keshor and Mantu, who helped me to solve all my doubts and questions. Selflessly, behaved very well with me and I wish them the best in the life. I am very grateful towards them, and really happy of the decision taken to book this hostel :)

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: VikkiGBAU
Detailed Review: Good Basic Hotel in convenient location. Room was clean, Breakfast basic but good, and staff are helpful. Not that easy for a taxi to get to the door, this is not a big problem but if you have a lot of luggage be aware you may need to carry it a short distance.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Pooja G
Detailed Review: Smyle Inn is a reliable property that offers clean, basic rooms with breakfast in the heart of Delhi for cheap prices. They also offer a lot of services like currency exchange, tours etc. We were picked up from the airport at 3 in the morning with no problems and our overall stay was very good. The staff is accommodating. The wifi is probably the fastest we experienced during our whole stay in India. It was possible to leave luggage at the hotel for a small charge while we went to the Andaman islands. Overall, good rooms for good value and the shopping street (Pahargunj main bazaar) is just outside the hotel, so it was very convenient.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Josh J
Review: Clean, basic rooms at the heart of Delhi
Detailed Review: I would recommend Smyle Inn.  We were traveling as a big group and Smyle Inn was great in meeting our needs and making us feel welcome.  They rose to the occasion to meet our groups special requests even though they could have said "No, we can't do that..." It was much appreciated.  I will look to use this guest house again for future teams. It's a good price, good location, and the stay includes a surprisingly good breakfast. Aram and Anil were especially helpful. Thanks, guys.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Anthonhi
Detailed Review: Room was clean and bed was ok, bathroom very small though.  Service was good and helpful. Name: Anthonhi
