Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: David C
Review: Good homestay in quiet residential area with easy access to Delhi.
Detailed Review: My wife, adult son and I enjoyed two days at this homestay at the start of our extended holiday in India. Good location to explore Delhi; situated in a quiet residential area. Comfortable rooms, good food and friendly staff -- particularly recommend the roof-top restaurant.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: graemesim
Review: a ray of sunshine in a city of smog
Detailed Review: all was good in Delhi, the location, the room, the service, the roof top terrace....an oasis in a sea of people. all staff were very friendly and helpful, the food was to a very high standard , what more can i say...would highly recommend

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: sunandajoshi
Detailed Review: Colonels retreat in Defence Colony, is  exactly what it says in their website; with lovely , understated, elegant decor,in a green, quiet area and yet a stone‚Äôs throw away from all the necessary amenities of markets and transport.  My husband  and I stayed here for 3 nights and were very  well looked after by the  friendly ,helpful and willing  staff.The breakfast at the roof top was a real treat boasting of homemade delicious breads ,cakes, jams and an assortment of delicious indian food and continental food .I loved the simple but elegant decor of our large sized room . The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom very well equipped .The common lounge in our  floor was a welcome sanctuary to lounge with a cup of tea and browse  through magazines and brochures kept for the‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Marlene W
Review: Away from the hustle and bustle
Detailed Review: This was a wonderful retreat from the hustle and bustle of Delhi. Quiet location with friendly, attentive staff and delicious meals on the rooftop restaurant.  My room was spotless, hot water plentiful and bed very comfortable. The legendary banana bread lived up to expectations as did the other breakfast and evening meal offerings.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: LONDONSEM
Detailed Review: Our second stay. Very centrally located, spotlessly clean, furnished to a very high standard. Most importantly a great set of staff who are most professional and helpful. A sumptuous breakfast of a variety of items got our days to a super start. A large defence colony market and a metro station are within a 10 minute walking distance.   Would highly recommend for any kind of personal or business stays.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Corinne M
Detailed Review: A nice welcome from the staff, our rooms were ready immediately. We sat in a comfortable communal area in the landing to sign the guest book. Rooms are comfortable and clean, and showers are piping hot. The AC was perfect and quiet. Dinner at the rooftop restaurant, and breakfast were great quality. H√¥tel situated in leafy suburbs, about fifteen minutes walking distance to town.  Only negative is that our room was next to the kitchen, so we were woken early by the sounds of the staff chatting loudly and going about their business.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Phil R
Detailed Review: We stayed here two nights at the start of our India tour. We landed at 9 am and it took an hour to drive there due to the traffic. We had a lovely welcome with tea and banana bread. We had lunch here one day and dinner two nights. And of course the inclusive breakfast. The menu is the same at lunch and dinner and although the menu is quite limited, the food was lovely. Each meal was 1000 rupees and the kingfisher beer about 130. For breakfast I particularly enjoyed the Bombay scrambled egg. The.curries were nicely spiced...beware the pickles. Service was great and with a smile.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: michaelibrahim11
Detailed Review: We had a long trip Feb. 2017 from Egypt and arrived by midnight when they check us in another building with a less than mediocre room and we were so tired to complain, When we complained the next day they changed the room but didn't refund the difference in price and they just offered a ride to the airport on our way back which was worth like $10.  The whole staff starting the front desk till the owner are rude. My father returned on one day earlier than me to the hotel where we had only one key and he asked for the spare key to get in, where they don't have ONE and that was shocking and they were super rude. They don't have the minimum qualifications of guest service.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Keith B
Detailed Review: We stayed at Ajantawhich is in a great central position good value clean nice food The travel desk is well informed and genuine. (Many travel offices in Delhi get kick backs so you pay more for lousy service ) We will return in Nov on our way to Goa know they will look after us.  Irene & Keith from Australia

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: WeR2gether2017
Detailed Review: It was really nice to stay at this property as a couple we wanted neat & clean rooms and centrally location and this property has it all. We searched this hotel online and saw some mixed reviews but when we came to this hotel, the experience is not totally changed. they offer good buffet breakfast and it is very close to connaught place where we wanted to see the night life. room was really spacious with hot water. this property is really a gem. surely recommend to my friends and families.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: jasonfahy31
Detailed Review: I would like to sincerely thank all the staff once again in Hotel Ajanta.  I would especially like to thank Gowjan. She was wonderfully helpful to us during our stay, so kind and professional. Looking forward to returning again this year.  Jason ‚ò∫

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: carmenregina555
Review: Very good, very helpull staff, very clean rooms, an nice food in the restaurant
Detailed Review: Very friendly staff, Gunjan she is very profesional and extremely helpful. In the hotel very clean and large rooms,nice food at the restaurant  serving  very nice Indian and international food  and very good breakfast.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: ndpn299
Detailed Review: I have been visiting Ajanta regularly. Its a nice hotel with courteous staff, clean rooms and good food at the in house restaurant. However, they can bring in some variety in their breakfast which can get slightly repititive for a long stay.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: theJRaj
Review: Great place to stay in the heart of Delhi!
Detailed Review: The Ajanta is situated right in the heart of Delhi, amongst the hustle and bussle of Indian life. Don't be put off by the road outside the Hotel, because inside you will find comfortable, clean and spacious surroundings. The staff on the reception desk are extremely helpful and always work hard to solve any problems you may encounter.  There is a great restaurant, serving good Indian food within the hotel, and breakfast is normally included in the room rate. For breakfast, can have Indian of course, fresh fruit, toast and cereal. Plenty of westerners stay there, so you won't feel too much out of place.  Included in the price is a free pick up from the airport if you require it, and they also have a money desk for changing currency. My room was clean and comfortable with all mod‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Leanne R
Detailed Review: Eddy, the Guest Services Manager was very helpful and quite charming.On check in he gave me a map and an overview of our location. I witnessed him help an older lady celebrate her birthday in the restaurant and I have no doubt that was the cherry on top of her birthday cake. A great local Sunday bazaar was just a short tuk tuk ride away where very reasonable, local, fixed price transactions were in place which made for some great buys without the stress of wondering if your bargaining was really a deal or not. I spied a delightful Hindu Temple directly across the road and was warmly welcomed inside by the Priest. My room opened on to a balcony that looked over the road, I spent quite a bit of time observing daily Indian life from that spot. My bed was very large and comfortable,‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Letiana B
Detailed Review: My stay at Ajanta hotel was nice and pleasant. The staff is very respectful and kind. The breakfast is delicious and  fresh. Rooms and bathrooms are cleaned. Maybe not the most luxury hotel but super clean and neat!! Is why I love to stay in it. Also, the lady that welcome the guest at the hotel entrance is very kind! Her smile catch your heart and wants you to stay there...

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: coolbritannia50
Detailed Review: My sister and me stayed two nights in the Hotel Ajanta. We can highly recommend the hotel: very friendly and helpful staff, clean spacious rooms and a nice restaurant. After a very bad experience in another hotel we was so glad to stay in the Ajanta and we will certainly return on our next holiday!!!!

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: –°–µ—Ä–≥–µ–π –õ
Detailed Review: Dates: 03-06 November  2017. Booking - 1903015166.  We planned a family trip to India, starting at New Dehli for a daylong sightseeing tour and a daylong round trip to Agra to see Taj, therefore we were seeking for a comfortable hotel near the New Dehli Rail Station at Paharganj.  Having read tons of different comments concerning the accommodation at the nearest hotels, we chose to stay at a Suite at Ajanta hotel, though a little costly comparing to other hotels at Paharganj, thinking that our first impression upon arrival to Dehli will be next to a cultural shock and the night at a cozy clean spacious room would sweeten the pill a little.  Being aware that there had been incidents when the hotel representatives didn‚Äôt know anything about the booking made far in advance we‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Marn√© M
Detailed Review: To all the staff thank you for best stay in India! Yes the wifi sometime do not work... And yes they can clean a bit more... But the manager and staff was the blessing in India he organized 7 days traveling flying and staying in the whole of India for the best price! You will not get this online!! Trust me we did try! Thank you for a wonderful stay I will visit again!

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Shri_15
Review: I have stayed in the hotel second week of November, 2017.
Detailed Review: Cushion of the Beds are uncomfortable. Otherwise Hotel Provides pleasant Stay.  The Hotel location is convenient from New Delhi Station and Airport. The Hotel is expensive in proportion to facilities provided. .

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Abrar S
Detailed Review: Stayed at this hotel for a day in their Suite category. To put it straight, it is a very ordinary hotel which charges excessivly (5K) for a day and half. It seems like an old property that has been refurbished with new fittings (bathroom, furniture et al) but nothing of it has been maintained well. It looks all shabby and unclean when you enter inside and your eyes reach out to the four corners of the hotel room. Don't be fooled with the pictures, they are just pictures and nothing that you can truly experience in real.  Stay away is all I can say.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Trip92idf
Detailed Review: Nice hotel at a walking distance from New Delhi Station. The room was clean and confortable and the restaurant was good. The staff was very friendly, especially the girl at the desk (sorry I don't know her name :)) who was always able to find solutions to questions. The only drawback was the poor quality of the wifi.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Franziska W
Detailed Review: We had a nice time staying in Hotel Ajanta! The rooms where clean and comfortable but also not very expensive. The friendliness of the staff was extraordinary compared to other places... we got very effective help with planning our ongoing trip. Definitely worth a stay!

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sonali M
Detailed Review: Location is very good and getting transport is very easy. Service is good. They do quick laundry service. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Their buffet breakfast is awesome. Staff is helpful and professional.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Devendra G
Detailed Review: An excellent hotel to stay with high class amenities. It is an luxurious hotel with top quality food . Ambience of the hotel is very pleasant . Every time i came to delhi i stay in this hotel only bcoz the staff is also very friendly and ready to help 24 * 7. I would rate it 5 out of 5 üòä

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Virginia D
Detailed Review: I was very pleased with this hotel. It is clean, comfortable, staff is polite and helpful, and I enjoyed all my meals in their restaurant. It is walking distance from train station, all types of transportation is easily handled here . I believe they have a very helpful travel advising staff too. They made all our travel, Hotel, tour guide arrangements for our jaunt around the surrounding area and everything worked out perfectly. We were very pleased with this service . It would have been a tremendous task to self-arrange all this ourselves . It is an older building but has been kept up well, perhaps the neighborhood could have been better but that didn‚Äôt turn out to be much of an issue.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Akshaychugh
Detailed Review: We booked a trip for our friends from France and they delivered more than what was promised at a very reasonable rate. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a comfortable and affordable stay.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: MikeJ84
Detailed Review: We stayed here for our entire time in Delhi in one of the budget rooms.  The room was clean and perfect for what we needed. It was very quiet given the central location of the hotel. The location itself is not far from the bazaars and a very busy area. This is true central Delhi, the surrounding streets can be a culture shock for first timers, but we felt safe walking to and from the hotel. I suggest downloading the area onto your google maps as it can be a bit of a maze.  The staff and owner were very helpful and friendly - the owner organised a driver for us for a day and he took us to all the sights in Delhi.  The hotel has a restaurant on the top floor. The view isnt anything special, but the food was amazing! Banana and honey pancakes for breakfast, great masala chai and‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Caish L
Detailed Review: Had a great two night stay here! Good food and friendly staff. Really helpful if you want to book any tours or buses! Very professional and don‚Äôt over charge anything! Definitely a diamond amongst the rough

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: michel l
Detailed Review: We booked the flight to Delhi. At home we makes our own schedule for 5 weeks to travel in the North of India. We booked for the first 2 nights in Hotel amax inn. This hotel is very clean and good rooms and good good. After a good night sleep and a nice cycle trip. We meet the man from Amax inn. He asked us if he can help us with our journey. I already read good reviews about him. So we took the time to listen to him and him our plans. Together with him we planned our to trip. His advice was so good. He arranged us a perfect driver Rana for the first 14 days. He also booked our train and fly tickets  I only can say everything was perfectly arranged. Even when we changed something in our plans and flyeds. He managed the we have refund our money Now we are almost at the and if our‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Eline G
Review: Hotel and traveling through Rajasthan with private Taxi driver
Detailed Review: Nice Hotel, delicious food and kind people. You are save here and know for sure that people want to help you to make your stay in India incredible. We planed a 9 days trip with a private Taxi driver (called Mohan) and we loved it. I can really recommend Amax Inn, you will not be disappointed.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Michael P
Detailed Review: Staff are very helpful and the hotel is well located. Rooms tend to be on the small side. Hotel is reasonably clean. Great wi fi. The PowerPoint in our rooms did not work and there was no hot water. Food is tasty but menu is small.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Akshaychugh
Detailed Review: We booked a trip for our friends from France and they delivered more than what was promised at a very reasonable rate. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a comfortable and affordable stay.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Michael P
Detailed Review: Staff are very helpful and the hotel is well located. Rooms tend to be on the small side. Hotel is reasonably clean. Great wi fi. The PowerPoint in our rooms did not work and there was no hot water. Food is tasty but menu is small.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jo N
Detailed Review: My girlfriend and me went to india to study abroad for five months. We found the juggad hostel on our second day in india just random, but this was the best thing that could happend to us. Finally we stayed in jugaad almost our whole time in india and this has several reasons. It is a clean and cosy hostel with a lot space, you can have a good time with nice people at the awesome rooftop or in the commonroom, but u can also have space for your own if you like. The rooms are clean and cosy the doorms as well as the privatrooms and the staff clean them constant. Every evening u can have a delicious indian meal for a few rupies or you can cook your own meal in the commonkitchen. If you want to visit the popular sights of delhi u can reach them easy from the jugaad hostel by‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: jessyek2017
Review: Great hostel, DO NOT use their travel person to book.
Detailed Review: Hostel is amazing. The person who does the travel agent stuff is HORRIBLE. Beyond rude and mean, he also booked us the wrong tickets assuring they were right. We were 3 hours from where we needed to be after spending a lot of money on the train tickets. We arrived at 6 am far from hospet & Hampi. We‚Äôre short on time so it really sucked. Book through somewhere else but hostel staff and place is great.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Riza1117
Detailed Review: I booked ,cancelled and stayed :p All because of our flight delay. In my very short stay, I would say i liked it because of the spacious clean rooms, welcoming, friendly and helpful staff. Overall, the ambiance is good and I would definitely recommend this place. Only thing is it's a little difficult to find in the wee hours of the morning. Place some signage will yah!?

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Bob N
Detailed Review: We spent there a week and we had a very good time! The bathrooms and rooms are clean and the top floor theras   Is beautiful! The breakfast is ok nothing amazing but good. Chai is given and is sweet and good!  We did the food tour and it was great!   I would totally recommend this hostel! We met amazing people!

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: blancopoulo
Detailed Review: We went to this place because of the good reviews, but in our case the experience wasn't that nice at all.  The toilet was dirty, most of the days we couldn't have a warm shower, the towels were SO STINKY we had to take them out of the room, and the bed sheets had several stains. We used our own towels and sleeping bags, of course.  When we were leaving, they went to check everything was OK on the rooms, and a guy came saying one of the bed sheets had a stain (another one, I guess), and that we will have to pay it if they couldn't remove it. So they took the bed sheet and rub it on the sink. The stain disappeared, so they put the sheet back on the bed, and let us go.  SO, this is the way they clean the linens on Smile Inn. I guess this is why the towels were so stinky too. ‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Nfalduti
Detailed Review: Great budget hotel in a great location in Delhi! Few minutes to all sight seeing of the city! I really recommend it!! The personal always ready to help me with everything! Clean and cozy room! With all services working perfectly!

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Eyal B
Detailed Review: The Positive: Room was very clean and well maintained. The hotel was very professionally managed, service was efficient, and my experience was good.  Needs improvement:  Bathroom is missing a place to put things like toothbrush, shampoo, brush, creams, etc. Also in the bathroom, the towel's hanger is right under the shower-head.  Breakfast is quite small, and not really filling - yet coffee was surprisingly good! The blankets looked old, used and didn't seem clean.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Carola D
Detailed Review: Our experience at Smyle Inn was VERY nice and I highly recommend this place... specially for newcomers! (which we were). They sent somebody to pick us up from the airport,  sthing that I am very grateful to have booked - even when we always prefer the 'local way'. Here, things are different, and during our stay we heard of MANY people being scammed while taking tuktuks to their hotels (In case you don't book a pick up, do NOT believe that all hotels are fully booked, they will say that to make tourist pay for a car to take them outside Delhi paying crazy sums of money).  Smyle Inn welcomed us warmly and they gave us a very nice room, with a clean own toilet with hot water upon request. There is a phone in the room to contact reception whenever you need, which is handy. The staff‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Rishi G
Review: Very pleasant stay with warm gesture
Detailed Review: It was only 1 day visit for me but i was deeply touched with the rooms and the service provided by smyle inn staff. Its a walking distance from new delhi railway station adjoining road to citi bank atm (approx 600 metres from new delhi railway station), If you are looking for cheap but pleasant stay at paharganj, I surely recommend hotel Smyle Inn. I didnt tried the food there but room was very nice, small but clean, Also they provide the MMT welcome kit, that other hotels don't provide at all. I MUST RECOMMEND THIS FOR EVERY 1 as its a little inside from the main road you will not suffer from any noice outside and can get a nice sleep out here. Also the hotel owner was very polite and well mannered. Thanks hotel smyle inn :)

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Angel V
Detailed Review: Stayed in hostel Smyle inn in Delhi afew nights. Very good location, only 10 min away Railway St and Metro. Very frendly staff. Travel desk at 3, very helpful guy to advise about trains, buses, day trips etc. Breakdast included onthe top roof. Very convinient. I would stay again.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Cristian V
Detailed Review: We stayed in a four-people room, very comfortable and clean, value for money. It has a good location, you can get many places in a short tuk tuk trip. I definitely recommend it for everyone who want to enjoy New Delhi.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: kasface
Detailed Review: My husband and I stayed in The Smyle for 5 nights and it was fantastic. We stayed in a basic room and it was quite large, the bed was clean and comfortable, the t.v had about 100 English channels which is perfect for an evening of relaxing away from the heat and hustle and bustle of Pahar Ganj and the shower was hot. Can‚Äôt fault the location as it‚Äôs central to everything and it has a nice rooftop to chill, meet people and have a drink. We got upgraded on our last night to Superior and that was a really nice treat! I should also mention the tour guy who has an office in the hotel, he planned a 3 day trip to Agra for us and it was perfect too and not overpriced like most commissioned tour companies in the area.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: blancopoulo
Review: Nice place in the heart of New Delhi
Detailed Review: We went to this place because of the good reviews, but in our case the experience wasn't that nice at all.  The toilet was dirty, most of the days we couldn't have a warm shower, the towels were SO STINKY we had to take them out of the room, and the bed sheets had several stains. We used our own towels and sleeping bags, of course.  When we were leaving, they went to check everything was OK on the rooms, and a guy came saying one of the bed sheets had a stain (another one, I guess), and that we will have to pay it if they couldn't remove it. So they took the bed sheet and rub it on the sink. The stain disappeared, so they put the sheet back on the bed, and let us go.  SO, this is the way they clean the linens on Smile Inn. I guess this is why the towels were so stinky too. ‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: jamp51
Detailed Review: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at Colonel's Retreat three nights in October 17. It was just upon our arrival in India. We were impressed by the kindness of the people, the history of the building and the food, served on the roof terrace.  We really enjoyed this small hotel. The room, the food, the staff and the owners made our stay very special.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: somersettraveller08
Detailed Review: This small Home Stay is situated in a quiet residential area. Our room was spotlessly clean and the bathroom very large. Toiletries were supplied and the towels soft.  My wife was feeling nauseous and when the Gentleman of the house (the son-in-law of the Colonel) realised at breakfast the following morning, he expressed concern and then sent his driver to the pharmacy to get some pills he assured us would make her feel better. Not only did the pills work extremely well but there was no charge for this service.  Meals (delicious) were served on the roof and I was surprised and pleased to see the staff wearing disposable gloves.  I have given 5 stars based on a comparison with other establishments at the same price point and I'm happy to recommend The Colonel's Retreat as a good‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: pfcling
Detailed Review: Colonel's Retreat: is an oasis of calm in an extremely busy and quite polluted city.  I loved my room and the comfortable "communal area" on the third floor where I stayed.  The staff was awesome, nothing was too much for your satisfaction during your stay.  I will definitely stay here again, and will highly recommend this hotel for others who are planning trips to India.  A real jewel in Delhi!

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Beat S
Detailed Review: Colonel's Retreat is a good place to stay for a few days in Delhi as it provides an excellent refuge from the hustle and bustle of Delhi. It is located in a residential section of Delhi that offers a good nights sleep in a quiet environment. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Although it is more of a B&B type of place, it offers good food for dinner on the roof top terrace. The rooms are comfortable - although starting to show a little bit of wear and tear, but not anything that would prevent me from staying there again in the future.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Philip T
Detailed Review: Great place to stay in south Delhi.  Close to Lajpat Nagar metro station and plenty of the main sites.  There is a rooftop restaurant with excellent food and the staff were extremely helpful and able to offer advice and arrange taxis for us.  We visited during Diwali and the hosts kindly involved all of the guests in a small ceremony after which we watched the fireworks from the rooftop!

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Graham_J0hn
Review: Marvellous start (and finish) to out trip to India.
Detailed Review: Colonel‚Äôs Retreat is the first hotel we stayed at on our first trip to India (and it will also be where we spend our final night of this vacation). It is well situated in a (relatively) quiet area of modern Delhi, but within reasonable driving distance of all the attractions of this fascinating city. Our modern room was spacious, well decorated and immaculately clean - as was the whole hotel. Meals are served in the rooftop restaurant. Unfortunately, due to some excursions that started early, we only had the opportunity to sample the breakfast on one morning, but we can highly recommend the traditional Indian breakfast, which combines dishes from the north and the south of the country. Complimentary tea/coffee and cake is served between 5 and 6pm - and if you have the chance you‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: HolidayBliss8
Review: Wonderful and Welcoming Accommodation for 1st visit to Delhi
Detailed Review: Thoroughly enjoyed our 6 x nights here during October 17.  Quiet and spacious room, comfy big bed with air con.  Big common lounge on each floor, good range of informative books to read and plenty of delightful staff around to attend to your needs.  We loved breakfast and dinner on the roof terrace, watching the eagles and kites circling in the sky and meeting up with the very pleasant owners and other guests each evening.  Easy walk to Metro which we used several times.  Nearby N and M Block Markets were well worth a visit and Swagath Restaurant in Defence Village and Le Bistro Du Parc were terrific. Interesting to hear the various wallah coming through the streets each morning on pushbikes with a huge range of fresh produce for the residents to buy. Laundry service was so‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: nicdayman
Detailed Review: Had 2 nights in a great homestay with a lovely rooftop restaurant. Rooms were very comfortable with large bathrooms.Market and ATMs nearby.  Nice staff and helpful proprietor. Arranged transport for a day in Delhi and also to the airport. Very good all round.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Rozzymay
Detailed Review: Welcome first stop on arrival in India. Our hosts ensured a personal approach, always friendly and available on the rooftop terrace where we enjoyed their home baked bread, sampled Indian style Akuri( scrambled egg) and also the home cooked (renowned) banana bread. We returned on the evening of Divali for an overnight stop-  Beautifully decorated and a perfect place on the roof to watch the night sky celebrations. Comfortable rooms, good wifi reception. Ideal Homestay for us.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sandra D
Detailed Review: Stayed here as part of our tour. This property is like a small hotel/B&B.  On each floor there are about three rooms that share a common lounge and dining area making it ideal for small groups.  Dining is available on the roof top. Breakfast included home made jams and bread. Cereal, eggs cooked various ways and Indian breakfast could be selected. Afternoon tea was also provided.  Our guide told us that we could eat out for dinner as night time meal was expensive, however we choose to eat at the hotel and were not disappointed.  We found the prices reasonable and the food was delicious. Although we didn't - cooking demonstrations can be requested, not sure of the cost but you get to eat what has been cooked. The hotel was in a safe location and it was a short 10 minute walk to‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Rachel K
Detailed Review: This hotel was delightful!  Service was excellent, everyone was friendly and the Colonel himself came to say good morning to his guests every morning.  Next time I'm in Delhi I shall be booking in here.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Graeme14
Review: Nice change from your standard hotel offerings
Detailed Review: My wife and I stayed in this accommodation on our first night on a trip to India. The accommodation is around 30-40 minutes from Delhi airport and is situated in a nice area of the city. It's also handy for the metro. The accommodation has been an old residence converted into a hotel.  OK this is not five star luxury but our room was very comfortable with AC and en suite as well as tea/ coffee making facilities. There are plenty common areas in the hotel where you can chill out. The restaurant is on the roof. We enjoyed a superb evening meal there and would highly recommend the food. Unfortunately we had to leave in the morning before breakfast but the hotel provide an enjoyable packed breakfast.  The staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. ‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: albertrutz
Review: Very convenient and reasonable stay in Delhi!
Detailed Review: It was not easy to choose a hotel in Delhi. So I expected I would probably have to go for a ‚Äöhigh class‚Äò hotel. But then I found out (from traveller-reviews) that even expensive hotels are no guarntee for a convinient stay in Delhi. Maybe they are far from the centre, or you get a lot of extra charges, or the management does not meet your expectations, or the staff is somewhat careless... Well, all of this does not apply to the Hotel Ajanta! The location is good, the offered services are good (I was picked up at the airport literally in the middle of the night), there is a travel agency just next to the reception, led with great competence by Mr. Zahoor Baktoo, and there is a restaurant in the ground-floor which is frequented not only by guests of the hotel, but also by people‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: wemite
Detailed Review: I travel often to Delhi and have stayed at another hotel in Paharganj many times. On this trip I decided to try Hotel Ajanta and was very pleased. The hotel is well maintained and the rooms are pleasant. A good buffet breakfast is also provided with good variety.  Above all, I was impressed by the staff at the front desk being very friendly and professional in their manner. On one occasion when I needed transportation on short notice it was provided without hesitation.  I would highly recommend the Ajanta and will return on my next visit.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: chrishartley1974
Detailed Review: Service was friendly and helpful and the airport pickup is exactly what you need when arriving in India. The transport was  waiting with a signboard with my name on  at the exit gate even at 4 in the morning. The hotel itself was efficient but dated(ask to see other rooms before you accept,good advice for all India). If you are expecting the same standard as in europe for your 40 euros then you will be dissapointed. Bathrooms are not India's  best offer and here was no exception! That said, the breakfast was a great start to the day and the staff were fine. You will struggle to be quiet anywhere in Delhi so dont expect anything different here. Overall it was a good enough hotel but overpriced. But Delhi is expensive!

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: CaliforniaGal36
Review: Great location in old Delhi and great value
Detailed Review: This hotel is modest, has a good restaurant,  good rates, and good staff. As a single female traveler, I recommend it. I was not only able to change money at a good rate, but there was also a desk to book tours and travel advice. A nice perk is that I got picked up from the airport and taken to the hotel.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: astar n
Review: An excellent hotel with a team of employees and managers who are willing to help with any request or question
Detailed Review: On the second day of my stay at the Delhi, my bag with my pasport is stolen during a day trip.  The hotel owner heard the case and helped me in any way he could.  The hotel staff was sensitive to the case, everyone helped me and supported me at any hour of the day. The owner of the hotel provided the hotel's driver for errands and sent his assistant to file a complaint with me at the police station. The hotel itself is clean and pleasant  recommended !!

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Tara G
Review: Great stay in Ajanta Hotel - highly recommend!
Detailed Review: Friendly, helpful staff. Good travel advice and help to arrange a whole week of sight seeing. Our driver, Ranjan, was superb. Excellent family room. Good restaurant in hotel and cafe opposite. Perfect location and would definitely recommend to families visiting Dehli!

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Koronilover
Review: A great stay in busy Delhi!
Detailed Review: We really had a good time at Hotel Ajanta. Very polite and helpful staff, very clean. The room was spacious and the bed super comfy. Breakfast was tasty and of good quality. Sure, Arakashan road is not the most quiet road - but come on, where is Delhi quiet? We felt very warmly welcomed and always safe during day and night.  I highly recommend Hotel Ajanta!

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: LinknEddy
Detailed Review: The hotel arranged our pick up from the airport. Landed around midnight so this was greatly appreciated. The room was comfortable and a good breakfast included. All the staff were so friendly. We had 3 days at this hotel before going travelling so we took up the offer of the sightseeing tour around Delhi. We arranged this within the hotel for Rs800. The tuk tuk driver was terrific and gave us a wonderful day out. The Ajanta hotel gave us a great start to our trip. Can highly recommend it.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: John-Tuffin
Detailed Review: I have stayed here many times over the last ten years.  It has always been a pleasure to come back. The quality is consistently high - comfortable clean quiet rooms, good food, charming and efficient staff, and efficient airport collection and drop off.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: mth180
Detailed Review: The location is good ... easy walking to railway station and local market. Plenty of tuk tuks, taxis, cycle rickshaws around the hotel to take you further afield. The hotel is well run, clean and comfortable, and often very busy. Lady receptionist outstandingly good but all the staff were pleasant and helpful. Our room was spacious and well equipped. View of the street below, so some traffic noise, but not too intrusive. Good air con, fans, fridge/mini bar, mattress and softest pillows in India! Restaurant - disappointing. Sometimes over busy. Staff mostly grumpy. Breakfast very limited for western tastes. Place never seemed particularly clean. Cafe Voyage across the road but owned by the same hotel - good value, clean, good selection of drinks and bites (great chocolate cake!)‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: spencerserra
Detailed Review: From the moment we checked in to Ajanta in New Delhi we felt welcomed and taken care of by all the helpful and fun staff. Zahoor Baktoo, the travel agent that works in Hotel Adjanta took care of all the logistics for our entire stay in India and was very helpful and an enjoyable guy to talk to. It was my girlfriend and I's 5 year anniversary and they surprised us with some free chocolate cake and coffee with happy anniversary written on it. Make sure you talk to Ravi, the friendly talkative hotel driver that can drive you around Delhi all day for a good price. The attached restaurant is decently priced and has pretty good food. The rooms are clean and quiet at night. Overall great hotel with great service and friendly staff. Would definitely stay here again.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: muriel a
Detailed Review: on the night of our arrival, we were picked up at the airport by a driver send by the hotel eventhough we were delayed almost 2hrs (mainly b/c of the very slow and lengthy procedures at igia).  our room was ok. we would especially like to thank m. rasheed who put up a very nice 2-day golden triangle tour w/all the hotel reservations (agra and jaipur). he organized everything w/out prior notice and everything went very smoothly and as planned. we cannot thank m rasheed enough...thanks to him our trip to india took a very different and wonderful turn. we extend our gratitude to mr singh who was the driver appointed to us by the hotel for that tour and turned out to be a really priceless travel companion. we would definitely go back to ajanta and recommend the hotel to the curious‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Willo34
Detailed Review: Hotel's ok but location is shocking. It's in the middle of the market but good thing is its very close to the train station. The metro trains are about 10mins drive to Connaught place. If you have phone data I strongly suggest Uber around Delhi. There are many around the hotel and they'll pick you up right at the door step. Fixed price and can't get ripped off and very comfortable.  Breakfast buffet was very nice but be aware it's mainly indian style breakfast.  Rooms were alright too and good for the price.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Piriya N
Detailed Review: 5 of us stayed in the family room. There were 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms inside. Very comfortable and really match for family and friends. Besides that the owner gives us  really useful information and fair deal. The in house restaurant was very nice as well. Give us real satisfaction.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: WritingNomad
Detailed Review: Ajanta Hotel was exceptional - we weren't sure what to expect on booking, so were extremely happy to be very impressed with our clean and spacious room, the hospitable and accomodating staff and especially Zahoor who helped us out multiple times. Ajanta is a great choice with its central location (a seven minute walk from markets) and surrounding shops, as well as the well-priced restaurant downstairs. Highly recommend!

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: BoardingPass736465
Detailed Review: This hotel's staff is incredible! They went out of their way to make sure me and my partner felt comfortable and that we got to see the best parts of Delhi.  Zahoor Baktoo is a travel agent there who completely took us under his wings to insure that our experience in India would be exactly what we wanted it to be. He helped us with everything! From booking the hotels, to train tickets, to airport pick ups and drop offs, to full day tours of Delhi, and even with a complimentary taxi ride to and from our anniversary dinner reservation!!! We never felt without a resource with Zahoor on our side.  Hari was another memorable staff member who greeted us with a warm welcome and smiles everyday we were there. He even came with us to the train station, which can be overwhelming for‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Eusebio
Review: In the Bustle of Pahar Ganj, Better Than Expected
Detailed Review: I know that sounds like an unflattering title to a review but I had paid ¬£13 per night for my room via Agoda for an ensuite/air conditioned room including breakfast. My expectations were low even if the website gave a pleasant view of the hotel.  Firstly, if you're coming to Pahar Ganj then you have landed in full on touristy yet grimy Delhi. Nothing is as quiet as you'd expect from a Western tourist location. The streets are quite disconcerting but ultimately rewarding (walk more/auto-rickshaw less).  Within that context, the room I had in the Ajanta was a spotlessly clean and had comfortable twin beds, air conditioning that was usually up to the task (27 degrees centigrade at 1am was a challenge even with the a/c on full blast and fan going). The ground floor was a little‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Dax B
Detailed Review: The staff was really friendly, helpful. The rooms very comfortable and the breakfast was good. Specially Jack Ramzan was awesome, he planned our entire holidays with hotels, plane tickets, transportation, tours, everything!!! Great experience

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: beadfreak
Review: A Great Hotel in the Heart of Delhi
Detailed Review: This hotel is tops I recently stayed here with my husband and grandson. My daughter and her partner recently stayed here as well. We found all the staff to be so friendly and helpful, especially the lovely young lady on reception and also Mr Zahoor Baktoo is very informative.  The hotel is clean if you book a supreme double room, the standard room is not so. The bathroom is okay and would be excellent if a strong light was exchanged for the poor, weak, dim light.( my husband couldn't see properly to shave) You can hardly see at all. Also the hot water is not hot it only has the chill taken off. Temperature controlled according to Mr Baktoo. This maybe is what he prefers but most westerners don't like it. Bedding and towels are excellent, aircon and fan are  great. Breakfast‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: sheiladascmc
Review: I prefer staying  in  this hotel during my travel within India & internationally 4-5 times a year .
Detailed Review: The front desk  officers are polite & friendly , so also  are the bell boys & other attendants . The rooms  are clean & comfortable . The food is good . I want to compliment the present Chef for doing a great job !

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: rhiannonharrison
Detailed Review: Not only was the hotel nice, but Zahoor Baktoo was an excellent travel agent. He scheduled my tour of the Golden Triangle with driver, Ved Bist. I was able to see a lot in the little bit of time I had in Delhi thanks to them. You just tell him what you want to do and he takes care of the rest. I was able to keep my luggage in the air-conditioned car (which is something I am not very trusting to do) and Ved drove me from place to place letting me tour each sight and waiting patiently until I finished. He dropped me off at the airport safe and sound and I would not have been able to see nearly as much as I did thanks to Zahoor and Ved. I would highly recommend them both to be a part of your trip to India.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: James B
Detailed Review: I got a room for 2000 rupees.  The room is fine but it has 2 problems.  The minor one is that the wifi speed is capped at 50kb/s which is quite slow.  The major one is that the air from the AC is dirty. Has that distinctive smell many badget hotels have after you ender a closed room. It's probably due to unclean filters or moist in the air pipes or both.  Bottom line is you'd probably be better with the AC off (and heat on). And although it has a ceiling fan the room needs to be ventilated through the window which will leave it exposed to noise and flying bugs.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: DGB
Detailed Review: Everythg abt d hotel is gud .. my 10 th stay at d hotel. D room r clean . Food is gud .. reception staff is very friendly n helpful..... n menu need to be upgraded a bit n mini bar to . Hope to visit soon again

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Subhankar G
Detailed Review: rooms are just awesome u can get the utmost luxary here and there are many things that to see... the roof top resturant and the view from there is awesome .. there id free wifi and the things are very well organsed.. going to delhi book early from here

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: samclear1
Detailed Review: We had a good stay at Hotel Amax Inn!  The room was clean, smart and comfortable, and the rooftop restaurant did great food and drink.  The location was good for us: close to the Parharganj bazaars, and within easy walking distance of the train station and a couple of metro stops.  Our room didn't have a window, which we didn't mind, but its worth checking if you want natural light!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ilya Osipov
Detailed Review: A good hotel with friendly staff that will do their best to make your staying as positive as possible. In here you can relax after cruising in the city, though the Paharganj neighborhood may not be very comfortable for relaxed walking, but it was not a problem for me, it was even more interesting than sterile dull streets, because - it is India anyway). Recommended. (Do not ever believe the rascal rickshaw-drivers who say that Paharganj area "is not safe"; better call Amax Inn staff after arriving in the station/airport and arrange the pick up or just to be sure that everithing is safe and ok, because the rickshaws will try to take you to some "govt. tourist office" to make you book their hotel - this all is monstrous trickery).

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Catrien N
Detailed Review: It was the fifth time we stayed in this nice hotel and again enjoyed the welcoming atmosphere and the help of the friendly staff. Though the hotel‚Äôs location is a little bit hidden from sight, it is great inside, with nice and clean rooms, beautiful bathrooms, good working wifi and delicious food served in the restaurant upstairs. We will certainly pick this hotel again next time.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: –ê—Ä—Ç—ë–º –ö
Review: Best place to stay in Delhi
Detailed Review: I always stay here. Among of zillion hotels around Amax is one of the best. This is not just about rooms, it's about service. Very helpful staff. They really care about you and your needs. Can help with almost everything: tickets, information etc. Just come and enjoy.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Francoise P
Review: Experience in Delhi at Amax Inn
Detailed Review: Thankfully I was at AmaxInn hotel when I have been stolen my belongings!!! 27 days supporting me with my anxiety, sadness, hopes and finally success recovering the essentials! Owners have been so patience-full, helpful in all means, not being invasive either. And the place is quiet being in such a centre, clean with a team of young gentlemen. I felt homey even in such a trouble, secure and glad to be there.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: No√©mie C
Detailed Review: Clean room with ac. It's a little bit expensive but that's just delhi in general. Not the most beautiful hotel or location but worth the value. Nice owner who wants to improve his hotel and quite nice service.  You stepped outside the hotel, is chaos but that's India so didn't matter for us. The street looks like another world at night!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: lilygreen10
Review: Five years later, still the best hotel in Delhi
Detailed Review: Five years ago, I stayed at this hotel and it was fantastic. I recently returned, now with my super energetic four year old son, and it is still fantastic. There have been some upgrades in the lobby and the restaurant, but overall the hotel is as though we left it yesterday. Beautiful, clean, safe, and staffed by friendly guys who remembered all of us. This is our home away from home in Delhi, thanks for another great stay! Pro tip: banana pancakes for breakfast are delicious.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Maria P
Detailed Review: Had a good stay at this hotel. It is not a beautiful or spacious place but for the price it is great. The rooms are very basic but clean and with AC. It‚Äôs definitely not located in the nicest place of New Delhi but that was kind of the point for me. I always felt safe but still felt the chaos of Delhi as soon as I stepped out and loved it. I didn‚Äôt go all the way to India to not get a real feel for it. Staff at the front desk were very helpful with valuable information and allowed us to leave our luggage for a couple of hours after check out on our last day. Overall I would recommend this hotel for those who are on a budget or who simply want to experience the rawness of Delhi.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Gautam D
Detailed Review: I was traveling with my family.The stuff was nice. The room was clean and the stuff was very polite to us. They always ready to help us. They have a open rooftop   restaurant which was good. Room was perfect  as I seen in the hotel website. Specialy the owner was very active about the service of the hotel. I was really  happy  and appreciate this hotel. If I come again to Delhi I will come to this place.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Baby S
Detailed Review: It felt good to stay here. Room service was good. Foods were tasty. The behaviour of the staffs were extremely good. The hotel was neat and clean. Would love to come back again. And would recommend this hotel to people coming in Delhi.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: eleanorp871
Review: Relaxed and safe with kind helpful staff
Detailed Review: I came to Delhi after 35 years and had no idea what to expect. I came to Paharganj as this is the backpacker area. It is very different to my earlier experience in 5* hotels. This hotel is a perfect retreat from the crazy busy streets. Our room was basic but perfectly adequate and clean. The rooftop provided a lovely place to be outside -high enough to feel far away from the mania of the streets and a good compensation from our room which had no natural daylight. We only ate there twice as we wanted to try other places in the area. The food was good. We were also happy and comfortable to sit up there playing cards with just a drink. The staff are courteous and helpful and the management really want to know that you are happy and your needs are met.  If I return and want to be in‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Elke S
Detailed Review: Good hotel, right in the middle of crazy, dusty, loud Paharganj in Delhi. The room was clean and definetly very comfortable. AC made a lot of noise, though. The staff was friendly and helpful when i asked, and the food delicious! Because I had to get used to all the craziness in Delhi, i did a tour through the city with the hotels driver: Vinod. A friendly, not very talkative man, felt safe with him.  But, since i am traveling solo, it was a bit of a dissapointment that i did not meet or see any other backpackers here, although i spent enough time on the rooftop terrace. Overall, fine hotel.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sudip B
Detailed Review: Hotel Amax Inn when we entered with family it gives me perfect feel. I had seen the Rooms and bathrooms I was amazed with quality and standards of the Rooms for this price. The food we had at Hotel many times and it was delicious and not expensive. The reception and staff was always welcoming and smiling. It's perfect place for families.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jane R
Detailed Review: I would no go back there..small room felt unsafe could not wait to leave..place was clean that was the only plus side..loads of unsafe stairs that i could not manage with cases.glad when i left. Will not be returning

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ola O
Detailed Review: Amax Inn is perfect place for stay in Delhi. It's my first visit and I got this place from Lonely planet. The Rooms are clean with all nice modern facilites. The food on roof top is yummy with varity of items and not expensive. The staff is polotite and helpful. Coming back again.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Elina K
Detailed Review: Great location, near New Delhi train station. Tuc tuc cars at the every corner. Comfortable room and great service from every begining. Room was clean and with air conditioner also big bathroom. Happy staff with very happy boss!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Annija G
Detailed Review: Book your Hotel in Delhi online. No reservation costs and good rates. Great stay, close to New Delhi train station, staff was friendly and helpful, good WiFi. Bright, clean room, nice bathroom and air conditioner. Thank you!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Subhankar G
Detailed Review: rooms are just awesome u can get the utmost luxary here and there are many things that to see... the roof top resturant and the view from there is awesome .. there id free wifi and the things are very well organsed.. going to delhi book early from here

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ola O
Detailed Review: Amax Inn is perfect place for stay in Delhi. It's my first visit and I got this place from Lonely planet. The Rooms are clean with all nice modern facilites. The food on roof top is yummy with varity of items and not expensive. The staff is polotite and helpful. Coming back again.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Elina K
Detailed Review: Great location, near New Delhi train station. Tuc tuc cars at the every corner. Comfortable room and great service from every begining. Room was clean and with air conditioner also big bathroom. Happy staff with very happy boss!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Annija G
Detailed Review: Book your Hotel in Delhi online. No reservation costs and good rates. Great stay, close to New Delhi train station, staff was friendly and helpful, good WiFi. Bright, clean room, nice bathroom and air conditioner. Thank you!

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Camila R
Review: Fist impression of india! Just loved
Detailed Review: This was my first time in India and I booked this hostel literally on the plane, it was definitely the best decision ever. The hostel is really nice, at the beginning I was scared about the location because it seems dirty around but then I realize mostly of the places in Delhi are like that.  The hostel is amazing, the rooms are clean, WiFi works pretty , it has breakfast includes which is a plus but most important it has purified water. The hostel has a rooftop which is amazing to chill, yoga, workout , read, whatever you can imagine and the guest were so friendly and nice. The staff is really nice, specially Rohan who is an internship guy , I learned so many things from him and of course from the other workers in the hostel.   The hostel is located in a good area , pretty easy‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: william m
Review: Easily the best hostel in Delhi
Detailed Review: This is my fourth of fifth visit and this hostel never disappoints! The staff are always exceptionally helpful, on this occasion ever booking my transportation for me in advance of my arrival so that I could travel exactly when I needed to!  The rooftop is excellent and makes a great place to socialise in the evenings, there's access to a fully fledged kitchen which is available at all times apart from when the chef prepares the evening meal...  Excellently located and just a hop skip and jump away from Hauz Khas village and Khan Market, where you will find a side of Delhi you will totally miss if you stay in the Paharganj...  Top place, totally recommend!

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Nicolas M
Detailed Review: The people from the hostel was incredible, they help us with information and everything, and we went out for a tour, festival and party, always with very good disposition. Is a very good backpackers hostel

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: worldcitizen1961
Review: Perfect budget accommodation near New Delhi railway station
Detailed Review: Stayed here for the second time and can definitely recommend this place especially to first time visitors! Stayed this time in one of the ordinary rooms which are in the main building. The room is small but quite adequate, clean, comfortable bed, good AC, hot water on request, TV. The general service could sometimes be better, but hey it's India. If you want a bigger room with slightly more comfort choose the deluxe room which is in a different building nearby. My main reason for recommending this guesthouse is the professional, honest and trustworthy management.  At many places in this area you will find the exact opposite;friendly managers who only try to cheat you selling you expensive simcards, traintickets, taxis, tours etc and who get soon less friendly when you make clear‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Lara C
Detailed Review: Short but pleasant stay! Easy reservation, airport pickup arranged for 2am arrival for 16 students and 2 teachers with a smile! Comfy rooms, free WiFi, free breakfast, easy checkout (we were in a hurry!). Unbeatable price. If we come back to Delhi, we'll come back to Smyle Inn. Thanks for everything!

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: xtrailrunner
Review: It's always a good location to stay in Delhi
Detailed Review: We were here for the fourth time and it was as always a good location to explore Delhi. The hotel is very central near the rilway station (NDLS). Breakfast at the roof top is a good start for the day.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: fredjuvigny
Detailed Review: I stayed 3 nights with my girlfriend at smyle Inn and everything was nice. Our room was not so big but very tidy. The location is great in a small street adjacent to main road bazar, near the railway station and the staff is helpful !

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: travelling40
Detailed Review: We stayed here with our kids when we arrived in Delhi. They arranged pickup from the airport which was useful although our driver decided he needed petrol but didn't have quite enough money to pay for it. It turned our arrival into a 2 hour trip instead of 30 mins but to be fair we didn't mention this to the hostel when we got there. We arrived at the hostel at dusk. It is situated down an alley off the main bazaar so we would never have found it ourselves. At the top of the alley is a urinal so you could perhaps locate it by the smell!  The hostel itself is split over two sites, both down the same alley. We were welcomed with lovely cold bottles of water, our room was small but clean and the bathroom was functional. The air con was quiet and efficient and breakfast was lovely.‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: peterH4529BU
Detailed Review: Par excellence ....honestly...I am a senior individual in age and their attention to my needs was often beyond the call of duty...the honesty and integrityshown by  ALL of the staff was reassuring and. Well accepted  I have stayed here on a number of occasions and one of my main reasons for choosing New Delhi as my base destination as I explored other countries was the warm generosity and kindred spirit of the smylie inn and all its personel  No doubt in a few years the travel bug will once again take over y desires and the smyle inn will be focal in my agenda  Peter dickson ....australia

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: bkgisele
Detailed Review: Our first time in Delhi. We had the driver prior arrival as we arranged with the hotel. The hotel is located on the Main Bazar which is near everything but I would propaply pay a bit more and stay in a better hotel. The room is in average size but the toilet is disgusting and too small, water goes in everywhere during the shower and not clean at al.. Too noisy, people were talking loudly  on the corridor at 4am, it was pretty annoying. The breakfast horrible, no options. The staff saves the hotel, they are friendly and helpful. We didn‚Äôt get the room we booked from advertisement either.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Inbal F
Detailed Review: We've had a great time there! The room was very comfortable and clean. Good location for travelers at the Main Bazar, we didnt have any noise from the crowded street. The stuff were extremely nice and helpful! Highly recommended.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: dmrjan
Detailed Review: More often I come back to this place who feels like home. Very reliable place and the staff is friendly and very helpful. They can arrange a safe pick up from the airport and train station. This place is clean and in the middle of the main bazar. They always arrange my tickets, very helpful. Highly recommend this place for a comfortable stay! Thank you

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: worldcitizen1961
Review: Clean and budget rooms in city centre
Detailed Review: Stayed here for the second time and can definitely recommend this place especially to first time visitors! Stayed this time in one of the ordinary rooms which are in the main building. The room is small but quite adequate, clean, comfortable bed, good AC, hot water on request, TV. The general service could sometimes be better, but hey it's India. If you want a bigger room with slightly more comfort choose the deluxe room which is in a different building nearby. My main reason for recommending this guesthouse is the professional, honest and trustworthy management.  At many places in this area you will find the exact opposite;friendly managers who only try to cheat you selling you expensive simcards, traintickets, taxis, tours etc and who get soon less friendly when you make clear‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Lara C
Detailed Review: Short but pleasant stay! Easy reservation, airport pickup arranged for 2am arrival for 16 students and 2 teachers with a smile! Comfy rooms, free WiFi, free breakfast, easy checkout (we were in a hurry!). Unbeatable price. If we come back to Delhi, we'll come back to Smyle Inn. Thanks for everything!

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: xtrailrunner

Name: dmrjan
