Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Mahesh S
Review: Friendly and accommodating in every way
Detailed Review: You know in your first five minutes that you're in good hands. I landed there in the sweltering heat of June. Every bit of air conditioning counts. The common rooms have ac by day and dorm rooms have ac by night. That ok - it's a budget hostel anyway. The staff are quick to respond no matter what your need. There are two bathrooms en suite in the dorm room - helps beat the morning rush. They are frequently cleaned.   But beware - the hostel is on the 3rd (or 4th floor) and there is no lift. If you've got a tonne of baggage, they'll help you down but not up. Because there's no way of letting them know you've arrived until you climb all the way up :)  Also the location is not metro accessible. Can't win em all :(

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Grace L
Detailed Review: We stayed at this hostel for a few days starting our tour in india. We requested airport transport but for some reason they had computer problems and the request was never arranged as agreed. After we made it, they explained the problem and apologized profusely for the error.   We booked in a female only dorm with 6 beds and 2 bathrooms.  They were clean and what you would expect for the price. There were only two guests at the time and we never felt the need to lock up all of our things.   No one came into the room unless they were sleeping there or needing to clean.  The air was only on for certain times out of the day. Plenty of power outlets to use. Decent breakfast included every morning and dinner available for purchase. The staff.. mainly interns were very helpful with‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: crazytravz
Review: A warm Welcome‚Ä¶ A Fine Hospitality.. And a well appreciated comfortable stay!!
Detailed Review: Jugaad Hostels!! I really was not that impressed of the name when I was looking for a hostel in New Delhi which struck to my eyes while googling. But thought of giving a look, as it may turn the brighter part of the page which I have not seen.. :). Casually I gone through the reviews and to my surprise, the reviews were telling astonishing experiences of people stayed over there. I saw the pic posted by people and without any other thoughts I decided my stay in Delhi must be in Jugaad Hostels!!. I checked for availability of room for the period of stay and I was lucky that rooms were available. After booking through their website, I got a mail from Jugaad team about the info regarding my booking. The mail clearly described all the information required how to reach the hostel and‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Paul F
Detailed Review: We really enjoyed our stay at Jugaad. The staff and owners were very welcoming and helpful in advising us on our trip.  The rooms are clean and the common spaces are comfortable.  Included breakfast was nice.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Stef Rancourt
Detailed Review: I was there for a week ...i was stock in Delhi cause of passeport and visa lost.   The staff was amazingly pro polite helping always nice . The dorms as well as every single rooms were always super well taken care of : clean / organized. They really take good care of business and help you out with anything you may think about !   A peaceful island in the middle of crazy Delhi ! ‚ù§

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: muskaan_17
Detailed Review: Just visited Jugaad hostel yesterday. Was there from 8am till 4 pm in mixed dorm with my husband. They adjusted very nicely though as per their rule, check in time is 2pm. All the staffs Very polite and helpful. Homely arrangement. safety is also maintained. AC shall run from 9pm to 9 am. But rooms are not hot without AC (no windows in the rooms). Open terrace with nice sitting arrangement where u can have ur food. its neat and clean. Strictly for budget travelers. Little bohemian style. Their behavior and helpful nature is the best part in the total experience. at Rs 500 per head they give u breakfast and free wi fi as well. Ideal for solo travelers and safe for lone woman travelers. Situated in R K Puram, not very far from Airport as well.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Toby M
Detailed Review: The hostel was perfect for us as our first destination in India, the staff were very friendly and helpful and there was breakfast and dinner available at a very reasonable price. The rooms were well air conditioned and comfortable enough. Good areas to relax with fans on the rooftop terrace for a nice place to chill in the evening.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: zdvan
Review: A decent stay for a short night in Delhi
Detailed Review: My friends and I arrived late, around 2am, after a flight. We also left the next morning right after having the included breakfast. It worked for what we needed. A bit expensive compared to the other budget options available nearby, but did the trick. The breakfast was pretty decent too.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jessyfijak
Review: Excellent Place to Stay on a Budget
Detailed Review: I stayed at Smyle Inn on two separate trips to India. It is the perfect place to stay if you want a private room and are on a budget. Both times I got a small but clean room that had a clean private bathroom and air conditioning. The hotel staff is extremely friendly and helped me get to my next destination by personally escorting my to a shared van. The area that it is located in gives you a true look into Delhi life and has awesome inexpensive jewelry and handicraft shops.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: alcaraz_chantel
Detailed Review: My only issue was a loud group of 6 Indians in the two rooms across from mine. They kept me up a while but the second night was very peaceful. The staff was kind and held my bag from a few days prior.  I was impressed.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: 750veroniqued
Review: BEST place to stay in Delhi
Detailed Review: The room was very clean, location is great, very friendly and helpful staff.  Breakfast is ok, it is included in the room price so its great to have it. Especially if you plan on doing something, you can first have a little brekkie on the "rooftop" (was under construction when I was there). I highly recommend to stay here if you¬¥re in Delhi.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: YasminP94
Detailed Review: We stayed at Smyle Inn on two separate occasions while in Delhi, both times we were greeted by friendly staff. We had no problems with the AC and Wifi and the breakfast was good. The hotel is also in close proximity to New Delhi railway station, which was really useful for us on both visits.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: melanie_breezer
Detailed Review: I am happy with the hotel. The travel desk helped my book all my train tickets which is a big issue if you don't have a Indian SIM card. Some staff members were warm and some were cold, but that was not an issue as I only wanted a functional place to stay with basic amenities. The wifi worked very well and the breakfast was good enough. During my three day stay, it changed everyday. It is a fixed breakfast good enough for one person. Please choose upper floors that can have less street noise. The location was central and close to New Delhi train Station. I could catch my train at 6am for Agra very easily.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Akshay M
Detailed Review: The rooms and services are good.However they are smaller than in picture.Its location is good i.e it is in walkable distance from New delhi railway station and metro, but the surroundings is little disgusting.So I strongly recommend to bachelors or friends travelling together on a budget

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Meghan T
Detailed Review: My room was big, and the air conditioning worked really well.  Everything was clean.  Bed was comfortable enough.  Staff were pleasant.  Someone stopped me from forgetting my headphones as I was leaving.  Breakfast wasn't great, but it was free.  Met my needs for 1 night.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: bethanied798
Detailed Review: I stayed here last year and now I have returned once again. This is an excellent place to stay. Its right in the main bazaar where loads of shopping and eateries exist.The New Delhi train station is about 5 minutes walk. The staff can be good at times and a bit recluse at times. But whenever I needed help, they were eager to help. Breakfast was a fixed choice but it changed daily during my stay. I could get my train tickets at government prices from the travel desk. Overall if you are on a budget, then this place is for you.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: 23457y5678
Detailed Review: Our first and last stops in India, we found them helpful. The guy in the tour office helped us get our tickets even though we had booked with a different agent before leaving the UK without feeling like he wanted a tip etc, a rarity in India. We then booked a day tour of delhi on our last day with him which was good, but the driver annoyingly refused to take us to the shop we wanted and just to his friend's shop- beware of fake Dilli Haat shop!  The hotel was fine, clean, small rooms but everything you need and a free breakfast for a bargain price. Good air con. Huge bed for our last night big enough for 3! Would recommend, close to train station so you can walk. Also close to a metro for getting around and reasonable pick up rates.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: zdvan
Review: Friendly staff, airport pick-up at very fair prices & excellent location!
Detailed Review: My friends and I arrived late, around 2am, after a flight. We also left the next morning right after having the included breakfast. It worked for what we needed. A bit expensive compared to the other budget options available nearby, but did the trick. The breakfast was pretty decent too.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Floor v Kempen
Detailed Review: We stayed at Colonel's Retreat for 3 nights after our arrival in India. It's a lovely guesthouse in a quiet neighbourhood.  The room was nice, spacious and clean. Breakfast was great, we tried the Indian breakfast which was so tasty! Also the fresh bananacake is yummy!  The guesthouse is a 10min walk from metrostation Moolchand which is very  convenient for visiting the different parts of the city.  Staff is really friendly and helpfull! Can recommend this guesthouse!

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Isabella S
Review: Excellent place for a short visit in Delhi
Detailed Review: We stayed in this hotel the very first night of our trip in India. We had a wonderful experience, the staff was very kind and served us a tipical indian homemade breakfast!! The room was big and clean. The position is ok, with a tuc tuc we managed to reach the city center in about 30 minutes. Around 45 from the airport.  Suggested if you stay 1-2 nights.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Gerrit van Eck
Detailed Review: Stunning big room in this clean neighborhood.  Staff extremely friendly and helpful.  Good hearty breakfast both continental and local.  Good location with most sights to visit within relatively short distance.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Greg T
Detailed Review: My wife and I spent a couple of lovely nights at Colonel's Retreat.  Clean, charismatic and very friendly staff, it's the perfect place to stay where you'll enjoy a peacefulness that you just can't get anywhere closer to the city centre.  It's a 5 minute walk away from a popular ex-pat nightlife area and market where you'll find great, safe and well priced food (we recommend Swaghars Indian Cuisine).  Breakfast is nice and simple at the retreat, where you'll enjoy a nice rooftop early morning before heading into the chaos of New and/or Old Delhi.  We'd stay here again before looking elsewhere for sure.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jane W
Review: very friendly and nice hotel in New Delhi
Detailed Review: It's a very good stay at Ajanta Hotel in New Delhi. The hotel is much more clean than others in the same area and it's a safe hotel also for single woman.   The manager Mr.Santosh is very friendly person and gave me very good service when I requested hotel service. His service to the customer is quite effective and quick. I will come back when I visit Delhi again.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: prabu G
Detailed Review: Good clean hotel in a narrow lane very convenient for short Delhi trip  Centrally located good breakfast  Had taken two rooms one of them was small when checked they had said that was the available one at that time   They have accoumadated our late check request also

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Linda B
Detailed Review: Our room was adequate at the Ajanta . . . . . the air-conditioning (it was 45-50 degrees C. outside) and water worked.  Our room did not resemble any of the photos shown on the Hotel sight.  It was much smaller (twin) with high frosted windows.  I had outside windows as requested but room was always dark and dreary.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Manish S
Detailed Review: Ajanta had excellent service, courteous staff and very good restaurant. The entire property is  clean and centrally located. Ideal for both family and company stay as well as dining. They have a travel desk as well which can make travel arrangements and reservations and also have the facility of money changers for foreign tourists.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ankur J
Review: Best Place To Stay Near by New Delhi Railway Station
Detailed Review: I frequently travel to Delhi and every time when I have to choose for my stay there, the first and best option which strikes to my mind is Hotel Ajanta... almost 90% of my stays in Delhi are at Hotel Ajanta only.... The location, the services, the cleanliness, food, staff everything is excellent.... during my stays here, I experience like my home stay.... staff is so co-operative and caring that it's just like home to me. I always and will always recommend stay here to everybody visiting Delhi.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Bikash S
Detailed Review: Very good ambiance. Good Service. Location is very attractive. Spacious rooms. Fit for official stays as well. Very near to tourist spots,walking distance from New Delhi Railway station and Metro station.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: bhawnasahu06
Detailed Review: this hotel provide me a fiver star experience. Very good welcoming with welcome drinks. Rooms were so nice with all needs. Comforable bed gives a tight and long sleep. It was very nice. Food was so delicious and great. Every time at reception they welcome to me with a nice smile and sound of "welcome". I strongly recommend it to everyone for it's nice services...

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: kuldip k
Review: Beautiful hotel in a great location
Detailed Review: Positive: This must be one of the nice hotels in Delhi. Staff is very friendly special Mr Santosh  The sheer majestic style and presence of this hotel is like none other. The rooms are first class and the food is excellent. The breakfast is one of the nicest I had since long I only ate breakfast in the hotel, which had a very good selection

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: ranjanasg
Detailed Review: I have very warm memories of this hotel. I was coming in to Delhi at 6 in the morning for just about 9 hours, and I needed a decent hotel near the New Delhi Railway Station. I tried a number of hotels, all of whom insisted that their check in time was 12 noon and could not be changed.   Hotel Ajanta staff were very understanding, and agreed to cater to my need for early morning check-in and afternoon check-out the same day, and gave us a decent, clean room with breakfast thrown in for my husband and me. We could get a good rest, bath, and a decent breakfast and lunch before we had to check-out.   The staff were very understanding and co-operative and made this stay really comfortable for us.   The hotel has made attempts to give it some character - there are pictures of old‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Julio O
Detailed Review: The hotel is nice, semi-clean, good location and friendly staff.  The restaurant is overpriced and not good. You can find something WAY better for the same price at Connaught Place which is 2km away.   The wifi system sucks and the internet is somewhat slow. You need a ticket to log in and it expires every 24 hours. To get another ticket it takes them-- no lie-- about 30 min to get you another one or just go to the front desk to avoid waiting.   Restrooms clean and rooms where a bit dusty.   Apart from that, they were quite hospitable and kind and I would recommend to stay here if you are looking for something cheap, comfortable and close to the main area.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: MrNigGle1971
Detailed Review: Authentic Colonial/Indian.  Well located.  Excellent value for money.  Staff were terrific and the adjacent restaurant very, very good.  The tour desk excellent.  As an experienced traveller I never use hotel services because of the additional cost.  On this occasion a tour price was offered for five days including trip to Agra, Jaipur and returning to Delhi.  Price all inclusive of  driver at our beck and call, fuel, tolls taxes etc.  Comfortable six seat van.  Four person cost us $25 Australian per person per day.  Outstanding value in my opinion.  Thanks to Jack, Rashid and particularly our excellent driver Anil and guide Nazil.  Trip highlight! üòâ

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Taha U
Detailed Review: Hotel Ajanta is the best hotel across paharganj in Delhi because the service level of the hotel staff is really really good.... i booked this hotel by thinking that it will be okay sorts but it is a very good hotel, rooms are clean, staff is always available for help, centrally located and easily connected to the whole of Delhi Metropolitan

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: PaulCarrick
Detailed Review: Hotel Ajanta is excellent value. Staff professional and helpful. Hotel clean and comfortanle. Coffee shop however needs improvement.   Arranged car tour of Agra, Jaipur, Jodhpur Udiapur with budget accomodation through travel desk. Choice of hotels given our budget were excellent. Kundwinder Cheema a great driver, ask for him by name.    Rashid, Jack and Zohar were all very helpful. Outstanding customer service when through no fault of tour organiser we had to change one of our hotels.   Rashid responded immediately and fixed problem without excuses.   As with elsewhere in India, clarify taxes and credit charges prior to payment.  We had a great tour and leave India after 6 weeks on a very positive note.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Roving232419
Detailed Review: This hotel was a bit hard to find but backtracking showed easily where we went wrong. Rooms are clean And the beds comfortable. Staff is nice and reception speak fluent english. Manager is nice and can give you good advice. Location is a bit to the side but calm though surroundings might fool you. Good value for money. Only the location is a bit inconvenient. Food is tasty. Bathrooms are clean and functional.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: DIVESH W
Detailed Review: This is the second time I stayed in amax Inn,  got introduced to Mr. Anil owner of the hotel.  He added extra touch in his way of service and made me feel special and homely.  Great hotel to stay in for short business trips,  centrally located and staff is helpful.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Maria N
Detailed Review: This was  the best hotel we stayed in. Good value for money, nice food, friendly staff, clean and cool rooms. It lost a point because the wifi was broke, but other than that it was a comfortable stay at a good price.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Emma B
Detailed Review: I stayed here on two occasions during my travels in India.  This hotel is located very close to New Delhi train station and many local attractions including red fort and India gate.   The hotel arranged a private city tour for myself and my dad which worked out to around ¬£10 each for a full day. Not bad I think.  The restaurant here serves good food and will deliver your food to your room if requested.  Good stay for the price we paid!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jesse M
Review: Best place to stay in Delhi!
Detailed Review: This is a wonderful hotel! I've been traveling non stop for a year now and this was my favorite hotel. The staff is extremely helpful and trustworthy, the management is always around and very helpful and honest. My husband and I stayed in Delhi for 4 days and our stay was really relaxing. The rooms are very nice and clean, hot water, ac, room service, really delicious food, friendly staff, laundry service, roof top restaurant, and great location. I wish I could move in!   - Jesse Males

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Cody7010
Detailed Review: The staff was amazing! They were on top of everything. The room was clean and the food was great and at a reasonable price. Definitely one of the best places you can stay in Delhi, especially on a budget. The location was perfect for us!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: kamil s
Detailed Review: Nice place to stay in Delhi. Its my first visit in Delhi. I stayed first night here and then shifted to other place.  But then I feel I had done a mistake and I come back to stay for my long 15days stay. Its perfect place for value for money.  Staff is excellent and helpful. So it's recommended to everyone.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Anchar B
Detailed Review: I was travelling with my wife and daughter. The stuff was helpful and service was excellent. It was safe place to stay with family.its situated  near new delhi railway  station. The room was nice and clean.I took a trip for nanital and myssorre with car that was excellent in reasonable  price.thanks to hotel amax.carry on

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: SHEENA B
Detailed Review: Full security and privacy. Good for ladies stay. Services are very good. Calm and quiet environment. Hospitality is amazing.All over it  is a very good place to stay. Walking distance from railway station.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Priya2796
Detailed Review: The ambiance of the hotel attracted us and the hotel is simple yet  comfortable.  The food from this hotel was damn good. I would like to recommend to this hotel to have a wonderful and comfortable stay. .

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Bopella H
Detailed Review: Hotel Amax inn is amazing place. I stayed with my wife on a trip to Delhi. I found this place on TripAdvisor and impressed with rating. When I reach amax inn I found its true. The Rooms are well decorative and up to standards. The bathrooms are full hygienic and clean.  The Reception was always welcoming. Defiantly Recommend to others.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: guruswamy p
Detailed Review: This was perfect place for familes. Tge Rooms are clean abd bathroons also very clean.  The staff is helpful and always active for any queries. The Rooftop is good place for  varites of Food. The Reception was friendly and Mr. Anil helps a lot in our Travel need. We enjoyed our trip with them.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Musleemean A
Detailed Review: Peace place to stay . I had stayed with my family. The Rooms are clean and bathrooms are amazing. The staff is helpful and always smiling.The rooftop is great for food with lots of variety . I definitely Recommend this place.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Zulnurain S
Detailed Review: Amax Inn  is Great  place for families.  I had visited with my family and stayed for  two  nights.  It was great location and great Rooms.  The Rooms are very clean and up to standard.  The value for money.  The staff is helpful.  We had  used travel services for Agra and Delhi  trip it was superb.  Coming back again.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: KGrt
Review: Such a great place to stay!
Detailed Review: I stayed at the Amax Inn for three nights and I really enjoyed it. The stuff was always so helpful and nice, providing any kind of information or support with booking. I also tried the food, which was very tasty.  Thank you!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Roving232419
Detailed Review: This hotel was a bit hard to find but backtracking showed easily where we went wrong. Rooms are clean And the beds comfortable. Staff is nice and reception speak fluent english. Manager is nice and can give you good advice. Location is a bit to the side but calm though surroundings might fool you. Good value for money. Only the location is a bit inconvenient. Food is tasty. Bathrooms are clean and functional.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ryan Johnson
Review: Didn't think Delhi would be this great
Detailed Review: Staying at Jugaad absolutely MADE my visit to Delhi.  I had never been to Delhi and all my friends told me I wouldn't like it there, but instead, I had such a good time, pretty much because of this hostel.  All the people I met there were nice, worldly, seemed trustworthy, rooms and bathrooms were clean, roof was nice, there was breakfast included and yoga day and night, and on the weekend some guys from the hostel got us on a guestlist for a party at a club which turned out to be a blast--I'm not a clubber at all but this was something different: people from all over the world, very laid back, great music.  Ended up going to after parties and meeting people who I partied with many more nights.  Good times!  The common room and roof are excellent for hanging out, and there's a‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Wook W
Detailed Review: This is a top-notch hostel either for solo or group travel.  Besides being clean, spacious and well-equipped the staff is super helpful and friendly.  A major plus: they take extra care ensuring you get to/from the airport!

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Julie H
Review: Friendly staff, airport pick-up at very fair prices & excellent location!
Detailed Review: PROS:  Probably one of the most welcoming places we stayed in India so far. We were greeted with bottles of water (which is much appreciated after a long, hot ride from the airport). The sales guy was not pushy at all, despite some bad experiences we've had at other places.   Comfortable rooms with an extra large bed - and I also loved the vibe. Each room in the hotel had a pun posted on the front of the door, which were fun to read.   Late check-out (12 noon) and luggage storage were convenient for a late flight, which we had. In the heart of the main bazar and walking distance NDLS train station.   Airport pick-up was SUPER convenient and priced similar to the airport pre-paid taxis, which we had also taken. The driver took our luggage directly to reception (so we didn't have‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: anubadok
Review: A transit hotel, and nothing more
Detailed Review: This is a hotel with quite small rooms (crammy is probably a too harsh word), and OK-ish staff (and sometimes quite rude). If you are in delhi for a day or few hours in transit, you can try out this hotel, as it is quite near to the New Delhi Railway station. But locating this hotel is not an easy thing. You need to really search for it, as it is tucked in a small alleyway. However the hotel people are good and direct you to their hotel. They have a very good wifi in room, that is the only super thing.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: gareth N
Detailed Review: I really liked this place, Was simple, clean, very well managed,  Harish the manager was great at communicating with me when I had to cancel last minute. The air con was quiet and the price was very good. I have been here 10 days and yet to find a hotel that ticks all these boxes, hopefully there will be more Smyle inn's dotted around India in the future :)

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: PoppyVernon
Detailed Review: Me and a friend had a lovely stay at this hotel. They picked us up from the airport which was no trouble and the driver was very nice and gave us a little tour as we went. The hotel itself is very clean and located in a busy area close to New Delhi station (very handy for catching a train inwards). The staff were not overly friendly but very helpful and always gave us any information we needed. They helped us sort out a local sim card which was really useful. The rooms were simple but had nice clean bathrooms attached and the aircon worked fine. We had a complimentary breakfast which was very basic but did the job! Would stay again. Thank you!

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: RHY468
Review: Clean budget rooms.. area is bit of letdown
Detailed Review: First the pros.. I had opted for Superior deluxe rooms with breakfast. The room was quite good and spacious, Good aircon. You get bottled water on the first day only. Towel change, housekeeping is done on request. They gave me an early checkin. Walking distance from new delhi rly station. cons.. The steet outside is typical crowded old delhi one.. The gali leading to the hotel is xtremely small.. and smelly.. The hotel room is well insulated from the outside noise though.. Paharganj is quite safe now ..it is best to take taxi if you are coming very late in the night to this area. The breakfast is basic, but the staff at the breakfast counter think they are doing a favour by serving the guests..  wifi is free for only 48 hours.. not sure why..

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Krishna J
Review: Excellent accommodation for tourists and short stay
Detailed Review: Apart from the comfortable stay the well mannered staff and equally helpful owner makes this hotel as my preferred choice.   The rooms are neat and well maintained and the first thing you notice when you enter the hotel is the pleasant welcome and make you comfortable only then will the formalities of checking in will begin. The working breakfast keeps you going even in the oppressive heat of Delhi.   Beds and linen are immaculately clean and comfortable. Free Wi-fi for people who want to connect to the world and the Television that has almost 100 channels to watch. I can only say that this became my 2nd home.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jay L
Detailed Review: Everything about smyle was good. Nice clean AC room. Free breakfast. Had a trip advisor there book all our trains for cheap. Rented a cheap friendly driver to see all the sights in delhi. Good tips from the staff on how not to get ripped off (train station, scams). My only complaint is the smyle inn is in an ally off the main bazaar where the locals use as a urinal. Not really there fault tho

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: rensiyun
Detailed Review: everything was ok, the bed was so comfortable, they have 2 shower rooms in one dorm, and the staff was so nice..they picked me up at the airport...although i cant find the river at first but suddenly he came to me...

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jay L
Detailed Review: Everything about smyle was good. Nice clean AC room. Free breakfast. Had a trip advisor there book all our trains for cheap. Rented a cheap friendly driver to see all the sights in delhi. Good tips from the staff on how not to get ripped off (train station, scams). My only complaint is the smyle inn is in an ally off the main bazaar where the locals use as a urinal. Not really there fault tho

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: rensiyun
Detailed Review: everything was ok, the bed was so comfortable, they have 2 shower rooms in one dorm, and the staff was so nice..they picked me up at the airport...although i cant find the river at first but suddenly he came to me...

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Bhaba S
Detailed Review: It was easy to find the location plus it feels very clean and safest compared to other areas of Delhi. The hotel itself had very friendly staffs who helped us book this hotel last minute.  But it didn't had free cancellation which might have effected my other plans but yeah overall I loved my stay.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: 111_Jimbo_uk
Review: Don't be put off by the lack of reception...
Detailed Review: Lucky that the driver knew where it was because there are no signs and it looks like a private home. The entrance looks like the trademans back entrance. It was evening time when we arrived and the staff where nowhere to be found for over 15mis the taxi driver was running all over the place looking for them bless him.  They have a major mosquito problem in the place they call a reception.  Eventually we got in without the normal information like times for meals where meals where served etc.  The rooms made are good and nothing like the first impression, thank the Lord.  Good size room with equally big on suit all to a high standard. Safe in the room and enough storage to move in for a month.  The hotel is in a very nice safe residential area which is very close to a small‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Suzanne_bucks
Detailed Review: My son and I stayed one night on our return to Delhi before travelling back to UK. It was just perfect - quiet location, very helpful staff and not far from the metro. Wish I could have stayed longer.. The rooms were light and comfortable and the breakfast was perfect - at last GOOD coffee and tea! Thank you!

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: harold59
Review: A small, safe and pleasant hotel with excellent food
Detailed Review: We stayed 2 nights here and immediately felt safe in this small and friendly hotel. Everything was clean and tidy, the rooftop restaurant was lovely and the evening meal (fixed menu) was delicious and very reasonable. The only disappointment was the pack-up breakfast provided because we had to leave very early for a train journey to Agra. There's little to explore by foot nearby, and the amenities in the hotel are understandably limited,but we enjoyed our stay very much.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: moziz52
Detailed Review: The perfect place to stay to get away from it all. A relaxing and spacious B and B with lovely rooms, crisp white sheets and excellent breakfasts. A family business where you do feel welcome. Really helped us cope with Delhi- a great city but also exhausting.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: FruitMonsters
Review: Wonderful home stay - the roof terrace alone is wonderful
Detailed Review: Definitely recommend this if you're looking to stay in Delhi somewhere away from all the crowds! There are only 3 rooms here so it's a very cosy place to stay, and so peaceful. We enjoyed breakfast and dinner on the lovely roof terrace - the food was absolutely incredible! If you stay I really recommend the dinner - we were actually the only people eating on the terrace that evening and it was stunning, so it would also be great for a couple if they wanted a romantic evening. Breakfast as well was exceptional - cooked to order and lovely Indian fare available :) They also provided a breakfast bag on the day we left as we had to leave very early. Only slight downside - the twin room had short beds (I'm only 5'7" and my feet were at the end!) and there doesn't seem to be much in‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Anita H
Detailed Review: Colonel's Retreat is in the heart of one of the quietly affluent areas of New Delhi. It's a great place that attracts people from all walks of life, travelling through incredible India, and happy to share their amazing experiences with you. It feels like you're staying at home, surrounded by friends - breakfast and dinners are served up on their rooftop, with beautiful breezes and perfect service. The owners Arun and Suman are extremely personable and gracious, and will go to the extent to make you feel part of their family. We will be back for sure!

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: EmSaw
Detailed Review: What a wonderful place! We stayed at the Colonel's Retreat on the first part of our India holiday a couple of weeks ago. The hotel is bright, light, clean and has air conditioning in all rooms.   We were given a very warm welcome and made to feel at home here. We travelled with my 17 month old boy and they couldn't do enough to help. We had a proper cot in the room for him and they offered to prepare food specially for him though he was more than happy to eat what we were eating. They even provided a sandwich to keep him going on the long drive to our next destination!  This leads me nicely onto the food! The breakfasts were the highlight for sure! So much beautiful food! You must try the banana bread and the parantha is beautiful! The owner offered for us to try a bit of‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Matthew K
Review: Quiet retreat in the bustle of Delhi!
Detailed Review: We stayed at the Colonel's Retreat on our recent holiday, and we couldn't have asked for a nicer place to stay! The rooms were comfy and spacious, and the staff were so friendly and helpful! The food was especially good; you've never had banana bread as good as this before! Definitely worth a stay!

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Gurmeet S
Detailed Review: Better housekeeping..  Good food...  Spacious rooms...... Ajanta has everything that it promises to provide. And the best and Quality staff..... No need to worry if you stay with Ajanta. Matchless experience every time you stay there.......

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: mrar4444
Detailed Review: very good hotel and service is very excellent its a good and posh area located staff is very friendly and very good hotel rooms were so nice with all needs The rooms are first class and the food is excellent. The breakfast is one of the nicest I had since long I only ate breakfast in the hotel, which had a very good selection

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Kalyani C
Detailed Review: Its a very nice hotel to stay.The architecture or theme of room is wonderful... Staff is very polite & co-operative. Complimentary breakfast  provided by the hotel is very tasty.Rooms are well maintain and clean.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: lyadja
Review: a nice place in  busy Delhi
Detailed Review: we felt very safe and conforted during our first visit to Delhi. No question was too much and the food was nice. Never a dull moment and good facilities that we could use 24 hours. Excellent help with the planning if the rest of our trip. Everything was arranged for us. taxi fir puck up at the airport and the toue that folliwed. Also the hotels and tickets for Taj Mahal, for instance. good choice of hotels for a nice stay at all the cities we visited. I certainly will recommend hotel Ajanta and the staff to all my friends.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Simon L
Review: Budget trip rajasthan with hotel ajanta
Detailed Review: I came to Delhe city to stay at hotel Ajanta. I met zahoor baktoo the tour manager who sugested I do a  4 day pakage tour of Agra city the Taj Mahal  and then on to Jaipur city the capital of Rashistan also known as the pink city to see the pink fort. My hotels were superb and my driver Kishuri was always waiting for me with a clean car every mourning and was a great wealth of knowledge of all the tour. I consider him a friend. In total I had an awesome experience and can highly recommend Ajanta hotel for your stay in Delhi thank you zahoor from Simon

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Gavster Bedlington
Detailed Review: Great value - right in the bustle of downtown Delhi - its a bit scruffy here and there - the breakfast service is slapdash but the atmosphere is fantastic and the reception staff super friendly - opposite there's a decent coffee shop - if you are looking for peace and quiet this is probably not for you - but a great end to your Indian trip - and want to leave with a bang stay here - Close to the bazaars and fancy shops of Connaught Place. Some really lovely period decor remains - especially the encaustic floor tiles .

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Georgina C
Detailed Review: I just wanted to write to say thank you for a wonderful stay! It was our first night in India and we had a wonderful experience at the Ajanta Hotel. Not only did we find the best driver through the hotel for the rest of our Rajasthan trip but the stay was also fantastic, the rooms were also wonderful and the staff were so kind!! Thank you

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Trishna B
Detailed Review: Hotel Ajanta has always been my 1st choice whenever I have to stay back in delhi (paharganj area)to drop my sister for her school. It is very near to the railway station. It is one of the oldest hotel of delhi. I would definetly recommend this hotel for a pleasant stay. Rooms are good and very affordable.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Fardeen M
Review: It was OK to be honest!Not Good Not Bad either.
Detailed Review: Poor room service. Hotel location in a very crowded and dirty neighborhood. Very deceiving sales people. No WiFi one day Good! Nice buffet. Nice customer service representatives. Close to airport.....

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: CocoMacleod
Review: Really friendly and helpful staff, great value for money.
Detailed Review: I've been travelling for two months in India, and stayed in Delhi a few times, and this is one of the better hotels.  Even though it's in the heart of Pahargang, supposedly a cheaper and noisier part of Delhi that some agents will deter you from going to, but I find it relatively quite and extremely welcoming.  Yes, you are in the heart and soul of Delhi and that's what makes it vibrant and alive and as a solo female traveller, I've found it to be a very safe and friendly place.  I've stayed here three times now in different rooms, and they've all had comfy beds and great, HOT, showers! The staff are what make this place.  They are all so helpful. On my first visit I had requested a room with a window, but on arrival was taken to a windowless room. It was very late and I was‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: ankievanaalten
Review: One night stay, with great service and lovely people
Detailed Review: The staf was great. Very helpful and always smiling. After my check out, they stored my bagage till my plane was leaving. I spend a day in the city and when i came back to the hotel they gave me the upportunity to use a room where they braught my bagage, so i could refresh before i had my plane. A very pleasant feeling. Also i could use their computer and printer to check in online and print my tickets.  During the past years I've stayed a few times in different hotels in Delhi. Never felt so good and welcome as in Ajanta.  You made my last night and day in Delhi very pleasant.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Michelle J
Detailed Review: The room in which I stayed was the best with the window with scenic beauty and cleanliness and fresh air.  I would recommend you to visit the hotel,  the best part is that it is inexpensive and the service provided by them is also nice.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jessica H
Detailed Review: We stayed here for 1 night and arrived early in the morning. We were able to check in early which was perfect after a long train journey. (It's close to the station) The room was clean and a good size for 3 of us. The staff were very helpful and got up for us when we left at 6am with a driver to do the Golden Triangle. We left some luggage with them for 3 weeks until we returned to Delhi and it was perfectly safe and we were extremely grateful. When we arrived (again after a long journey) to collect they made us tea and let us sit for a while in reception. Outside is chaos and it's a bit tricky to find but amongst the other hundreds of hotels in the vicinity this is the one to choose!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: mcconnellkdub
Detailed Review: I stayed in the Amax, with two Dutch friends, over several nights during two week exploration of India in April. The Amax became the base for our early trips to Varanassi and Agra in week 1, and to Shimla and Amritsar in the North in week 2. The staff were genuinely some of the nicest I have met anywhere and really went out of their way to look after us. We booked our trip up north with the Amax travel agent, and this turned out to be best move we made, getting a great deal and with great driver to look after us for a week. When I go back to India, I will stay in the Amax again - not only for the fond memories but it delivers way more than you can expect for the price. Some of our best nights were on the roof top at the Amax, sipping (gulping!) a beer and looking out over‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: paragshah40
Detailed Review: best neat n clean hotel , good staff n nr by rail station , room service is fine , hotel managers are very cooperative , overall good hotel in delhi .ac are working fine , very safe hotel. rooms are good design with all necessary modern equipment .

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: prashantprao
Detailed Review: i stayed here for  one night with my family group.we are satisfied with facility yes  the area is not that great but its ok for us.It is closer to New Delhi railway station i used this place as transit hotel  on the way to Uttarakhand.  pros.faster check in and check out,gd food   con: area little bit dicey; u can ignore easily

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jelena R
Detailed Review: I think the best arguments for the hotel are:  1) excellent service - the lobby staff were really helpful and friendly. They helped us to organized car for Delhi sightseeing, Agra visit and airport pick up/ drop off. When we needed to use an ATM, one of the staff member actually walked us to the closest ATM so that we will really find it and as there was an issue with our card, we ended up walking quite a bit and trying different ATMs, but the staff did not mind. They were also more than happy to answer all our questions e.g. related to indian traditions and so on. I really felt that the staff is there for any of our needs. The hotel owner was also at the hotel on couple of the days and he was really friendly and helpful; always welcomed us for a discussion and encouranged to‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Qaneeh
Detailed Review: I had a great stay at Hotel Amax Inn for 5 days. 1. Very friendly staff at the hotel. 2. good service at the booking and all over in the hotel. 3.It is a good budget hotel.  I will choose again Hotel Amax Inn on my next visit to Delhi.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Suman B
Detailed Review: The rooms are tereffic....with good ambience....room services are prompt with very pleasent behaviour.... food very tasty, with all kind of dishes available.... visa v the charges the quality is above my satisfaction.....full marks..

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Florian D
Detailed Review: Good services. H√¥tel is at good location near to  New Delhi Railway station. The staff is good and ready to Help . The Rooms are Clean and well mai tain. I am coming back soon .I left my Luggage for free and safe. Thanks

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: alokagarwal4871
Detailed Review: Booked 2 rooms in the month of April 17 by phone and was confirmed reservation. Situated just a few minutes walking distance from new Delhi railway station therefore location is ok. However, the hotel is located in a bylane of Arakashan road in its narrow part and hence no facilities to park any vehicle. Rooms are on a smaller side approx 100 sqft excluding bathrooms. Bathrooms though small are clean and new tiles and fittings have been installed. There is a refrigerator in the room but was not working.The food is good, room service fast. Wi-Fi just doesn't work at all. Rooftop restaurant of no use in the summer months.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Wander-Beaut
Detailed Review: The location is near Main Bazaar (New Delhi Metro is the nearest, Araskashan Road)   The staffs provide great services. We had them to arrange our trip to Agra and Delhi day tour. The price is reasonable but the driver depends on your luck (not hotel's driver)  The rooms were clean and good comparing to its price. The new building is equipped with elevator and the shower is much nicer than the old building  (I have 2 rooms, luxury room-> new building) the shower room in old building was extremely hot on April.   And they always change the staffs at the lobby/reception so make sure the new guys know your appointment  Hotel's rooftop cafe was okay, they served a big portion with variety of food.  Open 24 hrs. you can eat in your room or rooftop tables.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Madhava S
Detailed Review: Great location, next to the New Delhi railwaystation. Clean rooms with nice bathrooms and AC. Very nice pure vegeterian resturants just 100meters away. Great service and hospitality, giving a comfortable feeling. Good prices, we have already booked for our next stay.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: yoyocu
Detailed Review: Anil's place is a great one, it is a hidden gem on Araskashan Road. Everything worked as he said it would. I stayed there twice and both times I had a great experience. He even arranged my four trips to and from the airport. I never had to wait for the driver, Becaush, a nice guy who is also a great and safe driver. Everything was great while at Anil's. I stayed there because of the reviews and I have to say that they were completely accurate. All the staff was amiable and very competent. Thanks again for making my staying in Delhi a great and pleasant experience.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Arun K
Detailed Review: I would like to highlight how Anil helped me navigate through the technicalities and administrative hassles I faced because I had to reschedule my trip. The Airbnb app didn't allow me to make modifications due to some technical glitch. I called up Anil and informed him of my change of plans. He was very accommodating and helped me by getting in touch with the Airbnb officials himself and arrange for my cancellation. I thought my interaction with Anil would end there but no there was more to it. Unfortunately, I missed my return flight from Delhi. I right away called Anil and asked him if he could accommodate me for a night. And to my delight - he said yes! He let me stay overnight without any extra charges. I am very grateful to Anil for helping me out at those times when I‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: 233TripAdivsor
Detailed Review: This is an excellent low cost hotel. The owner, Anil and his team go out of their way to cater for their guests. They brought us fresh towels etc when we needed and went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. We organised our hotel transfers and a day trip around New Delhi through the hotel. The staff even came out to the street and requested tut tuts for us at good prices. They also gave us business cards to show the tut tut drivers to ensure our safe return. The food is cheap and very tasty. Definitely value for money. The hotel also catered for my nut allergy which was a big relief on our first trip to India. We cancelled our last night in a different hotel in New Delhi and booked back into hotel Amax Inn for the final night of our two week trip to India‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: ays_7ice
Detailed Review: The hotel had amazing customer service. All the staff went out of their way to help us, with anything we needed including getting us tut tuts, to where ever we pleased.  The food was delicious and great value for money with large portions, we always struggled to finish our meal! The butter chicken was our favourite!  We travelled all round India and of all the places we stayed in, this was definitely the best value for money and very comfortable. The excellent customer service was the cherry on top!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Rushad U
Detailed Review: I have been there with my big family, there are overall 6 adults and 5 kids. Its an ideal budget hotel, its very hard to explain everything to the staffs, they didn't know English at least to manage. Management people are good. Situated place is rubbish a slum. Bad smell always, too crowded can't even walk.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ruzky U
Detailed Review: Value for money! Kind and very friendly staff! Would recommend to everyone! Stayed there for couple of days , no complaints at all. Everything smooth and fine. Thumps up for the staff. Perfect value for what u pay

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: AnnaSpencer
Detailed Review: Snug in a little bylane in Arakashan road you might miss this hotel. However I saw  it's review in trip advisor and booked it. Small but well equipped rooms. Powerful ac and away from the hustle and bustle of ever busy paharganj but still close to all main points especially new Delhi station. Staff helpful and courteous. On my last day though check out was at 1200hrs they still extended it by 3 hrs since my train was at 1600hrs free of cost. Thanks a lot. I would recommend this hotel any day

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Anna-Marie T
Detailed Review: First stop in New Delhi and couldn't have hoped for anything more!  Delhi can be quite an intimidating place at first if it's your first time so was great to have airport pick up arranged by the hotel for only 750 rupees. All staff were great. From the owners, to the reception staff, to the restaurant staff. Nothing was too much trouble for them! Gave us great tips on arrival and when going out about what to watch out for and scams to be aware of. As we were two young females travelling together this really helped us to feel more comfortable.  Hotel is located in a busy area near Paharganj and Old Delhi train station. There are restaurants and shops on the street just a short walk away. Really is in the heart of Old Delhi and not too far from New Delhi/Connaught Place. Just a‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: madhab chandra p
Detailed Review: We stay at Amax with our family for two nights in March,2017.We take two rooms in same floor.The room was clean as we think ot before and the bathroom was also nice.The staff is very helpful.They have restaurent on the top.The food was good.We take a cab for local Delhi tour that was also good.This is not the 5 star hotel but they giving there best services to us.We got a man at reception who can speak bengali that was very helpful for me. I want to give them suggetion for making food not too much spicy and oily. Overal the stay was excillent.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: OnAir334580
Detailed Review: it's a awesome place for living and for family. my mom and dad love this place and love the food..  it's really awesome. No hidden  charge... the hotel are best price for familly and Friends..   however it's a good hotel and best price.   (y)

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Michelle J
Detailed Review: The room in which I stayed was the best with the window with scenic beauty and cleanliness and fresh air.  I would recommend you to visit the hotel,  the best part is that it is inexpensive and the service provided by them is also nice.

Detailed Review: Anil's place is a great one, it is a hidden gem on Araskashan Road. Everything worked as he said it would. I stayed there twice and both times I had a great experience. He even arranged my four trips to and from the airport. I never had to wait for the driver, Becaush, a nice guy who is also a great and safe driver. Everything was great while at Anil's. I stayed there because of the reviews and I have to say that they were completely accurate. All the staff was amiable and very competent. Thanks again for making my staying in Delhi a great and pleasant experience.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Arun K
Detailed Review: I would like to highlight how Anil helped me navigate through the technicalities and administrative hassles I faced because I had to reschedule my trip. The Airbnb app didn't allow me to make modifications due to some technical glitch. I called up Anil and informed him of my change of plans. He was very accommodating and helped me by getting in touch with the Airbnb officials himself and arrange for my cancellation. I thought my interaction with Anil would end there but no there was more to it. Unfortunately, I missed my return flight from Delhi. I right away called Anil and asked him if he could accommodate me for a night. And to my delight - he said yes! He let me stay overnight without any extra charges. I am very grateful to Anil for helping me out at those times when I‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: 233TripAdivsor
Detailed Review: This is an excellent low cost hotel. The owner, Anil and his team go out of their way to cater for their guests. They brought us fresh towels etc when we needed and went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. We organised our hotel transfers and a day trip around New Delhi through the hotel. The staff even came out to the street and requested tut tuts for us at good prices. They also gave us business cards to show the tut tut drivers to ensure our safe return. The food is cheap and very tasty. Definitely value for money. The hotel also catered for my nut allergy which was a big relief on our first trip to India. We cancelled our last night in a different hotel in New Delhi and booked back into hotel Amax Inn for the final night of our two week trip to India‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: ays_7ice
Detailed Review: The hotel had amazing customer service. All the staff went out of their way to help us, with anything we needed including getting us tut tuts, to where ever we pleased.  The food was delicious and great value for money with large portions, we always struggled to finish our meal! The butter chicken was our favourite!  We travelled all round India and of all the places we stayed in, this was definitely the best value for money and very comfortable. The excellent customer service was the cherry on top!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Rushad U
Detailed Review: I have been there with my big family, there are overall 6 adults and 5 kids. Its an ideal budget hotel, its very hard to explain everything to the staffs, they didn't know English at least to manage. Management people are good. Situated place is rubbish a slum. Bad smell always, too crowded can't even walk.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ruzky U
Detailed Review: Value for money! Kind and very friendly staff! Would recommend to everyone! Stayed there for couple of days , no complaints at all. Everything smooth and fine. Thumps up for the staff. Perfect value for what u pay

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: AnnaSpencer
Detailed Review: Snug in a little bylane in Arakashan road you might miss this hotel. However I saw  it's review in trip advisor and booked it. Small but well equipped rooms. Powerful ac and away from the hustle and bustle of ever busy paharganj but still close to all main points especially new Delhi station. Staff helpful and courteous. On my last day though check out was at 1200hrs they still extended it by 3 hrs since my train was at 1600hrs free of cost. Thanks a lot. I would recommend this hotel any day

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Anna-Marie T
Detailed Review: First stop in New Delhi and couldn't have hoped for anything more!  Delhi can be quite an intimidating place at first if it's your first time so was great to have airport pick up arranged by the hotel for only 750 rupees. All staff were great. From the owners, to the reception staff, to the restaurant staff. Nothing was too much trouble for them! Gave us great tips on arrival and when going out about what to watch out for and scams to be aware of. As we were two young females travelling together this really helped us to feel more comfortable.  Hotel is located in a busy area near Paharganj and Old Delhi train station. There are restaurants and shops on the street just a short walk away. Really is in the heart of Old Delhi and not too far from New Delhi/Connaught Place. Just a‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: madhab chandra p
Detailed Review: We stay at Amax with our family for two nights in March,2017.We take two rooms in same floor.The room was clean as we think ot before and the bathroom was also nice.The staff is very helpful.They have restaurent on the top.The food was good.We take a cab for local Delhi tour that was also good.This is not the 5 star hotel but they giving there best services to us.We got a man at reception who can speak bengali that was very helpful for me. I want to give them suggetion for making food not too much spicy and oily. Overal the stay was excillent.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: OnAir334580
Detailed Review: it's a awesome place for living and for family. my mom and dad love this place and love the food..  it's really awesome. No hidden  charge... the hotel are best price for familly and Friends..   however it's a good hotel and best price.   (y)

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Deepak A
Detailed Review: Location is little difficult to find but worth finding the hostel. Building was under construction but their rooftop is awesome with chill environment. Common Area is nicely designed but little small. You should explore the hostel for sure.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: jeyanthivictor
Detailed Review: We stayed at Jugaad for one night before embarking to Srinagar the next day. Although only for a day, the staff were helpful. I remember Waseem who works in Jugaad had welcomed us into the premises when we arrived during wee hours of the morning after catching a night train from Jaipur. He also helped us get transport to the airport the following day. Good services and nice ambience.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Shoaib K
Review: Best place to stay in delhi
Detailed Review: This was my 6th visit at jugaad hostels n the place just seems to get better everytime. I love stayin here and recommend everyone travelling to Delhi to stay here...Love the setup, the environment,so peaceful and relaxing, everything abt the place is amazing from cleanliness to interiors to hospitality the friendly staff.i would recommend every backpacker to come stay here n enjoy the place

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: agarwal0120
Detailed Review: ovarall very nice stay.i vijited to this hotel in the March..i must say this a very good budget friendly hotel for every travellers..the rooms are very good and well maintained..the staffs were very helpfull..keep it up

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: awei l
Detailed Review: We have good stay in Jugaad, just a few improvement that we wanted to suggest to the management:   1. Aircond. It's very hot when we arrived at Jugaad Hostel & we requested to open the aircond but it doesnt work.   2. Wifi. Good wifi only in certain area, in lobby and rooftop but poor line in room.   3. There is no lift. Unconvienient for those who have huge amount of luggages.   4. Locations: Hard to find.   Average is ok. The staffs are very helpful and nice especially in directions and suggestions of our transports to town.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: KateJ
Detailed Review: Do yourself a favor and stay here! Best hostel in Dehli. Great atmosphere, clean rooms, aircon, hot showers and the most accommodating and friendly staff! Team puts on events to help you experience India. I even left my mobile phone at hostel and the staff brought it to me at the airport! Won't find that any where else. FANTASTIC!!!

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Roman W
Detailed Review: We highly enjoyed our stay at Jugaad Hostel. The staff is just great, very helpful and always happy. You get any kind of help u need, such as booking train tickets.  The rooftop is super cool to hang out in the evening and enjoy a comd beer.  Highly recommend this hostel and its friendly people. Always happy to come back.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: George M
Detailed Review: I had a great time here. Having arrived from the UK and struggled to find the hostel initially, a mere 2 hours later I felt more than at home on the rooftop with my stomach and mind satisfied and at peace. It is a community with a great capacity for sharing. I would urge anyone going to head to the terrace and talk to as many people as possible. I might have only stayed for 4 nights but the memories I made and people I met last forever. Thanks again

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: James S
Detailed Review: Super friendly staff. Well-kept little backpacker hostel with ample opportunity community making and group outings. I like the fact that the hostel is located in the residential part of Delhi so you experience a different side of the city. But because it's in an obscure location, I would HIGHLY recommend getting the airport pickup arranged through the hostel.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Younes M
Detailed Review: I love that place, the rooms are clean, the food is delicious, the staff very helpfull and friendly, they can help you with absolutely everything, and the olace is perfect you gonna meet a lot of great people ecxhange travelling stories make new plans. I will definetly comeback to this hostel.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: robovell
Detailed Review: I stayed at Jugaads for about a week overall. The staff/volunteers there were great and very friendly. Nice and clean facilities. Met a good handful of fellow travelers also. It's really easy to stay here longer than you may intend if you don't have any strict plans, but that's not a bad thing ha.  I'd recommend it to anyone, and would come back if I find myself in Delhi again.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: ZAHID UL I
Detailed Review: It's Good Hostel for tourist, It's cheaper then other Hostels. In Here have is all everything, Roof top have biger Space for Hangouts. I will suggest for tourist. If come in New Delhi so please come Jugaad Hostels For live...

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: thomask34980
Detailed Review: Very nice place to stay in Delhi, very clean and safe, the area is well deserved by the metro and its not a touristic place. I recommend this place to anyone wishing a convivial place in Delhi Nice roof top

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: william m
Review: Quite simply the best time I've ever had in Delhi
Detailed Review: I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this hostel to anyone, the location- Mohammadpur Village- is excellently situated and allows quick and easy access to all of the major sites in South Delhi. Additionally, it's super close to Hauz Khas Village, which is excellent if you're interested in contemporary art galleries and boutique shopping. Hauz Khas is also great for going out in the evening if you're after that sort of thing.  The staff are absolutely first class, Udday was exceptionally helpful with my travel arrangements and was able to accommodate my very specific schedule. What really sets Jugaad apart from other hostels is that they're able to break down the barrier between staff and travellers, and the result is very relaxed and fun environment.  Additionally, I have an‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Rasmus J
Detailed Review: The straff and environment is perfect! You can also Cook your own food if you prefer. Since it is a pretty small hostel you get to know everyone. The rooftop is a really nice place to relax if you wanna stay away from sightseeing some day. Overall this place is good for everyone who wants to interact with other travelers.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Lars B
Review: Meet your new home away from home!
Detailed Review: Jugaad is a great place to stay. What makes it stand out from other hostel experiences is the sense of this place being open and warm. Much like a home. At Jugaad you will have great breakfast in the morning and long talks in the evening on the rooftoop. I had a great stay!  The location is great, with easy access to most of south Delhi! Thanks for a great stay. I had such a good time here that I extended my stay there from 1 day to around 2 weeks=)

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: HollyZ456
Detailed Review: Small rooms, staff were nice enough. The guy who booked our tour was very helpful however our driver for the 3 day golden triangle tour was far from. This was the first time we had been to Delhi and it's right off the main bazaar which is really dirty, very busy and full of people constantly trying to sell you things (granted this is most of India!). If we went again we probably wouldn't stay but this is more personal preference. Breakfast was OK.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: elle_b121212
Review: Ok stay - reasonable value for the price
Detailed Review: This place was okay - cheaply priced and we got ac, large bed, towels soap, a fan and a tv. The bathroom was pretty clean, but tiny. We had to request he hot water be turned on but there was a phone in the room so it was easy to call down to reception. The rooms were functional but not cosy and the hotel lacked atmosphere.  The staff were reasonably friendly and advised on how not to get scammed. We got a good map of delhi and we're offered tours and train tickets.   The location is just off from a main bazaar- but down a small street past a public urinal, which is kinda gross, but can't be helped.  DO NOT bother with the airport pickup. The car they sent us was an absolute heap - filthy. The driver took a 30 min detour for gas and did not explain this. Once we arrived he begged‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Bindi B
Detailed Review: Stayed for 2 nights. Management asked us to move for the second night but not to sure why. First room was great with heaps of space. Second room was tiny. I could not sit on the toilet seat because the toilet was to close to the wall. However the Staff were friendly and helpful. Free breakfast was great. Airport transfer also great. Extremely hard beds!!! Extremely hard!!! And location not great. Would leave the hostel and men would make comments who were sitting in the ale. I would recommend it to travellers wanting somewhere great to stay for a cheap price however I wouldn't stay here again.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: RGM
Detailed Review: I was pretty worried to go to Paharjang at night as some of my friends did not give me good review about the location but that was not the case at all, me and my 2 friends reached the place at 12:00 am in the night. The Location is in a small alley but its a very happening place and nothing to worry about. The staff was cooperative and room was also very good and clean. Everything was working fine and was upto the mark.  PS: The Hotel is absolutely good for friends and family and no need to worry about any thing.    Thanks Harish and Ahemed for your cooperation and assistance. I will surely suggest your place to my friends and will look forward to stay their whenever i am in Delhi.  Regards, Reyansh Mestry

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: rotterdam1992
Review: Nice hotel in the center of real Delhi
Detailed Review: Nice hotel just 10 minute walk from new delhi train station. Its in the middle of a street market and has everything within reach. Friendly staff and good wifi. Be aware of scams telling you hotel closed recently closed down.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Deborah M
Detailed Review: This is a lovely little hotel right off the Main Bazaar. Simple, clean rooms with a ceiling fan and a/c.  The price is right. Breakfast mediocre. Booked train tickets to Haridwar from the front desk with no hassle or hustle.  Recommend.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ben P
Detailed Review: The room has everything you need and is comfortable. It is located down a very small alley which is not the most fun to walk down, but beyond that it is right on the main bazaar and a short tuk tuk ride to anywhere you want to visit.  Back to the private room, huge bed, air con, fan, tv, and hot water (upon request). Everything you would realistically need and more, although a bit clinical. But hey, it's a hostel at a very reasonable price so what are you expecting.  The staff are all very kind and the manager very helpful. He can arrange train tickets and give good information about exploring Delhi.  Overall, highly recommend as a budget place to stay in Delhi.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ria H
Review: Clean, basic, friendly staff and very noisy.
Detailed Review: Be prepared if staying in Pahar Ganj it will be extremely noisy throughout the day and night. We Thought being just off the main strip the noise might not be so bad but was wrong. We stayed in our own room and bathroom, they also do dorms. Clean basic room, staff were good pretty helpful. Breakfast was basic. Location was good and fine if staying only for a short period. Lots of restaurants close by. If you want to be thrown in to the middle of it all it be perfect.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: kashyap m
Detailed Review: pretty good. nice hotel with good breakfast. close to the railway station. on the flip side, small bathroom ! On the bright side, the aircon was strong and cooled the room instantaneously. Okay for a couple of nights stay when you are backpacking.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Japanisadhu
Review: reliable oasis in a world of uncertainty
Detailed Review: Thank you for good space where I could take it easy for a while in transiting from UP, India to Malaysia. Pretty breakfast was nice for morning. I want to stay again when I reach India from abroad. See you again

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: gsxr
Detailed Review: Room was Nothing like they show on pictures (upgraded)  . Staff was not helpful. Tiny, dirty bathroom with non working shower. Had to sit on the toilet sideways as there was no space otherwise- smallest bathroom we have ever seen in our travels!   No privacy. Big window(only window) in our room was into the hall!!! Staff was very loud at times.    Staff would turn off ac in the room and you always have to call and ask to turn it on. Same with hot water. And they never mentioned that. We had to figure that all out.    Breakfast was in another building.   When we arrive, room wasn't ready and they said 5 minutes. It took them an hour and they kept saying 5 more minute every 10 min. Why lie?! Check in took forever too, as they were copying every info(passport, visas, etc)  ‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: HollyZ456
Detailed Review: Small rooms, staff were nice enough. The guy who booked our tour was very helpful however our driver for the 3 day golden triangle tour was far from. This was the first time we had been to Delhi and it's right off the main bazaar which is really dirty, very busy and full of people constantly trying to sell you things (granted this is most of India!).
