Name: gsxr
Review: reliable oasis in a world of uncertainty
Detailed Review: Room was Nothing like they show on pictures (upgraded)  . Staff was not helpful. Tiny, dirty bathroom with non working shower. Had to sit on the toilet sideways as there was no space otherwise- smallest bathroom we have ever seen in our travels!   No privacy. Big window(only window) in our room was into the hall!!! Staff was very loud at times.    Staff would turn off ac in the room and you always have to call and ask to turn it on. Same with hot water. And they never mentioned that. We had to figure that all out.    Breakfast was in another building.   When we arrive, room wasn't ready and they said 5 minutes. It took them an hour and they kept saying 5 more minute every 10 min. Why lie?! Check in took forever too, as they were copying every info(passport, visas, etc)  ‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: HollyZ456
Detailed Review: Small rooms, staff were nice enough. The guy who booked our tour was very helpful however our driver for the 3 day golden triangle tour was far from. This was the first time we had been to Delhi and it's right off the main bazaar which is really dirty, very busy and full of people constantly trying to sell you things (granted this is most of India!). If we went again we probably wouldn't stay but this is more personal preference. Breakfast was OK.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: elle_b121212
Review: Excellent accommodation for tourists and short stay
Detailed Review: This place was okay - cheaply priced and we got ac, large bed, towels soap, a fan and a tv. The bathroom was pretty clean, but tiny. We had to request he hot water be turned on but there was a phone in the room so it was easy to call down to reception. The rooms were functional but not cosy and the hotel lacked atmosphere.  The staff were reasonably friendly and advised on how not to get scammed. We got a good map of delhi and we're offered tours and train tickets.   The location is just off from a main bazaar- but down a small street past a public urinal, which is kinda gross, but can't be helped.  DO NOT bother with the airport pickup. The car they sent us was an absolute heap - filthy. The driver took a 30 min detour for gas and did not explain this. Once we arrived he begged‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Bindi B
Detailed Review: Stayed for 2 nights. Management asked us to move for the second night but not to sure why. First room was great with heaps of space. Second room was tiny. I could not sit on the toilet seat because the toilet was to close to the wall. However the Staff were friendly and helpful. Free breakfast was great. Airport transfer also great. Extremely hard beds!!! Extremely hard!!! And location not great. Would leave the hostel and men would make comments who were sitting in the ale. I would recommend it to travellers wanting somewhere great to stay for a cheap price however I wouldn't stay here again.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: RGM
Review: Ok stay - reasonable value for the price
Detailed Review: I was pretty worried to go to Paharjang at night as some of my friends did not give me good review about the location but that was not the case at all, me and my 2 friends reached the place at 12:00 am in the night. The Location is in a small alley but its a very happening place and nothing to worry about. The staff was cooperative and room was also very good and clean. Everything was working fine and was upto the mark.  PS: The Hotel is absolutely good for friends and family and no need to worry about any thing.    Thanks Harish and Ahemed for your cooperation and assistance. I will surely suggest your place to my friends and will look forward to stay their whenever i am in Delhi.  Regards, Reyansh Mestry

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: rotterdam1992
Detailed Review: Nice hotel just 10 minute walk from new delhi train station. Its in the middle of a street market and has everything within reach. Friendly staff and good wifi. Be aware of scams telling you hotel closed recently closed down.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Deborah M
Review: Good Hotel in heart of Main Bazaar.
Detailed Review: This is a lovely little hotel right off the Main Bazaar. Simple, clean rooms with a ceiling fan and a/c.  The price is right. Breakfast mediocre. Booked train tickets to Haridwar from the front desk with no hassle or hustle.  Recommend.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ben P
Review: Nice hotel in the center of real Delhi
Detailed Review: The room has everything you need and is comfortable. It is located down a very small alley which is not the most fun to walk down, but beyond that it is right on the main bazaar and a short tuk tuk ride to anywhere you want to visit.  Back to the private room, huge bed, air con, fan, tv, and hot water (upon request). Everything you would realistically need and more, although a bit clinical. But hey, it's a hostel at a very reasonable price so what are you expecting.  The staff are all very kind and the manager very helpful. He can arrange train tickets and give good information about exploring Delhi.  Overall, highly recommend as a budget place to stay in Delhi.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ria H
Detailed Review: Be prepared if staying in Pahar Ganj it will be extremely noisy throughout the day and night. We Thought being just off the main strip the noise might not be so bad but was wrong. We stayed in our own room and bathroom, they also do dorms. Clean basic room, staff were good pretty helpful. Breakfast was basic. Location was good and fine if staying only for a short period. Lots of restaurants close by. If you want to be thrown in to the middle of it all it be perfect.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: kashyap m
Detailed Review: pretty good. nice hotel with good breakfast. close to the railway station. on the flip side, small bathroom ! On the bright side, the aircon was strong and cooled the room instantaneously. Okay for a couple of nights stay when you are backpacking.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Japanisadhu
Detailed Review: Thank you for good space where I could take it easy for a while in transiting from UP, India to Malaysia. Pretty breakfast was nice for morning. I want to stay again when I reach India from abroad. See you again

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: gsxr
Detailed Review: Room was Nothing like they show on pictures (upgraded)  . Staff was not helpful. Tiny, dirty bathroom with non working shower. Had to sit on the toilet sideways as there was no space otherwise- smallest bathroom we have ever seen in our travels!   No privacy. Big window(only window) in our room was into the hall!!! Staff was very loud at times.    Staff would turn off ac in the room and you always have to call and ask to turn it on. Same with hot water. And they never mentioned that. We had to figure that all out.    Breakfast was in another building.   When we arrive, room wasn't ready and they said 5 minutes. It took them an hour and they kept saying 5 more minute every 10 min. Why lie?! Check in took forever too, as they were copying every info(passport, visas, etc)  ‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Adrian O
Review: 2 Short stays at a very nice comfortable Hotel
Detailed Review: When we decided to have a holiday in India and knew we would be flying into and out of Delhi we informed our booking agent (Enchanting Travels) we would prefer to use our short stays in various cities, in hotels with less than 50 rooms. Their advice was very good providing options with local knowledge. We selected the "Colonels Retreat" for our arrival and departure, nearly 3 weeks later and found the Proprietors/Hosts very nice friendly people to get to know and stay with, in their private hotel. A little out of the main stream of central Delhi, which to the novice traveler in India is a little easier to understand how 23 million people live in some sort of special harmony which we came to partially understand.  The accommodation was comfortable well managed and our hosts who‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: shakespearestarr
Review: Don't think of it as a B&B
Detailed Review: I was a bit worried about starting our holiday in a B&B. I'd read the very good reviews it was getting but still in the back of my mind I was concerned it wouldn't meet my expectations when I'm used to staying in hotels. Maybe the reviews were from people who always stay in B&B's.  I need not have worried. It was a great start to our tour of India. Located in a lovely quiet upmarket residential area, we were welcomed with tea and cake. The room was cosy and fitted out with beautiful furniture. Our evening meal which we booked on our arrival was on the upstairs terrace and was very pretty. The food was excellent and the Colonel and staff were very friendly.   My only disappointment was that we were there for one night only and due to an early start the next morning we didn't get‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: martingsmith1951
Review: A quiet haven within an amazing city
Detailed Review: After a long flight from UK...we (2 couples) arrived at this hotel , and were ushered up to 3rd floor.....we were a little shocked at the arrangement of rooms...we thought some aspects were a little jaded..maybe a little soiled ie well used books in the lounge.. A grimy tv control .....grubby corners...   It was a long flight !!!.....we settled in for 2 nite stay ... Then Beers on the roof terrace ...rather attractive.  Chipmunks chuckling around us. A first tour of the nearby old city showed us how crowded, dusty and crazy this place is. A good nites sleep was followed by a nice breakfast , again on the terrace ..the lady owner ?  came up to say welcome etc..     this hotel grows on you....you get to realise how good it is, being cramped into such  a mad place ....keeping the‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: XenaWP1999
Review: A pleasant B&B in quiet Defense Colony
Detailed Review: Compared to Jaipur and Agra, New Delhi hotels are expensive. It's the capitol, after all. The Colonel‚Äôs Retreat is basically a multi-storey apartment building with 1 apt on each floor and a security guard at the front gate. Each apt has 3 bedrooms, a living room, dining room and kitchen (not for use by guests). The doors to the apts are left open all the time. There is no Front Desk.   Next to the elevator, on the outside of the apt door, there is an additional bedroom (was this once the servants‚Äô quarters?). This bedroom is very small ‚Äì only 1 person can fit in the washroom at one time. There is hardly any space to put one's toiletries or luggage.  When we arrived in the late afternoon, only 2 rooms were available in the building. One was larger, with a much larger washroom.‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: catrin212017
Review: Fabulous start to our tour of Northern India
Detailed Review: Excellent 2 night stay at the Colonel's Retreat. Our room was comfortable providing all the facilities required for a short break. Breakfast was excellent with home made breads, preserves (which included an excellent gooseberry jam) and the famous banana bread. We had dinner on the rooftop terrace which was atmospheric with lights and candles, the service and the hosts Arun and his lovely wife were attentive and welcoming. There is a lovely park a short distance from the hotel where we chilled out after our overnight flight.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: warn1
Detailed Review: We stayed here for our first two nights for our holiday travelling the golden triangle. More of a home stay than a hotel, the food was fantastic, the colonel and his wife were very friendly. Eating on the roof terrace was great, the Indian scrabbled eggs for breakfast are lovely together with homemade bread. Dont miss out on the home made banana cake :)

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: 123Ann1234
Detailed Review: We stayed 2 nights at Colonel's Retreat as part of a round trip to Ranthambhore National Park and Agra.  The first and last day of the trip, we stayed at Colonel's Retreat.  We felt like home here, as it is the type of guesthouse, with living room, kitchen and private bathroom.  Having breakfast on the roof terrace, is just wonderful.  Homemade bread, banana cake and jam are delicious.  A place where you can relax and don't have to worry about anything. I would recommend it to anyone.  Thank's for everything!

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Kolourful
Review: Exquisite rest, caring staff and generous hosts
Detailed Review: Colonel's Retreat came highly recommended and it exceeded my expectations due to the safe secure quiet location, staff who couldnt do enough to make my stay relaxing and enjoyable and generous personable hosts/owners who greeted me at every meal and treated me to the greatest Festival of Holi/Colour experience of dance, food and wine and celebration of life. Thank you and I look forward to returning.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: MediaWisdom
Detailed Review: The Colonel's Retreat was our first stop on our first visit to India - and it didn't disappoint. The staff there are so helpful and charming we just wanted to stay longer.    The rooms are comfortable, clean and restful.  The upstairs roof terrace restaurant is a hidden gem.  The perfect place to catch up and chat with other travellers and get tips on places to see and do. And the food is delicious, in relaxing surroundings.  It's also a short walk from the Metro which makes getting around easy.  We had 2 fabulous nights there and were made to feel right at home.  We met a couple who had been going there regularly over 20 years - and I can see why.    It's not a stuffy Western style hotel, it offers character, soul, a friendly helpful team, and delicious food.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: travelguru
Detailed Review: Clean,spacious, comfortable, friendly staff and best of all location. Stayed for 5 nights and enjoyed my stay. Spacious room, nice area for breakfast on roof terrace and safe, secure and quiet area. Location is superb only 10 mins walk to metro station, another 5 mins past there to Lajpat Nagar market which is super. In the other direction 10 mins walk takes you to Defence Colony market which has some wonderful restaurants and bars. We would walk there in the evening for our meal a couple of drinks and then get rickshaw home. Very friendly place and safe place. I would stay here again.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: abhidrock
Detailed Review: I recommend this to visit with your soulmate. My experience here was fantastic.people are very nice and professional they look forward each and every need of customer. Housekeeping is well mannered and have good behaviour

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Roger T
Detailed Review: Very enjoyable stay with friends. Clean, well equipped and best of all extremely hospitable hosts. Lovely location, safe and welcoming. We particularly enjoyed the rooftop eating area for both breakfast and dinner.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Manny-C
Detailed Review: We arrived tired from an overnight flight.   We were welcomed showed to our comfortable rooms with great bathroom.   That evening we had an excellent dinner on the roof, hosted by Arun and his wonderfully friendly staff.   Breakfast the next day we were delighted to meet the Colonel himself (Arun's father) and a real, galant, gentleman.   Good free wifi, comfortable beds, perfect location.   Why even think about staying in 5-star hotel (and spend a fortune) when you can stay in this comfortable, well run, friendly hotel, were you can meet like-minded travellers?

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: leuca
Detailed Review: what sets Colonel's Retreat apart from the rest? The personal attention Arum the owner bestows on all his guests.  Arum sets high standards and makes sure that all efforts are made to ensure they are achieved. The accomodation is spotless and our room was large and had a very spacious marble shower room. Each floor contains a separate communal lounge with comfy sofas and dining area. Before I went I asked a question on TA about the evening meals.  We ate here both nights on the roof terrace. It was very pleasant , quiet  ( that's not a word associated with Delhi) and the food was from a fixed menu with a choice of around 6-8 main meals . They were delicious , why bother eating out? The staff were fantastic and very helpful.  Breakfasts were tasty and varied, again we enjoyed‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: RajatBhattacharya
Detailed Review: Very good hospitality. Best thing they receive you from airport free , location wise very good. .Connaught Place is walking distance. New Delhi station is also walking distance. Good restaurant & food also available for 24x7

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Claudia W
Review: Visit our daughter, who lives one year in Pune
Detailed Review: Our family stayed 2 nights in this nice hotel, we had two clean rooms with chairs, table and TV. The WLAN was available, the breakfast tasted perfect, it was continental and Indian. We could stay our luggage there till the evening, all perfect

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: gourab2010
Detailed Review: I have been to Delhi many times. I found Hotel Ajanta best among all the budget hotels I experienced till date in Delhi. Rooms are spacious, well decorated and well maintained. The food quality is good. The washroom is very clean. Each room contains a minibar and arrangements for making tea. Apart from few, the staffs are also very good and always ready to help.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Juliana H
Detailed Review: We did a one month trip to India coming from Colombia! Our first hotel was Ajanta. Apart from the great rooms we had during our stops in Delhi, we enjoyed the tour we took with ajanta's travel agency and also the restaurant is great! Thank you! Contact Mr zahoor +91 9899295786

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: VANISHA G
Detailed Review: Will definitely visit again whenever back in Delhi.  Clean room with all facilities. Good staff and good restaurant. Good breakfast provided. Complimentary taxi transfer is so helpful for us foreigners. Will definitely visit again.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Utsav95
Detailed Review: I was visited this place with my friends first I say that the design and lighting are superb of this hotel. I am also impressed with the food quality and taste of the hotel. Also in there room services available which is fantastic.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: neha c
Detailed Review: Nice Ambience , Courteous staff spl Thanx to Ms Gunjan ...comfortable stay..really enjoyed location is perfect food is good rooms are neat n clean ....We really appreciate to see them again ...will prefer to others also

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: vh0001
Detailed Review: Never made it to the hotel. Nobody was waiting at the airport to pick me up even though both pickup and drop off were pre-arranged. When I eventually managed to contact hotel manager by phone he said that he has no reservation in my name. But he was willing to send someone to pick me up within an hour. It was late night, I was tired so I declined.  I eventually ended up in another hotel recommended by the scout at the airport. All other reservations for this trip made by the travel agent worked fine.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: hartiraths
Review: Poor Hotel Management - we stayed from 16-3-2017 to 18-3-2017
Detailed Review: We stayed at this hotel as part of our triangular trip between Delhi, Agra and Jaipur. We got into our room to discover the wedding hadn't been changed, the pillow covers were torn, no covers on blankets, the room smelt of smoke. The safe did not work. The person sent to look at it, didn't know what to look for. I discovered the next day that there were no batteries in the safe. Staff was very unfriendly as they didn't get any tips because they were nor delivering service. A lot of manager looking types, but didn't quite know what to do. Seems like lack of checklists

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: rebecca7910
Review: Very difficult sales people at the front desk
Detailed Review: The hotel itself was nice enough, but while there the people who ran the hotel would not let us walk through the lobby without trying to sell us on their travel service. The first day alone we missed 4 hours of our day because they just wouldn't let us leave. They kept telling us how everyone else would scam us and we shouldn't go out without their tour guides or protection. They would bring up bad reviews of all other hotels and services and say that if we booked anything ourselves we would loose our money. The first day was one thing but after 3 days there, it was a very bad experience. In fact, they charged us a 25 percent booking fee when we left after trying to charge us for two extra days that we weren't even there for. So I caution people with this hotel that they will‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: wanderingtheworl2017
Review: Very helpful staff and clean hotel
Detailed Review: Quiet, dark, clean rooms that drown out the sound of busy Delhi so you can get a good night sleep. The staff were more than helpful, arranging a complimentary taxi and also letting us freshen up after we had checked out, prior to our long train journey. Buffet breakfast was very good value (170 rupees each) and lunch very tasty. Would come back again.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: MrsDSuffolk
Review: Old favourite in characterful part of Delhi
Detailed Review: Near main railway station and lively Pahar Ganj market area, this large hotel is a bit old fashioned in terms of build/decor as there are many other newer ones now in Arakashan Road. Have stayed at Ajanta several times and would return. Staff provide a good service, has good Indian & continental restaurant - although breakfast a bit limited. Hotel can arrange tours etc (eg Taj Mahal) and change money. Wifi in rooms. Rooms & beds comfortable.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: aziey_zaini
Detailed Review: Booked to stay for 3 nights but I checked out after 1 night. I decided to move to South Delhi area as I didn't proceed to go to Agra via train. It's in a crowded area; decent hotel with average cleanliness. Be prepared to tip the worker who helped with your luggage, though you decided not to tip they will tend to be pushy for tips.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Anna R
Review: Just back from Delhi, we were at this hotel March 5-7 th 2017.
Detailed Review: The staff and food was the highlight. The hotel is very conveniently located in the middle of the the city. They even arranged a free airport pick up and a drop off at a minimum rate.  The breakfast buffet is good food and well organized. There is a lot of street noise but the rooms are nicely buffered so not much noise came up. The rooms are clean and lots running hot water. Would highly recommend and would return to this hotel again.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: shashi p
Detailed Review: I was there for a official trip i went there bya train also organise pick up from the railway station that was smooth and was on time breakfast was decent and the hotel staff was so kind and helpfull thanks

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: sdas_32
Detailed Review: Stayed for five nights in family room. The three room unit was good as accommodation but housekeeping, linens calls for improvement.  Food was good but room service lagged behind. Lack of variation in the menu too.  Best part is the location. Overall a decent stay but you might be able to find some better place in same area.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Kaalo
Review: Quiet location in a lively area
Detailed Review: The Amax Inn is in a busy area but being slight off the street, relatively quiet. Everything was as described so no surprises. The room for the amount paid was good value. Best of all were the very friendly staff who were most helpful. A great hotel for the experienced traveller after a good deal with great service by the staff. Would stay again for sure.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: moziz52
Detailed Review: Great stay as usual tried different rooms from my usual room I stay at. All rooms are clean and the restaurant good place to meet other travellers. The service from the staff and Anil the owner is 100% nothing is to much any problem ask Anil and he will try his best to sort it out for you. You cant beat this budget hotel in the area. Close to the metro & new Delhi railway station. Been staying here for a number of years and looking forward to my next stay.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: davebolland
Detailed Review: the only place to stay in Delhi and the best showers in town.  Whenever im in delhi which is usually for 1 night this is where i always stay. Tucked away in paharganj it offers a haven to the hustle and bustle outside. it has a good foyer area to chill and meet other travellers.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: LouiseA007_
Detailed Review: I am very glad I booked this hotel when I stayed in Delhi. The value of the room is excellent - big rooms, hot showers, TV. The restaurant on the rooftop is nice and the food is delicious. The staff are friendly and you can exchange money (only $100 US bills, we were told) at the front counter. It was just off the main road, which was a nice relief from the craziness of Paharganj. The only bad thing was it took a few tries for the staff to fix the air conditioning, but besides that, everything was great.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Kartik M
Review: Iffy location, but overall great value!
Detailed Review: The location of the hotel is amazing connectivity wise- a quick rickshaw ride away from New Delhi and RK Ashram Marg metro stations. And even near to many of the tourist attractions. It's right in the middle of an incredibly crowded and congested street that's mostly dirty too but the hotel is very well maintained making it a really valuable budget stay. The rooms and bathrooms very clean and the staff were very cordial  who were happy to oblige to requests of mine. The room service isn't too costly and they arrange for laundry too. Totally got my monies worth at this place!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: YashpalSengar
Detailed Review: A great Budget Hotel to stay in Central Delhi. Talking about the approach, its near to New Delhi Rly Station but you have to spent nice 5-10 mins to get there due to crowded streets but the hotel is in alley in quiet corner which gives a little peace to mind. The Hotel hospitality is commendable and the hotel is overall clean and tidy. The food (vegetarian) which we ordered in room was really tasty.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Philip B
Detailed Review: This hotel might be in the middle of the noisy, busy, grubby Paharganj area of Delhi but it's a clean haven at the end of a dirty alley.   The staff were friendly and helpful and the room was great for the price. Hot water flows eventually and the facilities are functional.    I was ill whole in delhi and the staff were supportive. I'd use this hotel again.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: ghosh_shankar
Review: Fabulous Hotel at Extremely cheap rate
Detailed Review: We, 4 families, stayed at Hotel Amax Inn for 4 nights from 6 March, 2017. This is one of the best budget hotel in Delhi. We got triple bed AC luxury room @ INR 1400 only. You will get the comfort and facilities of a 3-star/4-star hotel here at a very cheap rate.  Some positive points of this hotel:      1. Absolutely neat and clean room and washrooms.      2. Spacious rooms      3. Helpful and cordial staffs, the Owner Mr. Manish is a nice person. Milan dada at reception is very pleasant.      4. Fantastic location at Arakasan Road at Paharganj.      5. Good quality food. I liked their Veg & Non-veg Thali.      6. Good overall ambience suitable for family staying.  Negatives:    Only thing, the hotel management may think of is to provide some more toilet kits including some‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: somendra g
Review: Stayed 2 nights at hotel amax inn
Detailed Review: I stayed 2 nights 3 days in this hotel .Good budget hotel, good hospitality ,good ambience, good food, good and clean roomand also Every floor had his wifi router.Every one must stay in this hotel when I and with my family will again come to New Delhi I will stayed in this hotel .

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jamie G
Detailed Review: My wife and I had a nice stay at Amax Inn when we first arrived in New Delhi. They sent a driver to pick us up at the airport at 4AM for 750 Rs and had a room ready for us when we arrived. Rooms were clean and staff was very helpful. Rooftop restaurant was comfortable, food was some of the best we had in India and at a reasonable price. Got to know the owner Anil and he offered to set up any travel arrangements we might need. Amax Inn was a nice retreat from the craziness of Delhi, quieter than being on the main bazaar. Ample hot water and good wifi! 15 minute walk to the New Delhi train station.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ott N
Detailed Review: Rooms are clean and cool. AC in most rooms, in March was not needed though. Was cool enough without it. Rooftop restaurant has a nice selection of food and drinks with cheap prices. Just takes minimum half an hour for order to be fulfilled, even if it's just coffee. Location and price good. Free Wi-Fi!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: ThisisBo
Review: Great staff, clean rooms, nice terrace
Detailed Review: I stayed at the Amax Inn twice on my trip, once before traveling to Punjab, and once after. The rooms I got each time were clean, a decent price, and the staff was really helpful and kind. I naturally got sick in my first few days in Delhi and they ran out to grab me medicine and were really very considerate. The terrace is great to have breakfast on, and I met a good assortment of people to talk to and hang out with.   On my last day we celebrated Holi with the staff, it was the perfect farewell to Amax Inn. See you next year!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Erin Y
Detailed Review: Anil and his staff are extremely accommodating, offering to help get whatever you need from airport transport to drinks to train tickets. The location is great if you don't mind the bustle and noise of Delhi. Easy walk to the train station or metro as well as the Main Bazaar. 15 min rickshaw ride to the red fort and famed Karims restaurant - try tye chicken tikka. Also Great restaurant options within a few blocks and colorful shopping opportunities. Rooms are clean enough with hot water and decent WiFi (stronger connection on rooftop than in room). WiFi often turned off after 9pm/10pm. Food is EXCELLENT value for the money with delicious eastern and western options. Try the milk tea or coffee and the thali options are great for the value. For breakfast the egg briyani.‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Shanti C
Detailed Review: This us by second visit to Amax inn. Its roomsare clean and bathrooms are super clean. When you travelling in India bathrooms hard to find clean.  The Rooftop is perfect place for breakfast and dinner frim variety of Menu.  I am coming back soon.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Tila M
Detailed Review: There are no words to describe... Amax Inn is one of the best hotels in Delhi, with an excellent service and a very good team. Very helpful and warm welcome... Always there for making the trip more great , easier and joyful. One of the best things is the food too. Everything organized in an perfect way....Regards from my all family!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: sudip b
Detailed Review: Amax....A home away from home. Great staff that knows the true value of customer service. Special mention for Milanji and Kuldeepji, who have taken hospitality business to another level...   The tariff is fairly reasonable considering the location of the hotel and the standard of rooms on offer.  The restaurant service is above par, but the menu is ordinary.. lacks variety and needs improvement.  However, the excellent support staff (special mention for Rajeev) makes you forget the culinary shortcomings.   I have been a regular guest to the hotel since the last two years...and would always remain so...  Sudip Bhattacharjee

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Matt C
Review: Perfect place at a perfect price
Detailed Review: I was very happy with the stay here, it had everything i needed. The room was very clean and comfortable, it has great in room wi fi and a great shower. It was close to the centre and all the popular sights. The staff are very helpful and knowledgable  The in-house food was also really good. Although in the centre of Paharganj it was reasonably quiet, away from the traffic of the main street. They also provide tourist services at a really good price and the accomodation was very inexpensive.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: AHB007
Detailed Review: The hotel is well situated near the railway station. It is a budget hotel and you get exactly as advertised. The owner arranges to pick us up late from the airport, which was very much appreciated. The rooms are budget but plumbing works and they gave us whatever we needed.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: SANDEEP K
Review: Right place in Delhi to stay at Amax Inn
Detailed Review: Reasonable & Good place for stay in Delhi. Customer delight quality manager (Milind) Ausom experiounce. When u visit at hotel Welcome with very plesent smyle. Coaprative staff. AC Room, Soap, Towel, TV with cable connection, In dore Restorent.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Reshmi M
Detailed Review: I was traveled with my husband in a holiday trip.I find this hotel in trip advisor with good reviews. after reaching there I felt like home away from my house. the room was exactly same as we expected.room was clean and bathroom also nice.special thanks to the stuff because they are always ready to help us in any occasion. there is a man in the reception who can speak bengaIi and he was very helpful. this hotel is almost half kilometer from New Delhi station.if I come again I will definitely come here.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Arindam B
Review: Very good hotel with good service
Detailed Review: Rooms are well maintened, services are good also, well decorated. Hot and cold water is also available and working 24 hr.. hotel is clean. Servicemen are helpfull, price is also within budget, there is a bengali staff in the hotel, so it is helpful for kolkata people, I will give 5 out of 5 mark.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Saumen A
Detailed Review: Amax  inn is perfect  place for stay in Delhi. its amazing staff with Rooms and bathrooms. Rooftop is perfect place for food.  we really enjoyed and recommend. Hope to see them again soon. What else you wznt.  perfect price with service.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Surojit M
Review: Very comfortable and reasonable ............ full familiar hotel... good in fooding very near by from new delhi st.
Detailed Review: Very comfortable and reasonable ............ full familiar hotel... good in fooding very near by from new delhi rail station...... we are very satisfied.... close to all good location in delhi like china market lal quila..

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: debjoy g
Detailed Review: We r travelling with our family and our friend. The hotel is nice and stuff was excellent. The room are neat and clean.bathroom are very nice.they have open roof top place to sit.food was good. We r satisfy in all angles. WiFi speed was.thanks to amax stuff.big thumb s up for them

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Rebeca D
Detailed Review: Honestly do not know how this hotel is recommended by the lonely planet and has such a good rating on trip adviser. Starting with the positives - the hotel is clean, the food is good. If you want somewhere to crash then come here. They will rip you off, tell you there are no rooms available if you are only staying one night which we heard was common from a few tourists, and try and charge you more than the 10% tax. I don't really have a bad thing to say about anywhere, but this place in my opinion is pathetic. I hope for other people staying here you have a better experience but from me I wish that I could rate it less than 1 star. Also with the travel agency they have inside of the hotel DO NOT TRUST THEM! Or make sure you know prices. When questioned the travel agent became‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: ZapoMago
Detailed Review: Hotel is super good! Its close to the everything you need in Delhi! Also staff is great with any request! From trains to planes to tea to spices you name it they can help you!  Do not hesitate to stay here! Cheap, clean and good!   Anil the owner is a great host! He is almost always here and always happy to help!  If you are to tired to go walk and shop for some spices you can ask Anil to get anything for you from the spice market!  Enjoy India!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: simbelina
Review: Right in the thick of it!
Detailed Review: A mid sized hotel amid the bustle paharganj, located off the main road down an alley.   Big clean room with TV (with some English channels), fan, wardrobe and fridge.  Good sized bathroom with intermittent hot water and pressure.  Wi-fi comes and goes.  Small rooftop restaurant is pleasant and service is friendly.  We stayed in room 101 and there was alot of street/lobby noise. Our window looked out on to the adjacent building and so gave little natural light.  On a busy street with plenty of restaurants / shops. 15-20 min walk via busy streets of paharganj to nearest at metro.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Honey A
Detailed Review: Very nice hotel excellent service nice well behaved staff    Values for money I liked the hotel very much. Nice location. Very good restaurant service and yummy food at good cost not so high price.  Very good

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Soumyadev S
Detailed Review: I was very satisfied with the stay. Room, service and the staffs were excellent and very helpful. I would highly recommend this place and also looking forward for another experience at this hotel soon.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Kaalo
Review: Quiet location in a lively area
Detailed Review: The Amax Inn is in a busy area but being slight off the street, relatively quiet. Everything was as described so no surprises. The room for the amount paid was good value. Best of all were the very friendly staff who were most helpful. A great hotel for the experienced traveller after a good deal with great service by the staff. Would stay again for sure.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: moziz52
Detailed Review: Great stay as usual tried different rooms from my usual room I stay at. All rooms are clean and the restaurant good place to meet other travellers. The service from the staff and Anil the owner is 100% nothing is to much any problem ask Anil and he will try his best to sort it out for you. You cant beat this budget hotel in the area. Close to the metro & new Delhi railway station. Been staying here for a number of years and looking forward to my next stay.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: davebolland
Detailed Review: the only place to stay in Delhi and the best showers in town.  Whenever im in delhi which is usually for 1 night this is where i always stay. Tucked away in paharganj it offers a haven to the hustle and bustle outside. it has a good foyer area to chill and meet other travellers.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: LouiseA007_
Detailed Review: I am very glad I booked this hotel when I stayed in Delhi. The value of the room is excellent - big rooms, hot showers, TV. The restaurant on the rooftop is nice and the food is delicious. The staff are friendly and you can exchange money (only $100 US bills, we were told) at the front counter. It was just off the main road, which was a nice relief from the craziness of Paharganj. The only bad thing was it took a few tries for the staff to fix the air conditioning, but besides that, everything was great.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Kartik M
Review: Iffy location, but overall great value!
Detailed Review: The location of the hotel is amazing connectivity wise- a quick rickshaw ride away from New Delhi and RK Ashram Marg metro stations. And even near to many of the tourist attractions. It's right in the middle of an incredibly crowded and congested street that's mostly dirty too but the hotel is very well maintained making it a really valuable budget stay. The rooms and bathrooms very clean and the staff were very cordial  who were happy to oblige to requests of mine. The room service isn't too costly and they arrange for laundry too. Totally got my monies worth at this place!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: YashpalSengar
Detailed Review: A great Budget Hotel to stay in Central Delhi. Talking about the approach, its near to New Delhi Rly Station but you have to spent nice 5-10 mins to get there due to crowded streets but the hotel is in alley in quiet corner which gives a little peace to mind. The Hotel hospitality is commendable and the hotel is overall clean and tidy. The food (vegetarian) which we ordered in room was really tasty.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Philip B
Detailed Review: This hotel might be in the middle of the noisy, busy, grubby Paharganj area of Delhi but it's a clean haven at the end of a dirty alley.   The staff were friendly and helpful and the room was great for the price. Hot water flows eventually and the facilities are functional.    I was ill whole in delhi and the staff were supportive. I'd use this hotel again.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: ghosh_shankar
Review: Fabulous Hotel at Extremely cheap rate
Detailed Review: We, 4 families, stayed at Hotel Amax Inn for 4 nights from 6 March, 2017. This is one of the best budget hotel in Delhi. We got triple bed AC luxury room @ INR 1400 only. You will get the comfort and facilities of a 3-star/4-star hotel here at a very cheap rate.  Some positive points of this hotel:      1. Absolutely neat and clean room and washrooms.      2. Spacious rooms      3. Helpful and cordial staffs, the Owner Mr. Manish is a nice person. Milan dada at reception is very pleasant.      4. Fantastic location at Arakasan Road at Paharganj.      5. Good quality food. I liked their Veg & Non-veg Thali.      6. Good overall ambience suitable for family staying.  Negatives:    Only thing, the hotel management may think of is to provide some more toilet kits including some‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: somendra g
Review: Stayed 2 nights at hotel amax inn
Detailed Review: I stayed 2 nights 3 days in this hotel .Good budget hotel, good hospitality ,good ambience, good food, good and clean roomand also Every floor had his wifi router.Every one must stay in this hotel when I and with my family will again come to New Delhi I will stayed in this hotel .

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jamie G
Detailed Review: My wife and I had a nice stay at Amax Inn when we first arrived in New Delhi. They sent a driver to pick us up at the airport at 4AM for 750 Rs and had a room ready for us when we arrived. Rooms were clean and staff was very helpful. Rooftop restaurant was comfortable, food was some of the best we had in India and at a reasonable price. Got to know the owner Anil and he offered to set up any travel arrangements we might need. Amax Inn was a nice retreat from the craziness of Delhi, quieter than being on the main bazaar. Ample hot water and good wifi! 15 minute walk to the New Delhi train station.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ott N
Detailed Review: Rooms are clean and cool. AC in most rooms, in March was not needed though. Was cool enough without it. Rooftop restaurant has a nice selection of food and drinks with cheap prices. Just takes minimum half an hour for order to be fulfilled, even if it's just coffee. Location and price good. Free Wi-Fi!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: ThisisBo
Review: Great staff, clean rooms, nice terrace
Detailed Review: I stayed at the Amax Inn twice on my trip, once before traveling to Punjab, and once after. The rooms I got each time were clean, a decent price, and the staff was really helpful and kind. I naturally got sick in my first few days in Delhi and they ran out to grab me medicine and were really very considerate. The terrace is great to have breakfast on, and I met a good assortment of people to talk to and hang out with.   On my last day we celebrated Holi with the staff, it was the perfect farewell to Amax Inn. See you next year!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Erin Y
Detailed Review: Anil and his staff are extremely accommodating, offering to help get whatever you need from airport transport to drinks to train tickets. The location is great if you don't mind the bustle and noise of Delhi. Easy walk to the train station or metro as well as the Main Bazaar. 15 min rickshaw ride to the red fort and famed Karims restaurant - try tye chicken tikka. Also Great restaurant options within a few blocks and colorful shopping opportunities. Rooms are clean enough with hot water and decent WiFi (stronger connection on rooftop than in room). WiFi often turned off after 9pm/10pm. Food is EXCELLENT value for the money with delicious eastern and western options. Try the milk tea or coffee and the thali options are great for the value. For breakfast the egg briyani.‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Shanti C
Detailed Review: This us by second visit to Amax inn. Its roomsare clean and bathrooms are super clean. When you travelling in India bathrooms hard to find clean.  The Rooftop is perfect place for breakfast and dinner frim variety of Menu.  I am coming back soon.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Tila M
Detailed Review: There are no words to describe... Amax Inn is one of the best hotels in Delhi, with an excellent service and a very good team. Very helpful and warm welcome... Always there for making the trip more great , easier and joyful. One of the best things is the food too. Everything organized in an perfect way....Regards from my all family!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Honey A
Detailed Review: Very nice hotel excellent service nice well behaved staff    Values for money I liked the hotel very much. Nice location. Very good restaurant service and yummy food at good cost not so high price.  Very good

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Soumyadev S
Detailed Review: I was very satisfied with the stay. Room, service and the staffs were excellent and very helpful. I would highly recommend this place and also looking forward for another experience at this hotel soon.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Tha√≠s L
Detailed Review: My husband and I stayed 4 days at the hostel and we really loved it. The staff is very helpful, the rooms are clean, with aircon and hot shower, and the common areas are great! After 1 month traveling through 9 cities in India, we can say Jugaad was the best hostel we stayed. We highly recommend it!

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Elliot L
Detailed Review: I had heard about Jugaad from a friend (look up its meaning). I stayed for two night before leaving India and did not want to leave.  Friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms, hot showers, and other great travelers.  It felt like a home for me quickly. The rooftop was a fun place to hangout and make friends. I will be back next time I am in Delhi.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: ËóùÊñá Èô≥
Detailed Review: Ë¶ÅÊé®Ëñ¶ÈÄôË£°ÂæàÂ§öÊù±Ë•øÔºåÊàøÈñìÂæà‰πæÊ∑®ÔºåÊàëÁöÑÂçÅ‰∫∫ÊàøÊúâÂÖ©ÈñìÂªÅÊâÄÔºå‰∏çÈúÄË¶ÅÁ≠â„ÄÇÊó©È§êÂ•ΩÂêÉÂèà‰πæÊ∑®ÊØèÂ§©ÈÉΩ‰∏çÂêåËèúÂñÆ„ÄÇÂæàÊé®Ëñ¶walk tourÔºåÂèØ‰ª•Ê∑±ÂÖ•‰∫ÜËß£Áï∂Âú∞‰∏îÊúâ‰ªñÂÄëÂú®ÈùûÂ∏∏ÂÆâÂÖ®‰∏çÁî®ÊìîÂøÉË¢´È®ô„ÄÇÂèØ‰ª•ÊâæShahzada‰ªñÊòØ‰∏ÄÂÄãÂæàÊ£íÁöÑÂ∞éÈÅäÂíåÊúãÂèã„ÄÇ Here have too much thing I have to recommend!room is clean;my room is 10pp room but have two bathrooms here,it's convenient for traveler(don't need to waiting for shower);delicious Indian breakfast and change menu everyday;great top floor,you can spent half day there enjoy music and cheat with friend. I joined walk tour,you will understand many local and history of india.here owner and staff all are kind and friendly!(especially Shahzada his old delhi walk tour was so great AF!) but you have to notice google map always bring you to wrong way,should trough street between vivekanand marg and africa ave.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Anthony p
Detailed Review: Great Place to stay if you're looking for an awesome Hot shower, Comfortable bed, Great Staff, Clean and Safe location, Good food, Free chai tea, Help with getting to and or from airport for cheap, and Great advice on what to See, Do and Eat in New Delhi! I couldn't of asked for a better hostel and will certainly be back to start my next India trip.  The owners and staff want you to enjoy your experience in India not just take your money like so many businesses in this world.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: birgitte h
Detailed Review: I cant tell anyone enough how much I fell in love with the people at Jugaad. They really made Delhi for me. Shahzada took us out for a great street food tour of Old Delhi, we even ate in a Sikh Temple, and everyone, Vasu, Vasi, Uddav, Udit and who-not was so helpful and good-humoured. Also the atmosphere is super-relaxed, and I found it REALLY really easy to also talk to and connect with the other guests there because of the way the roof-top, the kitchen, and the common-room is set up. We went out with the volunteers and other guests there and everyone became just like a family. Its really close to Haus Khaz, a fun spot with restaurants, bars and clubs. I would recommend it to anyone.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Stefanie G
Review: Great staff and very nice place to stay
Detailed Review: First it was a little hard to find, and I did not like the neighborhood too much, but the hostel is very safe, the staff is always there for you and helps you with absolutely everything. Also, the rooms are comfortable and the common rooms are a great place to just hang out and meet nice people from all over the world.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Reejus L
Detailed Review: I had wonderful experience at Jugaad. The people there were quick to help me out with how the hostel worked. Also they gave me a good idea of how to make the most of my short visit. and i'm glad i got to see so much  of Delhi in the time that i spent there. Met a wonderful set of people there too. some who make the biggest impression on the shortest time. Overall a great place to stay.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Daniel Park
Detailed Review: I had a really enjoyable time here at Jugaad Hostels.  The staff is one of the most friendly I have met, and very helpful.  The are great amenities like morning yoga, guided tours, and music jams at night.  Raja Burza was the most helpful and set up the rest of my travel plans for the rest of my journey in India.  He sat down and helped me find a driver, accommodations, and flights.  He really made it a point to help me find where I wanted to go and do.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: TillyWonderer
Review: The best! Exceptional! Amazing! Jugaad was a delight!
Detailed Review: The staff are amazing and make you feel free and at home! The rooms are clean and spacious and the sheets are even changed every day! however you can save water etc and keep your sheets if you please! Security is great! There is a gate and I felt so safe! The rooftop is ideal! Such a great view, yoga in the morning is great! Breakfast and chai is delicious! Dinners also were amazing! I really do not have any faults for Jugaad. The location is okay, not too far from the metro and walking distance from Haus Khas!! There are quite a few stairs to climb but it's worth it! The common room is so well did up, there are board games, darts, a tv etc. I extended my stay here to because I just loved it! They really accommodate their guests and the tours, yoga and nights out are great!

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ashish T
Review: Awesome place to stay in delhi
Detailed Review: Amazing place to start your trip with. Staff will help you with anything you want.Nice place to to meet new people. Gym facility's is also available. Will definitely recommend if anyone is staying in delhi. Love the place and the rooftop is amazing

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sagrario1985
Review: One of the best in Delhi
Detailed Review: Awesome friendly staff, received us with a smile and gave us a pretty detailed tour of the amenities. The rooms are clean and spacious and the simple yet yummy breakfast was a bonus. Pretty cool sunset views from the rooftop. Coming back here for sure on our next visit to Delhi.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ruben
Review: Jugaad is the best place in Delhi
Detailed Review: Recently came to Jugaad, stayed longer than planned. It is the perfect basecamp from where to visit the city. The area is not as chaotic as the centre and the staff will help you with everything you need! Also several (free) tours are organised. Really liked Jugaad

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Kim S
Detailed Review: I stayed here for 2 nights awaiting my flight home from Delhi.  The staff are SUPER personable, easy to talk to and are helpful with travel plans. The space is awesome, a cool rooftop patio to do yoga on, chill out, drink beer, etc.  They have home made breakfast available every morning for 100 rupees, and dinner for ... 150? something like that.  The location isn't bad, not far from the metro or the airport.  I liked how it was difficult to find, provided more privacy. The place doesn't have a sign out front so it's not really targeted as a tourist place.  It was also the cleanest place I had come across in my 5 weeks in India, and the hot water always worked which was also the first time I had experienced that in 5 weeks.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Samantha T
Detailed Review: We arrived late at night and were very happy to get to Jugaad. Everybody there is very friendly. They helped us a lot with the pick up from the airport and to organize the rest of our trip. Its a great quiet place in a good area. The rooftop terraca is nice to hang out and relax after a day in New Delhi.  Dont get confused, there is no sign from the hostel in the entrance.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Yullover
Review: Good Hotel in heart of Main Bazaar.
Detailed Review: Got a room in the main, newly renovated building. Room without windows... sad for not having natural light, but good for sleeping long hours and without noise from the street.  Room was ok, two single beds to make one big bed. Only two single bed blanket for using. Sheet covering the bed but not for covering us, but all was perfectly clean. Need to call front desk to have A/C working and same for the hot water. They said hot water available in the morning and in the evening, but always need to call for having it. Bathroom was not really clean, has the water from the shower accumulated in a corner of the bathroom. Wifi was ok, slow but ok.  Breakfast was included, on the roof top of the other building. It was good, one day was continental and the next day was indian one. tasty,‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: westcoasttraveller11
Review: Great place to stay in New Delhi
Detailed Review: This hotel was recommended to my husband and I by friends, and we highly recommend it to others!  The rooms were clean, the staff were incredibly helpful, and the breakfasts that were included were filling and tasty.  Staying in the Pahar Ganj was a great way to experience Delhi, and Smyle go out of their way to make sure you have a great trip. We got tips on taxis, tuk tuks, the metro, and tourist sites from their travel desk.  The wifi and A/C worked really well and the rooms were very quiet.  It's a phenomenal value for money.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jon O
Detailed Review: Go here, it's the best introduction to Delhi you can find. Good staff that can help with anything. Currency exchange, breakfast, train booking : everything great!   Rooms are clean and nice. I couldn't believe how cheap it was too.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Mahmood F
Detailed Review: Well, I stayed there for 10 days, the staff were friendly and the room was also good. The only weak point I noticed, was travel desk, he was not supportive to book a train for us to Agra....he was emphasizing to hire a taxi rather than a train. It was a bit difficult to sleep a bit early, as people were talking/shouting in the street till 12:00 AM -:)

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: JahWarrior
Detailed Review: we are a couple and needed to stay in delhi for 4 nights.  the guest house have good location in the heart on main Bazaar in a small ally. the room was clean and the stuff is very nice and helpful.  overall we had a very good experience in this guest house.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Al-the-optimist
Detailed Review: When landing in Indira Gandhi airport, we asked the hostel to organise an airport pickup which they duly did. The hostel is situated in the middle of the extremely busy, main bazaar, but tucked away so the noise is fine in the evenings. The staff were extremely friendly, and we were greeted with a bottle of water on arrival, and shown to our room.   Breakfast in the mornings was an adequate start to the day, with a banana, muffin, and most mornings having hot sundries as well.  The travel agent of the hostel was also extremely helpful. While charging around 100 rupees commission on each train ticket (and not actually notifying us of this) it was still worthwhile and saved us a lot of faff further down the line.   We were also advised to pay for a chauffeur for one of the days‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Merry K
Review: Breeding flies and extreme chemical smell
Detailed Review: The hostel staff was great, check in was a little weird but it's India after all. Breakfast was fine especially since it was free... Pass on the coffee though. The tea is much more satisfying. The major problem I had with this place was the massive amount of flies and overwhelming chemical smell in the bathroom. It was unreal. It irritated my throat so badly I woke up all night both nights with a scratchy throat. The flies would have been fine if it were a few but they're definitely breeding in the bathroom and you had to lift the toilet seat before using the bathroom because there were always flies in the toilet. Inevitably there were a few in the dorm room as well. I hate to leave such a negative review but now I have a full on sore throat and I'm more than a little upset that‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: fleming1990
Detailed Review: If possible I think I probably would have given this place 3 and a half stars, but that's not possible so I'll round it up becuase they were helpful! Pretty good price, great location and very helpful staff/travel office. The only downside was the bed, which overall was pretty hard and the hot water, which you kept having to ask to be turned on. Also the street outside which isn't really their fault, absolutely stank.....But the hotel is trustworthy which means a lot when arranging further travel!

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Chantal L
Detailed Review: We stayed three nights.  We were very happy with our rooms. We had only reserved for two nights and we asked for one more night, but there was no availabilities.  The manager checked for us if there was any cancallaton and booked our second room in the hotel next door.  He really made sure we were satisfied. We also had a problem with the travelling agency of the hotel and the owner gave us back a part of our money.  It is a hotel where they really want you to have a great experience.  We would return next time in Delhi for sure !

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Yullover
Detailed Review: Got a room in the main, newly renovated building. Room without windows... sad for not having natural light, but good for sleeping long hours and without noise from the street. Bathroom was not really clean, has the water from the shower accumulated in a corner of the bathroom. Wifi was ok, slow but ok.  Breakfast was included, on the roof top of the other building. It was good, one day was continental and the next day was indian one. tasty,‚Ä¶
