Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Mike S
Detailed Review: Stayed at the Colonel's Retreat on two occasions during our recent visit to New Delhi. This is a very welcoming "homestay" and the host ensures that all guests are comfortable during their stay. The rooms are adequate and are set on three floors, each with their own lounge. Complimentary tea/coffee on arrival is accompanied by banana bread that is first class. There is a rooftop terrace that serves as a breakfast/dinner area. This is excellent to relax with a drink in early evening and, should you partake of the dinner menu, there are fire pits beside your table to keep the chill away. Breakfasts offer a wide range of options, ranging from juice, toast, fruit and coffee, to a variety of eggs and excellent Indian delicacies. Unfortunately for our nights stay we were allocated a‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Mimi A
Detailed Review: After a harried road trip (there seems to be no other kind in India) and good but rougher accommodations to go with our elephant sanctuary volunteer work, finding that our guide had booked us here was truly delightful. The area is quiet, but convenient to central Delhi attractions, the rooms and bathrooms spotless, and the full pots of select coffees (the real thing!) with breakfast most appreciated. Not fond of the citronella candles burning in the room when we arrived...cough, cough, but the owners are pleasant, helpful, and genteel.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: juliesW3561HI
Detailed Review: We stayed for 6 days at the end of Jan/Feb and settled in very quickly.  The staff are friendly and the owners offered us so much help and hospitality.  They are full of information about getting out and around in Delhi and advised us on visits to events and sights that, as tourists, we might not have known about.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Gls211
Detailed Review: We stayed here for 2 nights. The hotel is very comfortable and gives you a feeling of being at home. The breakfast is really good and you have a choice of coffee. The dinner on the roof top is great and home cooked.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: bananapancakess
Review: Excellent service, good location and great banana bread
Detailed Review: We loved staying at Colonel¬¥s retreat. The rooms are clean and nice. There is a small heater for the winter temperatures. You have to wait a little longer for the hot water, but you get used to it. I liked there mind set bout refilling water bottles, baking their own breads and cooking their marmalades.  The people are super nice and the ambience is open and cordial.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Amitabh Gupta
Review: Great location, high value for money
Detailed Review: In the heart of pahargang... about 10 mins from New Delhi metro station. This worked brilliant for us as out plan was Mum- Del (flight); Delhi airport- Pahargang (Metro); NDLS to Amritsar (train). Stayed for one night. Staff is nice, rooms small but great for the price.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: –°—Ç–∞–Ω–∏—Å–ª–∞–≤ –ë
Detailed Review: Frankly speaking, I didn't like New Delhi. But Ajanta hotel offered to us really calm and quiet island in the crazy city, full of rush and slums.  Also I would like to notice, that we didn't know almost any of the breakfast dishes. But all of them appeared delicious and it was very pleasant new experience. So, If you don't mind to live near New Delhi railway station and Main Bazaar, this hotel is very good solution.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Richard C
Detailed Review: A really nice place, with friendly staff. I had a taxi tour of the city, but to be honest I enjoyed my walks around the city more than being chaperoned around the place. The hotel restaurant is nice enough but I also ate at street food joints and roamed all over the city, which was easy as the hotel is in a central location. Rooms were clean. I recommend the local Indian breakfast cuisine at the hotel restaurant.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: pgtips26
Detailed Review: We stayed for one night at the end of our trip. The hotel served a purpose but I wouldn't choose to stay here again. The room wasn't great. It was very small and it wasn't overly clean. Food was ok but not great. It all felt a bit robotic and that the bare minimum was acceptable.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Edleise M
Detailed Review: The best of the hotel Ajanta is the location and the staff. It is in the heart of the New Delhi, where we can see the real indian life around us. There is a loto of restaurants and small stores, and we can feel the crazy everyday life. We loved India and his people.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: pbgmolly
Detailed Review: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights 17 to 20 February.  I found it clean and facilities good. Staff friendly and helpful.  Good English.  Also took tour for 5 days and it was good . Good bureau d change. Nice breakfast.   WiFi very poor . Good location,

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Karla P
Review: Trust worthy Hotel, Staff, & Travel company in India
Detailed Review: Ajanta is a clean and cozy place to stay (based on price and quality) and the staff was friendly. Breakfast was fine and dinner as well. The rooms are spacious. Excellent location and facilities superb hospitality & service had a wonderful stay and felt like home. Recommended for great stay in the Delhi, Food is another plus. The best 'aloo pranthas' and coffee or chai the staff is very accommodating. On arrived at Hotel Ajanta we were put in touch with Capital city Travels and Tours. Zahoor took us to his travel Office in Hotel. After asking us what we liked and wanted from our holiday, he began to make itinerary out ideas and places of interest. We had a driver for a couple of days in Delhi, then another 10 days around Rajasthan, a train ride to Delhi (as we wanted to‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Doron_J
Detailed Review: We spent four nights at the Ajanta hotel and warmly recommend it. The best about this hotel is the friendly stuff and great service you get. In previous years we stayed at another hotel in Paharganj (near the Main Bazaar street), where facilities were better but the service was poor and frustrating. This year we look for something else, picked the Ajanta and were very pleased. We stayed two nights after arriving to India. They provided the pickup from international airport which was on time. We got room 219 in the fourth floor. As other mentioned, this floor need some renovation. The room is very large, it includes a safe box and kettle. There is no light near the bed, although overall the room lighting is good. Hot water is good, although one need to waste a lot of water until‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sumita G
Detailed Review: I was looking for a good hotel for my mom and aunt . Many warned me about the paharganj area but in the end I decided to go ahead and book with this hotel. I had booked the suite room . The booking process was pretty smooth . They also offered complimentary breakfast and pick up / drop service from . Everything was organised as expected. Yes the area is crowded with many other hotels around but this property stood out of all attracting many tourists. The room was spacious with good amenities. The service was good . After a busy day we also decided to have dinner here and it was pretty good (especially the butter chicken) . The breakfast spread was also decent . I feel the south indian items need a bit of improvement. The checkout process was smooth as well .   Reaching this‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ramneek S
Detailed Review: When in come Delhi , I always stay in this hotel , hotel location is very good , everything is closer from hotel , rooms are net and clean staff is very god and cooperative , room size is big and price are not so much costly & so I advise you to pls stay in this hotel   Thanks, Ramneek singh.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: PriyaWadhwa
Detailed Review: We stayed there for a night, and were provided with a room on the highest floor. The rooms definitely were very old and needed an uplift.  The linen as well were not that great. The breakfast was good.  Wi Fi was hopeless. Decent stay but you might be able to find some better place. TIP : Ask for any rooms other that the top floor, they are better maintained.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: John S
Detailed Review: The service offered from teh moment of arraival to the poiint of departure was fantastic. The hotel arranged an airport collection and the driver was outside awaiting my arrival as promised. The check in was quick and efficient.  I was given a room on the top fllor which is in need of renovation and looks nothing like any of the photos on line or on the website. There was nothing to complain about it just looked tired.  I would recommend you go for the option to include an evening meal as teh food was fantastic and menat not having to venture out at night.  Very close to Delhi railway station if you have an onward journey.  Finally the hotel owns the coffee shop opposite which makes super coffee and has a great range of cakes.  Overall a very enjoyable experience.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Dan M
Detailed Review: After arriving a day late into India our plans had to change slightly.  Luckily Hotel Ajanta were very helpful.  They had arranged for a driver to meet us at the airport from arrival.  From there we stayed 2 nights, once in a suite and once in a standard double. I would recommend the standard double. More recently refurbished and better shower. Suite is a bit tatty and definitely not worth the extra money to upgrade. Called a suite based purely on size.   Zahoor helped arrange our tour of the golden triangle. We were very lucky to have Vijay as our driver. He was ace! Very accommodating and a really nice guy.   We had an amazing time on the trip. Thanks

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: H√•vard T
Detailed Review: Very comfortable hotel in the centre of New Delhi right next to railway station. We spent three nights here, and were also helped with arranging a trip around the golden triangle (Delhi - Jaipur - Agra), with good service all along the way (driver, guides, hotels). Also very reasonable price.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Kaitlyn V
Detailed Review: I was nervous to arrive in india alone and on my first day and I am so happy that I chose hotel ajanta as the first place to stay. The stay was extremely welcoming and kind. It has a very "homey" feel to it, the rooms are large and clean, and the food.. üò∂ AMAZING!!!!! My favorite part of my stay at ajanta was the people. They are funny, good-hearted and genuinely want you to be happy/feel good at all times. I look forward to returning again to Ajanta, it will be the only place I will stay in Delhi!!!

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: jigme2014
Detailed Review: The staff here are the life of this hotel. Location is fine; it is in a busy alley way however it does get very noisy. B/fast is good, facilities and amenities are basic, the free wifi is ok, however the 4 stars is all because of the people who work here. All of them are very sincere, polite and friendly. A lot of hotels (including the bigger ones) can and should learn from them on customer service. We also had complementary pick up from the airport which was great! (most hotels do not do this free of cost). If you are looking for big hotels, with numerous facilities and amenities hit the "back" button and keep looking but if you are here for the experience and to be taken care of by sincere and friendly people, look no further!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: MohammedAves
Detailed Review: This was my second visit at the hotel. Again a business trip in month of Feb. There were majority of similar faces in the staff. All the services were exactly same as it was earlier. I love their Banana Chocolate Pan Cake. There are simply no words to appreciate a staff, they are always helpful. Planning to visit again in the month of October with Family. Keep doing the amazing work.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Detailed Review: Amax inn is a absolutly fantastic place if you travel with a smaller budget! Nice food  and amazing staff! I recommend you to try the garlic vegetables noodles and the mango juice!   It took a while before I got used to the extreme traffic in Delhi but that is the only thing I thought was not as good as the rest of my experience!!   The rooms were much cleaner than I expected, even the shower was clean, which is very unusual for a indish hotel! Don't forget to keep your mouth closed while showering (especially if you are from europe and america) since the tapwater isn't drinkable.   The area is full of resturants and stores, bring a compass though cause it is a maze!! ;)  I strongly recommend you stay at this hotel! I had a fantastic experience!!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Petra E
Detailed Review: Very nice and helpful staff, tidy rooms and very good food on their roof restaurant, especially their breakfast. WiFi worked good and the hotel is very close to metro and train station. A good deal for any traveller who wants a valuable stay in Delhi!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Gowtham K
Detailed Review: helpful staffs. Rooms were clean and as shown in the photo. Rest rooms were ok. Food was delicious. We hired a cab through hotel for local sight seeing. Price was reasonable and driver showed us as many places as possible for a day trip...

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: drbhattacharyyaab
Detailed Review: would especially like to thank mr.milan pandey and manager mr.anil for making our stay in delhi such a good and pleasurable experince... right from the airport pick-up on time to the hotel servicing which was absolutely top-notch to assisting in planning our itinerary to our final drop-off at the airport...was absolutely great..would definitely like to stay put again on our next visit to delhi...also the rooms are quite neat and clean and definitely worth the cost..

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: EM_SM1234
Review: Arrived in India and been to Amax
Detailed Review: Good hotel, in Arakashan road. Dont trust all the strangers that will say the hotel is unsafe, not good, region is unsafe: it is old delhi, sure, but it is good! Good rooftop, good service - and they are not the people that will be selling you stuff at exhorbitant prices. Anil is a cool guy, and will be able to help you with your trip.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: ananya2017
Detailed Review: The hotel is located at a very short distance from Connaught place, one of the prime locales. The experience of staying here was amazing with the prompt and friendly staff always ready to help. It is pocket friendly and provides value for money. The rooms were neat and well maintained. They provided us with airport drop and pick up facilities as well as car service for our extended trip to Agra-Mathura-Vrindavan-Haridwar-Rishikesh at affordable charges. The manager, Mr. Anil and one of the staff members Mr. Milan Pandey were always prompt to help us deal with any confusions that we faced as tourists. The overall experience was great. A stay here is certainly recommended for everyone visiting Delhi to experience the best of hospitality and service.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Scott H
Detailed Review: The place is wonderful. From the cleanliness of the rooms, to how  quality the rooms actually  are comparatively to the other places around the amax. There's a solid restaurant as well.  Maybe the best part of it is the staff. Extremely personable, helpful, nice, and down to earth. They will go out of your way to help you in any way possible!  You'd be missing out to not stay here!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: wakarocksa
Review: Good place, a little pushy sometimes
Detailed Review: I stayed there with my girlfriend and we certainly enjoyed our time. The staff was friendly and attentive, but it felt pushy. For example they set up a cab ride to a restaurant for us and charged 250 rupees. On the ride home, we had a nicer newer cab and were only charged 100 rupees. The manager also tried to get us to review him with him sitting in front of us so he could read our review and edit it in real time. Things like that bothered me. The room its self is nice though. Some dirt and stains on the bed, but nothing too bad. Over all, I thought it was good, and I did appreciate the help they provided, just not the inflated price.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Barbara T
Review: Excellent hotel - very clean, meets European standards!
Detailed Review: We found this place by coincidence and spent altogether 8 days there. The room was very clean, staff very friendly and helpful and they dont mind if one brings his/her own food to eat to the very nice rooftop restaurant, where they serve as well delicious food. We are very happy that we found (after having stayed in several other dirty and unfriendly places) this cosy and clean hotel - and when we come back to Delhi we ll stay there for sure again! Thx to Mr Anil and his team for making our stay so pleasant!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Baktash J
Review: Excellent hotel (clean place, professional staff, and good food at reasonable price)
Detailed Review: Normally, I'm a critical person. I won't make comments without substantive knowledge. I have had couple of visits in India and have experience of staying in various hotels in different parts of the Delhi and few other states in India. I found this hotel, I would say by lucky chance or good coincidence. It's a great place to stay! Normally, in Delhi, it's so hard to find a clean, hygienic, reliable place at a reasonable price. I found this place so hygienic and clean. The food was also nice and with good variety. The important thing about food was that, its cost was around 20-35% cheaper than many other restaurants in this neighborhood. The mutton masala was my favorite there. The staff were so professional and friendly. You could ask for cleaning anytime during the day. The‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Josep F
Detailed Review: I am back again to my favorite place in Delhi. Its wonder place as i am regular visitor in Delhi. The Rooms are perfect clean and wellnaintained.  The roof top is best to exchange views with other guests afterlong day in Delhi traffic. No doubt to recommend to everyone who is looking perfect place.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: ViveckTewari
Review: If you are looking for value for money, i would highly recommend this place.
Detailed Review: I booked this hotel during my recent business trip to Delhi. I was looking for a cheap, centralise place but had my doubts about cleanliness as most of the hotels in the budget i was looking for doesn't pay much attention to Cleanliness specially the toilet. after booking i spoke to Mr. Anil, The owner of the place and he assured me I will have no issues. I landed on the day and met Mr. Anil, he asked me to first see the room and i was surprised to see the cleanliness of the bathroom. It was as good as any 3-4 star hotel toilet and room was also cozy, clean and as per my requirement. There was no view from the window but my priority was my business trip so i was ok with that. the staff was courteous and ready to help. The service was also prompt. I have seen in many hotels where‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Julian M
Detailed Review: The place this perfectly located to live a unique experience in India. The Attention and quality of people from the hotel is great. They are always aware any concern of huepedes. I recommend this place a lot.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ander S
Detailed Review: Amax inn is an hotel that you can go to without any kind of doubts. From my experience finding a  clean and relaxing hotel in the pahargang area is not an easy task. It took me a few years to find this one, and ever since i did it i go every year. The owner anil is super  nice and helpfull. the rest of the staff has up and downs, like we all do ... i guess this is quite normal.i hope this is helpfull for you. Have a nice trip around india.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sakel A
Detailed Review: . ‚ÄúStay Here!‚Äù its just awesome for their services. staffs arre quite friendly... wifi, food, an amazing roood decoration.  We stayed 4 nights at this hotel and had a great experience. What I found unique is that they are set up to accommodate both traveling families and also couples wanting a quiet stay. For example, they have a outstanding . On the other hand, for adults only, there is a heated rooftop pool with a view which was perfect for us. Breakfast and dinner buffets were very good, having options for children and adults in both western and Indian cuisines. As a couple, we were able to enjoy a relaxing stay along with many families that were also enjoying themselves. The staff was very professional and helpful. We requested a room on a quieter/higher floor and they‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: javed a
Detailed Review: After reach in india, than I was trying to get a dreamy hotel,after long time searching I get valuable one.this is hotel amax inn which is in arakashan road little  far from new delhi station.this hotel provides delightfull pasties service, hotel people are really careful about duty.everything in this hotel are out of hypocrite..estimating  clean fresh & cheap this is better than other hotel.love like sweet my room... there is available way of tiket confirm, even some people are known bangla, so comes this place for lovely day spending & this hotel makes sure ur journey amazing...

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Klaud K
Detailed Review: Its my 2nd visit toDelhi. I find  Amax  inn is the best choice. The staff is friendy and well behaved.  All the  amenities  working perfectly.  The roof top is Great place to share with our clients,  As i had travelled in many cities i found this is perfect  value  for  money,  Definitely  Recommend.

Name: Klaud K

The roof top is Great place to share with our clients,  As i had travelled in many cities i found this is perfect  value  for  money,  Definitely  Recommend.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sarah G
Detailed Review: Sunset view from the rooftop is amazing! The rooftop is a really nice place to chill out with other travelers, with nice seating and tables. The rooms and beds are comfortable, you receive a locker and everything is nice and clean! Breakfast is included with stay and its freshly made every morning. Dinner can also be purchased at a reasonable price- homemade delicious dinners. The staff is helpful and some of my favorite people ever... and its an awesome place with positive energy brining together groups of travelers all the time!

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jamie M
Detailed Review: Jugaad is a great little hostel high up away from the chaos of Delhi. The rooms are clean and tidy and the staff are very kind and knowledgeable. I can't recommend this place enough to anyone who wants a little peace and quiet away from the city madness.,

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Lavananda
Review: Chill homelike spot in the city
Detailed Review: Great place to stay when in Delhi! Staff is great and place is clean. The breakfast and other meals available are great too. Nice place to meet people and have a good and meaningful time. I hope to see you all again one day!

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Gabrielle F
Detailed Review: Overall really pleasant stay‚Äî great vibes, friendly team and nice chilled out atmosphere. Very accommodating in ensuring I had an easy time navigating the city and had recommendations on good neighborhoods and sights to explore. Wish I'd had more time in India to join one of the longer trips outside of Delhi. Next time! Modern/comfortable set up in dorm rooms and nice common areas for socializing or catching up on wi-fi time.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Gijs d
Detailed Review: Such an awesome place with awesome staff! Clean rooms and facilities with a good free breakfast. Located in a calmer part of the city but within easy reach of a metro line. Highly reccomend this place.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sunny R
Review: Wonderful place to stay for backpackers
Detailed Review: This is a little away in a market area from Greenpark Metro. Don't get fooled by the surroundings, the establishment is just awesome. Run by a few enthusiastic people, the dorm type accommodation is wonderful, with an attached bath. The common room is fun and the people are fun too. They serve breakfast in the morning. It is not much, but simple Indian breakfast (they have a weekly menu). I'd highly recommend this place to everyone from every country, especially for backpackers.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Liz
Review: Amazing place with great atmosphere and facilities
Detailed Review: I loved my time at Jugaad Hostels! The facilities are modern, clean, spacious and overall great. Common kitchen was clean, free drinking water, and great free breakfast in the morning. Before all I really enjoyed the atmosphere, it is a great place for solo travelers, easy to meet other backpackers. Also the staff went above and beyond for their guests (I was not feeling well and they made sure I really had everything I needed). We spend great evenings chilling on the rooftop and having great conversations.  The area the hostel is in is really nice, with everything you need in walking distance (shops, ATMs, restaurants, etc).  Would definitely recommend this place!

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: B√°rbara F
Detailed Review: Juggad is the best hostel I have ever stayed in. I would definitely recommend this hostel for a cheap and cozy stay in Delhi! Helpful and friendly staff! Thanks for an amazing stay! I've met so many interesting people and gained a lot of experience ;)

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Kasia W
Detailed Review: Amazing place! Very cosy, with its own climate, clean and comfy. The Staff is very helpful and friendly! And the Owner is a great person to hang out with. There is a very interesting offer of day or more trips or various proposals how to spend time in Delhi.  We enjoyed staying there a lot, hanging out on the rooftop in the evening, meeting very interesting individuals and having a great time.  And the location is perfect - New Delhi, very close to many key points. Big Thank You to Jugaad and looking forward to coming back!

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Tomo C
Detailed Review: Jugaad staff is most prominent impression during my stay. Culture of the hostel is amazing. Unfortunately didn't have opportunity to stay longer. If you want to explore India hostel can serve you as a great base, where you can rest between trips.  Best of luck, guys!

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Tjtommy
Detailed Review: First night it Delhi was a pleasure staying at Jugaad. All the staff and owner were so eager to help and make our stay the best it could be. Great local knowledge and great advice for our next stops. Stayed in the private bedroom. Great night sleep and welcome hot shower. Good base for exploring away from the hustle and bustle.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Julia P
Detailed Review: I could tell this place was going to be great when I received a very detailed email before I arrived about how to get to the hostel without hassle, and all the things I might want to know about the hostel. I stayed in the all female dorm which was very clean and comfortable. The staff went out of their way when I had a question on how to get around to make sure I had an enjoyable time and avoided any scams that unknowing tourists might fall prey to.   They provide a nice home cooked breakfast in the morning and have a secure door so that only residents can enter the hostel.   As a solo traveler who can be introverted I did feel this hostel had a more open atmosphere geared toward extroverts with everyone hanging out together on the roof at night, but if you need alone time, you‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: nishanth_fox
Review: A no-nonsense budget accomodation in paharganj..
Detailed Review: I love winters in Delhi, but when you come to a new city and you don't have a room or a bed to sleep in for the night, this place does the job for me. Keep in mind it's a budget accommodation, they provide all the basic essentials, including a small breakfast to start the day with, definitely good value for your money. Metro station is just a couple of minutes walk away from your room, that's a big bonus for budget travellers..

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Meri_Ajla
Detailed Review: In the middle of old delhi this place is like and island. You feel safe and the personnel helps you with all your questions and organizes trips or drivers for a good price. Definitly a good choice and worth the price.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Hanneke300
Detailed Review: The hotel is just off the busy shopping road. It has several nice clean rooms. Smyle Inn has very friendly and helpful staff. We stayed in two rooms, some rooms are a bit bigger. Smyle Inn also has a roof top where you can have breakfast.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: rooseM3
Detailed Review: It was a nice place but the guys took absolutely forever to check us in and it was extremely difficult to get a straight answer from the front desk guy.   Rooms were very basic but clean, and the steps felt never ending. We were on the top floor and it was a lot.   Breakfast is extremely basic and busy. Even though it is included it was super busy and I always skipped it.   I give it an Indian 4 stars but anywhere else it would have been 3.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jen B
Detailed Review: The overall location of the hostel is great, it is right off the Main Bazaar so you can walk out and be right in the midst of the market.  You do, however, have to walk down a small alley off the main road, which can be hard to find if you don't know where you are going.  Also, there is an open air urinal (common in Delhi) right at the entrance to the alley, so the smell is quite bad.      The hostel itself is quite good, rooms were clean and comfortable, some of the best I experienced in India.  We stayed in a Family Superior room, in the main building, there were 2 large double beds which was perfect for my family of 4.  The included breakfast was quite good, served at the secondary building on the rooftop.  Never had an issue with hot water.     The staff were fantastic, they‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: PBK43
Detailed Review: The hotel is in good location near to new delhi stn and near Ramkrishna mission ashram. The superior hotel room was clean. Breakfast was good but that is less and limited option. Except a few servicemen all were good and polite.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: OnAir596985
Detailed Review: This is by far the worst accomodation i have ever stayed in. On the first night when we arrived they had overbooked the superior rooms that we requested so two of my friends had to stay in an alternate room despite earlier bookings. The superior room we booked had the smallest bathroom i have ever seen, i am 6ft 1 (average height) and my legs banged against the wall when i sat on the toilet. The shower pressure was awful and the water was cold. The service from the travel desk was a huge scam, as they attempted to overcharge us by nearly 1000 rupees per person for same day tours offered by the travel agent down the road. Furthermore it was disgusting coming in late at night to find workers asleep on the floor of the reception (this is not what a 24/7 reception is). On one‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: vonnystella
Detailed Review: I only stayed for one night when I had to transit in Delhi before flying back to my country. The location is perfect, just 10 mins walking from NDLS (New Delhi Railway Station) and about 30 mins walk to Connaught Place. The room is small but clean, staffs are helpful, excellent value for money!

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: nishanth_fox
Detailed Review: I love winters in Delhi, but when you come to a new city and you don't have a room or a bed to sleep in for the night, this place does the job for me. Keep in mind it's a budget accommodation, they provide all the basic essentials, including a small breakfast to start the day with, definitely good value for your money. Metro station is just a couple of minutes walk away from your room, that's a big bonus for budget travellers..

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Meri_Ajla
Review: They were very kind and helpful with us
Detailed Review: In the middle of old delhi this place is like and island. You feel safe and the personnel helps you with all your questions and organizes trips or drivers for a good price. Definitly a good choice and worth the price.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Hanneke300
Review: Clean budget rooms.. area is bit of letdown
Detailed Review: The hotel is just off the busy shopping road. It has several nice clean rooms. Smyle Inn has very friendly and helpful staff. We stayed in two rooms, some rooms are a bit bigger. Smyle Inn also has a roof top where you can have breakfast.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: rooseM3
Detailed Review: It was a nice place but the guys took absolutely forever to check us in and it was extremely difficult to get a straight answer from the front desk guy.   Rooms were very basic but clean, and the steps felt never ending. We were on the top floor and it was a lot.   Breakfast is extremely basic and busy. Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: vonnystella
Detailed Review: I only stayed for one night when I had to transit in Delhi before flying back to my country. The location is perfect, just 10 mins walking from NDLS (New Delhi Railway Station) and about 30 mins walk to Connaught Place. The room is small but clean, staffs are helpful, excellent value for money!

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Wallytravel1950
Detailed Review: I stayed here for 3 nights, Jan 27 -29, 2017.  It was a great place to stay.  Good location, close to shopping and a lovely park.  The room was very comfortable and clean.  I loved the dining room and it gave me opportunity to meet some other travellers.  When I arrived I was given tea and their famous (and delicious) banana cake.  The people were very good, taking good care, friendly and yet not always hovering,  Highly recommend this as a good place to stay in Delhi.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Rolf O
Detailed Review: It was like home! they akes you if you would like to have dinner at the hotel. And if you say yes you get a verygood meal for a not to expensive price.  We aresure wecome back again.  Public transport (metro) is not to far away

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: kingmonk
Detailed Review: We stayed for 1 night at the Colonel's retreat at the start of our 3 week Indian adventure. What a wonderful introduction to India following our long haul flight. Greeted with banana bread and coffee taken in one of the many cosy sitting rooms dotted around the property. The room was spotlessly clean and with all the facilities you would expect. It was chilly in Delhi during our stay so the room heater was very welcome. Beds were comfortable and environment peaceful and quiet away from the clamour of Delhi The service was attentive and welcoming.  The dinner we had on the terrace on our first night in India was probably the best we had during our trip . Fairy lights, good wine , and a fire pit enhanced the experience.We craved the banana bread and home made bread for the rest of‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: katerinephillips
Review: What made my stay an unhappy experience.
Detailed Review: Staff is kind but scarce :upon arrival late at night,it took me several minutes to find a staff member to show me to the room.  Room was good,bed was comfortable. However,in years of travel,I have never seen this: a tiny,used bar of soap was in the bathroom!!! So this facility recycles soap.....yuk. The next unpleasant experience came at breakfast: Bread close to sandpaper in texture and taste. Fresh fruit: a tiny banana! I went to the Defense Colony market and bought fruit and bread  which I had every morning while I was there. Upon departure, I found out that Amex was not accepted for payment. This being a business expense I offered that my local partner settle the bill. When she checked the bill ,she found charges which were not accurate. She presented this to the accounts‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sophie N
Detailed Review: After long flight we arrived at Colonel's Retreat very late in the evening. The staff were very welcoming and helpful on arrival. The owners were very knowledgeable and were available to assist with any questions.  Breakfast was very good and the banana bread was delicious. Location was short walk to good restaurants and bars.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: auntieshaz21
Review: I which we had been staying longer here.
Detailed Review: We arrived in the early hours of the morning and there was a warm and friendly welcome awaiting us. Paperwork etc. was left until the following morning. Our room was clean, good size and comfortable.  Great breakfast including the famous banana bread - yummy! Don't waste your time looking for a place to eat in the evening, stay in and enjoy their delicious cooking - Good value for money. The red wine wasn't bad either.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: katie d
Detailed Review: We arrived here after a long haul flight from the UK. We had a lovely welcome and offered tea and delicious banana bread.  The room was simple but very clean, running hot water and complimentary drinking water. Good wifi.   The evening meal was also delicious with incredibly generous portions and the breakfast was one of the best we had in India.   Very friendly and hospitable staff.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Hellis248
Review: Lovely little guest house in a quiet location
Detailed Review: Arrived very tired but a warm welcome and a lovely room to rest in. The proprietor was very helpful and the staff attentive but discreet. Thank you to all the staff for making our first ever 2 days in India so memorable.  The evening meals taken in the rooftop restaurant were a real bonus. If travelling in January, take warm clothes, although they provided fire braziers.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: ldale330
Detailed Review: Stayed here whilst on route to Sri Lanka. Hotel very clean and the hosts were lovely. It was really peaceful (yes you can give a bit of quiet in Deli).  Really lovely breakfast and comfy bed. Quite a long way from airport.  Would happily stay here again.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Daltonian
Review: Boutique hotel in a leafy part of Delhi
Detailed Review: This place is a gem. Great food and rooftop restaurant with open fire braziers to to take the chill off if cold. Helpful owners and excellent breakfast with rooms at a high standard. Would definitely recommend!

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: cracknell_lynne
Detailed Review: Really nice modestly priced hotel with airport pickup. The staff were friendly and helpful, there is a good restaurant in the building, my room was clean, there was free wifi, what else could you ask for at the price?

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: SACHINPARMAAR
Detailed Review: This is a better hotel in the New Delhi Railway Station vicinity in Paharganj area. The reception staff is courteous, though the hotel was running almost full, they showed us 3-4 rooms to select and quickly accommodated us. Rooms are not that spacious but comfortable. Seems to be a old building but is renovated and maintained well. About 10 mins far away from the Railway Station & 30 mins to the Airport. Food at the restaurant was good enough. The room had a mini bar too. Soap & towel and no other toiletries will be provided.A cab was quickly provided in the morning to airport that was inclusive of the room rent. All in all an economical & better hotel to spend a night & not bad at all.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Amanda D
Review: Not the best place in the area for that price
Detailed Review: We decided to stay at Ajanta considering the reviews, but our experience wasn't as good as we could expect. The hotel is placed in a really busy and noisy street from 6am to midnight. The rooms need to be restored as the furniture starts to be really old. Is not as clean as you could expect for a hotel of this category and the shower didn't work so you need to take a shower with a set of buckets that where already there (so we assumed they knew the issue). Internet didn't work most of our stay. When we asked about that issue we were told that it was for security reasons, apparently the government blocked the internet access due to the celebrations of the Republic Day.... Well, only Hotel Ajanta was "blocked" because the coffee shop next door had internet. The rooftop terrace is‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: massimo g
Review: Restaurant at Ajanta, very good and very reasonable prices
Detailed Review: We only tried the restaurant. It has a great variety of food but it's better to go for indian one. We had almost all dishes from tandoori, paneer, breads, anything and they all were delicious. Better avoid chinese dishes as they are not properly done. Price very low compared to quality and portions.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: DGB
Detailed Review: Everything about the hotel  is excellent .. the front  desk is really helpful.breakfast is good .dahi ka kebab were mouth watering .the rooms were clean ..add sm more things in the mini bar. Will surely visit the place again .

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: WilsonAus
Detailed Review: Great value for money. Big size rooms. Good bathroom, hot water. Delicious breakfast. Lovely, attentive staff. Really good location. Hotel not noisy. Clean, tidy. Good wifi. English tv. Wonderful stay, well worth the stay!

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Rebecca M
Detailed Review: The hotel staff are very friendly and the restaurant serves good food too, especially the decent buffet breakfast. Comfy beds and nice room. Can be a bit loud outside the room at night and location didn't feel the best. All in all not too bad a stay.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Danfromaustralia
Detailed Review: This hotel is quirky and unique. The bed is comfortable , the staff great and the restaurant was really good . Prices are reasonable and staff are happy to get your laundry sorted inexpensively. All great value.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: gpk27
Detailed Review: Hotel Ajanta is a great hotel, clean and cosy rooms with enough space and a nice interior. Big compliments to the very helpfull and kind staff, we had to go back home because of an emergency, the staff took very good care of us. Even when we checked out they gave us a room for a couple of hours to clean up and arranged our transfer to the AirPort. The tourist office Capital City provides information and good tours to Agra and Rajastan for example, this also very reccomendable. If we ever come back we will definitely stay here again.  Enjoy your stay at Ajanta ;-) Gaytrie & Suraj

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: siddarth h
Detailed Review: i liked the hotel mainly because of the heritage look rooms..very clean..but few suggestions i don lik to make it out here..i hav informd the hotel.. but family would hav a pleasent stay.. helpful staffs

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Maria Laura S
Review: Excellent rooms and the best breakfast in Delhi. Very helpful staff
Detailed Review: I arrived at Ajanta hotel looking for new acommodation, as the one I had arranged from Cape Town, south africa was not satisfactory. Ms Gunjan was at the reception desk and I was impressed by her professionalism. I also liked the impecable presentation of staff and beautiful reception area.  Ajanta hotel  offers excellent value for money. Close to the railway station and important tourist destinations within Delhi. The rooms are excellent and the breakfast absolutely the best.  The staff at reception and the rest of the staff were extremelly polite and kind,  Ms Gunjan and Mr Rohit especially. The manager, Mr Rashid organised a wonderful tour for me and thanks to him I had a memorable and maginificent trip around rajastan.  I strongly recommend this hotel and will certainly come‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: 207umarb
Detailed Review: A good place to stay in vid family at this place hotel staff is very cooperative n helpful the most good thing is dt it's location is in centre of delhi wherever uh ve to go it's quite convenient from hotel morng buffet is pretty good jus loved the moments which I spend at this place

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: jatin s
Detailed Review: I stayed with my wife for one night. We were earlier given a room at fourth floor. Some renovations are going on at that floor and the room was stinking due to some whitewash. On our request, we were given same category room at second floor which was much better than the earlier room. Staff was helpful and acceded to our every request. Food was awesome (especially the Thali). If you are staying at this hotel then there is no need to visit any other restaurant for the food. It was nice and hassle free stay. Would love to visit again.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: gghti5321
Review: Helpful lovely Never forgettable staff & Clean Rooms
Detailed Review: Especially consideration of the less price of the rooms if I count the facilities they provide and The staff at the hotel more helpful then they must be! They exceeded all of my expectations, I had few special requests and they met all of my needs. Rooms are clean, beautiful and the area is safe,  was a very important thing I saw. I will definitely be staying at this hotel whenever I come back to Delhi.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Shashank S
Detailed Review: The best thing about this hotel is that despite being in paharganj it is  too far from the shady and conjested areas and is nearest to connaught circle... excellent receptionists good and tasty food and good hospitality... the rooms n bathrooms are very much spacious and beautiful.. neat n clean.. a better place to stay when u r in delhi .. thats all ,thank you.. !!

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Dana G
Review: Helpful staff, safe, and lovely rooms
Detailed Review: The staff at the hotel couldn't have been more helpful! They exceeded all of my expectations, especially considering the low price of the rooms. I had a few special requests and they eagerly met all of my needs. The rooms are beautiful and the area is safe, which, has a female traveling alone, was very important to me. I will definitely be staying at this hotel whenever I travel to Delhi.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Manish B
Detailed Review: I was have 1 nite stay in this hotel . Hotel was very gud it was clean and the room was awesome I just luv to stay it was gud  Well maintained. Staff and it was near from New Delhi station breakfast was much btter than other hotels ....

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Max B
Detailed Review: We spend a very nice moment at the ajanta H√¥tel. The rooms are nice and spacious, some of them have terrasses with a large view on Delhi. The staff have been realy kind and helpful with us. They help us to get a indian telephone number (one of them came with us to the sim cards shop) and they advice us on our train tickets. They also let us use the hotel's computer to book our flight. They are always available to facilitate your trip in Dheli. The ajanta is Well located. I stongly recommand this h√¥tel.  Mathilde and Maxime.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Andrew M
Detailed Review: I arrived at the airport about an hour and a half late and met with the driver that this hotel sent for me. On our drive back, he complained about 4 or 5 times that  he had waited 3 hours for me, even though I had sent the flight number so he could check the status. A couple times after complaining he said "but don't worry, it's not your fault". Well if you are repeatedly complaining about it then you're making me feel like it IS my fault.  Finally, after a long ride, we reached the hotel and he walked me up to the front desk at about 10pm. The guys at the front desk told me that a big group had come in and now their hotel was fully booked but not to worry because they already set me up at another hotel for the same price. I booked this hotel a week in advance and had been‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: AzaddazA
Detailed Review: Our stay with Anil was great! It was our first night in India and it couldn't have gone more smoothly. Even though we arrived after midnight we were greeted and shown to our room without a hiccup.  We were also incredibly impressed with the genuine and honest help from the staff. They ensured that we were able to shop and book travel without being ripped off by the cities many touts. They really couldn't have been more helpful.   Please remember that staying close to the hustle and bustle of Delhi means that you will hear some noise from the busy streets, but for the value and convenience that we experienced it was well worth while!  Finally, make sure that you enjoy a meal and some tea on the rooftop! The food is amazing and in a way that little blue space is strangely serene. ‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: manita s
Review: Hotel AmaxInn is Great place to stay
Detailed Review: I dont know from where should I start the qualities are 1000 plus. Let's start with the safety point of view Best female security you can have. Hotel staff are very cool and they agree on every note of yours Cleaning point of view every day cleaning very clean washroom and rooms. Big rooms with all amenities like WiFi Ro water purifier lift hotel staff is very cool they welcome you like god. Very very special thanks to hotel staff and there the owner anil for these guidance while traveling delhi and near by cities like Agra and Chandigarh. Thanks a ton and keep doing good work. All the best to hotel staff and owner.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Boni L
Detailed Review: Hotel Amax Inn is the perfect hotel for a city break, approximately 05 minutes from New Delhi Railway station.It is located in a quiet street away from the crowds but close enough to be part of it. A continental breakfast, selection of cereals, (with the best Veg and non veg food ) sets you up for the day. Conveniently located in walking distance to the New Delhi railway station, along with other historic sites. The rooms are clean and well appointed, with comfortable beds, daily cleaning service, plus the TV has satellite channels and a high speed wifi facility.The staff are freindly, service orientated and multi-lingual and can arrange excursions for you.There are great local restaurants minutes away on the roof top of hotel. A very Special thanks to Anil Ji kuldeep Ji Milan‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Rayhan A
Detailed Review: The rooms are nice and comfy. The staffs are also very helpful and easy to reach. Price is way more reasonable. Overall, great deal if you're visiting Delhi and looking for a place to stay. It's near the metro station too which is helpful if you want to move around the city easily.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Faysal A
Detailed Review: Well this is one of the best hotels I've ever visited.The room service is so decent.The behaviour of the stuffs are very kind and decent.I'd like to visit this again tbh. Hands down.And milan da the hotel manager everyone is cool and helpful.They even can book tickets for you.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: SHA E
Detailed Review: The  most  famous hotel in delhi .three time I'm  came  here Good relationship and comfortable Rooms and very good service . always  donig somethings  new for their  customers.  these  days  they are  working  for a new closed restaurant. maay be next  time we can use that.  thanks for taking  care  of me and my friends.  will see you  soon guys

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: ALI H
Detailed Review: I am staying  in  this hotel from last three years.  Me and my other  friends  always come to this  place, feel home away  from  home.  Good  services, clean bathrooms, and very good  food on rooftop restaurant.  Reception  people  very helpful, and always  ready  for your needs.  I recommend  this  hotel.  Will come again Thanks Amax team

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Cyril
Detailed Review: We with my wife are staying in Amax Inn every time we are in Delhi, and this is at least 2-3 times a year. I is always a pleasure to start or end any trip with the hospitality and service quality of the Amax Inn. In India it is not an easy to find really good place and good honest people, while Amax Inn and their staff are the ones. You will find here everything you might need after long flight or night train. But what I like this place for the most is their constant improving - every time I came I have found some new nice advance: few years ago that were renovation in rooms and Wifi extended to all floors, ACs included into all rooms, then it was a refrigerator inside the room, this time it was a coffee table with needed facility, next time, as we've seen' it will be new‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: setheriault
Detailed Review: Great service from Anil and everyone at Amax inn. Everyone was so helpful: before our arrival and during out stay. They helped us planned out entire itinerary in India as we only had two weeks and wanted to see as much possible. We got an amazing price for 2 weeks with a private driver who was so nice and helpful. We were two girls traveling and we always felt very safe. I recommend this place as  first stop in India to everyone!! Thanks again Amax Inn!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sophie A
Detailed Review: This was our first time in India, Amax Inn organized the trip for us and made sure we maximized our 2 weeks. We had a driver for most of it, very nice and knowledgable. He was accommodating, brought us where we wanted to go. Great and friendly service in the hotel. The rooms are comfortable and clean.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: LiamC1986
Review: Excellent base hotel in New Delhi
Detailed Review: In a nutshell, this place provided everything we needed and more. Not the best looking from outside but the staff were brilliant, very helpful. We stayed for 2 nights, food was amazing and we booked a driver through the hotel to take us to Agra ( Taj Mahal) and on to Jaipur. They also secured flights down to Goa which was a huge help.   The terrace on the roof provides welcome relief from the busy street below.   If you are a light sleeper, Delhi is not for you, or if your not fond of crowds... but the rewards of seeing such an amazing place is worth a few noises at night. I was recommended this hotel and I would do the same again to my friends and family.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: orangecake78
Detailed Review: It was great time here. Nice people, clean, cheap an very good food.  They organised also a 10-days-trip incl car for four days, driver, 4 nights in nice hotels, 2 x Train, one flight from Varanasi to Delhi for 2 People for only ‚Ç¨550 together.   Thank you all.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Rose Marine
Detailed Review: You should be careful choosing a hotel in Paharganj area, most are not clean and robbery can happen but in this hotel you will feel save and like in family. I'm coming every time only to Amax Inn for already 5 years, more than 10 times in total - it's always comfortable and nice staying, very friendly and helpful staff became my Delhi family. Every year they improve and add something new for guests comfort. It has wifi on all floors, restaurant and room service, refrigerator and coffee table in the room, air-conditioning in all rooms, comfortable beds and very clean bathrooms!!! New Delhi railway and metro is in walking distance so if you need budget but very good stay in Delhi- the best option is Amax inn. Thank you and see you again soon! Shanti

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ritesh f
Detailed Review: If one wants "THE" place in Delhi, Amax is one! Very hospitable and friendly owners with solution oriented mindset. Staff is excellent, professional  with ready-to-service attitude!! I would highly recommend for long stay!! "Home" in a hotel:-)!!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Christian N
Detailed Review: Our stay at the Amax Inn was perfect for starting our India Adventure!  The hardest part was to get to the place because there are so many people outside who are telling lies! Just don't trust them and take a taxi, telling the driver the exact address. The people at Amax Inn were the most trustworthy people we met in our first 3 days in Delhi/India. They even help you with getting sim cards and changing money to good rates!

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Andrew M
Detailed Review: I arrived at the airport about an hour and a half late and met with the driver that this hotel sent for me. On our drive back, he complained about 4 or 5 times that  he had waited 3 hours for me, even though I had sent the flight number so he could check the status. A couple times after complaining he said "but don't worry, it's not your fault". Well if you are repeatedly complaining about it then you're making me feel like it IS my fault.  Finally, after a long ride, we reached the hotel and he walked me up to the front desk at about 10pm. The guys at the front desk told me that a big group had come in and now their hotel was fully booked but not to worry because they already set me up at another hotel for the same price. I booked this hotel a week in advance and had been‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: AzaddazA
Detailed Review: Our stay with Anil was great! It was our first night in India and it couldn't have gone more smoothly. Even though we arrived after midnight we were greeted and shown to our room without a hiccup.  We were also incredibly impressed with the genuine and honest help from the staff. They ensured that we were able to shop and book travel without being ripped off by the cities many touts. They really couldn't have been more helpful.   Please remember that staying close to the hustle and bustle of Delhi means that you will hear some noise from the busy streets, but for the value and convenience that we experienced it was well worth while!  Finally, make sure that you enjoy a meal and some tea on the rooftop! The food is amazing and in a way that little blue space is strangely serene. ‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: manita s
Review: Hotel AmaxInn is Great place to stay
Detailed Review: I dont know from where should I start the qualities are 1000 plus. Let's start with the safety point of view Best female security you can have. Hotel staff are very cool and they agree on every note of yours Cleaning point of view every day cleaning very clean washroom and rooms. Big rooms with all amenities like WiFi Ro water purifier lift hotel staff is very cool they welcome you like god. Very very special thanks to hotel staff and there the owner anil for these guidance while traveling delhi and near by cities like Agra and Chandigarh. Thanks a ton and keep doing good work. All the best to hotel staff and owner.

Just don't trust them and take a taxi, telling the driver the exact address. The people at Amax Inn were the most trustworthy people we met in our first 3 days in Delhi/India. They even help you with getting sim cards and changing money to good rates!

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Joly_Anne
Detailed Review: I went to Jugaad Hostel 3 times during my 3 months journey in India. It was the perfect base. The place is clean, the vibe is great and they have an amazing roof top to hang out. It's possible to do your own laundry, hang it outside and it's also possible to store extra luggage while travelling to India (for exemple, my trekking gear). Internet is not very consistent but I've always managed to get my things done. The staff is friendly and the place is safe. I had a great time at Jugaad Hostel.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: pranaytheja
Detailed Review: I had a really amazing time staying at Jugaad Hostel, Delhi. The ambience at the hostel was very good and it was very nice and clean. The beds were really comfortable to sleep in and tuck yourself in especially in these chilly winters at Delhi. The most wonderful part were the free breakfast served at hostel. It was delicious.Kudos to the cook who makes amazing Dishes, esp the Paranthas. I made real good friends at the hostel. and it is very near to almost any place anyone wants to go, be it metro, Hauz Khas Village or anything, and thanks to Wasim who accompanied all these days and entertained us with his charisma. I would definitely love to visit the hostel again.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: olgipi
Detailed Review: Stayed there for few days in December an January. Despite Delhi winter cold there was always someone to offer you Ginger Lemon Honey ! Everyone from staff to guests was friendly and chatty. Location itself is great- close to airport and not far from Hauz Khas village where there's a tiny market with really nice bars and restaurants !!   Recommended to anyone, Olga

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Matthew B
Review: A good base for a trip to Delhi
Detailed Review: Before we arrived in Delhi the staff at the hostel were very responsive to our messages and helped us arrange a pick up at the airport. We were warned beforehand of various airport scams but to be honest we had no trouble at all and no one even approached us as we exited the terminal.  When we arrived at the hostel we received a friendly greeting and someone came down to meet the taxi as it arrived. We booked a tour of Delhi through the guys at the front desk which was great as we only had a day to explore Delhi before moving on.    Breakfast at the hostel was great as was dinner which was very reasonably priced at 150INR. The hostel was also very clean and safe given the locked front gate and 24 hour reception. The outside terrace is also really cool and if it was a bit warmer‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Kane
Detailed Review: Like a second home when I was in Delhi for over 2 weeks. Great guys, amazing memories and the best hostel in India!   This place was really the highlight of trip, met so many people and had an amazing time exploring Delhi.  The Market is just outside and you're able to pick up lots of fresh fruit and vegetables to make some tasty food at anytime.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Alex S
Detailed Review: *Cleanliness/Safety*   Yes! Secure gate manned 24/7 restricted to guests only. Hostel was in great shape and common areas were designed for comfort.   *Staff*  Wow. These guys really make you feel part of the family. It was a great reminder how much fun hostels are because the people are just so good to you - even if you are a decade older than everyone!   *Accessibility*   Not the easiest to get to, but once you get there the first time, you're all set. Actually in a very cool neighborhood and the staff do a good job of providing detailed instructions prior to your arrival.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: sharifkk87
Review: Great stuff, Hotel Manager Did great hospitality,
Detailed Review: Clean rooms, my arrival was 7am at the hotel, I got my rooms 9 that is great, normally check it 12 o clock, but I got soon,   We got SIM card, & the manager did the activation ,i have booked 3 rooms  for 3 nights, after one night I should leave the Hotel because of my Mom operation I should book room next to hospital, after one night I ask the Manager we should check out,because of my mom she is ziek she admitted to hospital,  then I ask the mnager I should pay the  penalty because I booked online in its not possible tge cancellation  price is 6000 INR,  He is No no problem You can pay for one , üòÄ

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Tony B
Detailed Review: The best accomodation of our whole trip, very clean and great service. Breakfast was great and the showers were good pressure with consistent hot water!! The best part however was the travel desk helping us plan the rest of our trip in India, I can't explain how helpful this was. We were able to book train tickets, flights, along with city tours around Delhi, and with being given great directions to catch the metro. Will definitely stay at the Smyle Inn again! Thank you :)

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Diane F
Review: Staff is wonderful - great customer service
Detailed Review: This is a very humble place, but clean, friendly, and right in the middle of the main bazaar. The staff were super helpful with everything. Great if you are on a budget, and want something authentic, and wonderful customer service.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: michaelleader2017
Detailed Review: This was the second time at Smyle Inn. I travelled with 24 other people. Check in was late at night but very smooth. We booked tours with them around Delhi and the Taj Mahal. Both were excellent and we had our own minibuses. The breakfasts were good and the rooms clean. The plumbing was also great (a problem often in India).  Don't be put off by the scary looking entrance - it's a great place just off one of the busiest market streets. Harish was very helpful, as was his team. And the pricing is perfect for budget travellers who aren't wanting $2 rooms but don't want $200 luxury either.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Terry2004_11
Detailed Review: Great budget option in tourist - backpacker area of New Delhi.  Only stayed a night but room was absolutely fine, good internet, and very reasonable price. In an alley off the main bazaar so not so noisy, close to station.  Delhi a bit of an overload of sensations - some good, some pretty bad but would definitely stay here again.  The reception guy Anil was very helpful in assisting us, especially late at night when one of our friends needed an uber.  It made our stay to find a helpful friendly hotel and Anil was definitely keen to ensure we enjoyed our time at Smyle Inn.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Hirak Jyoti Roy
Detailed Review: Well I searched many hotels which includes budget/safety/service etc. After searching a lot I got Smyle Inn.... Well i viewed many reviews regarding this hotel...  I booked a superior room, and it was allotted to me as per as it was mentioned in their official website although my superior room might not had the same space which I saw in the site(just my perception). The room is located in the middle of the main bazar & very easy to find. The staffs are so friendly, just 1 call at the reception & within 1-2 minutes your query will be solved(if required). Very much satisfied with the cleanliness, service, complementary breakfast, safety. The hotel ambiance is great, very motivational wall mount images on the way to the rooftop restaurant(only breakfast) which is very much required‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Kim J
Detailed Review: I've stayed here many times over the years both as a solo traveler and with my partner.  The staff are always extremely welcoming and helpful and it's reassuring to have the same high quality of service over and over again.  Guests are offered towels, soap, toilet paper and a bottle of water upon arrival - small things that make life easier after a long flight or bus ride.  The rooms are simple and clean and location is central and slightly off the busy road which makes it quieter than a lot of other places in Delhi. Breakfast and wifi is included and the staff are able to help arrange airport pickup or train/plane tickets if needed.  They are quick to respond to emails and are happy to store luggage for very reasonable rates if needed (10 rupees per bag per day).  Overall a‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: rune11
Detailed Review: I have stayed here many times over my many trips to India! When ever Im in Delhi I go here !  Rooms are clean and simple, water all ways works,  beds are comfortable! Low cost luggage storage! Breakfast and wifi works!! But the best about this place is location and the staff is amazingly helpful and you can count on them!  For stays in Delhi I highly recommend  Love from Denmark  ‚ù§Ô∏èüáÆüá≥‚ù§Ô∏è

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Dr_Borpa
Detailed Review: First we booked a standard room, which was quite small and I immediately noticed that there was a blood stain and hair on the sheet. It clearly was not washed. I called down and they sent up an employee who wanted to argue with me about how it was not blood. After I insisted that they give me a clean sheet he finally changed it. We asked how much it was to upgrade to a superior room and it was only 400rs so we switched. Surprise, surprise, the second room had dirty sheets with food stains on them. We asked them to give us clean sheets again and once more we were met with arguments. Go stay at the Su Shree Continental a few blocks away. The price is the same, the staff is friendly, and the rooms are clean!

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: susan m
Detailed Review: The hotel and the staff could not have been better. Arranged airport pickups and departures for multiple small groups in a group of 15. Travel office in hotel set up van for Taj Mahal side trip. Rooms are clean, breakfast provided and service is excellent. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. That said, you are going to India, not the Marriott. The rooms are small and you call down for hot water in 10 minutes. Everyone in India does NOT speak English. You will be deep in an Indian neighborhood which is crowded and noisy. You will be dropped off across from the chai shop and a cow. Then go down the alley past the outdoor pee station for men and take a right. This is a neighborhood with hundreds of hotels full of Europeans and Americans. They are used to us. If you want‚Ä¶

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: PeteTheKiwi2014
Detailed Review: I've stayed here many times and have always been completely satisfied.The rooms are comfortable and clean, everything works as it should (e.g. rooms have their own hot water heaters), and the staff are welcoming and  helpful. The complimentary breakfast is very convenient (factor that into the tariff if you're comparing) and the wifi's about as secure as anywhere because the login changes every couple of days -- an example of how Harish and his staff have thought carefully about travellers' needs. It's within easy walking distance of Connaught place and the Metro, so once you get your bearings, it's a great base for exploring Delhi.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Bee225
Detailed Review: We stayed at Smyle Inn for 2 nights on our arrival in Delhi and then for our last two nights in India. We use the airport pick up and drop off and found the hostel was located in the Main Bazzar a central location and easy to access the train station.  The rooms were clean and reasonably priced.  Good water pressure for showering. Wifi was good. Breakfast provided on the roof was a bonus. We used the travel agency to book our train journey on wards for a small fee of 100 rupees. The lane way to the hostel does have a male toilet at the beginning but don't let that put you off- It's not the hotels fault.  We would happily stay at Smyle on our return to India.  We loved all the quotes and images on the walls.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: LauraMccartney
Review: Great base for exploring the city
Detailed Review: Great hotel for exploring Delhi.  Good price and nice clean rooms.  The breakfast on the roof top is great.  The travel agent in the hostel is very helpful and it's easier to book train tickets through him for a 100 rupee fee than to attempt to book them yourself (which proved impossible).  Don't let the alley way to the hostel put you off. It's not as bad as it seems.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: DH1
Detailed Review: We've stayed here for two nights. Fine hostel in the middle of the main bazar in New Delhi. Very nice area with lots of food places and shops. Real India feeling just outside the hostel. We walked with our backpacks from the central station without a problem. So good stay for a good price.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Sophie
Detailed Review: We stayed here for 3 nights, great location on the main bazar with lots of places to eat and it was very close to the railway station. Breakfast was good and so was our room. The staff were very helpful sorting out train tickets and getting an adaptor for us. Only downfall was that our taxi organised with them didn't turn up at the airport but they were quick to send another. Would recommend to other travellers.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: sharifkk87
Detailed Review: Clean rooms, my arrival was 7am at the hotel, I got my rooms 9 that is great, normally check it 12 o clock, but I got soon,   We got SIM card, & the manager did the activation ,i have booked 3 rooms  for 3 nights, after one night I should leave the Hotel because of my Mom operation I should book room next to hospital, after one night I ask the Manager we should check out,because of my mom she is ziek she admitted to hospital,  then I ask the mnager I should pay the  penalty because I booked online in its not possible tge cancellation  price is 6000 INR,  He is No no problem You can pay for one , üòÄ
